Not while they are on your head, thank goodness, but while you take them on and off, they kinda rattle.Bottom line, the only reason i got these was because they say/claim they are polarized (which i will be able to find out more on when i take a boat trip next week but until then, i have no real way of knowing).  If you don't need polarized lenses for skiing or water sports, then you're obviously much better off just buying a new pair of glasses for $41.  I almost did, but, the polarized part was important for me but if you're not using these for water/snow sports then it really shouldn't be an issue and non polarized should be fine for you.If these lenses were $19, i would have given it 4 stars.  Maybe I am out of line for saying so, since i don't "truly" know what it costs to produce a plastic, polarized lens, but $40 seems like a hell of a lot of $.  maybe i am wrong.

Worked great for trigger mod on my new Crossman NP Nitro .22 pellet gun.  Took the trigger down to a crisp, no creep, 3.2lb pull.  Trigger varies from about 2.8 - 3.4 on my mechanical scale.  Watch review on Youtube (the old guy).  Took me about 5 minutes to do it, and if i had to do it again i could probably shave 3 minute off that time!

I bought these to polish a plastic lens with some polishing compound.  Nope!  Destroyed it.  So, it's probably not the product's fault here but these are not designed to polish plastic.  Metal perhaps though honestly i would expect them to scratch anything but hard metal.  They are hard, VERY hard.  Yeah, not really sure what the H these are for.

I loved these glasses, eventually my teenage daughter took them from me (lol).  Note, as other reviewer stated, it's true, the tip of the frame will rub on the inside of the lens and in time, can/will leave a mark and thus the 4 start review - they really should fix that.  I had mine for 2-3 years and the mark was very faint - i think i kept my frame more snug than he did so anyway, you have to be aware of this design flaw (common with a lot of sunglasses).  These are ultra light, and that is why i got them.  You really forget you're wearing them, i use em for driving and many people who have put them on after wearing other sunglasses all but shouted at how much better the clarity and light is seeing through these.  My wife also loved how they looked on me and usually, i can't wear round sunglasses as i have a round'ish face but these looked pretty decent on me.  They are not large circles, as with some glasses in this shape range.

I've owned 7 pairs of these over 9 years (I've given most of them away to people who fell in love with them, and lost the rest).  Most sunglasses i buy seem to b built for skinnier heads so i guess i have a slightly larger than normal head, these always fit perfect (I really mean perfect, the most comfortable sunglasses I've ever owned and I've owned 20x Arnette, ISpy, Smith, etc).  These are not polarized for "reflected" light, which is no biggie if you're not skiing or on the water, and i use them for driving.  The lenses are very good, no distortion.  They are not super stylish obviously but they look good on my roundish face so if you've got a roundish, big head, they will look good, and, will fit great.

this book was pretty disappointing. the first half of the book was ok if not a little strange but around about the middle of the book it took on a sort of a George Lucas meets Sesame Street kind of vibe and it got seriously annoying. the reason why it was disappointing was because I read his other book and I'm sorry I forget the name right now but I thought that book was pretty good and I really liked the central character which was kind of a HBO's Dexter meets outer space. I think the only way I can describe how I don't like this book is to say that it would be more appealing to young readers. I can't see a mature Syfy reader truly enjoying this book.

I always start any sci-fi review by saying, i read a lot of sci-fi (30 sci-fi books a year maybe) and I am probably "picky."  I think most of it (90%) is trash or, at best, suitable for young readers who would otherwise read comic books.  Now that we've got that out of the way, I loved this book and am so happy to have found Alan Black. The book is clever, at times laugh out loud funny (really, and i can't remember the last book that made me laugh out loud and this book did, 4 times). It's believable, the science is fine - no glaring "how in the hell did that happen" moments apart from one (later) and he seems to have a good understanding of how the military works which always makes me enjoy such books better. Few writers can capture the tiny, subtle details of military life, AND put it into prose, unless they've been there as Alan no doubt has. I usually give a list of sci fi writers i like, but I don't think i could compare this book to anything else i've read.  Alan claims he hates editing (boy, i understand, i do) but the editing in this book is pretty good - i don't recall getting yanked out of the story over and over from annoying mistakes.The only negative is that toward the end, i think the book got away from Alan a little bit and it is hard to pinpoint what it is exactly, but it seemed like maybe he rushed it a little(?)  And, in the middle of this he made one big mistake:  in the middle of space, 24 people jumped into fiberglass gliders, blew themselves out airlocks (and I never could figure why exactly that aspect was necessary) with no more guidance than being shot out the door, they glided over to, and somehow landed on another space craft.  In space.  Erm, that's improbable, i'd argue - not even possible.  He noted that the "wings" of the gliders were deployed, and then retracted just prior to landing.  Alan, you were in the Air Force sir, and certainly you know there is no atmosphere in space so a) why would they deploy any wings at all, and b) how in the world could they get a perfect vector/velocity to land from one (moving) space craft to another (not moving) without thrust or atmosphere?  Even with thrusters, on such a simple tube shaped craft it would take a computer or the best space pilots in all of history and certainly more than the distance you allowed between the two aircraft to perform the maneuver (100s of meters, not 1000s).  Anyway, I am not saying this to complain about you Alan, i LOVED the book and one error such as this does not make a bad book!  And, better it happened at the end, than at the beginning, i say, and the book is still overall truly fantastic, clever, funny writing (your characters are great).  If you can simply discard that one operation as an error (and, there were many plausible ways the maneuver could have happened, so it doesn't wreck the story), you will like this book from cover to cover.

what a shame, I was really looking forward to this book series but I probably should have read some of the negative reviews first because they are spot on. I read a couple hundred pages and pretty well got the gist of it. I started noticing that the writing was plane and simple, somewhat childlike and at first it didn't bother me I thought maybe it's just me, but the writing style didn't change and as the various different scenarios involving engineering, science, or technology started to play out I started realizing that they really had no idea how any of this was happening, so much so that I don't think they even realize that most of the things they were describing as really taking place were physically impossible. I'll just use one example, in the asteroid they construct a 25 by 60 foot tunnel one mile long and build a thousand two bedroom apartments complete with small kitchens and bathrooms in it in a matter of a few months. I'm a contractor and I don't care if it's 2015 for 2515 you don't just build a one mile tunnel through rock and drop a thousand apartments in a few months, it's impossible.and that's just one of countless examples. I was extremely disappointed because I loved the story and if this were written well it would have been epic. What a disappointment

I'm not sure that's scifi is this authors strong suit. If you're a science fiction geek like me and very much enjoy the science and details thereof I don't think you'll like this book. There are some in consistency is and scientific aspects what are inaccurate. For example during a ground assault laser beams for being fired by the alien enemy which blast apart rocks but lasers don't do that. Lasers don't impart force, all they really do is heat up the object and any high school science class knows this and this datum extends up to and including weapons-grade lasers it doesn't really matter how powerful they are the objective is still the same it would just burn a hole through the rock not splatter it all over the place and this is just an example I'm not going to sit here and pick apart the entire book but you get the idea and for me these kinds of things are critical to the story and whether or not I will be sort of interested or extremely interested. it wouldn't be so bad if this were the only negative, but also felt that the author did not have a sense of how the truly powerful, or military leaders would really act with him the various scenarios laid out in this book. I did not find her characterizations very realistic, they were not clever, and I just could not find myself buying into it. I don't think the author is a bad writer but I don't really think Syfy is her genre.

well I have to admit I did not get very far in this book so you have to take my review with a grain of salt. But as far as I got I really did not like and at that point I looked the book up in the store and started reading some of the negative reviews and I saw that readers who had finished the book had already come to the same conclusion that I came to and I'm not going to go on any sort of tirade here but suffice to say I read a lot of science fiction and I guess I'm a little picky but I just felt like this read like a comic book. It isn't that the author is a bad writer, I didn't get that, but the characters or ripped out of a Michael Bay film with very little originality. I think for some consumers of SciFi this sort of thing is like a nice old worn couch but I like a clever book with original characters, not guys named Jack Hammer who getting bar fights and screw aliens.

My daughter plays competition volleyball, and i bought this for her to practice with and she didn't like it.  I don't know if it is because we need to break it in more, but, it's not really smooth.  The seams project out a bit, and that's not really a good thing.  This ball, she says, hurts her arms on bumps more.  Her game balls are smoother (Tachikara's) and she likes them more.  Won't buy again.

My daughter liked it for her Droid Ultra.  It's not as vibrant as photo shows but it is a small form factor (not fat) and it's soft.  It's pretty much like rubber, and that is a lot better for protecting your unit than hard plastic.

So the 1 star is because this was the wrong seal.  (not really my fault, read on).  It's difficult to be sure you're ordering the right thing, i don't know why, or how that could be - how many bloody toilets do they make?  The major bummer is i only realized it was the wrong seal after i had my toilet ripped apart.  NOT.  FUN.  Someone even answered in the Answered Qs section that YES indeed, this certanily does fit the 210.  NO, no it does not, it does not fit the 210.  My advice to you is, somewhere on your toilet (depending upon model, location will vary LOL) you will find a model #.  YOU NEED that model # and you need to know if it's got an overflow or not.  What the hell that is, is anyone's guess and i think most of you who got the right seal (which is most of you) are probably luckier than you think (or geniuses maybe, who knows).  Anyway, all i can say is that apparently the correct part for me, is 385311462 and I have Sealand BC 210 from a trailer circa 2007.Good luck fans!

I installed in a 2004 X-type Jag and it went really easily.  I will make an installtion note:  I have a "hub" of 12v "cigar type" outlets on the driver side, down by my right leg on the floor, because i run so many darn different things.  Running the provided power cord (yes they do give you a cigar type for cars with 8 ft cord) up over the driver visor, down the molding, and then under my driver carpet thing, it only just made it to my hub, so, the cord length is about perfect and it only took my 5 minutes and you can't see the cord anywhere when you just push it up behind your trim (I used a plastic pen as a  pusher, worked great).There was no data chip included which almost certainly is not the seller's fault (Speedy Mobile) but  they promptly responded to my comment, and refunded me $7 for the missing chip which was extremely nice.  They could have just said "I am sorry" and i would have left it at that but it was nice of them to take full responsibility and shows they are a good vendor.

One of the few shorts that actually fit me.  I am pretty big, and most so called 'relaxed fit"  or big boy clothes fall short for me around the thighs and rear end/crotch.  I just bought carhartts version of these shorts in 36 and noooo waay.  They were so tight it was comical.  The waist was almost there but  I have really big thighs and rear end (not like craaazy fat or something, more like football player big i walk/stand 12 hrs a day and the carhartts were a total joke there.These fit fantastic in every way.  Love the pockets (I am really picky about pockets), fit n finish, etc.  the whole 9 years, i will buy these from now on.

Would love to love the shorts but they run pretty small and had to return them.  I read reviews and everyone seemed to think they fit fine but not even close for me.  I have 4 different brands of shorts that i wear in 36 - they all fit fine.  These carhartts were super tight on my thigh, crotch and waist.  I would need to buy at least 38s and even 38s could be dicey.  I don't get it.  I thought Carharrt made shorts for big thigh'd football playing cord fed white boys?  I have zero fat on my legs (I walk.stand 11 hrs a day on average) and i know i have big legs, i know that but they are not elephantine.  LIke i said, no problem fitting in any other brand at size 36.  I had same problem with Carhartt's overalls, waaaaay too tight.

Bought two different pair, these, and a more or less identical pair sold by Zeroview entitled "Casual Fashion Horned Rim Rectangular Frame Clear Lens Eye Glasses".  The Zeroview glasses are far superior because they have a flexible, sprung frame that will accommodate almost any head size.  I can barely get these "nerd" glasses on my head.

I was pretty surprised at the design quality for what it cost.  You really do expect junk at this price point but apparently not so here.  This is a very small stun gun (in my view, the absolute perfect size, particularly for a woman with smaller hands who wants to carry a purse).  It easily fits in almost anyone's pocket.  It can be concealed in your hand, even if your hands are small.I like that the light is VERY bright, it's not a "toss in", token light that will barely light the path in front of you, it's blinding (I know, i stupidly shined it in my eyes and was seeing spots for a few minutes).  I don't know the lumens, but it's got to be around 40.The best thing about this is the brilliant way it charges.  It has it's own built in prongs.  You just slide em out, and plug the whole thing into an outlet (an American 110v standard outlet only i guess - don't know if they make euro models).  Nothing to lose, no cord, no hassles.  I've had a couple stun guns, this is the smartest, best design i've ever seen.Operation is idiotically simple (so, keep it away from Damien your recalcitrant 13 yr old).I haven't tazed myself with it yet, but when i do i will let you all know how it goes after i wake up.You should probably replace these every 3 years tops.  It's a built in battery so, they are not going to last forever, but at 10 bucks, that's not bad.

I was pleased (amazed) these fit, i have a pretty big melon.  The frame is exactly 5 inches wide at rest, but stretches out (the frame is "sprung", surprisingly) to 9.5 inches to accommodate even the largest brains though i expect for really large heads, these would be a little uncomfortable.I would think these would look acceptable on almost any face.  A couple of people tried these on in my office and they seemed to look fine on almost anyone.  I have a roundish face which i think is the hardest sort of face to accommodate, style wise.  Everything seems to look like crap on my face, even my face itself sometimes whereas skinny people could paste broken glass to theirs and somehow, pull it off.  damn you skinny people, damn you....I will say, they have real temerity to label the side of the frame "Hand polished frame" when you can see the defects with the naked eye (up close).  I am pretty sure hand polished in China = "we wipe finger print off."  Of course at $10, i could care less what they look like through a magnifying glass.

A little shocked because i love Carhartt but on this particular pair of shorts, i wore a hole in them within say, 20 wearings and the hole was in a place where i can't even imagine why a hole would be there (groin area - hey now, hold the snickers!). I will try their other ones, but not these again.  They are a bit flimsy.

As a roofer I lay down a few thousand sheets of plywood a year and this is the only blade we'll use.  Try to ge them at around $9.50 (you won't get em much cheaper, i have tried, i'd buy a 100 of them if i could get them cheaper) they outlast all other blades anywhere from 3-8 times.  They cut super fast - they are very thin.  You can walk your saw along a sheet of half inch plywood with this without stopping.

G-E-T  T-H-I-S  O-N-E. omg get it!!!If you're not sure about multitools, maybe you're buying this as a gift for your husband or whatever, read on so i can make your choice easy for you - get THIS one.In terms of size it's perfect, not too big, not too small, fits any hand with perfection.This is almost exactly the same thing as the super expensive Charge TTi, which is twice the cost, made of titanium, but somehow they weight almost exactly the same so why get the Charge?  Sure, the Charge TTI blade is made from S30v stainless - a slightly better steel at holding an edge but it's hardly worth double the price and was really made for uber picky knife snobs. There are a couple minor differences which i do not care about (the Charge TTi has a gut hook on the blade which very few people are really going to use (even if they were in fact faced with gutting an animal) and i prefer not to have the blade end wakened with a gut hook i will never use.The standard WAVE sheath is awesome and i do recommend the little extra bit set (u get two little plastic wafers filled with bits) you can buy (15 bucks i think) and those little plastic wafers of bits easily fit inside the nylon sheath that comes with the Wave in fact, they made a little pocket for them (no one seems to mention that pocket for some reason).  The sheath is designed to work with either a simple belt, or for military MOLLE attachment.  Totally awesome that they made it that way because i do intend to MOLLE strap it to my armor plate carrier for deployment as a primary go-to force-multiplier kick-ass everything tool - YES!  omg i am way to excited about this thing.I think the single aspect i like most is that the major tools (blades, file and saw) deploy from the o-u-t-s-i-d-e.  This is not something a casual observer might notice but if you go to Leatherman's website, you can see how all the tools unfold, or, display, and the WAVE, as with a few others, have the 4 major tools deploy on the outside.  So for example, if you need to deploy the blade, you don't have to crack the tool in half, you simply slide your thumb to the thumbhole and flick the blade out and it 100% locks into place like a real knife that won't fold back and cut your damn fingers off.  you could even use it as a legitimate weapon (against an angry bear obviously). anyways, a-w-e-s-o-m-e.  That really makes it for me.  The ease of use compared to say, my old leatherman which i've had around 20 years is night and day.I got black because i just prefer it so whether you get black or shiny stainless is up to you.  if it could be for military use, get black otherwise it hardly matters and they are both equally corrosion resistant. Just note that the black stuff "cures" with handling, in other words, i guess the oils in your skin are what sets this carbon powder stuff into the steel, so, you might get black hands and fingers for a bit.  I didn't care for it, so i wiped most of mine off (and mine is still a really nice, soft black, love it).  It's still stainless steel under there so the black is technically just for show.

works great to get "crap" off of things.  I use it in roofing to knock off old mastic from metal in place of say, a drill and wire brush, which will get all gummed up.  These can get gummed up, but it does not really affect it's performace because of the nature of the beast, so to speak.  can't comment on how long will last but these usually only last a season, but a caring homeowner should get many years out of it.  NOTE: these use a LOT of air, so a tiny air compressor won't work out too well.  you need serious CFM.

i bought a bunch for my roofing foreman because this particular unit accepts nails with large heads (half inch i think) which many roofing nails area.  This allows us to nail in tight spaces using smaller roofing nails that have necessarily large heads.  Awesome.  i can't comment on how long they will survive but i would never expect it to last more than a year or so with the abuse my guys put them through.  They are simple devices and should last a caring homeowner many years.  Just squirt em with air oil before each use and when you're done and use a water filter on your compressors to make your tools last longer.  OK, dad - out.

i love this stuff, i cut it up and use for AC pre filters, for stand-alone air filter (as a pre-filter - instead of that crappy, cheap foam).  Air will pass easily through this and with one roll, depending on your filter size req's, i get a bunch of filters out of it.

great little locks, not for uber security, for sure, and they are fairly small, about an inch or so across (see prod description) but they will stop prying hands.  i like that you get so many keys.  you get a crapload of keys and they are real keys.  I was using much bigger locks but let me tell you about most "bigger" locks, one blow with a hammer, and they come off, unless they are those psycho locks that cost $50 bucks.
well i think it's great, but my cat thinks it sucks.  what can i say.

Kinda sucks.  Range is about 12 feet and it just goes to static.  i just work in a normal office, yes we have wifi and possibly things could be interferring but no other device has any issue with that sort of conflict
i think it's a great product but my cat doesn't.  not sure why!  she's 6 months old, likes other cat condo thingies but she won't touch this one.  waah!

my cat goes ballistic for these things.  I think she likes that she can pick them up in her mouth and her paw.  she makes me throw them across the room, for hours but she will also play with them all by herself.
awesome, these work fantastic, waaaay better than ordinary or others.
my 6 month old, playful cat does not like it.  sad.
works good

Seller is MeGooDo (and far as i can tell, everyone else as well) ---- this is not a genuine SJ4000 (the pics they show are of a genuine SJ4000, but you'll notice that not one single vendor includes the pic showing the back of the waterproof case, which is, visually, the only way you can easily spot the fake).One reason you should care is that aftermarket batteries (that i bought) don't fit (off by 1mm) so you're pretty well stuck with one battery and one battery is no good.  Perhaps you can find a battery that will fit it, but gooood luck.I found one supplier (not on Amazon I am afraid) selling a genuine SJ4000.  Just google "who makes the original sj4000" and you'll see what all the hoopla is about.  The manufacturer is Tron/Novatek and i've seen the fakes listed here as that - i wouldn't buy it unless it says "genuine SJ4000."

The width of the center "tube" is 3/8, i put my micrometer on it.When the two sides are screwed together all the way they are 1/4 inch apart, meaning, that the MINIMUM amount of material you can use is 1/4 inch (slightly larger really).  So if what you're trying to put together is less than 1/4 inch, this won't work without washer or something to make up the distance.These are often used to bind two pieces of kydex plastic together and another reviewer commented that it won't snugly put together two sheets of 0.80" kydex and that is true.  you can make up the difference with two small washers though.  I would imagine these would be perfect with 093 kydex x2, or at worst, you'd have to put one small nylon washer or metal washer in there.

UPDATE #3: I noticed another reviewed said his pan does not say Joycook on the handle and it's not doing well. Mine also does not say Joycook but i havn't had any issues with the pan surface. I will say that within months, it started to knick around the rim and this is because the stainless rimmed lid would knick it, but this did not, has not, translated down to the pan surface so it's not an issue for cooking. It did bother me, but again, the knicks and stuff didn't cause any sort of progressive failure.UPDATE #2: So after 4 years or so, still works. Not as good as it used to but still not bad at all. I must stress that for these to work right, you cannot use anything metal on them or "scrub" them with greenies. NO NO NO NO NO ! only use a plastic brush. only use plastic or wood utensils. My pan only has one mark where my wife knicked it with a fork. When i originally bought my pan it was $85 and now i see they are $45 which is a great deal.UPDATE #1: Good pan so far, have owned now for just over a year and I cook a lot, i use several times per week. Has not lost any of it's no stick powers yet.ORIGINAL REVIEW:Bought because it doesn't release harmful chemicals. It's certainly non stick, I rarely have to brush it clean, just shoot water on it, clean.If you don't scrub them with greenies (which is tantamount to 120 grit sandpaper, my paint and body guy uses greenies to prep car bodies) these kinds of pans will stay non stick a lot longer. When you clean them, ONLY use a plastic brush (if u need to use anything at all). DONT use the scrubbie. Don't wipe it with paper towels either (they will micro scratch pans, oh yes they will) unless u do it gently.NOW WHAT I LIKE MOST ABOUT THIS PRODUCT IS THAT IT DOES NOT LIE ABOUT WHERE IT IS MADE. There is a certain other pan that says it is "From Germany" and it's not, it's Chinese (I finally found a review that says it it is actually made in China, the coating if from Germany - what they hey???) and I simply cannot stand products that lie.This pan is made in Korea and I've actually had pretty good success with Korean products, they seem to be well made, not just this pan.

Like everyone else: hard water, can't do soft water for myriad reasons. Tired of crusty white stuff on everything (imagine wine glasses that are a particular shade of white - and that feel like they are covered in a very fine sand paper).  We just moved here recently, and well, who knew water could be like this!  I am sure you do if you're reading this but it's all new to me.So I researched, like you, and among the "electronic Water Zapper" dealies, this was the best+cheapest, apparently.  It seemed to do the same thing as the Eddy, but for quite a bit less.  Now this only has a 90 day warranty, the Eddy comes with a 1 year, but then the Eddy charges you a $40 restock fee.So, i ordered this (well actually, my wife put a proverbial gun to my head, and then i ordered it).  It arrived, literally, the next day (wow).  So i wasted no time, and, within 15 minutes had it installed.  Super easy.The very next day we're noticing a big difference.  The glasses are clear, skin feels slippery and my wife claims that she can finally wash her hair.  The water tastes better - I used to get a kind of chalky film on my mouth, teeth, etc.  Now it just tastes like, water.  In one day!  I had expected to wait a few days or even a few weeks for any sort of noticeable improvement.I will say that i didn't research my water to see what sort of hard water we have, or what our water composition is.  Obviously, i fell into the category where this really works well (if you have high iron, for example, you're kinda screwed since it upsets the process).What else can i say, so far (3 whole days) and we love it!NOTE: In the instructions, it says quite clearly: Do not install this BEFORE any ground-wire that may be attached to your piping (I see most plumbing ground wires outside, which would almost automatically put the ground before the unit if you install the unit inside, of course).  For those of who are not aware of it, most metal plumbing should have a ground wire somewhere on it, that grounds it to the uh, ground (so if you're house gets struck by lightning, and you happen to be in your bathtub...u get idea).  So, it just so happens, that where my water enters the house (which is where i needed to put my little CLearWave unit), just inside my garage door, is well "behind the ground" wire, which is across the garage, and next to the water heater.  So i thought i would just move the wire, but - the wire disappears into the wall.  Crap.  So I went onto ClearWave's website, sent their sales staff an email (the only option), which they relayed to techsupport, and they answered me the next day saying: "don't sweat it, your ground is 20 feet away, that won't interfere, you're good to go."  Nice!  So anyways, I don't remember exactly what he said but i got the impression that so long as it's at least several feet away (6-7 ?), you're ok.

It's a very nice press that comes with the extra of a base that is on wheels so it moves around.  you can take it off that if you want but i think that's helpful for some people working with large items like tarps, where you want to move the press, not the object.Just beware it doesn't come with the dies.  They say it doesn't in the description but i missed that and stupidly ordered it but the people at Crosslinks were really helpful and got me a set of dies at a discount which in total, equaled about the cost of other presses that come with die sets so it's still a good deal.I would recommend that they pack it with some extra packing.  Mine was only packed with a small piece of bubble wrap on top, and the press had worked holes in the box and was "fixing" to make a getaway!  Also, the handle rubbed and marred the finish on the base because it was not properly wrapped up.  I could care less about the marring, it will not alter the performance and it's minor but some people are pickier than i.  Personally, i'd just wrap it all up in a bunch of newspaper.  I think most people are like me - we don't care what you use to wrap something up - use toiletpaper for all we care, we just want it to arrive unscathed.

I am a roofing contractor and i have installed probably 1000 solar fans over the last 15 years.  The Home Depot jobs are weak, and made in China.  For the $, you can't beat this unit.  It's US made, pretty high quality, i hasn't had any failures (have used dozens) and powerful.

I purchased mine as a "refurbished" unit from a company called Data Sales Co, through Amazon of course.  The computer is, unbelievable.  I swear this thing is new.  I have gone through the whole thing, inside and out, not a nick or scratch or even spec of dust.  It sincerely does not like it's ever been used.  They sent it promptly, it was very, very well packaged with a foam pad that surrounded it and was made for it.  It came with a W7 disc though it was pre-loaded.  Just bear in mind because this is a refurb, the refurb Co loads their license copy of W7 in it (they are a distributor) so you don't enter the product key on the case, you enter the product key they give you.  It works fine, it's totally legit.  Havn't spent ton of time with it but it seems fast, it's quiet, and the Dell Optiplex line (i ahve several) is a tank.  These are built much, much better than your average computer, many of which have the appearance of being "tossed together" - this whole thing looks very purpose built.  I bout the SFF (small Form Factor) so the case is pretty small and, regrettably, i don't think i can stuff naother HD in it which kinda sucks since the one it came with is only 250 GB but it's not a huge problem for me and anyone can buy an external HD and use that.  It does only come with 4GB or RAM but this is easily upgrades for around $75. (1333 mhz ram) and i would recommend adding another 4gb chip.  i think it maxes out at 16gb but finding specs for these computers is not hard, DELL still has web pages for them, just type in DELL OPTIPLEX 790.

I should have read the first two (voted most helpful reviews) 3 star reviews, they are dead on.  I read 100+ sci-fi books a year, so you can imagine, like some of you no doubt do, i don't always put the research into it i want to.  I just want to read man.  I stupidly went with the fact that this book is 4.5 stars with at the time, 358 reviews which is a lot.  Usually, that's enough, right?  Not this time.  Look, it's not "bad" but I agree with the other reviewer, people are losing their objectivity here.  The problem is, if you read the sample, it's pretty good.  It is, at least, exciting.  Once you buy the book and the first "scene" is over, it is frankly, boring.  Clumsy, not-at-all-clever, clunky scene writing that is sort of connect the dots simple.  Seriously, there were chapters upon chapters of backroom Navy board meeting and strategy planning that, in the hands of a skilled writer may have been passingly of interest but it was so boring, i fell asleep reading it two nights in a row and on night 3, finally got so frustrated, i sit here now, writing this review to spare the rest of you.  And i agree - amazon needs to change this 5 star business to a 1 - 10 rating.

I am half way through and ready to toss in the towel.  Look, for $3, try it out, you may like it, particularly if you're younger and like smaller words.  It started out ok, not terribly clever but not bad.  At the midway point the writing became stale and even juvenile.  I was a bit surprised since this book had quite a few reviews, 4.5 stars, i expected more than this.  I might read it through, if it gets better i will amend this but so far, the only reason i could recommend this book is that it's "OK" for $3.  I don't mean to go overboard here but rating this book 5 stars is an insult to the really great writers out there.

I go through lot of tapes, 4-5 a year, been using max steel and fat max which frankly, i don't like because they are really expensive and don't last.  havn't had this tape long and if it goes south i will update this but so far, i like it.  it only has a 7 ft stand out so if you really need that to be more, then go with the fat max.  it reals up ok but what i really like is the easy to read, double sided tape.  i also like the large end which makes it easy to snag stuff - most important for me.  the end of this tape is, therefore, fairly heavy and prob why it only has a 7 ft standout before the tape "breaks" but you can't have your cake and eat it too, it's one or the other.  if you wanted too, you could shave off the rivets, remove the end, and fab your own using a piece of aluminum and i might try that.  that would increase the standout a bit without compromising the "grabability" and i think they should have used aluminum there (it's stainless steel and like i said, kinda heavy).It fits nicely in my hand, the rubber grip is a must for me as i have dropped a few tapes with wet hands.
i have 1995 dodge v10 2500.  what can i say, it looks like an OEM unit.  impressive when you consider the cost.
Your/You're. Their/There/They're. i almost put it down several times just because the basics of grammar were missing. Soooooo irritating, and really ruined a decent book. Not amazing but decent.

this book needs a MASSIVE TRIGGER WARNING. The male is abusive (he rapes her for crying out loud), he's constantly having dangerous flashbacks where he talks about the abuse he had as a child, he repeatedly hurts her and then asks for forgiveness. As a marital abuse survivor this book was horrible to read. I expected a love story not a horror story. It was nothing but abuse and stockholm syndrome. I kept reading hoping the guy would "see the light" but he was abusive to the end. I don't know the author but this book frankly is disgusting. Scene after scene of abuse, both of the wife and the reliving of his childhood abuse. If I wanted to read a book about child abuse I'd have picked up Lolita instead, at least that was better written. The male lead is an idiot on top of it (your pregnant wife is upstairs and she's not going to hear you f!$@ing a hooker downstairs? Come on!!!) The woman is constantly thin, losing weight, unable to sleep and it's blamed on pregnancy not abuse. Seriously if you went to an Obgyn and you had bruising they would still likely comment on it or ask if you needed help, no doctor is going to ignore a pregnant woman with such obvious signs of physical abuse.The writing itself was dull, the author has moments of passion (ironically abusive scenes) and the rest of the book is jumbled and dull. It jumps around a lot both in perspective, time and what's going on. One minute he's happy the next he's a sociopath. One minute she's a sane human the next she's a needy abuse victim who had a rough life. There's no cohesion with the characters and the plot drags on with abuse after abuse after abuse. If I hadn't lived through an abuse situation I'd wonder how any woman would continue to stay through his behavior. The thing that cinches it being a terrible book is that even though she's being abused not once does she justify his actions, in fact the woman is constantly saying how his behavior is not ok (if you're not ok with it why do you freaking end up staying with him?????)I don't know what to make of this book, the writing is sub par, the plot had potential UNTIL the abuse rolled in. This isn't 50 shades "non consent" junk, it's abuse - he rapes her and leaves bruises on her and then cries about it the next day and says sorry citing his childhood. Not buying it and I certainly wouldn't recommend it for anyone with trigger issues.

TERRIBLE . Spelling and grammar mistakes. Characters are flat, cheesy and underdeveloped. "love/sex' scenes are less than a line and sound like they were written by someone who's never had good sex. Written like a freaking high school essay. Couldn't get past the first few pages between the poor writing and bad editing. YUK. Avoid and read something else, this was a waste of time. One of the worst books I've ever read.

This is one of my favorite new series out. I LOVE Mass' writing anyway but this is great. It's a little tentative, but that can be the same with any new book. Not a lot given away at first which I think could be frustrating for some as you're not sure of the plot. I'm 50/50 on the family characters - they seem to develop one way and then switch up so they're rather ambiguous, hopefully that will be better in future. I liked the style of the book though, mixing traditional faerytale and folklore in with the world. I'm sketchy on her name, I'm hoping that Fayre turns out to be for a good reason because it's too damn obvious. Also I'm still in the dark about why "roses and thorns", maybe I missed the line that explained that because since there's more than one court involved I don't feel it applies as a whole.However, despite the shortcomings it's very easy to fall in love with the characters, and it definitely leaves you wanting more. Seriously, could she write faster??? I'm looking forwards to reading the next book already.

Exactly what it says it is. The only thing I was disappointed in is that these are thin, flimsy and appear cheap, but then again it matches the price. I wouldn't want to give these to kids, they would probably break very quickly, but as a photographer to use for props they are ideal. The wood is unfinished and does have some splinters to it so you'll have to sand or finish it yourself.

very easy to apply, if you can remember to do it often enough. I'm not seeing a lot of difference so far (about a month) but I'm hoping it will just take time. It's worked well on some other smaller scars but the deeper, darker ones aren't really showing a whole lot of improvement (however I'm really pale skinned).

Bought this on sale at Michaels, it's really soft. The texture is lovely but as a beginner I'm a little annoyed. I frequently have to unravel and this catches and also ends up unraveling into separate threads very often. I know this is partially my fault but it's not ideal if you're learning since it seems really finicky. The texture is nice though so I'm going to keep trying.

Watched this today, I love it. The style of animation reminds me of my childhood so much. Not going to lie my bff and I totally sat there singing along to the theme music. It's a very dark story so if you're one of those pedantic parents who doesn't want their children to see anything about cruelty and death then maybe miss this one. IF you're a twisted 80s kid then it's brilliant.

Ouch!!!! 7-10 days I did see peeling but not like in the picture, after 5 days my feet were uncomfortably dry (even with reading online to do 30 minute soaks everyday). on day 8 I saw significant peeling however it was not deep enough that the calluses were gone and my feet just got drier and drier. It's been 16 days now, still peeling, not much difference on the callouses, but my feet are so dry that they started to crack and bleed on the outside. It constantly hurts to walk on them because they're so dry even with ointment on them. I would only recommend these if you're getting regular pedicures and have uncalloused feet or some magical moisturizer (aquaphor and eucerin healing haven't helped much).I'm wondering if the "official" product might have been better. These are definitely not original baby foot socks. I did get some basic instructions but double checked them online too.

Well I started reading this as soon as I bought it, I'm hopeful with my results so far. I already have fair sized breasts but I read the reviews that noted improved firmness and that caught my eye. I've been doing the massages and exercises and they do seem firmer within a week! I lost 2 cup sizes with some weight loss so I'm really hoping to get those back by the end of the 8 weeks. My boyfriend has noticed a little bit of a difference, and I guess I've also seen more "overflow" on my bras too. The book itself is easy to follow and read, it's very well laid out so if you want to just read up on one of the methods you can. I like how it also has information on your hormones and other things that can affect breast tissue growth.  I really think this would be an easy book to follow for anyone who wants to get "the girls" bigger.

This was so cheesy, so so so so so cheesy. And so obviously written by someone with no connection or knowledge of the fire service. Don't get me wrong I'm all for fantasy but if you believe every FF is a calendar model you'll be disappointed. That being said I'm all for the hero being hot. It was rather typical plot, easy reading overall. Probably wouldn't read it again though.

I really like this series, though it's tough to remember which book is which since they all run together. I liked the plot, liked the characters, and thought it had a lot of good content. My only issue so far was book 5 which is almost entirely a copy and paste of excepts from the other books and I couldn't finish it because I couldn't find a story there! I think it would be nice to see some spin offs on some of the characters - max finding a gf, michael etc.

I wasn't overly impressed with this book. It was an "ok" read in the most all round sense. There was nothing impressive at all. The plot was basic, the characters undeveloped, and though there was a lot of potential for there to be so much more it just left me debating whether or not I want to bother with the additional books. It was cheesy, and almost theatrical at times. I kept reading in the hope that it would improve but I don't hold out much hope after finishing it. To be honest it almost felt rushed, like someone was told "here write a story in a week" and this is what was produced.

Eagerly anticipating the next one now. I really liked this and I'm curious to see how everything plays out. Really good writing and well organized. Just enough to peak attention and leave you wanting more for the next book. I'm looking forwards to the next one.

I really loved this story, it was so sweet, but I felt that it cut off at the end. It seemed like it had the potential for being a series about this culture and group of people but then the ending sort of just lumped everything together. I'd like to see more, maybe with the potential for explaining things and some of the other characters stories as they work things out. A resurgent of the Steps maybe?

These books  rather run into each other so it's hard to remember what book I'm on.  I do really like this series,  it's a little obvious arty times but overall decently written,  fleshy plot. I liked it.

I reaaaaaaallly liked this. I feel so bad for Deidre! It's too easy to empathize with her character being dropped in the deep end and being so turned around and clueless. I feel that Gabriel isn't strong enough in how much he disliked her predecessor in this book, if someone had screwed me over that bad I certainly wouldn't just treat the "new them" like nothing had happened, and even after 1000 years would be able to recognize their face (pink hair isn't that distracting). Overall good to read, language was easy, though I dislike the "book" being divided into three purely to make you pay for each part.

Though not the most historically accurate rendition the tortured rescuer is definitely one I enjoyed. I thought this was fairly well written and their banter realistic. The only thing I disliked was the fact that there were glaring historical inaccuracies for the period (seriously old people talking about their sex life at the dinner table to strangers in the middle ages?????). I understand it's a fictional kingdom loosely based on Europe at the time but it just annoyed me. Ciara is a little bit too modern for a time that spawned damsels. I did like the innovative ways the author made them get out of their scrapes (sledding on a shield?!) and their ending up together didn't seem too cheesy in the end.

I'm the midget of the family, even my grandmother is taller than me and I always thought it was genetic. I never knew how to get taller as an adult was all in your posture and stretching your body out. I don't know about a whole 4 inches but my posture has improved from the stretches alone which has certainly added a cm or two just from that (and it's only been a couple of days!). I'm pleased so far as I feel more flexible and my back feels noticeably more comfortable with just a few days of following the stretching. I have back issues and they aren't particularly difficult so I think this book would work for anyone who has reasonable flexibility, the stretches aren't that complicated but I think if you're an advanced yoga practitioner this might be a waste of time. I knew yoga stretching could help children grow but I didn't honestly believe that it would make a difference as an adult. I'm definitely going to continue with the routines and see whether or not there is any more improvement.
Get the stick version. This one is slower, picture quality is poorer and it's finicky with the remote needing to be pointed at exactly the right spot.

My boyfriend bought this for my birthday a couple of years ago and I've finally come to the conclusion I hate it. Can't get to anything, have to take everything out to get to lenses on the bottom, no side pockets so it's hard to 'organize' if you want lenses and flashes separate unless you just throw them in the front. I'd rather use my vest if it weren't so heavy. Can't sling it round the front because my blobs are in the way and on the back I'm nervous someone will unzip it and take things. Also its pretty hefty so that and equipment makes this rather clunky

I really enjoyed some of these, I'm vegetarian so I was hoping for more that I could have but there's things I can adjust. The recipes are straightforward and they are fast to prepare like it says. So far the ones I tried were under 30 minutes, which I've seen plenty of books lie about so this is true - they're fast . Too early to say if its really doing all much for my metabolism but my boyfriend says he feels more energy so it must be something working already! The pineapple pork got rave reviews from the family though which is reason enough alone to buy it! I'd recommend this for anyone who is busy and likes not to spend a lot of time cooking.
Never heard of the author so I was pleasantly surprised. Looking forwards to more of these. Decently written but not amazing by any means. Plot wasn't toooooo predictable
Its a real beginner book. Either I'm too knowledgeable to be a beginner or this is very simple. Good information but starts out too basic for me.
Made on of the bars from here the other day and it was delicious! Loads of compliments from my buddies on our road trip. Will definitely be trying some more

I upgraded from the tab 2 and so far its great. My only complaint is that 8gb is a joke. 4 is taken up by bloatware so you're severely limited on how many apps etc and if you read a lot you will be forced to store everything in cloud which is extremely annoying if its WiFi only. Otherwise its light and very easy to handle. Battery life is good but I keep it in powersave and no Bluetooth etc.

I have this in red, so far two complaints - the hose came loose inside but once I popped the side off it was easy to reattach; and the cups of coffee are tiny. I need two to make a decent sized cup. Other than that its fast and functional.

I reached my heaviest ever a couple of weeks ago and finally said no more. I've heard Calisthenics is very effective. I work two jobs and don't get a lot of time so a 15 minute Calisthenics workout seems ideal! I've tried this a couple of times so far and it's kicked my #!#@! I'm pleased with it so far, it's certainly challenging and I'm hoping to see good results quickly from it because of that. The book is quite simple, and gives you a basic run down of the what's a why's which was helpful. I'm fairly fit already so I think this would be difficult for anyone who is a total couch potato to follow. I'd recommend this book for anyone who's looking for a quick work out that's challenging and effective.

I got a free sample of these and within a day or so I noticed a huge improvement with my knees. I'm heavy and have knee pain/issues kneeling and they've almost disappeared within a few days of taking these. I'm sold. Will certainly be buying these again.

This is a pretty handy little tablet. I bought it as a more portable version of my tap 21 and it's close. The lack of internal memory is frustrating, and the fact that there's no case or stand to use it as an actual laptop is annoying if you don't want to be tied to a desk. Still i've got lightroom, photoshop, caliber, and a bunch of other programs on there. I've noticed the keyboard occasionally disconnects but there's a simple fix for it. It has a pretty decent battery life, and I really like the fact that you can actually play handheld games with it like a mini console. I LOVE the drawing/painting capasitive touchscreen app part. I'm still amazed at how light and easy to handle this is, it's a very handy gadget - tablet and pc in one.

This was a total lifesaver for me! It's actually been a two for one because this makes wearing flip flops so much easier also. They are comfortable and fit well, I've honestly forgotten that I was wearing them most of the time. They do get a little dirty though so I've been cleaning mine with alcohol to keep it looking nice. The material is solid and seems to be well made - no sharp edges and a uniform shape. I liked that these were a set of two so if one breaks I can use the other, or if I simply want to match in flip flops I can wear both and it doesn't stand out so much. These have lessened the pain and discomfort I feel in several of my regular pairs of shoes significantly. I'd love if they can make one for bunionettes too though....

It was a bit predictable and underdeveloped. It seemed like there was good plot then it kept getting lost, some parts were well written and descriptive others were flat "and then" writing. There was potential for a good story and good series but it seemed to be all fat and no meat - seemed to spend ages on wasted nothing while the important parts of the plot were quickly skipped through. I also don't like that the second book predates this (why?!?!) before jumping back again to the third. That makes no sense.

Actually was really hoping this was going to be a series. It's a great read, well written as usual from this author but there was so much potential to expand this into more (a bit like the vampire chronicles tbh). I loved the plot, loved the characters, and just feel there was potential for so much more development with them. Cleo could easily be a heroine like Anita Blake for a series using this,

I've never really heard of blood type cooking before but I'm willing to try anything at the moment to lose a few pounds. I found this book really interesting and informative and the recipes seem fairly simple. I'm not much of a cook so I was specifically looking for recipes that didn't take long, tried one for dinner last night (took me more than 30 but like I said I'm not much of a cook) - the veggie pancakes were really good. I'm really pleased that there are a lot of vegetarian recipes included too so I'll be trying some more for sure. I liked how there was also a little introduction and information on the different blood types so it wasn't just recipes with no explanation.Eating for your Blood type seems like a well written book (didn't see any errors) and the recipes were complete (no time or ingredients missing). I'll be trying more from this in future- probably going to give the smoothies a go for breakfast this week. I'd recommend this book even if you don't want to follow the diet because some of the recipes are really good anyway and if you are looking for a blood type cook book this is a really good deal since you get so many recipes.

I wasn't a big fan of this book at first, it took a minute to get into (frankly calling them "kingdom of Ohio" etc was rather annoying and offputting), couldn't quite figure out what the point of the steampunk references were - just didn't really fit. However there were some really good twists in there I didn't see coming and I'm going to continue the series, hopefully this was just the wobbly knees of the first book and the second is better. I think the descriptions could use a little work its very much an "and then" book - as in this happened and then this and then that. Not a bad read overall though.

I just got this, and I loved it. Looking forwards to the next book already. I've not read from this author before and was pleasantly surprised to actually find someone in this genre who wasn't a powerhouse and who didn't suck - so many titles on here that are terribly written! Great book, the only thing I would have changed would be that some of the scenes might be a bit stronger (no spoilers but I like things a bit more gritty). ell worth the 5 stars.

I've always seen the pressure cooker as a bit intimidating - what if it explodes! Recently I've seen several shows where people used pressure cookers to make cook times faster and it prompted me to want to try it. I chose electric because it seemed safer so I wanted to get a cook book specifically for electric pressure cooker recipes. I've bought another book from this publisher before so I thought I would trust them and I'm really happy I did. I didn't want to spend a lot of time only to find out things didn't cook right so this book was ideal. As it says the ones I tried were all really fast and super easy to follow. I was especially surprised about how you can cook more than one thing to make an entire meal with only one pot! This is such a time saving idea and it's really great to be able to make decent meals even if I feel pressed for time. It's a really good book even if you're just starting to use a pressure cooker so I'd suggest getting it even if you are a beginner at using one of these.

I used to be obsessed with Christian Jacq and the Wilbur Smith books set in Egypt and was hoping for something similar. This series wasn't bad, it possibly could have been a little more exciting at times but I realize the author was trying to stick to historical fact as much as possible. I definitely stopped reading several times and thought about not going back because it drags, on and on and on and on and on by the time you get to the third book. In fact the third book seemed like the author didn't want to write it either the way it just suddenly cuts off and ENDS. No wind down, just end of the chapter, epilogue. The first book is the best that being said, it's still lacking for me in either some action/adventure/raciness/something to really make it pop which is why I probably won't read it again.

I'm not a cook and following the Atkins diet has been hard. The fact that these recipes are so quick and easy is great. I love that nothing takes long to make and they still taste so good! I've tried several recipes so far. It's also pretty great that it uses a lot of gluten free stuff like coconut flour which is more Atkins friendly (who knew?!). This is the second time following this diet, Atkins works well for me and I've seen some noticeable weight loss already.  I'd recommend this book of Atkins diet recipes, especially if you're not much of a cook because everything in it is so easy to understand that you'll look like a pro with these recipes!

I'm glad this was free. It's so Meh. So average. The book feels rushed, it seems like in the space of 24 hours they meet and get married! The sex scenes were poor, short, and under done. Four lines isn't enough if you're trying to get into this genre. The story had potential but nothing was elaborated on, just "this happens" then "this happens" - no feeling, no depth. It's not miserable, it's decently edited but I wouldn't read it again or recommend it. It feels like a first book or someone who has never written before and is self published. No good publishing house would produce this tripe, it's not Nalini Singh that's for sure.

I bought this because I've been under so much stress lately and I've developed a nasty habit of grinding when I'm trying to sleep. This has been ideal as it's not intrusive at all and I hardly feel it while trying to sleep, it has fallen out a couple of times but I guess that's normal. The instructions for the custom forming process were easy to follow and worked well so this really does fit perfectly. This was definitely a cheaper option than the one my dentist suggested, especially since I got it on a promotion, and I can't see anything different from theirs! I like the added bonus of the whitening feature but haven't gotten to use it yet. I really like the travel case too since it means it's not creepily sitting on a dish or glass by the bed. Even though I've only had it a couple of days my jaw and head feel much better when I wake up so it's definitely working.

I was quite surprised by this book. I've got to admit a little disappointed. i was hoping for more magic and less whining. It had good reviews and was free, passed some time but I can't say I'm running to read the rest of the series.

This set has been a great investment, we bought it on a whim for summer parties and it's held up great with both adults and kids playing with it - the impact resistant coating really works since the jack barely shows any wear yet. The balls are easy to spot even in the sand and grass so they've worked out well in both locations. They're a good weight, not too light and cheaply made like some but still easy enough for the kids to pick up - they're certainly worth the extra money in quality. I'm thinking about buying a second set just to have a spare or perhaps so we can play more than once game at a time as this one gets a lot of use in our family. I'm really pleased with this set so far it's been a pleasure to play with and not worry that the balls will chip or break or that one will get lost. I would definitely recommend these over other bocce sets, especially if you are considering a cheaper version.

I recently got another book by this author and loved the style. He's really good at getting the basics of programming down for beginners and I encourage you to check out his other books too.  I think there is some great information in here and it's well laid out, I feel that as a beginner shorter books work best and this was quite succinct. I know zip about Linux but had a few questions relating to other codes and comparison and this book helped answer them, though my knowledge is limited so I think this book would be better for those with a bit more background in OS rather than web programming. I found the 'deep dive' parts really useful and a convenient addition if you wanted more information on the topic. This would be a good companion book to add for someone taking classes with more in depth Linux textbooks.

I checked this out here and ended up getting it elsewhere, this book has been a really useful addition to the textbooks I'm working with in my programming class. I thought the language was easy to follow even to someone like me who is just starting to program and the book is well set out with the included examples so it doesn't get confusing. I liked the examples used because they weren't just a copy and paste but included explanation and thought the fact that the author really starts you from scratch with downloading was very helpful. I think there are good tools and advice for anyone wanting to start working in python. It's a fairly short book so I just went and read it again after learning new things in class and found that even after I've gotten a little more comfortable I'm still able to spot things in the code that I hadn't quite understood before. I think the author did a really good job with this and more beginner python programmers should check it out.

I've always been heavy and recently made a commitment to losing weight. I chose this supplementbecause Schwartz products are made in the US and also being manufactured in a FDA regulated labmade me feel safe about its content. I also purchased another product (Phytceramides) from thiscompany and received the product at a discount which was awesome. I thought the capsules weren'ttoo difficult to swallow, I didn't have to break them up to take them and they're not rough edged likesome. The bottle is pretty good value for money since you get quite a lot of pills in there – taking twoa day has been really easy to remember. I've noticed that while taking pure caralluma fimbriata Ihaven't been grazing as much so it has markedly decreased my appetite. That has really helped me tocontrol calories without feeling like I'm hungry all the time. I've lost a little over 3lb in the first weekwhich is more than 1% of my body weight so I'm very excited to see if that rate continues with this.I've tried Garcinia Cambodia and a few others in the past that haven't been quite as effective, andespecially not so fast. I would absolutely recommend this product based on my results so far.

This year I hit 30 and I detected a marked difference in my skin, especially the fine lines appearing on my forehead. I just started taking these capsules and my skin looks noticeably fresher. I chose Schwartz over other brands because they're vegetarian which is important to me, and because I got it at a discount - an unexpected bonus. I have always known about antioxidants being important to skin care so I thought these supplements would be a good choice since Phytoceramides 350mg are just concentrated antioxidants. I thought they were easy to take, especially since it's only one a day and there was no aftertaste at all. My skin feels more supple and looks brighter, I've also noticed that I don't need to use as much moisturizer anymore or as much concealer on darker areas. I'm very pleased with my results so far and will continue to use this to fight any new wrinkles.

I bought this book to better understand my other half and found it quite insightful. He's an ISFJ whereas I am an INFP "diplomat". This book has really helped me better understand him - he's so analytic where as I'm more of a feeler. I thought the book was well written and easy to read, the introduction was particularly good if you haven't read a lot about personality types. I felt that the book went into more detail than expected and learnt a lot of information such as some good suggestions about what I was doing a wrong to make Mike happy. There's a lot of really good information here and the book gave me more information than I really needed which was great and the author included some interesting personal views as well.  I would recommend this book to anyone looking into the INFJ personality type and thought it was a fascinating read.

I was pleasantly surprised by this book. A lot of non fiction that I find here tends to be painful to read - this book was well written and though some of the words were hard to pronounce/understand I felt that the author went above and beyond for the information included. The book was well laid out with clear chapters though it did seem there was a little repetition in some areas - poses for example. I liked that the author went into detail about how to perform the poses, though it would have been nice to have pictures to go with the information. I also thought it was pretty impressive for a beginner book to go into diet and chakras since I never ever knew the subjects were related until this. I think it could have been improved potentially by adding a meal plan but it already went over my expectation so it isn't a huge loss. This book is so much more than a crash course - it gives you everything including suggestions for what to wear for different types of yoga.  I'm really impressed by this book and it's definitely worth the price and I would recommend it for anyone looking into yoga.

I was a little concerned being that I have sensitive skin and others had a reaction but after doing a test patch I tried this on a really nasty zit and some unbroken skin. The zit was definitely down the next morning a little bit but still red. The mixing instructions were easy to follow but it is supposed to sit 20minutes and I didn't leave it that long so that could be why the effect wasn't so pronounced. The mud felt luxurious and very thick after I mixed it. On the unbroken skin my skin was quiet soft afterwards, no redness or irritation. It actually felt like a really good face mask when it was on - a little drying but washed off easily. My skin seemed a little less greasy for the couple of days afterwards.The package is huge - it's going to take me forever to finish this so it was really good value, especially since I got it on a promotion. I haven't tried it on my hair yet as a mask but I will soon. I think perhaps if I have the time to mix it and let it sit longer it might give better healing results.

A few years ago I took my Realtor license and never did anything with it, now we're looking to sell our house and I think the insider knowledge I already have has been invaluable but it's out of date. That's why I bought this book since I know nothing about real estate online.This isn't a how to but it's excellent for adding to the knowledge you already have. I wouldn't recommend this book if you don't know anything about real estate already since there's plenty of work terms in here you might not be familiar with but it's got a lot of useful information even for its small size. This is good if you're thinking of doing a FSBO even if you won't be able to access all the services it mentions or if you are using a broker at least you will know what they are talking about when listing.

So we have the whole series of these books so far - temple run, flappy birds etc and they're great for family night. I actually look out every time that one comes out because it helps change things up. Of course the kids play everything so they win but it's really good for being able to boost their confidence in that they know all the answers. The books are full of facts you would never know otherwise and is also good for roadtrips and such being that you can keep it in the app. I definitely learned a few things from this book I didn't know and am glad to add it to our collection

So I've always been a big fan of if it looks good enough then I'll buy it anyway. I admit it, I buy fakes, but this book is great because it points out things that are really obvious on them so I know what to look for in future when shopping. There are some things in here I already knew but there's also plenty of things I never would have noticed. I thought the book was short but got plenty of points packed in especially if you like to shop online. I wish it did extend to other brands a bit more as it does focus a lot on LV products. Maybe the author should do a series for different brands?  This was an easy and quick book to read and was perfectly laid out though there were a few points that were simple common sense. I'm going to be getting rid of a few bags after reading this because now I can see how obvious they are and using the information to shop for new ones.

Ok so the cover might be a little unrealistic but I'm certainly seeing a bit of results so far from the exercises. I suffer from classic white girl @$s and my boyfriend constantly picks on me for it. As someone mentioned there aren't pictures but it takes a whole few minutes to google anything you don't understand and a video will pop right up. I think the explanations were pretty good overall and I've been trying out the exercises. I have seen a bit more firmness, and my butt certainly aches like I've been working out! I haven't had this long so I think realistically I've seen results being that it hasn't been but a couple of weeks. I like how the exercises suggested don't have to all be done together - if you've got a couple of minutes you can do one at work, or in the morning before you get in the shower etc and get the whole program done through the day without having to add an extra time to work out your butt. Overall I'm happy I bought this book and look forwards to seeing more results.

As the book says this is all about the basics. There isn't a lot of in depth instruction but it introduces the how and what for those looking into biodiesel for the first time. I really liked the fact that this book was so simple to read as it helped me understand a lot of the more complicated material I had already come across. I thought the way it was laid out also helped those of us starting from the ground without prior knowledge as well. There were a few editing mistakes but it didn't detract from the book and it was perfectly ok to read. I think the author did a good job on the book overall and I feel ready now to go back to the more in depth material with greater understanding on the topic. Not ready to brew my own stuff yet but this was a really good start and this book has helped my confidence.

I just started programming, it's quite difficult but this book has really helped me so far. I've not encountered R before so this is rather new. I don't think I'm comfortable with it yet but I've only just started and this book has given me great understanding about what R is and how I can use it. I think I have the basics down after the first read. I like the way the author has presented the material and they have made it easy to follow and understand even if you aren't familiar with programming. It seems really similar to VB how the author has presented R (maybe how much I've gotten comfortable with so far of basic programming) but this is ideal for anyone looking to expand their programming languages. It's a fairly short book too which is why I'm quite surprised how much I've grasped after reading this.

I got this book for my daughter, she had a report to do on a famous person and chose Robin Williams. This was easy to follow for her and had a lot of good in depth material. There were many facts in here we hadn't heard about before. He was really a great man and I'm glad that after reading this book we know more about him, he seems much more human from the information in here rather than just a screen star. I think the author did a really good job researching the information in here and it's laid out well even if it is quite a short book.

This book is so cool! I've always wondered what those pretty patterns were called and this was a great book to learn how to make them. I love how easy the instructions are to follow and I've already started doodling a bunch so far and they have turned out great thanks to the suggestions in this book. I'm looking forwards to putting the authors' advice into a bigger project as there are several things I wouldn't have thought to try included in the book. I'm happy I read this book and as short as it is it really got me into the projects quickly.

I got this book to help with my computer course. I'm not great at programming but it's been so useful! Javascript is much harder than HTML so I really hoped this book would get me at least the basics down before my first course Quiz. Textbooks are so in depth and confusing but this was a much simpler and easier to understand read. There are some typos but it's not really distracting from the material and I think the author still did a goo job making the topic manageable to those who aren't very familiar with programming.

I got this book for work, I'm an artist but I've always used oils. I'm really happy with the techniques and tricks included here. The processes are described well and clearly so that they are super easy to follow. The author is really good at explaining her processes and has divided the book well. I feel confident that having read this book my painting will improve drastically. This book has helped me understand that the two mediums are not the same and that there are several things about acrylics that I had never realized were so important when painting with them as a medium. I'd like to read this book again to be sure I've gotten the techniques right as it is quite short so I don't feel I really got into enough detail with each part.
Perfect Arduino Uno clone with a stable clock and USB interface that does not require extra drivers. You can't ask for more.
The assembly went well until I connected the motors. They seemed to be tilted inward and flop around. While the price is right, there might be too much play for some applications.

I really, really, really, really, really wanted to love this mouse. The sharp cuts. The colors! The mouse draws a lot of attention. Tell me the last time you heard someone go, "OMFG, what a cool mouse!" Probably never...Then the mouse did something terrible one week later. No matter what happened, no matter what computer, it slowly moved top right. Sure the mouse buttons worked, but the optical part (the part that MOVES the mouse) had a complete failure. I returned to Amazon for a full refund. But buyer beware.

Why pay hundreds of dollars for a ball mount? Seems silly. Balls are round, and Dolica figured out that balls are not difficult to manufacture.The tripod is stable. I have had terrible tripods more expensive than this one. It is easy to switch between landscape and portrait with my DSLR and PCM audio recorder. There is even an alignment slot when shooting in portrait.I have a minor complaint, and it might be from my video background, but where is the rod to control the camera?
Keeps drinks frozen. This made a perfect fathers day gift for dad!

I was almost sold on a hard case, but I needed something shipped very fast for a camping trip we had later that afternoon - we had some extra guests who were coming along in the vehicle. I have now learned there is no reason to get a hard case. This case is extremely durable and waterproof. They have even taken extra steps in the design to make sure even the dreariest of Seattle days would be no match for this top carrier.The straps worked out fine, but it did take me a while to figure out how to attach the unit. Unfortunately I lost a strap camping and had to strap it up with one less strap. It still held very well and did not have one problem. I am not sure where I will get a replacement strap just yet, but it appears there are a lot of great third party options out there.

It runs small, but follow the advice of the other reviewers and you will get a great fit. My wife is about size 4 and the Large fit her just fine. The rips and strings give it a very unique, authentic look. My wife looks great in them.

I was able to connect up an old Sears Pentax lens very easily up to my Canon T5 DSLR. There is another review with some very good instructions on how to properly secure this adapter to your camera.Unfortunately, the old Sears lens I had was broken and stuck at F16. Still, in bright light, I could see it worked perfectly fine.

I was able to plug this right into an Arduino Uno, load the TFT v2 libraries, and run some of the demos in the examples. My only complaint is that the screen is not fully secured to the rest of the board, and it bounces a bit when i touch it.
I bought this for my wife as a cover up for her swimsuit and to wear it with some jean shorts. She looks amazing in it!
Sound quality was okay, but the plastic pieces easily broke and lost paint with light usage. They only lasted my daughter a month.

I have a 2014 Macbook Air and needed to connect to a projector for a presentation. This was fully compatible with my Macbook Air with zero problems. Works just as good as the expensive Apple alternative.

We love our Bona mop, but unfortunately could not find these pads anywhere in store -- even next to all the other Bona supplies. This is a genuine microfiber reusable pad and is great to have an extra on hand when we are cleaning the other pad.

After my Ryobi failed, and dealing with their terribly lazy customer non-service, I decided to purchase a GreenWorks cordless weed eater. So far, it blows the Ryobi unit out of the water in terms of power and run time. I am using the exact batteries as I use with my GreenWorks lawn mower.My wife complains that it is a little heavy compared to the previous unit, but she is very tiny and I do not have a problem with it. The weed eater is very sturdy and also works great as an edger.
