I was looking for a large 6" phone and this fits the bill.  It is a pretty nice phone.  I do miss a notification light, vibration as it turns on and it is slippery in the hand, minor things that I can do without.  The screen is beautiful, bright and clear, the sound is fantastic, loud and not tinny as most phones are.  It is pure Google Android which I like.  Very easy to operate.  The battery life could be a bit better, but I do get a full day of heavy use.  All in all a nice phone.  Nothing extraordinary but a nice phone.  Glad I bought it for the much lower cost.  Thank you Amazon!

I bought Emmy's to use on spots where our little dog has urinated on various spots.  I have bought many other brands that did nothing.  After reading the reviews on Amazon I decided to try it and it really does work.  It has totally removed the smell and she doesn't go to the spots and smell anymore.  She hasn't gone in the room since I've used the spray.  It is quite expensive but it is worth every penny since it works.  Would highly recommend it.

The Anker 2nd Generation charger is very effective.  While at the hospital waiting for our first grand child to be born it was a life saver!!  It kept our phones fully charged to keep in touch with family while waiting and sending the first photos of our brand new grandson!!  It is so easy to use and charges quite quickly.  The price can't be beat.  I would highly recommend it.  Thank you Anker!
These are nice pillow cases.  The price is what sold me.  They are quite soft and fit pillows perfectly.  Would recommend.
Love these crossword puzzle books.  Large print is easy to read, puzzles are good.  Many hours of enjoyment.  Would recommend.
Neosporin is the best.  Love the 3 tubes.  Arrived quickly.  Would recommend.
Nice bandaids.  Good size and stick well.  Could of been packaged better.  Sent in a mailing envelope, the box was crushed and bandaids were out of box.
Swiffer cloths are the best.  They are easy to use and pick up everything, from crumbs to dog hair.  Would highly recommend.
Very nice crossword puzzle book.  Large print is easy to see and love the spiral binding.  Many hours of enjoyment.  Would recommend!
Bandaids are good size and they stick well.
Large print is easy to see.  Love that it is spiral bound.  Good puzzles.  Many hours of enjoyment.  Would recommend.
Very nice crossword puzzle book.  Easy to see and good puzzles.  Very enjoyable.  Would recommend!
Love these crossword puzzle books.  Nice puzzles and easy to see.  Arrived quickly.  Many hours of enjoyment!

Bought to use in my unlocked phone.  Very convenient and easy to use.  Activated the phone online with no problem.  I haven't used Cricket before, and am very happy with the service.  Would recommend!
Large print is very easy to read.  The puzzles are great to do.  Would recommend to anyone who loves crossword puzzles.
Great numbers to use on a mailbox.  Last forever.  Unfortunately, I ordered the wrong size, much too small.  Will order larger size.
These pans are so convenient.  Use and dispose.  Arrived very quickly.
Bought this for my mother, she enjoys the Jumble puzzle books.  Easy for her to see and very enjoyable puzzles.  Gives her many hours of enjoyment.  Would recommend it.

These are perfect magnetic note pads.  They have very simple, pretty designs, and they are lined.  They stick perfectly to the fridge without slipping.  There are 60 sheets on each pad so they last a long while.  The price was pretty good too.  I would highly recommend them.
What a beautiful story!  For anyone who has hummingbirds in their yard, this book is a must.  What a wonderful experience. Ms Heidcamp writes a story that I will never forget.  I highly recommend it.
Perfect case for my 8" tablet.  I bought it not only for the size, but because it has an outside pocket to carry the charger and other accessories.  The price was also perfect.  I would recommend it.

I bought this blanket for my niece who is expecting her first child.  She loves it!  The blanket is very soft and perfect size.  I'm sure she and the baby will get years of use from it.  Would highly recommend it!

I have the Friendly Village dishes and love them, so I was thrilled to find the teapot on Amazon.  I have the dishes on my hutch and the teapot is a perfect addition.  It arrived in 2 days, in perfect condition.  Very happy, would highly recommend.

I bought these slippers because they are light enough to wear during the summer.  They do run big.  I take an 8 shoe so bought the 8, and they were a bit big.  I washed them in hot water and dried them in the dryer and they shrunk just enough so they fit.  They washed beautifully too.  They are very comfortable.  Cute too.  I do think they are too expensive though.  I would recommend, but beware of sizing and the price.

I use this in my bathroom as a seat to use when I get out of the tub.  It is a perfect size and is very attractive.  It looks great and serves the purpose.  A bit expensive but worth it.  I would recommend it.

These slippers are very comfortable, but a bit big.  I'm hoping that they don't stretch too much!  They are very attractive.  I take an 8 shoe and ordered the 8, I think the 7 would be too small, so I'm caught in the middle between the 2 sizes.  They are also too expensive for what I got.

I have the Alcatel Pop Icon that I bought on HSN a few months ago and like it alot, so when I read that Alcatel was coming out with their new flagship Idol 3 I couldn't wait to try it.  I bought it on Amazon through Alcatel, it was very slow in coming, I wish I had waited until it was available on Amazon with Prime.  The phone itself it terrific.  Perfect size, beautiful screen, lightning fast, feels good in the hand, very light, couldn't ask for more!  The price is great!  Alcatel offers a wonderful product for a fantastic price.  Just about everyone who has seen my new phone has ordered it for themselves.  Very impressive.  Would highly recommend.

Bought this case for my new Alcatel Idol 3 5.5".  Case fits very nicely.  It does add a bit of weight to the phone.  Can't go wrong for the price.  There aren't very many cases like this available so I chose this one and it works.  I would recommend it.
These adapters work perfectly.  Very easy to use.  Would highly recommend.

Needed to convert 2 lamps for new lampshades to fit.  These adapters work perfectly.  Wasn't sure of size so I ordered both 9/16" and 7/16 ".  The 7/16 are the size I needed.  So easy to use.  Very happy with the purchase, would highly recommend.
Bought these finials for 2 table lamps.  They are very attractive on the lamps.  Arrived very quickly.  Very happy with them.  Would highly recommend.

I bought three of these to replace some 20+ year old screw-drive type openers, which were starting to get noisy and flaking out a bit (sometimes wouldn't open all the way, etc).I had no idea the new belt drive units are so quiet.. This is VERY quiet.  All I hear now are the rollers sliding along the tracks.Regarding the installation - many of the reviews on this unit mention that the instructions are a bit lacking.. I don't think they were too bad.  The first unit took me just under three hours to install.  The second and third units took about an hour each.  I used my existing wiring to my wall control panels (just two wires per control panel), but re-wired the safety sensors from scratch as my sensor wiring was very old.These do not use the manual stop sensors like the older units did (where the carriage hits a stop sensor spring for up/down) - instead, you initially program what open and closed is and the unit remembers these locations and knows where to stop.  This is a great feature.  Everything was very easy to program.  Also, the included remote controls come paired to the units right out of the box.I also purchased the MyQ Internet Gateway, which is a great product to compliment these openers.  This must be purchased separately.Overall, I'm very impressed with these - I'm surprised they can put out such a nice product at such a low cost.  A great upgrade from my 20+ year old screw-drive units.

Works great and very easy to use.. much easier than trying to piece together assorted apps on your PC and find the right cable to do coding.. this wifi adapter simplifies everything.  I was coding my car within 5 minutes of opening the package.  Highly recommended!

Great table to be used next to a recliner or massage chair.  Assembly was very easy - only took about 5 minutes to assemble.  It feels nice and solid.  Arrived very well packed.  I'd say the color is a bit lighter than the rest of my "espresso" colored furniture.

Works great for repelling ants.. After it rains we always get ants in a couple rooms of our house.  I put a few drops of this oil in a cup of water and sprayed it around where the ants were coming into the house.. the next day, no signs of ants at all.

This is the one to buy.. I've tried a few different variations which either leak or don't last very long.  This particular model lasted nearly 5 years before needing replacement (the yellow part started to deteriorate after 5 years).

I bought this to clean out my water fountain, and it works great!  There is an option to simply pump out the water via the other side of the unit, or collect the water in the bin.  Mine arrived and was missing the main hose, but Amazon quickly shipped a new hose out.
What I received was a genuine, OEM BMW part.  Piece of cake to install on my 2012 Z4 sDrive 35is, and looks much better than the long antenna which came with the car.

Great wall mount, incredible value.  Build quality is strong - held up my 48" Samsung just fine and without any sagging.  Note that the 400x400 pieces come as extensions which attach to the main plate via screws and nuts (included).The only problem I had was that the M8 screws included were not long enough to work on my Samsung 48" TV, so I had to buy some longer ones locally.

I've owned a couple of massage chairs in the past, in the range of $1500-$2500.  The Inada is in a completely different world than those chairs.You know that feeling of such great relaxation and euphoria that you get when you get off of the massage table after an hour long massage (with a masseuse)?  The Inada Dreamwave is as close as you'll get to that feeling from a chair.  I called around looking for a local store which had one on display that I could test out, but ended up being put on hold or getting answering machines from my local back stores.  After days of research and reading countless reviews, I decided to take the plunge and buy one without a test drive.I've only owned this for a few days so far, but have spent a lot of time in it.  I've read some reviews which say the rollers aren't intense enough.  I like a tough massage - keep in mind that you can use the back-3D function to push out the back area which helps with the intensity.Yes, it is expensive, but if you're looking for the best, this is it.  In my opinion, here are the pros and cons of this chair:Pros:- Manual functions are wonderful, and the ability to combine different functions at once is great.  I've found that I really don't use the preset programs much - I use the manual functions far more often.- The remote is easy to use.  It takes a bit of time to figure out what functions can be combined, but once you do, you're good to go.- It is heavy.  This is a good thing in my opinion.  In my previous massage chairs, some of the more intense functions (heavy tapping) would cause the chair to slightly rock around a bit (not much, but enough to notice).  This is not the case with the Inada - it feels very solid.- The rollers are big.  In my previous chairs, the rollers were too small and a bit painful at times.  These rollers are larger, and the width between rollers can be adjusted (a great feature).- The fact that this chair gives you that "just left the masseuse" feeling.  This is priceless in my opinion.- The build quality is excellent.  No cheap parts or fittings.  During assembly, it was obvious that high quality components were used.- No useless frills (like built-in MP3 players, lights, cup holders, etc).Cons (keep in mind, I'm being VERY picky to find any cons with this chair.. but if I were to improve upon anything, these would be what I'd improve on):- The heat output is minimal, almost useless in my opinion.  This isn't very important to me anyways.- The motor is a bit loud - if you have music or the TV on, you won't notice the noise of the motor much, but if you plan to use this in a quiet room with no background noise, be aware that the motor is a bit loud.- It would be nice if the neck/shoulder areas were a bit stronger.  I feel that I have to push myself into the neck/shoulder areas to get enough pressure in these areas.  The neck piece actually moves up and down - it would be nice if it could somehow "lock" into place and therefore provide more downward pressure on your shoulders.UPDATE:  I found that if you remove the neck/shoulder attachment, the rollers at the top of the back area provide plenty of massage strength for the neck/shoulder area.  There are instructions on how to remove the neck/shoulder attachment in the manual.I understand that there is now an updated model of this chair where the heat and noise have been improved.  I'd be curious to hear from somebody regarding this who has used both this model and the newer model.  It would be great if Inada had some sort of trade-up program.If anybody has any questions, feel free to post them in a comment and I'll do my best to provide answers.
Comfortable and easy to use, however, the results are very inconsistent.. I was getting 138, then 115, then back to 138 all within a couple of minutes.

So far so good - I've had this installed for about a month now, in a location where I have power but no network wiring (its a shed).  Its about 120ft or so away from my WiFi access point and the picture/video comes through very clear.  Setup was easy - just be sure to install the latest firmware updates (available from microseven.com).Overall I've been very impressed with the Microseven cameras.

I have two fixtures in my garage and was previously using T10 40w tubes.  The transition was VERY easy - simply disconnect the power wires feeding the ballast and connect them to the wires leading to the tombstones (just on one side, NOT both sides of the fixture).The lighting is just a little bit brighter than my old 40w tubes.  Perfect for my garage.Regarding a delay with turning on - they take about one second to turn on.  My old tubes would flicker for a second before being fully "on", so these are about the same as far as delay before being completely on.Overall, while still a bit pricey, a great purchase.

Great little vacuum, but just keep in mind that it is fairly small (holds 2 gallons).  I bought this to help clean out the bottom of my water fountain (for the water that's below the pump level), but unfortunately its capacity was just too small to be a good fit for my needs.  I'll have to go with a larger shop vac.Plenty of power.  As far as battery life goes, I used it for a good 5-6 minutes and it drained about 50% of my M18 battery.

Typical great OXO quality - we have lots of OXO stuff in the kitchen and it's always been great.Be aware that this is fairly small - I bought this to replace an older OXO bottle opener which was much larger (almost 2x the length of this one).

I have a 3300sq/ft single level home with 2 HVAC units (one on each side of the house).  For the last few years I've been using two Nest units - initially the first generation, then the second generation.  Never had any problems with Nest, but I've really been wanting a remote temperature sensor, as the master bedroom gets really warm compared to the hallway where the Nest unit is located, so it requires a bit more tweaking to get the temp just right than I'd prefer to have to do.So after reading into the Ecobee3 and its remote sensor functionality, I thought it would be a good solution.  Installation was VERY easy, took less than 10 minutes to wire it up and connect it to my network (I already had the C wire so I didn't need to run the extra connection cable).  The unit then went into "Calibrating" mode for about 30-40 minutes.  After it was done calibrating, I noticed the temperature reading was about 5 degrees too high.  Odd.  Within the next hour or so, the reading eventually adjusted itself (without the AC or heater turned on) to the proper temperature.. Ok, so the unit needs a good 60-90 minutes to fully calibrate itself, no big deal.  At this point, I got around to using the interface - I really like that its a touch screen, and it was very responsive.  No sluggishness at all - every menu responded immediately, and I like how you just touch and pull up/down to adjust the temperature.I then pulled the plastic tab out of the remote temperature sensor, and the Ecobee3 unit immediately detected the sensor and prompted me to pair/activate it.  I then put the remote sensor in the master bedroom, which is only about 25-30ft away from the Ecobee3 main unit - its almost a direct line of sight between the sensor and main unit.  Throughout the night, I got 8 alerts that the remote sensor had disconnected and reconnected.  I do have a lot of tech in the house, although not more than a few wireless devices are on in the evenings.  The next night, I decided to place the remote sensor within 5ft of the Ecobee3 unit, just to determine if the 25-30ft distance was the issue the previous night.  Sure enough, another several disconnects/reconnects occurred, even with the remote sensor just 5ft away from the main unit.  I also pulled the battery out of the remote sensor, replaced it with a new one, then re-paired it.  No change - still disconnected several times.So in summary, I really like the Ecobee3 main unit and its interface - it is very responsive and has a great feel to it.. I like the touch-screen on the Ecobee3 better than the wheel control on the Nest.  However, in my particular case, the remote temperature sensor would not maintain a reliable connection to the main unit, which rendered its functionality useless.  I understand that every home is different, and perhaps mine was disconnecting due to some sort of interference, but I don't have anything particularly unique (as far as wireless devices go) in my home, and I really don't want to spend hours or days troubleshooting this thing.  Perhaps I just had a defective remote sensor.  I returned it and went back to my Nest for now.  Maybe if they release a new revision in the future I'll give it another shot.

I bought this to replace my two year old Oral B electric toothbrush.  This Sonicare seems to vibrate at a MUCH higher speed and leaves my teeth feeling cleaner than my old unit did.The charging glass is great - you just set the toothbrush in the glass and it starts to charge.. you don't have to snap it into any place in particular in the glass, just set it in there and it starts charging.  Same with the travel case - you just plug the travel case into a USB port or power charger and it charges the toothbrush inside.The only downside I've found is that if you turn it on, then try to turn it off within a few seconds, you have to cycle through its cleaning modes before it will turn "off".  A minor annoyance but not a big deal.This seems to keep itself cleaner than my old unit as well - I don't see nearly as much built up gunk to clean up on this one as my old unit used to collect.As somebody else said, this really does feel like the "Apple" of electric toothbrushes.Would highly recommend!

Simple to setup and configure.  I like that the outlets are spaced far enough apart that all of my AC adapters fit without having to use extension cords.This works with the latest version of PowerChute personal edition, and includes a USB cable to connect the unit to a PC.I use this to power a Core i7 PC, an 8 Port PoE network switch, a cable modem, a router, and a cooling fan in my server rack - I'm told by the software that this will provide ~25 minutes of runtime with the load I'm putting on it.

Great scale!  The LCD display is very large and easy to read.  This has a nice heavy feel to it and is easy to use - just two buttons on the unit.Note the dimensions of the product, as it was a bit larger than most other kitchen scales I looked at.  Perfect for our needs in our kitchen.
Just what you'd expect from wire staples, keep in mind that you can use these for many types of wiring - CAT5E/CAT6, RG59, RG6, etc.

Looks great on our reclaimed wood coffee table (which is 60" length - so this hangs over 6" on each side).  This is thin/soft enough to properly fall flat over the edges of the table.  Would highly recommend!

Great salad bowl!  Feels sturdy, and just the right size.  Smooth on the inside but textured on the outside, with a nice "lip" around the edge for carrying.  Very light-weight.  Can't beat this for the price!Would highly recommend.

These are great for use with RG59, RG6 or even CAT5E/CAT6 cable runs.  I could only find these in white at my local hardware store, so it was nice to find these in black online (which prevents me from having to paint them when run under the eves on my home).Since these are only nailed down on one side, you can pull the cable out if needed, then snap it back in later, as the little U shape does pull/bend back to allow you to remove the cable even after its been nailed in.

This is a great camera for the price - PTZ and 720p resolution.. and much better wifi signal than my last wireless IP camera.  The antenna is removable/replaceable on this unit.The software, however, has some room for improvement.  Upgrading the firmware takes at least two "stages" of updates, likely more if you're on an older version (if on version X, you have to update to version Y before upgrading to version Z).Once you get it setup, it works great.  I use this to watch our dogs.  I am using this with Blue Iris which detected and configured the camera automatically.Overall, I would certainly recommend this for the price.

Works just as expected - I have 3 PoE IP cameras (9w each) and 4 workstations hooked up to this which are all working great.  This is as small as you'd expect an 8 port switch to be (the TP-Link 8 port PoE switch is much larger).  This uses an external power adapter.. So far its barely even warm with 7 of its 8 ports being used.  Highly recommended!

These are GREAT cameras for the money.. small, well built and very easy to setup.  I ordered four of these and had them all up, running and functional within a matter of minutes.  The firmware updates are easy to install.  I previously had four analog cameras which were state of the art in 2005.  These new IP cameras blow my old cameras out of the water - the picture quality difference is significant.What would be nice is if they offered a longer extension (between the base and the camera).. I can't seem to find a longer version of this extension anywhere.  They do include AC power adapters (which I am not using because I'm using PoE).  I ended up running new CAT6 to all four of these new cameras and using a TPLink PoE switch.Note that you DO need to use the included power splitters if you are going to use PoE - these "splitters" take your PoE RJ45 in, and breaks it out to an RJ45 and a male power plug, which both plug into the pigtail attached to the IP camera.I can't comment on the longevity of these, as I've only had them installed for a few days, but I will say that Microseven was very quick to respond when I e-mailed and called them (with pre-sales questions).

This switch is fine, however, keep it mind  that it is quite large in size.  Check the product dimensions to be sure its size suits your needs before purchasing.  I had to exchange it for a smaller physical switch (with 4 PoE and 4 non-PoE ports).Also, keep in mind that the 8 port model (with all 8 powered ports) DOES have a fan, so there will be some noise coming from it.

Overall, I love these - they are very soft (although I've only washed them once so far).Pros:Incredibly softDeep pockets - more than enough for my 13" memory foam mattressCons:These do seem a bit thin - I have two dogs that get up on the bed on occasion and I'm afraid these may tear easier than other sheets.  Time will tell.Also, these do get a bit warm - noticeably warmer than other sheets I've used.. you may find yourself removing the top sheet or duvet cover on a comforter, or even turning down the heater in the winter time.

This thing screams!  I put it in a Dell with a Core i7 w/ 8GB of RAM.. what a speed difference with this SSD installed!This does NOT include a 2.5" to 3.5" adapter, so you may need to pick one up if you're going to use this in a 3.5" drive bay.

I ordered this for my Kobalt stainless workbench - the light bar that came with it died (not just the bulb, the fixture was broken).. This one is a perfect replacement!  Same size and snapped right in.This is a bit less bright than I would prefer, but overall I like it.  I may look into changing out the bulb for a brighter one at some point.

Screaming fast!  Installation was a breeze in my Shuttle XPC - I didn't use the hinksink and fan assembly included.. I did pick up some Arctic Silver 5 thermal compound to use with this.  This runs at 4ghz by default in my Shuttle XPC.I can't comment on overclocking as I don't overclock any of my CPUs.

After eight years, my InSinkErator 444 finally gave out, so I ordered this one to replace it.. installation was not difficult, but it was time consuming, as this one is 3/4" wider than my old model 444.  Therefore, I had to re-plumb the piping under the sink to accommodate this new larger unit.This is a little bit more quiet than my last unit.. not a significant difference though.  I do like that this includes a 6 year in-home warranty.Keep in mind that you will need a 3 prong electrical cord, a cable clamp, and plumbers putty to install this.
Exactly what I needed - great adapter for turning PC power cables into general purpose extension cables.

This is NOT compatible with Corsair Vengeance 16GB (2x8GB) memory - part number CML16GX3M2A1600C10 - this memory worked just fine in my previous Shuttle model, but not with this one (or the SZ87R6).The system would randomly power off or power cycle (I'd hear a "click" from the power supply) every 4-5 minutes when in Windows - this led me to believe it was the motherboard or power supply.  I called Shuttle tech support who said the memory should be compatible.  I tried a different SH87R6 all together, as well as a different CPU before finding out that the memory was not compatible.  Unfortunately, the memory it was not compatible and was the cause of the problems.  I picked up some Patriot memory (16GB again) which works just fine.With that being said, it is a well built, quiet little machine.  I've always been a fan of Shuttle.

Works just as expected - I'm using this to connect my Dell XPS 13 to my Onkyo TX-NR818 receiver (and my Samsung TV).  Plug and play, came right up as expected.The cable head on the mini display port side is a bit wide, so it may block access to a USB port on the side of a laptop.

These truly are better mouse traps than any I've used in the past.  They are:- Easy to load - Just pull back on the top bar and it locks into place- Easy to unload the dead mouse - again, just pull back on the top bar and drop the mouse out- The yellow plastic around the metal bar prevents the mouse from getting cut and bleeding- You squish the bait into a little cylinder, so the mouse has to work a bit at getting to the bait (they can't just quickly pull the bait off like other traps allow).- Built from sturdy plasticI caught two mice within the first night after putting these out.Highly recommended!

This thing is like a sleeping pill!  The road outside our house has become busier and busier over the past few years.. and has recently been waking us up in the middle of the night if a loud truck or motorcycle goes by.  What I didn't realize is that its not that the road noise is too loud, its that the master bedroom is so dead silent at night that we hear EVERYTHING outside the house.This white noise machine is awesome - it just produces a whirring sound like a fan.. you can adjust the sound to be higher or lower pitched to your liking.. we put it on the opposite side of the room.  When I first took it out of the box and plugged it in, I thought it would be way too loud (even on its lowest setting), but once placed at the opposite side of the room, it's perfect.Update - 01/18/2015:  I still love this device.. however, a TIMER would be wonderful!  I understand they want to keep this simple, and I could easily add a wall outlet timer.. but the addition of a built-in timer, so it kicks on around 11pm and turns off around 7am would be great!

Great sink.. especially for the price point.  A few notes to be aware of:1 - Be sure to get the matching pop up drain (by Decor Star as well) as it fits perfectly.2 - The bottom edges are not perfectly straight - so you'll want to be sure to caulk to prevent water from seeping underneath the sink.3 - I ordered two of these - neither one was perfectly level, so you may need to use a very small shim (1mm) to level them out perfectly.Overall, I love these.. adds a great look to the master bathroom.

Great quality caulking gun!  I don't do a lot of caulking, but when I do I'd been using a cheap $5 gun from my local hardware store.  This one is great!  It has a punch and a clipper so this is all you need.Highly recommended.

I had to widen a drain hole in a granite counter top from 1.25" to 1.75".  This bit was able to do the job - it took about 20 minutes total.  Keep in mind that there is a special technique when using this bit - you have to go up and down as you go around the circle.  Be prepared for a LOT of dust.

Great drain!  I used this along with a decor star vessel sink.The only thing I should mention is that I have granite counters, and the threaded portion of this drain just barely made it through the thickness of my counters, so I wasn't able to use the rubber grommet at the bottom.. it worked just fine without it.Yes, it is bigger than you'd expect, but look at the dimensions in the product info before buying.

My mower, with a Kohler engine, needs lots of air flow for the intake. Most supply stores I went to only had the two shorter versions of this filter. The shorter versions starve my engine of much needed air. I was glad to find this filter on Amazon and now my mower works much better.It is quality built and I get a year of use from it in my dusty conditions.

I installed this cable on my 17' fishing boat so that I could have one Lowrance HDS unit on the steering console, and another on the bow of the boat. After fighting the boat for a few hours (it did not want another cable installed, or was it that I didn’t want to cram my arms and hands into the tightest areas of the boat?) I connected the two units and they work seamlessly.One note about my installation: the cable hole in my dash was not big enough to fit another connector through it. I didn't want to drill another hole in my dash just for one additional cable, so I cut the cable and fed the cut end through the existing hole in my dash. Then I spliced it together with conventional connectors. I was concerned about how well it would work after doing that, but it turned out to work perfectly. I am not saying this is something you should do, I'm just pointing out that it is possible in tight situations. Your results may vary.

I am very disappointed in these sharpeners. I used them on only one blade and the diamonds came off so quickly that I had to finish the project with a different set of sharpeners. I have owned several different kinds of diamond stones, and this was the worst I have come across.Everything else about the sharpeners was fine: the handles and glue holding the diamond plates. But the most important part, the diamonds, was terrible.

The concept of this fender is fantastic. It is easily stowable and can also be used as cushioning in your storage compartments. It is durable and comes with good quality rope and Velcro tape. Its construction is three layers of closed cell foam. The two outer layers are textured to aid in keeping it in place instead of slipping off easily when under compression between your boat and a dock.But here is the issue to be aware of before purchasing it: it won't help fend off your boat from a dock if the dock has poles on the outside of the dock framing and if your boat has a thick bumper lip. It is too thin for that. For example, my boat has a bumper trim that protrudes from the side of the boat. This protrusion sticks out slightly more than the thickness of this fender (taking into consideration the inward taper of my freeboard). Therefore, the bumper trim on my boat is hitting the poles, while the fender is not touching the dock or the poles. This leaves my boat still slamming on the dock poles when waves approach. Therefore, I need to continue to use the thicker, round fenders.So check the configuration of your boat carefully to ensure it will work for your boat. In my case, I have limited points where I can tie up this fender; so it is ineffective for me to get it tied up to the point of where it will protect my bumper trim.

I own low quality dial indicators, and some very high quality ones. On a scale of 1 to 10, I would rate this indicator a 7, which is a pretty good rating considering there are lots and lots of crappy indicators currently on the market. Just to put this further into perspective: most of the dial indicators on the market today, which are going for $60 or less, I would rate them as 1s or 2s. For the price ($20 at the time of this writing), this Steelex dial indicator is a steel.Its movement is smooth and has shown to be very accurate. The dial lock nut is a bit small, but a normal size for low cost indicators.My only complaint about this unit is that the pointer tabs are not that good to work with. They are just the small clip on style that can be tough to move when your hands are oily, and they pop off too easily. I gave it 4 stars because of this issue, otherwise it would have been 5 stars.I highly recommend this dial indicator over several of the $80 models on the market. This way you get a good dial indicator that won't kill your wallet if you accidently drop it.

Note: I don't use this on automobiles; but instead, I use it on machinery.It can be hard to get two or three prong pullers to latch on the tight areas of machinery, but this bearing seperator gets in the tight cranny's. The prong pullers can also slip off a part easily, but this bearing separator does not.I can speak on the wonderful quality of this tool for a home shop. I am not sure how it would perform to daily use in a commercial shop.I have used it about 10 times so far. The threads and nuts have remained solid through some difficult situations.It comes with all the accessories I have needed so far, and I cannot see needing anything else. The selection of sizes of the spacers has worked out fantastic.The case holds all the tools solidly in place.This set has helped me so much that I gave away my two and three prong pullers as I no longer need them.

The DualBus Plus is quality made. The housing is sturdy, cover is strong, and the metal is durable and made of stainless steel.The four threaded posts that accept the battery cables come with nuts. I had to add washers to ensure a solid fit to my cable connectors. The 10 screws were the perfect size for my accessory wire connectors.The base housing has two screw holes in it so you can attach this assembly to your boat. They are located in the center of the assembly.The clear cover easily disconnects from the housing when you squeeze in the two yellow tabs; very handy for accessing the screws.The one flaw I found is that the clear cover is not large enough to completely cover the connectors on the wires. There is enough metal sticking out that you can still get shocked if you don't watch your fingers close enough when working around other items near this bus. The cover is handy to have, and it makes this bus safer than others that don't include a cover, but it would be nice if it stuck out a " more on all sides.

This is a simple device that plugs securely into your cigarette lighter port. Both USB ports are spaced out far enough that you don’t have to fight with one plug while unplugging in the other.It has two output currents: 2.1A for the top plug and 1.0 amp for the lower plug. Some devices require lower amperage for charging. Both outlets output 5 volts.You can hook this up to either 12 volts or 24 volts. Neither will affect the output amperage and voltage.I powered two devices easily at the same time with no drop in power.This is great adapter in a small package.

This speaker packs more punch than I expected. I am not going to review this in comparison with more substantial speakers as that would not be fair. However, as a small portable speaker of its class, it has great sound and a wonderful shape.It also has the ability to connect to others speaker and headphones and have them all run at the same time.Size: this is only 1 7/8 inches (47mm) tall and 2 3/8 inches (60mm) wide when in the closed position. In the open position, it is 2 9/16 inches (65mm) tall.Shape: The round shape makes it great to transporting; no corners to get caught on things in your bag or pockets.Build: It is made with a plastic housing. The housing is coated with a thin rubber that makes it easy to handle the unit. The housing is a little flexible when squeezed hard, but this is good to keep it from cracking under pressure. The expandable tube is also durable as it has not split or broken from the constant opening and closing. This unit also has rubber feet to keep it from moving around.Switch and dial: It has an on/off switch that is sturdy and makes solid contact. The volume dial is strong and turns easily. The volume dial does not cause scratching sounds in the sound when it is adjusted. I have seen happen this on lower quality units.Locking position: Since this is an expandable unit, it operates by a simple twist lock action. There is a mark on the side to show its alignment, but it does not really need it since the twist action is very strong and easy to use. It locks in place and does not come loose accidentally.Speaker protection: The only protection for the speaker (and my only complaint about the unit) is a single plastic bar that goes across. It leaves two large gaps on either side of the speaker which are unprotected. If you throw this item in a bag or backpack with other floating items, then pens or such can poke at the speaker and ruin it. You will need to store it separately from other items. I do, however, know that if too much protection is placed over the speaker, then that can degrade sound quality; one of the very few tradeoffs with this item.Sound quality: The sound is great for a small portable speaker. The expanding feature of it is necessary to get better sound quality, but you can also use it in its collapsed position.Connection cord: it has one cord permanently attached to it. This cord is a mini plug that fits in almost all cell phone earphone connections. The cord is only 3.5 inches (90mm) long which means you cannot plug it into things that are located any decent distance away. But, one nice feature is that the plug tucks away securely so that it does not interfere with anything else when in storage.Recharging: It is rechargeable with built in batteries. It comes with a cable for recharging. Having its own power keeps a cellphone battery from draining fast.Compatibility: It works on all devices that accept 3.5mm speaker plugs. It does not matter about software or anything; if you have a speaker port, it will work on it.Accessories:It comes with an additional cord for plugging it into other items to receive sound or send sound. This cord makes up for the installed short cord if you need more distance since it is 3 feet (1 meter) long. This cord comes with a Velcro strap to keep it wound up nicely.It also comes with a multi-use cord that has the standard mini sound jack, a USB connection, and a mini HDMI connection. This cord is just shy of 2 feet long.A fabric bad is included that is large enough to hold the speaker and cords. It uses a draw string to keep it closed.Instructions: very short, simple, and clearly written; but the text it very small.I'm not much for small portable speakers in general; but based on what I have seen from this one, I highly recommend it.

This bit works fantastic in several kinds of metals. I have used it in soft and hard metals and had excellent results. The cutting edges have stayed sharp through it all. It gives a good, fairly smooth finish. This has become one of my important tools in the shop. I highly recommend this bit.

Overall, I am very pleased with this machine and I highly recommend it, but there are some details I noted further in this review that you may be interested in.I bought this for its variable speed option. I use it for buffing instead of grinding. Buffing should be done at about 1500rpm instead of 3400rpm. The lower buffing speed helps the material from becoming overheated. Even though this grinder runs at a minimum of 2000rpm, it is still much better than buffing at 3400rpm.I posted some photos as reference to what I am talking about in this review.Adjustable speed:The dial for adjusting speed is located on the front to the right of the power switch. It is a durable dial and feels like it is mounted well. You can adjust speed from 2000rpm to 3300rpm. Then there is a click at the highest setting that jumps the speed up to a max of 3450prm. It does not take long for the speed to adjust, and you can kind of tell when the processor it regulating to the correct speed. The processor is located within the base of the machine.Power at different speeds:I tested several different parts and pressures to see if the torque was reduced at lower speeds. I did not notice any difference in the power that it gave. It held a good amount of torque at any speed and seemed to be a little stronger than my Black and Decker grinder that I also converted to a buffer; even though both have the same horse power rating.Power switch:It works well, but its mounting is weak. It almost feels like it will pop out of the machine. It hasn't yet.Vibration:There is some vibration, but it is minimal for a machine in this price category. Vibration is a tricky thing since the grinding wheels can cause more vibration than a machine does. When I tested this Palmgren machine with the grinding wheels on, it had about the same vibration as my Black & Decker grinder, but less than my old (1970s model) Craftsman grinder. With the grinding wheels off, it had some vibration, but it was evident the wheels were causing most of the vibration.Grinding wheel manufacturers aren't the best at balancing their wheels. Therefore, if you get a machine that has lots of vibration, try changing the wheels to see of that helps.Stability:This machine is fantastically stable and has a wider base than my other grinders. When not mounted to a table or stand, my other grinding machines vibrate all over the place and cannot be used until they are mounted. However, I tried this machine not mounted and it stayed in place. I don't recommend using the machine not mounted, but I just wanted point out how well the base is designed.Wheel housings:The housings that go around the grinding wheels are very durable and well built; much better than other grinders (within this price point) I have used. The vacuum attachments are placed in a good position to keep the machine functional and suck up most of the debris.Resting platforms and guards:The resting platforms are thick metal and have secure mounting. They are also a good large size instead of being small like on other grinders. My other grinders have cheap and thin platforms that move too easily and bend with little effort. The eye shields of this Palmgren are ok; they are the same as my Black & Decker grinder. This means they are good for a home shop, but not what I consider to be good enough for an industrial shop.Motor housing:What I really like about this machine design is that the motor housing is long and narrow rather than fat. The large diameter motor housings get in the way of grinding or buffing large items, but this Palmgren housing is small enough to allow for grinding large items without bumping the motor.Wheel washers:If you note in one of the photos I posted, each side of the grinder has different types of washers which hold the wheels. The coarse side as the large, thick washers; and the fine grit side has the normal grinder washers. I don’t know what the benefit this design is, but I just wanted to note it for your reference in case you are using this machine for other purposes like I am.So far, this machine has performed very well for me. I will probably get another one to replace the junky, vibrating Craftsman grinder I currently have.

I got these to use with my tie down straps when I transport my small tractor (weighs close to 2000 pounds). I also use them as extensions to get more length when I am strapping down larger items.  The webbing is durable, and the protective sleeves work great at keeping the webbing from fraying when laid over cornered areas.The metal rings are very strong and big enough to easily accept the larger hooks from bigger tie down straps.I like the 36 inch length better than my other 24 inch straps since it makes it easier to access the rings under a vehicle.These work great and I recommend them.

I have a 17 foot fishing boat and didn't want a boat hook that was too big, but I also didn't want one that was too short when extended. This pole is the perfect size! When contracted, it is short enough to fit easily into the side compartment, but gets long enough to reach what we need it to.The pole is very strong when extended. It does not flex and the twist lock feature holds the sections in place very tightly.The plastic hook is also very strong and the shape is convenient to work with. The rubber tip seems like it can pop off easily, but so far ours has stayed in place.Case-in-point for how well this boat hook works: there was a log in our local river that became an obstruction and had already been hit by a few boats. We used this hook to lasso a rope around the log, tow the log and then used the hook again to remove the rope. My story may sound easy enough, but it was actually much tougher to accomplish because of several factors working against us such as: the heavy current, strong wind, and other obstructions around when we parked the log and tried to remove the rope at a distance while keeping the boat from hitting surrounding objects.This is one great boat hook and I highly recommend it.

I used this set of tie downs to strap down my small tractor (the kind with a bucket and tiller/grader, not a lawn mower) on a trailer. I'm not sure how much it weighs, but my previous hardware store straps didn't do the job. My hardware store straps lasted about one hour on the road and almost broke the webbing of the straps.I got two of these and also a pair of heavier weight JEGS tie downs.JEGS Performance Products 80137 Ratchet Tie Down KitThese Erickson straps don't hold as much weight as the JEGS I got, but they do hold quite a bit. My reason for getting these Erickson straps was to have a set that weren't quite as large so that I can use them for smaller applications.They did the job of holding my tractor very well on the trailer. The ratchet is durable and will also lock into the closed position. The hooks are strong and the webbing didn't fray after the few times I have used them (unlike my hardware store straps).I used these tie downs in conjunction with these axel straps:36" Blue Axle Straps (4 Pack)

I used this set of tie downs to strap down my small tractor (the kind with a bucket and tiller/grader, not a lawn mower). I'm not sure how much it weighs, but my previous hardware store straps didn't do the job. My hardware store straps lasted about one hour on the road and almost broke the webbing of the straps.  However, these JEGS tie downs worked great for a few trips on the road with no wear.The hooks are large and the locking tabs are strong. The ratchet assembly works very smooth. When done ratcheting the strap, it has the ability to lock the handle down to prevent it from flopping open.Overall, these work wonderful and seem like they will last a long time.If you are looking for tie downs that are a strong, but a little smaller in size than these JEGS, then I recommend this one:Erickson 51330 Black 1.5" x 15' Heavy Duty Ratcheting Tie-Down Strap

Our boat gets dirty from all the algae and dirt in our rivers. We also get severe hard water spots. This soap did just as good as any other soap we have used including automotive soaps. It did not get off the hard water spots; we used vinegar to take care of that problem.Overall, I cannot see this soap being any better than anything else except for its ability to be safe for use in the water.

I had roughly seven 10x15 foot areas of my yard that needed seeding. I tried grass seed from my local hardware store where they had their own special mix and some generic brands. That grass only lasted a year before it died. I then tried this Scotts high traffic mix seed. Wow, it did work great! These areas now look better than my old grass.The special coating on each seed really does work well. Many years ago, I was a landscape foreman and was leery about the coated seed just being a gimmick. However, the coating seemed to help tremendously.I did not do anything special when I applied the seed. I typically add hay and peat moss, rake it in, and etc. But I was lazy when this seed arrived, so I just threw it on the yard and watered it once a day, nothing else. I even missed a few days of watering because I was busy with other stuff. Low-and-behold, this seed came through with charm and has become very lush and deep green while my old grass is a little on the brown side. It took this seed about 8 days to germinate and I was mowing it in another 14 days after that.I highly recommend this seed since it can be neglected a little and still grow into something nice. My next job is to reseed the rest of my lawn to get the entire lawn back to looking lush.

I purchased this to cook bacon and vegetables on the grill.  My wife does not like the smoke and smell that bacon generates in the house when cooked on the stove or in the oven. I, on the other hand, think of it as an air freshener for the house. Since I did not win that battle-of-the-bacon, I decided to start cooking it on the grill with much better results. However, I was making pans with tinfoil and wanted something more durable.This griddle is very durable being made of heavy gauge steel. It is heavy and the seams are welded. It has a riser on the backside so you can fold it in to have the pan lie flat, and fold it out to have the pan sit up at an angle for draining liquids. It is so well made that it will perform flawlessly with continuous use such as in a busy restaurant.The advertising makes it look much larger than it is: The display image of the pan shows three sausage links, scrambled eggs, and two pancakes. In reality, you will only get one normal size pancake on it since the entire pan is only 9x11 inches. Because of its size, it actually fits perfect on my side burner, but is too close to the grill's adjustment knob in that configuration.I don't recommend cooking anything more than just a few strips of bacon on it. The drip trough is not very big and will not accommodate holding much grease. Besides, bacon tastes better when it is cooked in its own grease. Therefore, I am still using the tinfoil-pan method of cooking bacon which is working well as I can cook one pound at one time on a normal size gas grill.Overall, this pan works great for cooking vegetables and maybe a pancake, plus it is well made. I feel it is a great deal for the money. I recommend it, but not for cooking items that need a larger size griddle.

I have tried a few different kinds of receiver pin locks, and this one has done a great job so far. Other locks of this style have rusted quickly or did not have durable locking mechanisms. Last winter I had to cut off a receiver lock that rusted shut. However this lock has performed great. I will update this review once I have had it on my vehicle for a long period of time.It is made of stainless steel, but that does not mean much unless it is made of quality stainless. This lock seems to fit that bill. It is very heavy duty. It also has a rubber cap and an O-ring to help keep out the bad elements. I have removed the lock several times and not had any issues with the cap or the O-ring.I have a factory installed receiver on my F150 truck. The length of this pin lock fits it perfectly with a little extra length. I like having the little extra length because a tight fitting receiver lock can give trouble getting it off when they start to fail.I recommend this receiver lock over many others as I have tried several of them.UPDATE: I have had this on my truck for over a year now. It went through a rough winter of heavily salted roads, and through a very wet spring and summer. With all that salt and water, this lock has held up better than any other I have used.

The individually packaged wipes are what attracted me to this product. I keep a box on my boat, so they are stored for long periods in the heat, and I don't want them to dry out like the bulk packaged wipes will do even if they have a zip-lock style seal.In the regard of them being individually packaged, they are fantastic. These are far more convenient than any other packaging. I can throw them in a backpack without worry of a can accidentally spraying or a bottle accidentally spilling.As far as how well they work; well I have never seen "Off" brand products work that great. I have used many different brands of insect repellent and the best I have seen is the brand Repel. We have a large mosquito and biting fly population where I live because of all the swamp land. Repel brand wipes have worked the best for us to keep all the bugs away. The Off brand products seem to wear off easy and needs to be reapplied every hour. These wipes dry far too quickly and are useless after you only get your arms and neck covered. You have to break out another wipe to get more body parts covered.If you are in great need of the convince of individually packaged bug repellent wipes, then get these, but if you can deal with bulk packaged wipes, then these are a much better product:Repel 94100 Sportsmen 30-Percent Deet Mosquito Repellent Wipes, 15 Count 6-PackI hope that Repel will soon start providing their product in individually packaged wipes.

I installed this on my 17 foot deep V boat. It has helped tremendously for my mapping of the local rivers and lakes, because the waters where I boat are dangerous with unmarked shallow points and numerous deadheads. It can be very hard to find the channel when a fog drifts in or when the water becomes murky.What is comes with:Antenna/4' NEMA 2000 cableMEMA 2000 T connectorSpat/pole mountMounting hardwareGasket sealInstall GuideAdditional items needed for install:It comes with everything you need to mount the Point-1, except a pipe (pipe is needed if you don't mount the Point 1 on a flat surface).If you don't have a NEMA2000 installed already, then you will need to get the NEMA2000 network starter kit; there is no way around this option. Thankfully, the only difficult thing about installing a NEMA2000 network is working in the tight areas of your boat. Lowrance made its network set-up very easy to establish. Now that I have installed the NEMA2000, I am thinking of adding a Sirius weather receiver to my boat.Mounting:The directions say not to mount this item within 3.3 feet of your motor or trolling motor. That left me with mounting it near the helm. Because the Point-1 is only 3.5" in diameter, I could have mounted directly to a flat area on the front of my console. However, I was not ready to drill holes in the console, so I decided to use a pole attached to the vertical flat area on the front of my console.The Point-1 comes with an attachment to mount it to threaded plumbing pipe if you need the unit to be elevated. I found a 10" long plastic threaded pipe at my local hardware store that worked perfectly. I was able to string the Point-1 cord through the pipe and out the bottom through a gap in the boat console. The attachment also has a notch in the bottom of it so you can run the cord outside of the pipe if you don't want to run the cord in the pipe.There is an arrow on the top of the Point-1 device to let you know which direction to point it. You don't have to be perfect in aligning the arrow with the bow of the boat since you can also make an offset adjustment in your Lowrance unit. I had to set mine for -8 degrees.Keeps structure scan straight with your heading:One good surprise I noted is that the Point 1 will compensate your structure scan imaging for sideways drifting of your boat. If your boat is moving against a wind and current going different directions, then keeping your boat straight at slow speeds can be difficult. The Point 1 will sense this and change the alignment of your structure scan image to continue reading straight according to your heading. I have found this feature is most effective during mapping the contours of lake and river bottoms. Then I know my data is aligned properly when I upload the files into my mapping program, such as InsightGenesis.Software updates:Another great feature is that you can update the software of the Point 1 through your HDS unit as Lowrance makes improvements. This will help lengthen the usefulness of the Point 1 and keep it from going out of date too early as technology changes.Calibration:Easy! Just push the calibrate button on your HDS unit and drive the boat in a circle until it tells you it is complete. That is usually 1.5 circles for me. I only needed to calibrate it once so far, but I did a few more times just in case. I then drove the boat around and found it was not showing my point pointed straight forward on the HDS unit. I then set an offset in the HDS unit until I found that -8 degrees was the correct offset. It now shows my boat moving straight when I am moving straight.GPS:It is as accurate as the HDS unit internal GPS. If your HDS unit is mounted in an area that prevents it from getting good signal, then get this unit to compensate for that problem.  The HDS units receive GPS signal at 5hz (5 times per second), but the Point 1 receives signal at 10hz. This feature does not improve signal reception for the Point 1, but it gives faster location readings if you are traveling at high speed.Problems:There are only two problems I have found:1. It is slow to compensate for turns. If I am traveling at high speed (for me that is 20 to 40mph) then the Point 1 takes about 10 seconds to turn the arrow on the HDS unit to the correct direction my boat is facing.2. Shows a zigzag course: While traveling at 1 to 3mph, a trail on the HDS unit will show as very spikey and zigzag as the Point 1 is not incredibly accurate with its coordinates. It is accurate enough and comparable with the HDS unit internal GPS, but I have not seen the Point 1 be more accurate than the internal unit. Only survey equipment GPS units are spot -on accurate. That is why Lowrance says to not use the Point-1 for autopilot functions. You have to get a more expensive GPS unit if you need it for autopilot; I am not sure if Lowrance has one of those too.Overall:Overall, it is a very good accessory to have for showing your boat heading, getting proper structure scan alignment, and improving signal for HDS units that are obstructed from a clear view of the sky. It is great that Lowrance will continue to give it software support after you purchase it. I recommend the Point 1.

I have this bulb and the Tuwago 9.5W Globe CREE® LED Bulb - Warm White 2700K bulb, both of which are installed side by side in my bathroom. Both are great bulbs. However, I find this Satco S8784 bulb to be better.The 5000 kelvin light color is a true 5000K. It is not blue like 5500K and 6000K bulbs, and it is not yellow like the 4000K and 3000K bulbs. Mine seemed to be slightly on the bluish side when I first installed it, but then I realized that my bathroom walls are painted a pale blue. I tried the light in a different location and saw that this bulb is truly at the rated 5000K color, I even compared it to my photography lamps. Just in case you are unaware: 5000k is the rating for true white light. Incandescent bulbs are usually rated at around 2700k and give a yellowish light. Any bulb called "Daylight" is not really daylight unless its color temperature is 5000k.The box says it is only 460 lumens in brightness, and the product photo says it is 200 lumens. I thought I got a dim bulb since 460 lumens is not very bright. However, once turned on, it was a little brighter than my fluorescent and other LED bulbs. I think they might have underrated the lumens for this bulb. I can say for sure that it is at least as bright as the Tuwago bulb, which is rated at 480 lumens.Its size is the same as the typical bathroom globe bulbs that are incandescent and fluorescent. The Tuwago® 9.5W Globe CREE® LED Bulb - Warm White 2700K bulb is much larger, which is nice too but kind of bulky. I am glad this Satco bulb is the same size as the regular style bulbs.When turned on, there is no delay; it is instant on.I need to state that the product description is not correct at the time of writing this review: It states this is a 7 watt bulb, but the bulb is actually 8 watts as listed on the box. This misrepresentation almost wants to make me mark this review as a 4 star rating, but the product itself is very quality, so I left it at 5 stars.So far, this is the best LED globe style bulb I have tried out. I highly recommend it.

I would have uploaded a photo of the lights as they compared to my current 32 watt fluorescent fixtures to show these LED bulbs are not as bright as the seller states they are; however, that option is not available when I view this particular product.Seller issues - Micropoint Optoelectronics:I purchased a package of 10 of these bulbs under the product description of being 18 watts per bulb which were described to replace 50 watt fluorescent replacement. I was then sent 16 watt bulbs. I informed the seller of the issue, and they said they downgraded the lights as per their engineer to support their guarantee, and wanted to give me a 5% discount off my next purchase. This was not an acceptable resolve since I need 18 watt bulbs for a certain brightness level in my shop. This is what the description stated when I placed my order:New arrival! Micropoint T8 LED Fluorescent Tube,SMD5730 LED Lamp,10pcs/package,48",18watt,1800lm-2000lm,High Brightness, No Dark Area, Color Temperature:  4000-4500k,Natural White,Ac85-265v,Diffused Pc Cover & aluminum Alloy,50w-55w Standard Fluorescent Tube ReplacementProduct good points:The 16 watt bulbs are a good product. I installed them in one of my fixtures before I realized I was sent 16 watt bulbs instead of 18 watt bulbs. They installed easily. When turned on, it takes them only 1 to 1.5 seconds to light up. The wiring connection diagram is located right on the bulb to prevent any confusion or lost instructions.Product bad points:At the time of this writing, the product title was changed to read (changed right after my complaint to them):New arrival! Micropoint T8 LED Fluorescent Tube,SMD5730 LED Lamp,10pcs/package,48",16watt,1400lm-1600lm,High Brightness, No Dark Area, Color Temperature:4000-4500k,Natural White,Ac85-265v,Diffused Pc Cover & aluminum Alloy,50w-55w Standard Fluorescent Tube ReplacementThese bulbs do not put out the described amount of light of 1400-1600 lumens; they put out about only 900-1000 lumens. They also only shed light at 180 degrees of spread; normal fluorescent bulbs shed light at 360 degrees. This 360 degrees of emitted light causes light to reflect from the fluorescent fixture and  increase the light being shed in a room. These Micropoint LED bulbs do not reflect any light from the fixture, so therefore they do not equate to the claimed 50-55watt equivalent as stated in their description, nor do they even equate to 32 watts. These actually put out a little less light than my current 32 watt fluorescent T8 bulbs.While these lights seem to be constructed well and do put out an even amount of light (albeit at 180 degrees), the company has done a poor job of properly representing this product and ended up stating their products equate to higher brightness bulbs then they actually do. The company has shown a very poor ability to support their claims and clearly do not want to support their customers as based on the issues I had with them.Overall:If you are looking for 16 watt T8 LED bulbs that put out about 900-1000 lumens, then get these while they are at a good price. But beware that if you have issues with the lights after they arrive, you may not get much help form the company who sells them.

I got this to keep on my boat for those just-in-case situations. I have a small boat, so I didn't need a kit that was very big. It has all of the items I will probably need, plus a few extras.It arrives with a strong plastic seal on it that has a serial number. I did not need that, so I cut it off so I could get access to the contents of the bag with very little trouble when an emergency happens.Double zipper does not mean the bag is extra water tight; it means there are two zipper pulls instead of one. I am not sure if having the extra pull was really necessary, but was probably more for attaching the serial number seal than anything.The bag is not water tight; water slowly seeps through the seams and through the zipper if the bag becomes saturated from the outside.The contents are packed into three different plastic bags:1. General first aid bag- 10 fabric 1x3 inch adhesive strips- 2 fabric knuckle bandages- 2 fabric fingertip bandages- 2 fabric extra-large strips- 4 butterfly closures (large)- 2 gauze pads 3x3 inch- 1 adhesive tape ½ inch- 4 motion sickness tablets- 2 Triple antibiotic ointment packets- 2 first aid/burn cream packets- 20 antiseptic wipes- 4 extra strength non-aspirin tablets- 1 sting relief wipe- 2 latex exam glovesThere is a note for several of the items stating that you should check packets for expiration dates before use.2. Wound treatment bag- 1 5x9 inch sterile large wound dressing- 4 sterile 4 inch gauze pads- 1 sterile 4 inch gauze bandage with clips- 6 antiseptic towelettes- 1 pair latex exam gloves3. Sprain and limb injuries bag- 1ea 4 inch elastic bandage- 1 instant cold pack- 1 triangular bandage- 1 pair latex exam glovesEach of the three plastic bags is water tight with a zip-lock style seal. The bags are not heat sealed on all four edges, which mean the bags are easier to get into since you simply open the zip-lock and then can reseal it.The product description says there is room for adding extra items, but there is actually very little extra room.Overall, this is a good kit and will serve its purpose for my small 17 foot fishing boat. However, I would get a more water tight kit if I had boat that did not have dry compartments.

I use this cord with the Wagan 5 Amp AC to 12V DC Power Adapter so that I can operate my Lowrance HDS Touch in my house.The cord is constructed with typical Lowrance high quality. It has two cables that connect into the cannon plug: a cable with the cigarette lighter attachment, and an additional cable that is for connecting a transducer. Since I am not using this cable with a transducer. I just put small wire nuts over the exposed wires of the transducer cable to prevent them from shorting.The power cable is 12 feet long. The transducer cable is 46 inches long.I am very happy with this cable. I have used it for several hours when checking waypoints, maps, down loads, and uploads without having to get in and out of the boat each time. This cable will also allow me to use it in my car while the wife drives and I set up the settings for the next lake we are traveling to.

I bought this to apply on the bottom side of my new truck's running boards. These running boards take the most abuse from flying road debris.The Eastwood rubberized encapsulator is good for use as an undercoating. The best way to apply it is by spraying it. However, I did not spray it because I was only doing my running boards which had areas that only a brush could get to. I used foam brushes, but I think a bristle brush would have been better.You must use this in a well-ventilated area. The fumes are very strong.It applies thicker than paint. Two coats are necessary. You only have to wait 30 to 45 minutes before recoating.A can of this will not go too far because it goes on thick. Just the two running boards used up ¾ of a can. Each of the running boards measure 7 feet long and 6 inches wide.It is best to wear gloves when using this product. It dries quickly and will stick firmly to your hands (making your fingers stick together). However, it does clean up well with mineral spirits.I cannot speak for its long term durability since this was my first time using it. I should be able to update this review in a few years when I see how well it performs through our hot, humid summers and salty, snowy winters.UPDATE July 2015: I just checked it and it is doing well. No peeling, and no rust that I can find. The underside of the running boards take a lot of abuse, so i would say that this stuff has some pretty good long term durability, especially in my northern environment where they heavily salt the roads. This stuff now has 60,000 miles on it.

This rope is fantastic; very strong! I have a 17' boat that can use 3/8 inch diameter rope, and 25 foot length. This seems to be the perfect size for my size boat.The quality is exceptional. It does not fray easily. It has a loop at one end that is secured with string like they used to make them in the old days. It is done so well that it seems like it will never loosen up.After getting wet, the rope dries quickly.The description says it is a gold color. It is actually a blend of gold and white.It is easy to handle and I like it much better than other ropes I have tried. I got two of these for the first order and then got two more once I saw it is a quality product.

I purchased this to keep on my boat in case I needed some tools. It is not a kit I will use very often; and thank goodness I will not need it often...Case:The case is larger than I expected for it having so few tools. It's just 20 pieces of tools, but there is lots of wasted room in the case. The case measures 11 1/8 inches wide x 7 inches deep x 2 7/8" thick. I wanted a smaller case so it would not take up much room.The tools are a pain to remove from their slots. You can't just pop out the sockets and get to work; you have to really work at getting them out because they are held in at both ends and not enough room to slide fingers between the sockets to pry them out. There is also not enough of the socket poking out of the surface to get a good grip on both ends to pull them out. I normally have to use the extension bar to stick between the sockets to pop them out. What a waste of time.Tools:The quality of the tools is OK, but nothing special. Stanley has not been producing quality tools for decades, so I was already not expecting much from this set. For the price, and my occasional use, I should get a good life from them.Since the product description does not tell you what is inside, I will list it here:Socket ratchet wrench, 7 ¼ inch longExtension bar, 2 ½ inchMetric sockets: 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13mmSAE sockets: 5/32, 3/16, 7/32, ¼, 9/32, 5/16, 11/32, 3/8, 7/16, 1/2For as small as this kit was, I was expecting an all SAE set; however, as you can see, it comes with a few of each metric and SAE.Overall, this is a good kit to have ready in a pinch; but otherwise, there are far better kits on the market if you are looking for good quality.

Keep in mind that this review includes information about the LSS2 structure scan transducer, but this particular product does not come with it. You will need to look for the other item on Amazon which includes the LSS2 transducer if you want to order the fish finder and LSS2 in one package. The combo package is here: Lowrance 000-10778-001 HDS-7 Gen2 Touch Combination Chartplotter/Fishfinder with 83/200KHz and StructureScan TransducerI have had the Lowrance non-touch models and two Humminbird down scan models. In my experience, the Lowrance Touch is far better than those. I have only one recommendation: if you can afford the touch models larger than the HDS 7, get them. The 7 inch model works very well and suits me for the budget I have, but if I had more money, I would get the larger screen so that I see more imagery.Here is what I find superb about the HDS7 touch:1. The touch screen is far more user friendly to use than the key pad models. I can access many different options with just a press or two, and do it fast. The non-touch requires clicking through lots of stuff just to find basic functions, and those models also responds slower.2. The screen imagery is very visible in sunlight.3. The resolution is great. I used Humminbird models who say they have better resolution than Lowrance, but I actually see better definition on the Lowrance Touch. This was one reason why I switched back to Lowrance after trying the Humminbirds for a while.4. GPS accuracy has been fantastic. My older Lowrance had average accuracy, and my Hummingbirds had poor accuracy. This HDS7 has been spot on every time within about a 10 to 14 foot radius. Most consumer grade GPS units have an accuracy of 20 to 30 foot radius.5. It includes the structure scan hardware. This means there is no need to buy a separate Structure scan module if you want to upgrade later (assuming you purchased a unit without the structure scan transducer). The sales guys at the sporting store told me you had to buy the structure module, but they were wrong. Lowrance customer service was very good at explaining to me what the truth is: you only need the structure scan transducer and nothing else but the fish finder itself.6. Networking is easy.  It works with all of their Lowrance models which can be networked; with both newer units and older units. Therefore I was able to hook up my new HDS7 touch with my older HDS8 and have them work seamlessly at opposite ends of the boat. All you have to do is set witch fish finder is the master unit, and you can swap that setting anytime you want. One network cable is all you need to get two units to be networked. It is that simple. Again, Lowrance customer service was great at explaining the process, which I initially could not believe was really that simple.7. As normal, Lowrance builds very durable cases for their units. This one is no exception. The casing is strong and water tight. Even the door for the SD card is strong and has a water resistant seal.Mapping with chartplotter:I do boating on a few lakes in my area which have no charts. These lakes are very tricky to navigate since they are flooded areas for hydro dams. There are lots of dangers that are just below the water surface. I used the depth recording feature of the HDS7 and then transferred that data to the Insight Genesis program. The program quickly created graphical depth maps of these lakes and I am now able to navigate them safely. This increased the speed at which I can travel on the lakes, and I was able to locate a few new fishing spots.SD card:From what I understand, this unit can accept an SD card up to 32 gigs. I am running a 16 gig card in my unit. It also worked with a micro SD card using the adapter.Waypoints:Before using insight genesis for mapping, I plotted safe routes in the lakes using waypoints. I still use these to mark hazards. The best part of the HDS Touch is that you set waypoints just by touching the screen where you want the waypoint, and then the menu screen pops up with options for setting a waypoint. No more scrolling with the touch pad as older units required you to do. I love it! In addition, moving a waypoint is super easy too. Also, you can easily make a series of waypoints into a route.Base unit mounting:The included mount bracket will fit great on a flat surface. However, I don't have enough room on my dash to accommodate a unit of this size. I used a ram mount and drilled holes in the ram mount plate to get it work with the Lowrance bracket. It is holding very well.Cables:The cables fit great on my 17 foot boat. There is a few more feet of cable that will allow them to work on a longer boat.Using the touch screen with gloves:It gets cold here, so gloves are needed. I found a pair of good quality touch screen gloves here on Amazon that work well with this unit.180s Enduro Tec Touch GlovesTransducers:The regular transducer seems to be the same as the transducers Lowrance has been using for several years. It is the same size and shape. The LSS2 transducer plugs directly into the HDS Touch units. No need for the module box.Face cover:My HDS7 Touch came with a front cover to protect it from damage when in storage. I remove my fish finder every time I pull the boat out to of the water to keep from getting damaged on the road and from theft. This cover is very durable and takes a beating.I have been using this unit for a while and have loved every minute of it. I recommend any of the HDS Touch units over the older units.

This is perfect.  I mounted it to the wall in front of my treadmill so I can watch Youtube and walk/run for miles without realizing it.  I have one in the kitchen, too.  There, I can watch Allrecipes and Chef John while I'm cooking.  They are sturdy, don't wiggle around, but can be adjusted easily several different ways.

This coat is magnificent!  I have some other long wool dress coats that I've had for a while, and I paid over $150 for each of them.  This one is my favorite, so much so that I had to get some dark green boots to go with!  The tan colored trim looks like suede up close, the wool is very nappy, like boucle fabric.  It is so heavy and warm, I love it!  It looks cute with leggings and high heel boots, or jeans with shorter boots.  I wear it with everything.  Also, the fur collar (like rabbit fur) is removable and the coat looks great with or without the fur.  Buy this coat...you won't be sorry.  I got a medium and I'm 5'2, a little over 155#.

This was truly the worst diet book I've ever read. Sorry, Dr. Phil!  I bought it because of all the rave reviews, but seriously?  I'm thinking someone paid to have people write them.  I'm usually pretty good about dieting, eating the right things, etc.  With this, I lasted half a day.  The food was ridiculous.  Sure, only five days of that, but then you have to go back to it again and again.  I can eat nuts and raisins on my own, thank you.  I'm going back to Dr. Ian Smith, where you can eat good, healthy food all day long.
Little tiny bit of mist shoots out about three feet, two feet up in the air.  Is that how it's supposed to work?
My husband and I got addicted.
These are rather cheap, but they do work so far.
These are perfect.  I do have trouble making sure I'm on the right dog...#1 or #2, so I usually only use one at a time.
