Touted as cookware designed to serve the unique needs of Mexican cooking, this 10 inch fry pan is part of the Rick Bayless line of celebrity chef cookinng products.I have a cast iron Bayless tortilla press (made by Gorham) and it is of pretty good quality.The question is what sets this particular fry pan apart from all the others on the market.  It's an aluminum pan and dishwasher safe.  It features a plastic handle to prevent handle burns.  Other than that, it is about standard gauge for weight.  I would not consider it for use in the oven.  It does have a standard nonstick surface.  It can be used on most cooktops though I did not try it on induction and can't comment on that.I tried this pan with several things.  I used it to fry some bacon and make scrambled eggs and to make some sauteed chicken breasts.  It performed as well as can be expected.But the question still lingers as to what truly sets this pan apart and why Bayless would include it in his Mexican cooking line.  Is there a signature recipe requiring this pan?  I will never know.I have noticed that someone likes to downvote all the negative comments on this product and would like to comment that you have to weigh both pros and cons when evaluating a product.  I read the downvoted reviews and see nothing particularly wrong with them.  Instead of downvoting I would suggest writing a comment to the review and letting the review author address those comments if something is ommitted, in error or otherwise.Overall I consider this a standard fry pan offering.  It isn't stellar but has some good home cook features.

This three piece baking set features 3 different sizes of baking sheet.One is a standard cookie sheet size.  One is smaller and fits perfectly inside my Breville toaster oven.  The other is a medium sized sheet, possibly useful if you only want to bake a half-recipe of cookies.The sheets are fairly thin and what I would call entry level for home bakers just starting out.You might want to consider thicker sheets for more frequent baking.I tried a batch of store-bought cookies on the larger sheet and (when used with parchment paper) they came out nicely browned and evenly baked.  The thinness may cause these too cook faster then an insulated sheet.Overall - this is a decent basic set of three different sizes for your baking needs.

This book is a very gritty tale about Jack's mission to clean up after some pirates.The pirates steal sapphires and discover another item of interest during their heist.  Through greed and folly, they all end up dead.Enter Jack.  He is summoned by the enigmatic Angela and he ends up in Macau, tirelessly pursued by a typical superhuman antagonist, Laurence.Laurence is after a bunch of uncut sapphires and a giant block of supernotes that miraculously survived many impossible situations.Most of the time I felt like I was being held against my will in a classroom taught by a knowitall on the subject of crime.  The protagonist is one of those irritating sorts that never stops telling you everything he knows.  Half of the stuff the protagonist endlessly spewed felt contrived.Then there is Angela - Jack's mentor - another ghost who left him high and dry on some other job in another book that I will never read.  She basks in 5-star hotels with stupid names and spend money like it is going out of style.I wasn't sure if Jack was in love with Angela, saw her in a maternal sense or just thought she was a sage mentor.Regardless, the two are pursued by this heartless thug who is just that much better than the two of these experts and leads us to a showdown ending.I wasn't impressed by this book's author or the plot.I would not recommend this story.

This is a play mat in the shape of a sleeping fawn.The mat weighs about a pound and can be rolled for portability.It's made with multiple soft fabric surfaces (100% polyester) and measures 29" in diameter.The shape is round with some portions of the fawn protruding from the circle.The mat's look and feel is expensive and high quality.I think the intent was this to be a female-based mat and the Bear play mat (in light blue shades) to be a male-based mat.My first inclination was to use this as a rug.  I wouldn't consider this a rug though - it's not a blanket either.If you are looking for a portable play mat or even one that will stay put in a particular area then this is a good choice.

I have a variety of DII products from Amazon.They are all of good quality and workmanship and this apron is no exception.This apron is light blue with a Damask pattern and pockets.  I have a couple of male-themed aprons I use for myself and my wife likes this one.The apron is machine washable, gentle cycle recommended.A good thing about this apron is the extra long tie which means you can cross it to the front and tie there if that's easier for you than making a tie in the back.The apron has a squared off neckline and isn't highly fitted.  The fabric is medium weight and durable to stand up to wash after wash.I think this is a quality made apron and I would recommend it.

Mr & Mrs T Original Bloody Mary Mix has been a long time favorite of mine on flights when ordered with an "airplane" bottle of vodka.The cans are 5.5 oz. so they are a good size for a Bloody Mary.I add some extras to mine - an extra splash of fresh lime, a dash of Worcestershire, a stick of celery, a glass rimmed with ghost pepper salt.Mr & Mrs T Original Bloody Mary Mix has a real tomato flavor along with some spices and sweeteners.  It isn't overly sweet like some and has that perfect taste for mixing with a spirit.I personally like my Bloody Mary spicy, so it is good to note that this comes in a bold and spicy variant...or just use some ghost pepper salt like I do.  I like these and would purchase them again.

The LeapFrog Scout's Build and Discover Tool Set is a dog house that can be taken apart and rebuilt.I think this is a really novel idea to teach higher level concepts of construction, counting and color matching tools to the job.  You get five tools: a hammer, ruler, saw, screwdriver and wrench.This is not an erector set where you literally have to find pieces and fit them together using the appropriate tools to fasten them.The walls just fold down (and handle separates) and the youngster is encouraged to use puppy pal Scout to guide them through counting and measuring.Nothing is literally being hammered or screwed into place.  Yet in imaginative play, there is a feeling of accomplishment when the thing comes back together.One thing I am sort of surprised with (since this is a LeapFrog product) is a general lack of interactivity.We have other LeapFrog products that use various mechanisms to respond to being pressed in certain spots or under certain conditions.  I don't see those features with this item.  This one is obviously intended for a younger age range. I think this would be good for a 2,3 or 4 year old.Overall - this was well-received by my grandson.  He seemed kind of in awe with it and (since he is on the younger side of that range), was excited when guided through "building" the dog house.  I find the tools everywhere as he must be reasoning that if he can build a doghouse he can build other things.

Avery White Round Candy Labels are definitely a speciality label.Every year, during the holidays, I like to bake confections for gifts to neighbors and loved-ones.This year I am going to use these to make custom little labels.What you get is a small pack of 120 labels.  The labels are intended for indirect food contact, not adhering directly to food items.As with all Avery label products, you can go to their website and enter the label ID (41568) to use a specialized template for printing.There are 20 labels per sheet and the sheets are small, requiring a laser or inkjet capable of handling different sized inputs.I use mine with an Epson XP-520 with no issues.Using these (from printing to affixing them) requires time and patience but the end result is worth it.I have received a lot of praise from recipients of items utilizing these labels.I would recommend them.

I got this for my granddaughter since it is her birthstone.The necklace arrived in an attractive giftable box and was shipped inside a larger outside box.The stones in this necklace are blue topaz, 3mm.  I was surprised at the clarity of the gemstones.  There are six stones on my necklace.The necklace is very thin - rhodium plated sterling silver and it is 18".My granddaughter was happy to get this and excited to wear it to school.It would be a good gift for religious ceremonies or just to celebrate your faith.Again, I am pleased with how bright and visible the stones are and how attractive the necklace appears when worn.I would definitely recommend this product.

This curtain rod is a wraparound design intended for blackout curtains.The rods provide complete coverage of  window opening, ensuring no side light entry.When installed, the rod protrudes 2" from the wall.The rod length is adjustable from 66" to 120", offering coverage from standard to large window openings.  The rod itself is 5/8" in diameter.If you need to sleep during the day or otherwise need a way to block out light, this is a great rod for those kind of curtains.Installation is easy and includes the needed hardware.  I had mine up in about 35 minutes.  Instructions are included.Overall - I am pleased with this curtain rod and am planning to order another one since I have two windows in the room where this one is installed.

The 14k Italian Tri Color Twist Hoop Earrings arrived in a very nice presentation box.They arrived inside an outer shipping box.The earrings are attractive yet subdued and not overly large.White gold bands are twisted in with yellow gold.To the observer it looks like yellow gold earrings with silver.I do not readily see that they are tri-color - mostly yellow gold with some white gold.Upon close inspection, you can see that one of the bands in the twist has a bit of rose gold coloration.I think these are attractive when worn yet don't come across as equivalent to their cost.I think they have a bit more of a fashion jewelry look than that of fine jewelry though they do look refined and sophisticated when worn.

I didn't get this Five Star Locker Magnetic Dry-Erase Board + Locker Push Pin Board for a locker.  I opted to use mine in my cubicle at work.The top of the board is a white-board with magnetic marker.  The bottom portion is perforated to serve as a push-pin board.The magnet (on the board) is strong and will resist locker usage if that's what this will be used for.The size of the board is 6" x 8", so it is not a huge board.  The marker and some push pins are included.My marker has a very weak magnet and will not stay on the board.  The board came with four magnets which were stuck on so hard that they left behind damage marks on the board surface when removed.I think that in a tight environment such as a locker, cubicle wall, fridge door, etc. it is functional.I use it to leave myself notes.I am disappointed with the white board portion.  The provided marker writes clearly but it is removing the marks that is an issue.  The eraser on the marker leaves a black residue behind and is generally difficult to erase.  You could use water but would that really be convenient in a school setting such as a locker area?Overall I think this is a useful concept and fair implementation.  This would surely be useful in an organized locker but might make more sense on a fridge.

This review is for the Avery Easy Align Self-Laminating ID Labels.  They are 7.5" x 5" and the package contains 5.The laminated labels are UV resistant (prevents fading), water resistant and feature a permanent adhesive.The labels are easy to print. Simply go to the Avery website and enter the product ID: 00750.You then design your own label and prepare to print.Before printing, (with any label product, really) be sure to print a plain paper test page before doing the final print.After printing, you have to fold the plastic over the label to "self-laminate" it.This can be tricky but I was able to do it without much hassle.It's not as hard as putting on a screen protector on your cell phone.In terms of cost, you are getting five long-lasting labels which are laminated, so I think the cost is justified, provided you don't mess one or more labels up while printing which is possible.I printed mine on an Epson inkjet and the result looks really professional.In summary, these have a variety of uses.  I printed one sign about authorized personnel and keeping the door closed to the lab where I work.  I printed another which reminds those exiting to make sure the door closes behind them to prevent the security monitoring from detecting an open door.

This review is for the Avery Kraft Brown Labels, 1.5" x 1.5" square.  The pack comes with 60 labels.Brown Kraft labels provide a natural or earthy look and they are made from 100% recycled material.These labels are compatible with both inkjet and laser printers.  I use mine with an inkjet.Templates are available at avery.com/print (you might need to create a free account there).I always use the Avery stock templates versus trying to make my own designs.You can print 6 labels per page and the page size is smaller, 4" x 6" which for me required some tinkering with the inkjet paper guides.The rustic look makes these labels perfect in a variety of settings.I use the 2" round for giving away / selling baked goods like bread, cakes or cookies.I do the same with these.I am very happy Avery has so much variety available for labels.  They stick well, come off fairly well and have a good quality look and feel.

This review is for the Avery Kraft Brown Labels, 2-inch diameter.  The pack comes with 20 labels.Brown Kraft labels provide a natural or earthy look and they are made from 100% recycled material.These labels are compatible with both inkjet and laser printers.  I use mine with an inkjet.Templates are available at avery.com/print (you might need to create a free account there).I always use the Avery stock templates versus trying to make my own designs.Printing on my inkjet required some trial and error since the sheets are an odd size.  Once everything is set up though you are good to go.The finished label has a crafty, hand-made look.  What they are used for is up to you but I use mine when selling cakes, cookies and breads (My hobby is baking).  I use them to lavel the products.I am very pleased with these though my complaint with the Avery product line has been the price point versus how many you get.These are use-once so once they are affixed there is no re-use potential.

Rick Bayless, celebrity chef and cookbook author renown for his Mexican cuisine has partnered with Gorham to produce his signature cast iron tortilla press.This press is a 12" model which has been pre-seasoned.it is dishwasher safe but I always prefer to hand-wash cast iron.A cast iron press has an advantage over an aluminum model - it stays put when pressing because of its weight and offers additional leverage.Tortilla presses are generally used to make corn tortillas.  Flour tortillas can be rolled with a rolling pin.The concept is simple -- put a ball of masa in the center of the press and...press.  The pressure flattens the dough into a tortilla.Oddly, this press did not come with a recipe.  I would have expected one from a cookbook author.  However, I was able to easily find one on his website.Using one of Mr. Bayless' recipes, I made some tortillas using the press.The press is easy to use and flattens the masa into a perfectly round tortilla of appropriate thickness.I used parchment on both the top and bottom plate which makes release easier.  You could also use plastic.I cooked the tortillas on a dry cast iron griddle on medium to medium-high heat.The resulting tortillas have a fresh taste which is much better than the supermarket variety.  You can also try blue corn tortillas for added variety.If you really like tortillas and prefer to make them at home, this is the press for you.

With back-to-school season in full swing, it's a good time to add some pizazz to a locker.This board  measures 4.5" x 4.5" and 7/8 inch thick (which is pretty thick).The side of the board has LED lights and requires three AAA batteries.One of the biggest downsides I saw right away is that it takes the removal of 4 screws to change/add the batteries.That means you would need to take it home to replace the batteries once they go out.We determined right away that this would be of less use in a locker than in a bedroom or bedroom closet.The magnetic design makes it ideal for a fridge or metal door too.In the end it ended up in my office which is a cubicle environment.  I put it on the cube wall and use it for short reminders to myself.The concept is great though - this could be useful in a locker.  However, the LEDs are not diffused light - they are spots  that are sort of backlit.  I operate it without the LEDs as they don't add much to the product.  Any kid is going to turn on the LED and forget to turn it off, leading to a drained set of batteries.The whiteboard component seems to clean easily for now.  When using the provided marker, it leaves dark residue behind when erasing.  You can use water or a white board cleaner to remove the marker.Overall - this is a useful board but the battery / LED part is a downside.  I think it is useful for more than just lockers.

Playlist; The Very Best 80s Radio Hits contains a vast selection of pop, dance, and rock hits from the 1980s and from various groups.  Songs such as We Built This City by Starship, Jessie’s Girl by Rick Sprinfield,You Spin Me Around by Dead or Alive, Girls Just Want To Have Fun by Cyndi Lauper, Voices Carry by Til Tuesday, Manic Monday by The Bangles, Take Me Home Tonight by Eddie Money (feat. Ronni Spector etc.) are examples of the diverse selection of tunes on Playlist; The Very  Best of 80s Radio Hits.

Wonderland by Steve Aoki is an excellent medley of  avant-garde club/electronic hits from various artists.  There are brilliant songs on Wonderland such as Ladi Dadi (feat. Wynter Gordon)and Earthquakey People (feat. Rivers Cuomo). Wonderland is also good if you are familiar with any of Steve Aoki’s previous music.

Musique Vol. 1 (1993-2005) by Daft Punk contains a pristine music collection of electronic hits such as Harder Better Faster Stronger, Robot Rock, and One More Time.  I admit that I forgot which song I first heard by them, yet I at least remember hearing Around The World by Daft Punk back around 2001/2002 when I was still in Japan and I eventually made the connection (as with many others) that Kanye West’s Stronger is inspired by Daft Punk’s Harder Faster Stronger (not that there is anything wrong with that especially since I’m guessing West probably got permission to sample Harder Faster Stronger by Daft Punk for his Stronger song).

80’s Pop Hits does feature a wide range of 1980’s hits that range from the dramatic; Easy Lover by Phil Bailey & Phil Collins, the more upbeat with Rosanna by Toto, the heartfilled with Keep On Lovin You by Reo Speedwagon, Wake Me Up by Wham,and the super cheerful mood with the song Heaven by Warrant. There are many more hits of course by other artists on 80’s Pop Hits.

Many may remember Fragma by Toca’s Miracle.  On the  Embrace Me music collection by Fragma she sings from the heart with dance/club like type of songs such as Embrace Me and the love soaked Only You.  I also enjoy the jovial vibe of Embrace Me by Fragma.

Running Trax 2014 by Ministry of Sound feat. Various Artists  from the electronic, club, and dance music genres.  This is a great music collection that helps get your energy going if you want to listen to music from the past few years beause of how the Running Trax 2014 (Ministry of Sound) music collection opens with Eat, Sleep, Rave, Repeat by Fatboy Slim feat. Beardyman (Calvin Harris Remix) and goes right into the other songs with Emeli Sande, Iggy Azalea, Empire of The Sun, Avicii Vs, Nicky Romero, Zedd feat. Foxes etc.

Now That’s What I Call The 80s Volume 2 is a perfect music mix to listen to when you are craving 80’s style music to get your energy going and/or for listening to while enjoying time spent outside. This is because of the wide range of artists featured within this music collection; Faith by George Michael, How Will I Know by Whitney Houston,Never Gonna Give You Up by Rick Astley, Bryan Adams, The Police, Martika, Duran Duran,Billy Idol etc.).

Queen of Clubs Trilogy Onyx edition by Nadia Ali contains gleaming dance and club hits that many may remember her by such as Rapture (Avicii New Generation Mix) and Fantasy (EDX mix). However, her singing makes some of the other songs even more luminous such as with the music tracks such as Promises (Sebastian Krieg&Roman F mix), Crash and Burn (DJ Shah Magic Island Mix) and Love Story.

This Lucid 10 Inch Memory Foam Mattress-(Dual Layered Certi Pur US Certified Queen Size) is extremely comfortable. I’m so grateful that my husband and I got this mattress from my mother-in-law because this mattress is extremely soft and cushioned in a way to where it is effortlessly easier to fall asleep and provides sturdy support on my back.  Of course, my husband enjoys sleeping on this mattress as well (one of the reasons pertaining to the mattress being spring-free and provides a supportive foundation without being too solid).

Never Mind The Mainstream; The Best of MTV’s 120 Minutes Vol. 1 contains a unique and outstanding blend of  80’s/early 90’s rock music with hits such as Higher Ground by Red Hot Chili Peppers, Under The Milky Way by The Church, Dear God by XTC, and I Melt With You by Modern English etc..  Never Mind The Mainstream; The Best of MTV’s 120 Minutes Vol. 1 also sounds like a music mix that could have made it on the 1991 movie Point Break (which features Patrick Swayze,Keanu Reeves,Gary Busey, Lori Petty, John McGinley,James LeGros, and a cameo by Anthony Kiedis of the Red Hot Chili Peppers).

Monstercat 022-Contact is an electronic and discopop/house pop/futuristic pop compilation of various artists that run the gamut from the song The Difference Between Us and Aliens by Stephen Walking and Genesis by Protostar. What I enjoy the most about this compilation of Monstercat 022-Contact featuring various artists is the distinctive music found within this collection.  From my perspective, Monstercat 022-Contact sounds like some music that could probably feature within some sci-fi fantasy story within a sci-fi themed party song and/or some sc-fi/futuristic tv episode featuring elements of a heavenly utopia and/or cartoon setting of  some characters preparing for an upcoming event.

Ultra Music Festival 2013 does give off a celebratory concert vibe because of the social gathering themed mix of songs from various artists within this cd; Swedish House Mafia, David Guetta, Tiesto, Steve Aoki, Avicii, Wolfgang  Gartner, Benny Benassi, and more.  Ultra Music Festival 2013 is bleand of electronic and dance music from various artists that also sounds like something that can easily be played at someone’s birthday party, a weekend party, and/or probably even a dance themed dinner party.

Ultra 2014 contains an eclectic range of dance, electronic, and house music hits on this compilation.  Ultra 2014 also sounds like a compilation that could easily be played at a weekend party and/or a housewarming party with a club theme because of how sanguine the vibe of he first six songs are on the cd; Thinking About Yoy by Calvin Harris feat. Ayah Marar, Live For The Night by Krewella,  Atmosphere by Kaskade, Boneless by Steve Aoki Chris Lake & Tuajmo, and the sixth song being Legacy by Nicky Romero feat. Krewella.

Walking On A Dream by Empire of the Sun contains the popular catchy hit Walking On A Dream.  There are other good songs on this collection such as The World and Delta Bay.  Walking On A Dream by Empire of the Sun is best for those who like indie alternative rock music mixed with elements of chillout music.

Clarity (Deluxe Edition) by Zedd comes from an artist who many may know as musically masterminding hits such as Beautiful Now (feat. Jon Bellion) and the happy vibe of I Want You To Know (feat. Selena Gomez).  On this Clarity Deluxe Edition there are hits such as Spectrum (feat. Matthew Koma),  Clarity (Feat. Foxes), and Follow You Down (feat. Bright Lights). There are also other brilliant music features on Clarity (Deluxe Edition) by Zedd  such as Stay The Night (feat. Hayley Williams of Paramore),  Fall Into The Sky (feat. Ellie Goulding and Lucky Date), Lost At Sea (feat. Ryan Tedder) and more hits.  Clarity (Deluxe Edition0 by Zedd is perfect for those who enjoy music blends of electronica, trance, and upbeat pop.

The Essential Toto by Toto is another great collection for those who like 80’s music mixed with elements of classic rock because of their hits such as Hold The Line, Rosanna, Africa, and Pamela (which surprisingly I admit that I did not hear for the first time until 2008 when I was living in Norfolk, Virginia). There are also other fantastic songs within the collection of The Essential Toto by Toto that are not featured on certain radio stations (as far as I know such as Georgy Porgy, 99, I’ll Supply The Love etc).

Blow The Roof by Flux Pavilion has multiple songs on this collection that have a house music and electronic beat.  As mentioned in many of my previous reviews, I enjoy listening to Pandora radio and iheart radio (in addition to regular radio) for the widest range of music. However, I admit that I would not have heard of unique music by this artist had it not been for Pandora.  I first of Flux Pavilion’s music from the I Still Can’t Stop melody.  However, there are other great house and electronic songs on Blow The Roof by Flux Pavilion such as One, Two, Three  and Starlight.

The Ultimate Collection by The Eurythmics captures the essence of quality 80’s hits of a synth pop and dance quality.  Many may remember this group through their hits Sweet Dreams, Here Comes The Rain Again, Would I Lie To You etc(which are also within this collection). However, there are also other memorable hits on The Ultimate Collection by The Eurythmics available in this compilation that are not played as often on some radio stations such as “There Must Be An Angel.”

Food Lover’s Guide to Virginia; The Best Restaurants, Markets, & Local Culinary Offerings by Lorraine Eaton & Jim Haig is a guide to the various regions of Virginia mainly outside of the Northern Virginia area is a book good for Virginia prospective tourists and/or Virginia relocatees (whether 30 months or more from now or less time than that). For anyone looking at  culinary destionations of Northern Virginia,  good website resources would be the websites and publications connected to such companies as Northern Virginia magazine, Washingtonian magazine, and/or The Washington Post.  Anyhow, Food Lover’s Guide to Virginia; The Best Restaurants, Markets, & Local Culinary Offerings  by Lorraine Eaton & Jim Haig contains among the following;A Micro Café Called the Dancing Tomato In Virginia Beach Virginia (starts on page 44)The Tale of Three Chickens; The Listing of Three Chicken Restaurants in Portsmouth Virginia (Golden Skillet), Moseberth’s Fried Chicken (Portsmouth Virginia), and pollard’s Chicken (Norfolk Virginia) (pages 78-79),Village Butcher shop in Virginia Beach Virginia run by brothers Brad & Johnny Hardison,  a place listed to be called Delicate Oriental Grocery in Virginia Beach, Virginia, and French Bakery & Delicatessen in Norfolk Virginia (pages 98-99)A section on Williamsburg Virginia (starts on page 117)Information listed pertaining to George Washington’s Whiskey Business (starts after page 175)A recipe for Bacon Wrapped Pecan Salmon listed to be courtesy of Kahill’s Restaurant in South Hill page 204(recipe on page 253)Recipe for The Blue Talon Cocktail, listed to be courtesy of Blue Talon Bistro in Williamsburg, Virginia page 119(cocktail recipe on page 258)

This 15.5 ounce container of Campbell’s Slow Kettle Style Sweet Tomato Bisque (Tomato & Sweet Basil Mix)is scrumptious and cooks pretty quickly. Additionally, this soup has the right amount of sweetness with a robust tomato flavor. I’m grateful that the place of my overnight job carries this because nights like tonight I do not feel like cooking and would much prefer having something that can be ready in less than 10 minutes when having more time to myself to relax before leaving for work. This Campbell’s Slow Kettle Style Sweet Tomato Bisque fits the bill because it is ready around 2 minutes via a microwave.  I’m guessing that this Campbell’s Slow Kettle Style Sweet Tomato Bisque can be a standalone meal with pairing it with just bread and better. However, for me I admit to having this soup with Bar S Classic Corn Dogs dipped in honey batter (which my husband was able to have some corndogs ready for me within just 3 minutes) which paired perfectly with this  Campbell’s Slow Kettle Style Sweet Tomato Bisque (Tomato & Sweet Basil mix)tomato soup.

These patches are really terrible. If you remove the backing from it all at once the patch folds over and sticks to itself. It's extremely difficult to pull it apart.Do not put this on the delicate skin of your torso. It's way too hot and difficult to pull off. I couldn't take more than 10 minutes and when I pulled the patch off my body was red and burned for at least an hour afterwards. The patch will not stick again, so if you don't use it on one part of your body, forget about using it somewhere else.Don't put any lotions or creams on your body first. Even if you wait a while before applying, the patch will not stick.When I pulled it off, it stuck to my skin and I was afraid it would actually rip my skin.There's nothing that I like about these patches. Unfortunately, I purchased 10 of them. The medication is too strong and the adhesive is like glue.I prefer the Tiger Balm patches over these because the patches are comfortable, can be reapplied and come off very easily. Plus, they don't burn. The medication works very well.

In the box is a small credit card size card with a web address and ID number.  You downloaded this from the website.After downloading it onto my tablet I was sent an email with a download button to download it to my phone and computer. They really make it simple. All you need to do is register and enter your user name and password to download to your other devices. It does not say how many devices you can put this on. You'll download their app to your devices to run the security and protection.As far as total protection goes, I already have most of the protection from Samsung for my tablet and smart phone, such as locking the devices and using either a PIN or finger print to open, and the ability to lock or swipe your information in case of theft or loss. What I was hoping this would do for me is to stop those stupid pop-ups I get on my tablet. My internet security protection stops pop-ups on my computer, but this does not stop them on my tablet. I still get the same pop-ups I got before installing this.If you somehow have a tablet or smartphone that does not come with protection features, then this will give you what you lack.  It also allows you to backup your information, but I also get that from Samsung, so it isn't necessary to backup with McAfee too.What annoys me is that the app has number flags that show up to indicate that you haven't accepted all of their security protection offered. But, I don't need all of it. So, I wish there was a way to decline something so their flags would go away.I may not keep this on my tablet or phone, but I haven't decided yet. It's ok, but without pop-up blocking, it isn't great.

What's an Ets Candy? It's an M&M. This canister is full of red and green plain M&Ms. And, it's going right on my desk at work. There's no better way to receive, or get, visitors than having chocolate on your desk. And, it will be handy for my afternoon chocolate attacks. There's plenty to share. This would make a nice party canister.

I have the audible version of this and have listened to it twice now. Caroline Myss doesn't pander to the idea that people need a lot of hand holding and babying. She says what I've always thought and that is people need to move on from their past and just stop allowing it to affect their future. No-one ever got healthy by constantly moaning about what happened to them as a child. I have issues from childhood, but I know I'm in control of my life now, not my mother. Nothing in my life will change unless I'm willing to work on it and make those changes myself. My mother is dead. Why should I spend my life whining about what a horrible mother she was? Where will that get me? These are some of my takeaways from Caroline's message.At first I wasn't sure I liked this audible book and not because I think she's harsh, because really she isn't, but because I thought it would delve more into how to heal yourself. What this audible book is all about is what the Chakras are, how they affect our body and our relationships with others. If you're looking for more information on Chakras than you've gotten in other books, then this is going to be right up your alley. By the time I finished listening the first time around I realized that although it isn't what I thought it was, it was exactly what I needed. I'm sold on Caroline Myss. I've purchased another audio book of hers because I like the way she delivers her message. She's a strong woman who pulls no punches. Don't get the audio version if you think she's all woo woo sweet and mystical. That's not who she is. That's not who she needs to be because her message is a good one and she teaches it well.

The picture of these little snowmen ornaments do not do them justice. The picture makes them look like cheap aluminum ornaments, but they aren't. They are heavy-weight for their size and the design is clear, unlike the photos. They are charming and will look good just sitting on a mantel or hanging from a tree.Each ornament comes with a long red ribbon to hang them with. I ironed mine because the ribbon comes folded and there are creases in it. If you're not into ironing, the creases will probably fall out over time. There is plenty of ribbon to tie them in a bow.Very cute.
If you like lame, violent westerns you'll love this. Not my style.
Pass. Stopped watching after a few minutes.
This isn'the funny so if it's not a comedy, it'seems not going to work.
Boring. Stopped after a few minutes.

Tig is intriguing. This story has been told on HBO and Showtime. Hopefully, it'll get past what we already know and delve into other aspects of Tig's life. I can see at least one season. It's the second best shof Amazon's pilot season.

Finally, a really great series set in the 1970s which shows how women fought to be heard and accepted as more than wives and baby makers. The men are going to piss you off, but it's very realistic. That's the way it really was. Although Nora Ephron is a major character, she shares the show equally with other strong women. It's not about Nora, it's about women.Women have become too complacent and need to know what things were like before they came into rights of their own. This is extremely timely. This show will tell women why they should be feminists. This show will reveal the truth to a younger generation who just doesn't get it.Please make this an onoing series. It's best of the bunch. If I could give it 10 stars, I would.

These earbuds are oddly shaped. The buds are on a long stem that sticks out from your ears, and the stem is angled. I'm not really sure why they are shaped this way, but they feel weird and keep falling out of my ears. They do come with over the ear hooks, but those don't fit well and bug me.There's a plastic piece in the back that you wind the wire around so you can let out what you need. That's pretty handy, although because of the way the earbuds are shaped having the wire go behind the head causes the buds to pull out of the ears whenever I turn my head. Keeping it in front is easier, but then if you exercise with these you'll have that piece bouncing against your throat.The earbuds come in a plastic drinking bottle. As in actually inside of one. It was sort of difficult pulling them out as they're encased in plastic that is a rather tight fit in the bottle.The sound is ok, but not the best quality from earbuds. You would get these earbuds more for the style than the sound. So, you can exercise without them falling out. But, then I just don't think they fit well enough to get out of them what they are intended for.

True to its name, this book starts out fast, and never lets up. I was captivated by the first sentence and found it hard to put down. But, things like sleep and work got in the way.Jenna Cooper is caught up in a tornado while at a swap meet with her young daughter and 5 month old son, Caleb. Jenna and her daughter survive, but Caleb disappears. Everyone is looking for this baby. From Kate, the reporter who wants to write a job winning article, to the Russian mob, to a wealthy heiress in Denver, people want this baby. At the center of the baby’s disappearance is a couple of low-life drug addicts, who keep everyone on the chase to find Caleb. It may sound convoluted, but it works and made me want to find out what was going to happen next.This is the first novel by Rick Mofina I’ve read, but now he’s on my favorite author list. He managed to write a strong female protagonist in Kate, without making her helpless and dependent on men as many male authors do. I appreciated the fact that Kate could hold her own career-wise and still be grounded in family.

This is a simple little speaker that you need to wear close to your ear in order to hear. Turn the volume up on your device before controlling it with the speaker because you won’t be able to turn it up on the speaker unless it’s up all the way on your device first.There’s a thin piece of metal in the opening of the speaker that grasps onto your clothing and holds the speaker in place. It’s a tight fight, so tight that I had a lot of trouble removing it from my top. No matter how I tugged or pulled, it just wouldn’t come lose. I eventually pulled hard enough that the metal clip came out. I used a file from my pocket knife to put it back in place. It is probably best clipped to something hard like a cap, rather than cloth.It also comes with a fastener that you use to fasten it to a car visor. It’s easy to put on and take off of the speaker.The sound is really good. I was surprised that I was able to hear stereo sound coming from such a small speaker, but I watched a movie using it and could pick up the background sound effects. This will come in handy when I don’t want to wear ear phones, but still want to keep the sound to myself, or listen to music on my smart phone in the car.It operates with just one button to turn it on or off, or switch to pick up a call. I haven’t used it to make or take phone calls, and I think it might be a bit confusing just how many times to click the button to get your call or reject it, so you should keep the instructions handy for the first few calls.I give the speaker a solid four stars, taking off one star because of the metal clip that would render it useless if it came out and was lost or damaged. You won’t be able to clip it to anything without that piece of thin metal.

To use this you must have a smartphone or tablet with bluetooth. The thermometer does not have a read out on it.After downloading the app to your electronic device, pair the thermometer with it via bluetooth. The directions that come with it leave something out and it was a bit complicated trying to figure it out. I've paired many things with my devices and never had an issue. After I stopped following the directions and just followed my phone, it was easy.You can set up profiles for everyone in your family, even adding pictures. Then select the person you are taking the temperature of, select how you'll do it, oral, under the arm, anal, then take the temperature. The temperature will almost immediately come up on your phone. It really was fast.How accurate is it? Well, I wasn't sick when I tested it out and my temperature came out to be 98.1. Since I usually run between 97.8 to 98.3, I think it was fairly accurate.It doesn't come with thermometer sleeves, so I suggest you invest in some inexpensive ones, especially if you're going to be using this on more than one person.I can only give this four stars because the thermometer doesn't give a reading directly on it. So, if someone is sick, you need to grab your phone along with thermometer to take the temperature. But, having the profiles along with a history of temperatures can come in handy.

The pictures of this do not do it justice. It's really beautiful. And, it's so much larger than I expected it to be. The paint is a shiny metallic paint that sparkles in the light. And, the colors, which look mostly blue in the photo contain pink and yellow. I honestly couldn't believe just how pretty it is.It's super simple to assemble. I had it assembled before I even looked at the instructions. It comes in three pieces, the top part, a middle stem and the bottom, which you step on to push it into the ground.After assembling the three pieces, you bend the butterflies in one direction on one side and the opposite direction on the other side. It's very easy to bend. Don't use tools to do so because the butterflies are held on by thin metal strips which might break off if you applied too much pressure.I put this in my garden where I can see it from where I sit. It's definitely an eye catcher.

This is fraud! The photo shows someone with a blanket placed over their entire lap and knees. But, what it doesn't show is the person's face. Why? Because no adult is small enough for this 13"  23" piece of fabric to fit over their lap like the photo shows. It's obviously a child. I thought I was purchasing a lap throw with a 13" × 23" heating pad inside of it. However, the heating pad is only 8" ×6".The heating pad is a very cheaply made foil and paper with a heating element between. It is inside a zippered compartment on one side of the throw. There is no electric plug. Instead there is a usb plug at the end of an 18" cord. You wouldn't even be able to plug this into an outlet. You would have to place an extention cord on your chair to plug it in.What you also won't find on this page is that it comes from China. That is the reason I won'the tempt fate and plug in this extremely cheap heating element.Amazon should be ashamed for allowing this to be sold on their site. It's going back.I CAN'T EXPRESS STRONGLY ENOUGH NOT TO BUY THIS PIECE OF CRAP UNLESS YOU WANT TO BURN YOUR HOUSE DOWN.

I've never had equipment to work out my lower arms and hands before, but that's exactly what this does.  It's a solid rubber bar that bends when you use it.  Holding your arms out straight in front of you and bending the bar definitely works the forearms and hands. I have a tendency toward tennis elbow, which flares up with any repetitive use, like crocheting or typing. I worked with this bar for a short while a couple times a day and it helps to take that pain away. It's also good for my wrist that tends to hurt from using a computer mouse all day.It's pretty handy to just keep it around and use it whenever I take a break. I'll keep it at the office so I'll get more use out of it.It comes with a small pamphlet with pictures showing the types of exercises to do with it. However, the captions on a couple of them are wrong. It doesn't really matter because it's super easy to use just by looking at the pictures.The only issue I have is that the edges are cut straight instead of rounded. My hands tend to itch if I get them too close to the ends, so I have to remember to hold it up far enough to keep away from the ends when I push down on the bar.

This is the first book I've read in a long time where I wanted to immediately read the next in the series. It has everything, plot, action, smart, strong, take no prisoners women. It's good. I'm drawn to books with strong female leads, and this has two. The books are narrated by the husband, but he takes back seat to his wife and daughter, he doesn't over shadow them. While there's violence, there's not too much of it. And, the author tends toward non-violence in some instances when he could very well have gone the other way.Well thought out and told. I'm no to the second book now.

These gloves are really big. Since I have large hands, I got the X-large because there are no size guidelines online. Well, there are no size guidelines on the box either. I can only say that the X-large will probably be for men with really big hands. The fingers were about 1.5" too long. And the gloves were so large they were wrinkly on my hand. But, that's not the glove's fault. It would be nice if they gave guidelines so we'd know which size to get. But, just based on how the X-Large fit me, I would probably be a medium. So, expect them to run big.The gloves are thick blue gloves that snap like a balloon. But, unlike the latex on a balloon, they don't make me break out in a rash. I used them to apply ointment to my joints for arthritis. That way, I don't have to worry about getting the ointment on my hands and not being able to wash it off well enough.I also use disposable gloves for art work. These will be great for painting, staining and charcoal. Even though they're big, they aren't loose, so I won't have to worry about them falling off.

I have two other foam mats that I paid around $60 each for, and they are better than the Bon Home comfort mat, which is very cheap in both price and quality. The bottom foam doesn't have a cover, so I expect the foam to get ripped and pitted. The top almost feels like thick cardboard with grasscloth-like striations. I usually wipe my foam mats with a damp cloth, but I probably won't do that with this mat because I'm not sure what it's made of and water could ruin it.The foam is not as thick or comfortable as my other mats. This is definitely a case of you get what you pay for.

This blood pressure monitor is typical of those made for the wrist in that they tend to read low. What sets this wrist blood pressure monitor apart is that you can download an app onto your smart phone and transfer your blood pressure readings to the app. The app shows you a grid of your blood pressure readings against what normal readings are. The monitor also tells you if your heart is beating abnormally. For instance if it beats twice fast then one normal beat.You must first set the date and time on the monitor before taking readings otherwise the app will not download any of the readings as it stores them by date and time. It's easy to use and carry with you, but as I said, it tends to read blood pressure low.

These are a lifesaver for migraines. Sometimes I find ice packs actually make the pain worse. These are cool enough to ease the pain without being too cold. Although they say the pads last for 8 hours, I found them to be cold for about 4 hours. When I pressed on the pad the gel was still cold, but just sitting against the skin it wasn't.The pad stays on my head all day and allows me to do something other than find some way to hold an ice pack next to my head.

I have been using these Scotch-Brite scrubbing sponges for years. I honestly won't clean without them. After spraying my bathroom or kitchen counters with a cleaner I use the scrubber side to loosen any grime on the counter top. I then rinse out the sponge and wipe the counters with the sponge side. I do this several times a day with this sponge. They're also handy for cleaning the tub.I toss the sponge into my washer with the whites that I use bleach with to disinfect. You can also wash them in your dish washer. Don't use sponges longer than a week if you don't disinfect them because they hold germs and you are defeating the purpose of cleaning. With proper washing the sponges can last 3 to 4 weeks. After that they will begin to break down. The best part about getting so many to a package is that you will never be without one.

Although these earrings are costume jewelry, they look very nice. They're kind of heavy. I usually wear posts because I don't like dangling earrings; however, these fit very close to the ear lobe so my hair shouldn't get tangled in them. I can wear these to work, or when dressed up.

These are fun to draw on with colored chalk. They are flat and feel like vinyl, only with a surface you can write on with chalk. They come perforated with a floral edge and with an adhesive back. In order to make signs like those on the packaging you need to stick the labels to something like wood or plastic and glue a dowel to it. These would be practical for sticking onto to gifts or to use as name labels.I used a dry and a damp paper towel to clean off the surface. Both took the chalk off, but the damp towel removed all residue. I drew on them several times over.

You need less of this than some other shampoos because it really lathers up. It's a silky shampoo that feels soft while washing your hair. I'm often skeptical of claims made by beauty products, but believe it or not, this actually lives up to its claim to add youthful body and shine. I have thick, dry hair that's seen earlier days. After washing I usually add a de-frizing gel before or after drying, which gives my hair some shine. I left out the gel after using this shampoo and my hair had a nice shine to it. It also lifts the hair, adding volume, which I don't necessarily need, but if you do, then I'm telling you it works.The best part for me is that there is no scent to it. I hate the smell of hair products in my hair. This leaves my hair clean and shiny. I've never tried Tresemme before. Now, I think I'll try their conditioner.

This "milk" doesn't need refrigeration, which concerns me. All the ingredients are organic, so I'm not sure just how this "milk" can stay fresh without being refrigerated.  I did refrigerate mine after receiving them in a plain box without any freezer packs included in the packaging.The reason I put quotation marks around milk is because, it isn't really milk. It's much thicker than milk. It has the consistency of a watered down yogurt. Instead of being sweet, which is the expected taste of strawberry milk, it's tart. Now, I don't know if it's tart because it's closer to yogurt than milk, or because it was a bit spoiled. It didn't smell spoiled.This is going to be something you might love or you might hate. There's not going to be any inbetween.
I can't believe I've never seen this movie before. It was a nice surprise to find it. Natalie was a wonderful little actress.

Rice flour doesn't make a great pasta. The noodles were kind of tough. This is the second brand of gluten free mac and cheese I've tried, and I have to say this is much better than the other. However, it's not great. The white cheese is very bland and doesn't much taste like cheese. The flavor overall could use a good punch to it. I followed the directions exactly and used salt free butter, but it was way too salty. In the end, I couldn't eat much because of the salt. Maybe it was overpowering because the taste was so bland. I didn't save the leftovers because the noodles probably won't heat up well. They would get even tougher if they were cooked any longer.

At 3 and 3/4 pounds, I'm not sure it's even legal to have this much chocolate on hand. Store it in the trunk of your car if you're driving because you could go into a sugar coma and get pulled over for driving under the influence.These are bite sized candy bars of chocolate with toffee nugget crunchy bits inside. If you've never tasted one, what are you waiting for?This bag is made to share. Having a party? This will fill up all the candy dishes that are sitting unused in your cabinets. You know the ones - the glass door cabinets with all the pretty china you got as a wedding gift. Well, pull them out and fill er up because you'll never be able to eat this entire bag alone. And, if you can, maybe you shouldn't.Is there a Chocolate Monster? If not, maybe the Muppet folks should design one, because only a chocolate monster could eat all the chocolate bars in this bag.

This is 4 and a quarter pounds of sweet, sweet goodness. You only order this bag if you're having a party, giving out candy for Halloween, or have a massive sweet tooth, like my 5' tall, 88 lb college roommate, who had a Hershey's Kiss fetish.The only reason not to have ever tasted a Reese's peanut butter cup is if you have a peanut allergy, chocolate allergy, diabetes or live in North Korea. Other than that, I'm sure I don't need to tell you how yummy this candy is. You can't get a better peanut butter/chocolate combo in anything else.With this bag you get a whole lot of bite sized yummilicious goodness in your mouth. But, be prepared to share because this is a lot of sugar.

These colorful pencils are No. 2/HB graphite and not colored pencils. The wood is thinner than a regular yellow pencil and felt like I could snap it in two if I pressed too hard.You need a light touch on the lead in order to erase it using the white eraser tips. A dark mark would need to be erased several times before erasing completely.Fun colors, but not sturdy.

I’ve been intrigued with westward travel by the covered wagon since I learned about the Donnor Party in grade school. In the 1960s and 1970s, America was obsessed with the wild west as there were western TV shows on all the channels. However, I never really learned much about the pioneers and their travels across the planes to the Northwest coast. This book is about a personal goal to drive the first covered wagon across the Oregon Trial in more than a century, amidst a history lesson about the first pioneers.The author, Rinker Buck, takes the reader along on his covered wagon expedition on the Oregon Trail with his brother, Nick, in 2011. The two couldn’t be more different and this leads to some of the funniest passages in the book. Interspersed between the chapters of their odyssey, we learn all about what the early pioneers went through on their travels in the 1840s and 1850s. There’s a chapter on the mule, one on the cover wagon, and even a chapter on the first woman to travel the trail. We learn about the piles of waste left by travelers, storms, and deaths along the route. We also learn about the businesses that popped up just to service the thousands of people making the trip. But, mostly what we learn by reading this entertaining account of the Buck brother’s trip is how much affection Americans still have for the trail, the original pioneers and the present day travelers. It’s quite touching how ranchers all along the trail offered shelter, food, showers and knowledge to help the Bucks and their family of mules complete their mission.Honestly, I can’t recommend this book enough. I was sorry when it ended. There’s so much research that went into this novel, but it’s not dry and school-bookish. Rinker’s self-effacing humor had me laughing in bed late at night. I have a renewed appreciation for what thousands of people went through to get to the west coast.

I have the Sennhaiser RS 170 so I’m pretty much going to compare them to the new RS 185 version. Well, not really, because they just don’t compare. The RS 185 is a classic example of getting what you pay for. At the current cost of $400 bucks, they may seem pricey, but they are totally worth that price.The clarity of sound knocked me off my feet. I connected them to my HDTV using the analog RCA plugs,  instead of the optical plug because my HDTV doesn’t have an optical outlet. The news was on when I first turned on the headset and all I can say is “Wow!” You talk about clear, resonate sound. And, listening to music is even better. I’m no expert, but when I compare the RS 185 to the RS 170, the quality of sound is so far greater that it’s hard to believe they were made by the same company.The headphone is very easy to set-up and comes with an electrical plug that includes attachments for various countries. Plus, there is an optical plug and an analog RCA plug for whichever you can use with your equipment. You can also plug these into a sound system, so TV is not the only way to use them. It comes with a quick start guide and a manual on CD, but I preferred to look manuals up on-line using my tablet, so I haven’t used the CD. The directions on the quick start guide are all you need to get yourself up and running. You won’t need to purchase anything additional – everything is included. In fact, you’ll end up with spare parts.The ear pieces are a bit larger than the RS 170, which helps to keep your ears from being squashed into your head. Also, they are covered with fabric. When I purchased the RS 170, I did so because they came with vinyl ear covers. I wanted something easy to clean. However, they make my head sweat so much I was taking them off during the commercials just to air out. They are also very tight. The RS 185 headset is so much more comfortable that I can keep them on for hours.The best update on the RS 185 are the volume buttons. They are large buttons with engraved symbols for – or + that you can feel with your fingers. The buttons are in a circle along with separate buttons for the left and right ear and one to reset the volume at an equal level between the two. It’s so easy to turn it up or down while wearing them. I had to take the RS 170 off just to adjust the volume.Each earpiece holds one AAA rechargeable battery, included. Just twist the inside of the earpiece off and drop in the battery. When you are done wearing them, place them on top of the transmitter to recharge.Another nice change from the earlier model is that you do not have to turn the transmitter on to use the headset. There’s a button on the headset to turn it off or on. Hold for 2 seconds until the light goes on or off and you’re set. This is nice because I used to get all settled in my chair before I realized I forgot to push the button on the transmitter then I would have to get up again. It seems like they listened to their customers and made some nice revisions to this model.If you’re trying to decide whether to spend the money on this more expensive model, ask yourself if you like great sound. If so, they are worth it.

It’s not over refers to how the LGBT civil rights movement still has a long road ahead despite recent laws making it illegal to ban same-sex marriage in most states. Although many people are slowing changing their minds in a positive way toward LGBT people, and agree to live and let live, there are many who are just as stubbornly homophobic.The book goes into depth regarding national incidents of homophobia which have taken place in the past few years. It outlines that in many states there are no laws that make it illegal to discriminate against people because of their sexual orientation. It also discusses how right-wing politicians are trying to implement new laws to discriminate against the LGBT community.None of this should come as news to anyone who knows the history of America. Although the black civil rights movement managed to make segregation illegal, blacks still suffer discrimination because they’re black, especially in specific parts of the country.  Although women made some major inroads in the 1960s and 1970s with birth control and the right to abortion, they are still discriminated where salaries are concerned. Today, those same right-wing Christian Republicans, who are trying to continue to ban acceptance of LGBT people, are also trying to make it illegal for women to get birth control and abortions. Regardless of who you are, it’s never a good time to let down your guard.There has been a positive shift in the nation’s attitude toward acceptance of the LGBT community; however, there's still work to be done. Change takes time. Don't assume it’s over because it may never be.This book would be a great book to use while writing your college papers. I wish I had this available about 10 years ago. It's hard to find books chock full of factional information about current events in law and national attitude towards the LGBT community.

I must admit I like gel over paste in a toothpaste. It usually takes me about a week to get used to a paste whenever I decide to try a new one. However, I just couldn't get used to the taste of this Tom's of Maine peppermint paste.The peppermint is very slight. Too slight because I mostly tasted plain paste. It left a bad taste in my mouth, causing me to drink a lot of water after brushing to get rid of the taste. Since I'll brush my teeth if I have a bad taste in my mouth, having a toothpaste that leaves a bad taste is not what I'm looking for.It did clean my teeth real well though. And, if I had used it long enough I probably would see some whitening because my teeth were getting sensitive after a week of use. That's usually caused by the whitening ingredient.This paste isn't for me because of the taste, but it does do the job it's supposed to do.

I'm not going to lie. At first this deodorant was great. It kept me dry and didn't leave behind any scent, which I dislike. It's plain and simple, which is exactly what I look for in a deodorant.However, upon continued use after I left my first  5 star review, I started to notice a really strong underarm odor at the end of the day. Worse than if I hadn't had any deodorant on at all. Then one morning I awoke with a bad red rash under both arms. I stopped using it immediately and the rash went away in a couple of days. I may be allergic to one of the ingredients, but I don't know which one. Sometimes all natural is the best option.

This fictional story is the first person account of rape and its aftermath. I'm not spoiling by saying a rape happens because it happens early on and is the basis for the rest of the novel. Initially, I was turned off by it and thought I'd struggle getting through the book. However, that was not the case. I found the story engrossing and had trouble putting it down.Bailey Carpenter is a private eye. Thanks to her deceased father, she's also extremely well off financially, which is important because it gives her the opportunity to hide away and not work after her attack. A subplot is that her father, who was married twice before her mother and had 5 children in those marriages, left his fortune to Bailey and her brother. So, they're being sued by their half-siblings for a piece of their father's estate. I's only after her attack that one of Bailey's half-sisters becomes her caregiver and confidant.Nothing is as it appears as Bailey seems to see her attacker in every man she comes in contact with. She becomes obsessed with a man whose apartment she can see directly across from hers. She spies on him with her binoculars and is sure that he was the one who raped her. She calls the cops every time she believes that each man definitely had something to do with her rape. Not only does she offend all the men she comes in contact with, but the cops are beginning to dismiss her accusations as she becomes even more unstable.Due to her extreme wealth, it was too easy for Bailey to cocoon herself after the rape. I kept wondering how this story would have played out if she was of moderate means and had to get up and get dressed and go to work each day. The outcome of the subplot was no surprise. I suspected it early on, and was actually disappointed when it turned out to be the case. I like to be surprised by the ending of a mystery. And, I was. Because the man who was the actual rapist is one you never see coming. Totally worth the read.

This is a very pretty costume set for teenagers. I would hesitate to give it to a tween because the necklace chain is delicate and might break if one isn't careful. The chain isn't very long, which is why I suggest it for teens and not adults. That, and the fact that it's obviously costume.The ring is a size 7, which will significantly reduce the number of girls you'll be able to wear it. Size 7 would probably be too large for most girls who have not finished growing. And, some girls have very slender fingers, too small for this size; others have fingers that are larger than size 7 The fact that you can only get this set with one size ring reduces my star rating.The earring posts have clear backs. They are my favorite of the entire set and will probably get the most use.

I really love these novellas that bring us back to my favorite pair, Dragos and Pia. They always seem to get themselves in such a mess, and this time around is no exception. They really "stepped" in it this time, and I was thoroughly entertained watching their latest fiasco unravel. There's so much going on in this novella despite it's short length, and I found myself wishing for just a bit more by the end. Everything continued at a frenetic pace to the point where I wanted this to be a full length book and slow down to expand on things. Who am I kidding though... I'd find any reason to ask for a full length featuring Dragos and Pia. There's just something electric about the pair that keeps me wanting more. And I'm thankful for any tastes we get to see of the pair. So all in all, I highly recommend PIA DOES HOLLYWOOD to fans of the series. There's some pretty interesting and important reveals as well as a great deal of fun that you won't want to miss!

Wow, just wow. This book is one heck of a ride.TEN THOUSAND SKIES ABOVE YOU digs further into dimensional travel and all the complications and risks. There's so many ethical issues and risks they are taking, and this book really explores further into the implications of all that. I really enjoyed this deeper look and it kept me on the edge of my seat from the start until the very end. Not only are there big risks, but there's also emotional and personal aspects that get explore. The big question is whether we really all the same person a the core across the dimensions, or do our experiences shape us instead, making each version of us truly different? The ramifications of this question are really profound in this book, and it made for an incredible read.I have to admit prior to starting I was just a bit hesitant. I wasn't quite sure what I was going to get as trilogies are tricky things. It seems you almost always either have the sophomoric slump in the second book or if the book manages to escape that normal trend then there's a doozy of a cliffhanger. And that latter is the case here. There's not even a hint of a slump here, as TEN THOUSAND SKIES ABOVE YOU is every bit as good as its predecessor, but the cliffhanger ending is insane. Not only are there massive game changing revelations in this book that would have made me desperate to get my hands on the next one, but the very ending events are nearly cruel when it comes to cliffhanger terms. I kept trying to get to the next page as I just couldn't believe it ended there. I'll be counting down the days until the next book releases.TEN THOUSAND SKIES ABOVE YOU isn't just a must read, it's a drop everything you're doing, and run to the nearest bookstore to get your hands on it immediately read. Bravo!

I feel utterly torn about REAP THE WIND. On one hand I was utterly and completely hooked into the story. It was intense and the characters really shined. You could really feel the stakes involved. It's quite a long book, but I read it in one setting into the wee hours of the morning. All good things right? You might be asking what's the problem. I have one word for you... Cliffhanger. Another cliffhanger, after the past several books having killer cliffhangers, I had expected a resolution at least on that matter. But no, the past three books have left a certain character's fate in the balance, and unfortunately this one does as well. I had a strong urge to throw my kindle across the room when I realized this. As much as I love this series, the frustration factor is starting to weigh on me. It's just amazing how in such a long book, so much could happen, but in the end nothing that happened really matters as the main issue is still massively looming. I feel like I've been teased one too many times. Will I read the next book, absolutely, but if there's yet another cliffhanger on this same issue it might just be a towel throwing offense.Getting back to the good. Cassie really shines in REAP THE WIND. She's tested over and over, but this time around her reactions are a little bit more thought out rather than so reactive. Sure she's still in constant jams but less are due to her own scrambled reactions. She's maturing and learning more about her role and becoming more confident, and I cheered her every step of the way. Now if everyone else could just start respecting her... Speaking of respect, the whole Mircea thing is still a funny situation. The romance there leaves me scratching my head more often than not. I hope there's some sort of resolution planned there as well in the near future as again, it's been dragged out for a very long time it seems.Despite my frustrations due the overall arc of the series and lack of real momentum, Reap the Wind is a very good book in its own right. Take out the series issues and it's darn right fantastic, so with that caveat in mind, REAP THE WIND is an enjoyable and engrossing read.

It amazes me how fresh and interesting each of these books are considering how long this series has been running. Typically by this point, the twelfth book, I almost expect a bit of staleness, and yet with each new book, Eileen Wilks brings a whole new challenge and ball game. It's incredibly impressive and one of the reasons I really enjoy this series. Between knowing I'll get a fantastic plot and all the many previous books allowing for such rich and lengthy amount of character growth, and I don't even need to read the description. I'll read the next book sight unseen.This time around the plot centers around Lily and Rule again, my favorite pair so I knew I was in for a treat. And the book delivered. Between all the crazy politics, Dragon happenings, a new and troublesome ability for Lily, seriously tricky situations for Rule, and a very interesting new character, MIND MAGIC had me hooked from the start. It's a lengthy book but I read it almost straight through into the wee hours of the morning just to find out what happened next. I know I'll be counting down the days until the next installment releases.Seamlessly weaving fast paced action and strong characters in a fantastic blend of entertainment, MIND MAGIC is not to be missed.

I'm a huge fan of the Half-Moon hollows series. There's just something so comforting about them. In fact this series is one of my favorites to listen to on audio for rereads. And with each new book, I always know I'll get a solid block of entertainment and hilarity that will have me laughing out loud. Fangs for the Memories is no exception. This one is a bit different from the rest of the series as it goes back a bit in time to the beginning of Dick and Andrea's relationship. I've always wanted to see more about how this rough, roguish, and slightly sheevy vampire could win over the polished Andrea's heart. Of course knowing everything we do now so much further in the series, Dick's no where as bad as he seemed. But this story takes place before all that and I really enjoyed the further insight. It only made me love Andrea and Dick even more. So, all in all this is a fun little treat for fans of the series that's not too be missed.

I really enjoy Lila's character. She's grown and accomplished so much already and we're only the 2nd book in. It makes me even more eager to see what she can become in future books. She's no longer the skittish thief we met in the first book, but a loyal and dare I say trusting member of the family. Previously I felt like she had one foot out the door at all times but in DARK HEART OF MAGIC she seems much more settled. And considering everything that happens in this book and what's brewing next, this settled-ness happened just in time.I really enjoy the mix of urban fantasy and mobster families in this series. And the rivalry and machinations between the families seemed to only get thicker if that's possible. It's one of those situations where you just immerse yourself and watch the sparks fly. And boy did they fly in this book! I figured out the mystery pretty early on, but that didn't detract from my enjoyment at all. It was fun to see each new revelation make me think more and more I was correct in my guess at the culprit. And then the final showdown, whew! What a doozy.If you're looking for a fun and action packed read with great characters, an interesting world, and plenty of machinations, look no further than DARK HEART OF MAGIC. It's guaranteed to please.

While the premise and the characters of AUTUMN THORNS intrigued me, the immense world building kept me from enjoying this book as much as I would like. I'm all for a complex and unique world, but in this case I felt things were a bit too on the "craft" side. I'm a big fan of the author, and follow her various networks, so I know that she is very immersed in the magical world, and beliefs, and that knowledge showed in this book. Unfortunately it showed so much that it made it incredibly hard to keep up for lamens like myself. There were so many different magical aspects, deities, and ritualistic methods portrayed in this book that my head was spinning. That being said, as I started to get a grasp on the rules of the world by the end, I do have high hopes for the rest of the series.World building woes aside, I greatly enjoyed the characters in AUTUMN THORNS. Kerris is a no non-sense, kick butt heroine that you couldn't help loving from the start. She's thrust back into a town and duty she never wanted to return to, and yet she accepts it all with grace. Even better yet, when other powers that be, be they good or evil, attempt to bully her, she stands firm despite having no real idea what's she's doing. I really admired her for that. Add in a yummy hero who may have sparked a bit more of instalove than my tastes prefer at times, but seems to be everything Kerris needs, and I was sold.All in all while the world building bogged the book down a bit for me, I see a great amount of potential for this series, and I'm eager to see where things lead. If you're a fan of urban fantasy with a spicy romance, then this one is definitely worth a look or two.

I really enjoyed the previous installment, but ICE LIKE FIRE just didn't have the same spark for me. I just didn't feel like the book was moving anywhere to be honest and considering it's a 500 page book that didn't work so well for me. There was just a bit too much meandering rather than anything real happening. After the big build up and everything that happened previously I was expecting a bit more action this time around as well. Unfortunately while there was a quest, it was unrealistically easy, and the rest of the focus was more internal with both Meira, Mather, and even Theron's ruminations that were more wallowing than anything it seemed. Between that and all of the politics I found myself skimming at times as it just wasn't holding my attention. It really is a shame because there's so much potential here.I will say however that the ending events are what brought some excitement and action back into the book, and what made me decide to bump my rating up to a three instead of two. It's almost frenetic and a serious game changer yet again. I only wish it had of been spread out a bit more, and not left things so abruptly.In the end I can only hope that ICE LIKE FIRE suffered from a middle book syndrome and that the finale will return to the splendor of the first installment.

I'm a huge fan of the Elder Races series, and I have to admit while I love all the characters, Dragos, Pia, and Liam are by far my favorites. So these small outtake novellas are the perfect "fix" for me. I'm also always impressed at how much emotion and actual events Thea always manages to pack in these considering how short they are and this novella was no exception. It kept me hooked from the very first page, and even brought a tear felt moment by the end. Perfect for fans of the series who need a bit more Dragos and Pia in their lives like I do, DRAGOS GOES TO WASHINGTON is not to be missed. I'll be counting down the days until the two follow up novellas arrive, and of course the next full length coming soon. If you haven't started this series yet, what are you waiting for?

What a completely unique and very interesting read! I have to admit I wasn't quite sure what I was going to get when I read the blurb as it sounded nothing like what the author had done before, or really my normal genre reading preferences. But I'm so glad I took the chance as once I started reading MENAGERIE, I simply couldn't put it down. It was dark and gritty and oh so horrifying. I'm having a hard time putting my thoughts about this book into words, rather than just feelings like horror, outrage, etc,  but imaginative would probably be the best description. This book made me feel so much it truly was impressive, from the creepy, to the terrible, to the heart-warming AND heart-breaking moments, I was an utter wreck by the time I finished.That being said, as much as I enjoyed MENAGERIE, there were a few things that kept me from giving it a full five stars. At times the violence was too much. It's not that I mind violence in books, quite the contrary, but I do prefer a bit more positive or hope to balance things out. Aside from Delilah's stellar strength, for most of the book I didn't feel any hope or goodness, and it was just a bit oppressive. I also wish the ending and the interesting side of a certain character that I won't mention to avoid spoilers, would have been developed a bit more. Both the ending and that character's "story" and the repercussions felt incredibly rushed, and I just wish those parts had been expanded more.All in all, this book is a must read for any Urban Fantasy, Fantasy, Thriller, and/or Suspense lover. From the moment you start this book you'll be on the edge of your seat biting your nails in anticipation for what's going to happen next.

Oh my goodness did I love this book. I have to admit that I've been anticipating Ashwini and Janvier's story for a long time now, ever since reading their short story, and then all of the little hints and by plays in the rest of the series. The tension between the two was so palatable and oh so yummy. I just knew their story would be fireworks once we finally got there, and I was right. Ash and Janvier have this connection that just sucks you right in, but it's the banter that really seals the deal. There's no gushy love here, but that constant enemies to lovers tension that I absolutely love. Not that they are enemies, or ever really were, it's just that the tension and by play between them has that feeling, making for exactly my kind of romance. I realize I'm probably sounding like a bit of a fan girl here, but the book was simply that perfect for me.Onto other things aside from my love for Ash & Janvier. The plotline of this one was really intense, and kept me hooked from the start. I also liked the large focus on Elena and Raphael as well, always a plus. But what really stole the show for me was learning more about Nassir. He's always been a bit of a creepy mystery that I wanted to know about, and that wish was granted in this book.
