This brings me around and actively making my own without cringing.  The juicer handles the hard thick carrots and regular apple like a champ.  I still feel like it takes an awful lot of greens, fruits and vegetables to actually get a heaping glass.  This is the only reason why I wouldn't juice every day.... affordability is a big issue for us.Highly recommend if you plan to juice once or twice a week max.  It is a bit time consuming to have to manually grind everything opposed to just passing through a machine.  Great option for occasional weekly use towards a healthy start before serious juicing.

I was very excited for this locker extender to arrive so that my middle schooler could put to good use.  Unfortunately, this item is not for a universal fit.  My daughter made me aware that their lockers do not have any hooks on the sides.  This could be remedied by purchasing two 3M hooks but I am not sure how much weight they would be able to support.The shelf quality is great after the fit disappoinment.  The packaging claims that it will hold up to 100 pounds;  more than sufficient!  We recieved the appealing teal color which my daughter fell in love with.Recommend if you need extra storage in your locker but the consumer must make sure that they have hooks and that their locker width is wide enough.  3 stars for not being really universal.

I really wanted to come on here and write that this product kept my red color treated hair vivid and brighter for longer, but unfortunately,  I can not.I found that the shampoo is the color of red medicine and has a very pleasing scent.  So much so that my husband and eight year old son comment on how great my hair smells.  I felt that my hair was fading at the same rate but felt very silky.  What I did notice regarding the coolor was that it was much more golden this time around.  I do not remember my hair fading to a strawberry blonde that was so silky and bright.  I will disclose that I opted to use my own conditioner instead of the companion product.  On the labeling it does say to use 'daily'... I do not wash my hair daily, which has left me wondering if the result would have been any different if it was used daily as stated.Recommend for bottle red heads if you want great smelling silky hair that fades to a nice golden color.  This is what happened to my hair; your mileage may vary.  I did not find that it extended the true red tone but it also didnt fade and feel like straw.  If you understand that it may not produce those results and are still interested,  then give it a try and see how it works with your tone.

In theory, this bluetooth adapter with included earphones is a great idea... in theory.  If this adapter is purchased for a beginner to the technology, then it is a good purchase.  Do not recommend buying this product if you are tech savvy because it will fall short when it comes to options.Right out of the box you are severely underwhelmed by the included instructions that are written in the TINIEST font available.  Your eyes will thank you when you pull out the magnifying glass for these instructions.  Pairing them to any device is a cinch when you decipher the instructions.  You will hold down the center button until it flashes red and blue; what the instructions fail to explain is that once you depress the button it will first flash a solid blue then red and blue.  At this point you will release and make sure that your device is discoverable.  The MT103 quickly discovered my Dell laptop, Galaxy S5 cell phone and Galaxy S4.  I chose to connect the adapter to my S5.  Initially I am surprised by the length of the ear buds cord that connects to the device.  I had an issue clipping the adapter to my t-shirt.  I tried the collar but the cords were bunched up around my chin.  Attempting to attach to my sleeve didn't fare any better because the length was too short and didn't leave me any play to move my head while walking.You are able to answer calls from the device by just pressing the center circle once again.  I could hear the party on the other end perfectly, but they complained of my voice sounding 'muffled'.  I attempted to remedy that situation with different placement around my face.  Closer distorted my voice, attached to my collar produced a muffled sound and holding in my hand at a distance of about 7 inches from my mouth was the best.  This is rather unacceptable when you are outside walking or exercising!  We will not be using the bluetooth to answer our phones unless it is very necessary.  While attempting to stream music from my device and Pandora outside it kept on cutting in and out.  It became very frustrating when the device kept on disconnecting and had to be re-connected 5 different times.The included instructions do not mention the 3 different filters that are included.  The three included filters change from strong bass, medium bass or crisp bass.  I only remembered about them when I read the back of the box.  It is simple enough screwing them into each earbud.  I personally like the filters without any dots because it produced a nice heavy bass.  The filters with one dot sounded very crisp and loud; bass unsatisfying.  The two dotted filters felt very much like the aforementioned.  Silicone ear bud pieces come in three sizes, middle size seems to fit all the best.This is a very light and portable bluetooth adapter but it would do better with a couple of more buttons or even the tiniest screen that could scroll through your albums.  I hate the fact that you are not able to scroll through your albums.  All that you can do is go from song to song in an album that has been manually selected from your device.  With our developed technologies thus far, this really should have been an included function.There are a few pros for this device:Easily pairs with available devices once you understand that you do not stop pressing at the first solid blue rings.Makes any old headphones accessible via bluetooth and your other devices.Slight personalization regarding sound with the included sound filters.Included headphones that are pretty good with a nice thick braid.Beginner learning curve because of only 5 buttons.Operates at a great distance from paired device.  Went the length of our apartment and made it about 25 feet before it started to cut out.Cons for this device:There is NO low battery indicator.  I am not sure if I missed this in the included instructions and their tiny print.  Trial and error has shown me that after the device is charged the center is solid red.  Why not blue??Cuts in and out while listening to albums from Amazon Music and Pandora's streaming.Cannot skip to next album on device only to songs within the same album.Headphone cord just too short.Included charging cable is a USB to headphone jack.  Rather odd and will not be as easily found to replace.BATTERY CANNOT BE REPLACED.  This renders the device useless and left for the trash after it's battery life.Constantly disconnects while outside.  I do not understand why.Annoying hissing sound when it isn't connected to an outside device.Recommend only if you do not have a bluetooth device already and you have a pair of corded headphones that you cannot part with.  This will pretty much make them wireless.  IF you are an early adopter then the MT103 will not cut the mustard.  I couldn't get past the fact that I was not able to jump from album to album and the fact that it would disconnect while I was walking outside.  If you understand it's shortcomings, it will fit you perfectly.

Great tablecloth for everyday or special occassions.  Right out of the packaging you are plagued with deep creases that need to be ironed.  After a bit of ironing, the tabecloth lays beautifully on our oblong shaped table.  It hangs over the sides and transforms our dining room.  I received the Ivory 'Climbing Vine' herringbone weave pattern.  Be aware that the Ivory is more towards the yellow creams.The tabecloth is microfiber and spillproof.  This does not mean STAINPROOF though.  I tested with a bit of water because I was skeptical.  The water did bead up and allow me to thoroughly wipe away.  I did not want to try with a liquid that stains but I do believe that even a corrosive liquid would bead up if promptly wiped.One thing that I live is the fact that this tablecloth is machine washable.  The instructions state that it should be washed cold during a gentle  with light colors.  Non-chlorine bleach only, tumble dry low and light iron if necessary.Highly recommend if you are in the market for a pretty tablecloth that is versatile and easily washed.  No DRY CLEANING FINALLY!

I became intrigued by this catacombs playset because it looked deliciously creepy.  Even though this play set is aged for my girls, they did not care for it.  They are aged 10 and 11; they felt that it was silly and expensive.Upon receiving signing and hauling the box up the stairs, I wondered how large it was actually going to be.  Unfortunately, I soon discovered that this wasn't a plug and play type of set like the Batman ones that I had purchased for my son in the past.  There are pieces and MANY of them that comprise this catacombs playset.  It should have been an easy build, but after a very long hour I believe that the manufacturer wants you to feel as if you are getting your money's worth because 'more pieces' equals 'more money'.  After dedicating over an hour in meticulously putting everything together, the second shock came.  This 'toy' is over 4 feet tall and 3 feet wide!!  This set needs it's own room.  It would be great for families with large homes and sprawling bedrooms or play rooms but in our NYC apartment this will not do.There are positive points as well.  The fact that the set is so large it allows your little collector to display 15 Monster High dolls throughout the levels.  We were able to fit 17 Barbies in there.  I fell in love with the clock trick door to gain entrance to the secret lab.  There are little cute things throughout the set like this.  The pool can be flipped for a different theme, spin the courtyard to see the spooky eyes, turn the dragon and there is another hidden shelf for a doll and ride the elevator.The bad:  Elevator does not move smoothly.  The plastic feels cheap for the overall set.  As always a few extra pieces are included but just not enough for this price.  My daughter's are aged out already.  They find the set and whole Monster High thing corny.I really wanted for my girls to be excited when they saw the set, but instead I learned that my girls have turned into young ladies. :(  I truly considered keeping the set for Halloween even though it seemed like a cheap plastic toy.  My husband laughed at me and questioned where I could possible place this to be on display.  It really is just too BIG, bulky and cannot be folded for seasonal storage or otherwise.Recommend only if your child is a Monster High fanatic and already owns the doll.  I still believe that this item is just too expensive considering that the consumer has to put it together and then store it.  Why not have the ability to fold when not in use??  It's a display case that will lead to more 'accessories' purchases.  If your child is into imaginative play and you have the space then you should not be disappointed.  My girls didn't care for it at all.

How I wish that this item had originally been available when my little guy started school four years ago.  Our son would alternate between being a lefty to righty but one thing that never changed was the sloppiness.  With the sloppiness and constant pencil points breaking came pencil shavings and black marks on his hands, furniture and shavings spilled all over the home.  That is when I started purchasing mechanical pencils for home use.  The girls did wonderfully since they were older but our son struggled because he pressed too hard.  He also had a rather odd grip on the pencil; he still does!  I tried purchasing the thickest and 'strongest' lead available but that did not work either.At first glance a parent may not want to spend on only ONE mechanical pencil.  I thought before they arrived that it was a bit much, until it was opened.  Once opening the packaging, I was surprised to see a wider barreled but shorter pencils.  There is a little plastic guide to help little ones with placement, a spot to place the included sticker with their 'handwritten' name, a VERY long side eraser in a nice sleeve and a container of VERY thick lead.  I was so surprised to see that lead that resembled a pencils in thickness could be made mechanical.  IT'S GREAT!!The lead writes smoothly, and the pencil grip feels very nice.  My only complaint would be that the guide may get in the way for older kids.  Our son had an issue with getting the hang of the guide and why it was actually there.  It would have been a great learning tool all those years ago; now he accidentally placed his finger over the guide.  Even with that he still loves the thickness of the barrel, the eraser and the lead.  To prove that it doesn't break as easily he chose to stab the Amazon box.  After being scolded for stabbing the box, I did notice that he was right that the point didn't break!  If these pencils had been available all those years ago, then maybe the elementary school teachers wouldn't ban mechanical pencils from our school's classrooms.Highly recommend for first time writers or for children that struggle pressing too hard with the conventional mechanical pencil.  I have not been able to find BIC 1.3mm refills for the lead on Amazon which is rather disappointing.  I am assuming that you can use Papermate's lead instead which is rather inexpensive.  Great size in length and girth for little hands and should be easy enough to load once a child learns the mechanics.  Not sure if the 'guide' on the barrel will be appreciated by all parents.  It would have helped us back then because it would have reminded our son about his finger placement.  I still watch him awkwardly hold a pencil and sloppily write... he may become a Doctor!

This toy is geared towards children aged 6 to 36 months.  I believe that the age gap is too wide and it would be more suitable for an infant aged 6 months to the point where they are attempting to sit and stand up.  It will not keep the older set thoroughly entertained for long but does wonders for the 'tummy' set of infants.Very durable and colorful toy with a two setting volume and a very pleasing voice that appeals to babies.  The horse rocks and rolls or rather wobbles across the floor and your little 'tummy' floor surfer attempts to reach it so that they can hug and put it in their mouths!  At least that is how our story went.  It is not as annoying as other toys as far as sound and repetition... yet!  At first I thought it was silly that there were commands to touch his nose or play with his ears, but after thinking for a while, it makes sense because the child is learning 'cause and effect' with repetition.  I was delighted to see that the classic William Tell Overture happily plays as well as other music.  I don't believe that this toy will be played with for a long period.  As long as your child is more stationary, then this is a great purchase to hold their interest.Highly recommend for little ones first learning toys.  It would make a very nice inexpensive gift as well because it is a quality build that seems very safe.  I do not see how a little could hurt themselves.  LeapFrog has built another quality product.

This hot air popcorn popper has many horrible reviews and is starred very low.  After careful consideration and our limited experience, we have found this product to be good.  Does this item spit out un-popped kernels rather violently?  YES!  I believe it has something to do with it's slanted forward design and low black collar.Right out of the box there are instructions, the popper, plastic slanted funnel and measuring cup/cover.  It is a very easy read; just reading the first page allows you to become quickly acquainted with the machine.  It states to use a bowl with sides that are at least 5-5.5 inches high.  I recommend a very DEEP salad style bowl.  We used a shallow six inch high wide bowl and found the popcorn ricocheting in and out of the bowl onto the floor.  Lesson number 1 learned: USE HIGH WALLED BOWL.One afternoon I was sucked into watching yet another episode of Dr. Oz (*eye roll).  This particular afternoon the audience was schooled on the dangers of microwave popcorn.  We all know that it is dangerous but try to ignore it for the convenience.  Regardless, Dr. Oz scared the junk out of myself and husband enough to have us run out and swap our comfortably easy microwaveable popcorn baggies for a jar of un-popped kernels.  WE learned then how annoying it was to make popcorn on the stove top.  It was much trial and error, many different fats, temps and flavors.  Countless pots until my husband became the designated 'Popper' in the house.  Not an easy feat for a family of five that usually has 3 bags of popcorn while watching a movie.  We seriously considered buying a popcorn popper, but life took over and it went to the wayside.  Here I am now staring at this machine's shortcomings at the bottom of my salad bowl and yet I am still in the honeymoon phase.  It's a popcorn popper and it does pop the kernels.  Does it pop all the kernels?  NO.  Does it spit out MANY MANY kernels each and every time?  YES.  Do I still like it?  YES.We are able to make our plain popcorn without and oils and it is not necessary to add any toppings.  Both regular kernels and today's white hybrid NON-GMO kernels through Jolly Time have gone through the machine the same way.  Kernels that do pop are large and fluffy.  I can see why everyone HATES this machine, when I slowly start to count the amount of kernels that were spit out from the 1/2 cup.  That is the capacity of the measuring cup/cover on the top.  There are just too many wasted... I stopped counting at 35.  That is a lot of money wasted when you take it into consideration for each time.Recommend if you are in the market for a hot air popcorn for natural healthy popcorn.  We have never owned another model so we are not sure if they usually 'spit' out kernels down the chute.  It does it's job and ours does not run so hot that it is dangerous.  We only recommend that you do not attempt to remove the 'spat' out kernels while the machine is operating.  My burnt thumb did not appreciate the burn from the very hot kernel.  I really believe that the black collar should be a bit higher; possible that would remedy the kernels jumping out.

I have previously reviewed a Simplehuman sensor soap dispenser and instantly fell in love. So much so, that I purchased a second one for our master bathroom and then was able to review the larger stainless steel version of this rechargeable sensor pump.  If you have been keeping count, that is FOUR soap dispensers by this great company.  We have never experienced clogs. This might very well have to do with the fact that we use Simplehuman branded lavender hand soap.  It clearly states to not use any soaps with 'beads'.  We have also never had to clean up any drips because of the nozzle leaking.I will continue to LOVE this product and sing it's praises. The design is very round with a protruding snout with a smaller foot stamp than it's 11oz counterpart.  Shiny white plastic that looks great even when wet. At first I wasn't very excited about the white color, but now I am beginning to really appreciate the clean look overall. The buttons are actually part of the chrome top and seem to be "touch". As before, I am concerned about wetting the top and eventually making those functions non-operational.  It has been a little over a year from my original review for the 11 oz version and we have not had one issue.  I should probably let the fear go that the top will become non-operational if water touches it, because my kids soak it everyday.  The literature does tell you not to submerge the pump.  Again we are employing the same +/- system, as well as holding down the - button to shut the device off. Very useful when you know your kitty will be activating and dispensing soap all night long (TRUE STORY).  Included in the packaging will be a 3.5 oz Lavender scent sample and the micro USB cord for charging.At this point you are questioning why should you purchase if it is the same exact product with different aesthetics? The supplied micro USB slot to charge the internal battery. Yes, now you can charge your cell phone and soap dispenser at the same time apparently. Believe me, I tried and my Samsung Galaxy S4 uses the same cord. I was happy to see that when I plugged in the USB, my soap dispenser was fully charged by the green light indication. It has been nearly a month and we have not had to re-charge the device as of yet. I truly hope that it will go for another month.This product is backed by a very generous 2 year warranty.  You can be assured that it isn't a gimmick because I did need to use the warranty for my two original dispensers (not the rechargeable version).  I am happy to report that Simple Human has wonderful customer service that stands behind their products.  Two other soap dispensers (not the rechargable model) that we had owned became non-operational. I had never registered them. I simply called and gave the purchase dates. We once again went through trouble shooting where it was found that they needed to go in for service. They emailed me the UPS return slips and I returned both pumps. Within 3 days I had the return email confirmation. It took 10 days before I received a final email stating that they were replacing both pumps and tracking info. Sounds too good to be true... but I received two BRAND NEW replacement soap dispensers in their individual sale packaging with the lavender soap samples; just like my original purchase.The bad thing is that I received a letter stating that I would no longer have any warranty.  No new 2 year warranty and no remainder from the last.  I was a bit frustrated because it seems from my personal experience that they become faulty at the 1 year mark.  Apparently, this does not hold true for this model.  I will update if the replacements do the same. Great work Simple Human for standing behind your product but you should at the very least offer 6 months on the replacements.Highly recommend this RECHARGEABLE dispenser.  As you may have seen from my other reviews, I have balked at the original price.  It has been a year since I received the other rechargeable pump and we have charged it only ONCE!  The extra cost is worth it considering the amount that we are saving in batteries every month.  Backed with the warranty and long battery life this is a sound purchase that you will not regret.

Growing up I loved reading the Garfield comics.  My eight year old son asked for one of the Garfield comics and I was happy to oblige.  This was a 3-pack which is more bang for you buck.  It gets rather expensive buying each individual volume.  The art is the same and the strips colors are as vivid as ever.  If you love reading Cathy, Calvin & Hobbes and Archie comics, then you should check out Garfield.  Who doesn't love an obnoxious fat cat??!Highly recommend for any age!  These are good clean funnies that will keep you laughing for hours.

In all seriousness I needed a bell because I was undergoing a tonsillectomy and didn't want to strain my throat.  The bell is just that... a bell!  It has a nice handle and is loud enough to be heard through a home if necessary.  Seems like good quality; my only gripe is that I believe at the current purchase price it is too much.  You could find this bell at the .99 cent stores in your neighborhood.  When the product arrived and I had to tear it out of the cheap cellophane baggy, I instantly regretted paying anything over the three-dollar mark.Recommend if you need a bell.  Do not know of it's longevity as of today.  Do not over pay!

I have always wanted a breakfast tray but never truly got around to purchasing one.  After knowing I was going to be confined to a bed for a while, I decided to finally purchase one.  Right off the bat, the tray's color was uniform and beautiful.  I was expecting divots of paint missing and dents everywhere; surprisingly NONE!  The color at first looks to be a deep black, but when placed in natural light you will see the mahogany shade laced through-out.  Seems very much like an espresso shade at times.The tray is fully functional and rather big, which we love because our plates are on the largish size.  The legs fold out smoothly and stay in place while eating.  The other thing that I really love is that it can be used as a table tray when the legs are folded underneath.  They are flush to the bottom which gives it a rather seamless appearance.  I do expect that the paint might blister and peel if you do not use coasters though.  It feels like it is a laminated particle board.Highly recommend if you are looking for a breakfast tray that can double as a regular tray in this color scheme.  If it arrives the way mine did condition-wise, then you will not be disappointed.  I do not recommend purchasing this tray for laptop use; the lip is just too high and uncomfortable.

I found this pepper mill grinder at a local retailers over six months ago and it has been glorious from the moment I filled it.  Ok, ok, I may be over-excited over this pepper mill but there is a reason.  For years I would struggle with the other types with the little knob on top that would either be over-tightened or loosened to the point of the base falling into my cooking pot!  This happened so many times that I began to ban them and use the already filled small McCormick grinders that are not reusable.  I missed not having those special blend of peppercorns to dot my meals with before and after.  McCormick grinders were just not cutting it and rather expensive when having to be replaced every two weeks.This grinder has a great feel: rubbery at the top, plastic in the center and stainless steel at the base.  My favorite feature is the sliding grind selector; from very fine to very coarse.  I am able to handle it with dirty hands while cooking and it is easily cleaned and disinfected at the end of the night.The well that holds the peppercorns is larger than most which is great that you do not need to constantly re-fill.  The mechanism is smooth and it has been performing wonderfully while being used on a daily basis, minimally twice a day.Highly recommend this pepper grinder for it's ease of use, nice style that easily blends and quality materials.

Let's start this review off with the fact that even though the grinding mechanism has a lifetime warranty, I still believe that it is overpriced for a single mill.The wood does feel like real wood and would go wonderfully in a stainless steel environment or mahogany wood colored situation.  I am rather disappointed at the acrylic base.This is not my favorite pepper mill out there.  Through the years there has been much trial and error and I have finally found the best pepper mill for my use.  It is OXO branded with a grind selector at the base.  The materials lend themselves perfectly for being used while I am cooking.  This paper mill has a smaller well and there is not a visible selector but rather you loosen or tighten the bolt at the top.  I hate that way because I either over tighten or loosen to the point of it falling off of the base.It grinds easily enough and there is a discernible difference in the pepper grain sizes.Would have rated 3 stars for the price and grinding size selector but opted for 4 because it feels as if it is a quality product.  This pepper mill will also look nicer on your decorated table for company compared to my hearty all business OXO mill that I have shown in my provided image.  Recommend for the brand and warranty behind it.

Great tasting cappuccino without adding any sugar!  I love this product even though the price is a bit high and not easily available (only through mail or online!).  If you drink a lot at the coffee houses or Starbucks then the cost will not seem astronomical in the long run.  We also love how you can customized the amount of milk and coffee to everyone's taste.  Not more that I could write about it.  Love it and so will you.Highly recommend for it's flavor and customization.

5:36 MinsDe'Longhi Circolo Coffee Machine with two year warranty.  In my video review I made the mistake of stating that I would use less bars for a weaker coffee.  My husband has since corrected me that more bars would equal more coffee but at a weaker strength and less bars would be less coffee at a stronger strength.

3:44 MinsVideo review of Nestea Peach Iced brewing.  Made an error when I stated there were only 2 Iced flavors available.  There are actually 3 flavors: Nestea Peach Iced Tea, Cappuccino and Skinny Cappuccino.

Recently we had two of our vehicles 8 tires slashed while parked in our driveway.  After these events we have become shaken and uncomfortable in our surroundings.  It doesn't help that we did not have any sort of security system in place.After careful research we opted to purchase the Lorex LH03041TC4W model from another big box store.  Amazon did not have it available for purchase at the time.  This model is different only when it comes to the included hard drive space.  The product above is for a 500gb drive and the one that we purchased is 1TB.  The 1TB drive can record up to 263 hours at the highest setting.  The drive is a security-grade 24/7 recording type that overwrites.Installation for this system is a breeze.  We chose this WIRELESS option because we currently rent our apartment and did not feel like wiring the whole building.  Installation of this system is five stars; keep in mind that each camera must be plugged into an outlet.  We had an outdoor outlet on our balcony (the literature states that they need to be plugged into an indoor outlet) but not for the other camera on the other side of the building.  We did have to drill a hole into the building and fed the wire through there.  The cord that plugs into the camera is only 6 foot long and the power cables that attach to that and into the grounded outlet are also 6 feet long.  This allows you about 12 feet of length for a nearby outlet.  If you will not be drilling holes then I do not see how you could possibly install these cameras outdoors, short of leaving a window open (wouldn't recommend that!).  When drilling the hole we recommend that you use a half-inch drill bit.From the moment the system was turned on, the cameras were visible to the system.  The reason this product loses a star is because the cameras are not PTZ.  There is no auto-focus or any focus for that matter.  There is no optical zoom only a digital zoom for zooming in on certain areas while connected to the Stratus DVR.  This makes it rather difficult to discern actual faces and you can forget about license plate numbers.  So far we have not had any connectivity issues via WIFI.  Color saturation is actually nice and in the cool color-tone scheme.  They are supposed to work and turn to black and white color when it is absolutely dark outside.  THIS IS ABSOLUTELY not true! Once evening rolls around (keep in mind this is a summer evening in urban NY)the camera switches to black and white automatically.  This is a big disappointment even if it does render nicely.  The image is clear but is severely lacking any focus.The Lorex Eco Stratus app is easy enough to navigate and operates perfectly on our Android OS phones.  The main issue with the live viewing streaming is the fact that the refresh rate makes it very laggy and jittery.  They claim that it has to do with your internet connection, but we have found that do be a fallacy and an easy excuse thrown out by Lorex.  Our internet connection is strong and viable.  The laggy and jittery issues do not occur when viewing from a dedicated monitor/tv screen.  Even with it's shortcomings it is nice to have access to your camera views online.  We have been able to use the app away from home as long as there was a WIFI or 4G LTE connection.  Another issue with the app is that when accessing the live view at different times you have to connect to the DVR again by pressing the 'save' button in the Device Manager until you see the word CONNECTED.  This is very annoying.  If you are buying this system for the live view from a device then I would suggest that you pass.  It isn't where it should be.  It is a cute little perk that isn't ready for prime time.The loss of one more star is because in the included literature it states that the cameras should be placed in a 'sheltered' location.  It is rather contradictory because they are labeled WEATHERPROOF, yet they want us to shelter them.  Two cameras our currently placed under an open balcony and one is in the open.  I will report back if we have any issues with rain.Recommend if you need an easy to install wireless system with remote viewing access and playback.  The cameras are limited without the focus or zoom functions.  Keep in mind that remote viewing can only be accessed by three devices at one time. After speaking with Lorex customer service (half hour hold time) we were told that these were not PTZ cameras which have the functionality of auto focus and zoom through the Stratus DVR.  Entry level wireless system for home use but not recommended for a business.

Personally it think these are just okay. They sound good enough when you’re sitting still and/or when they are securely sitting in your ear canals, but I immediately took them on a 7-mile run the first day and was not impressed at how they held up. They fell out of my ears often. I did try to switch up the sizes, but no combination of the three sizes kept them securely in my ear canals on long runs.I did like the fact the ear phones themselves sat securely on my ears with the help of the clips, but as they slipped out, the sound got tinnier and tinnier. There was very little bass sustained on my runs, and that makes them better than the average dollar-store ear buds, but not a long-term solution.The iPhone features worked fine, and the microphone worked fine for calls, but they fact they kept slipping out on long runs was just too annoying to make them useful.One of my biggest irritations about the headphones that I received, seems to be an anomaly. The description clearly says “3 pairs of soft ear pads included (S/M/L)” but what I got with mine, right out of the box, was a set of medium plugs, and then one each of a large and a small ear pads. The description makes more sense, but I can’t be sure what ships with other headphones.So I suppose as long as you think of these as a cheap solution, you won’t be disappointed.

I used to make cold brew by brewing the coffee in one container and then filtering it into another. It's definitely the cheaper way to go, but this is SO convenient! The filter really filters out all the little particles of coffee and the concentrate is very tasty. I have even tried some of the recipes that came with the Toddy.I particularly like that this comes with a glass carafe. There's really nothing I would change. It's a simple thing, making cold brew, but the Toddy just makes it easier.

I grew up in an old house with no central heating and we always used electric blankets. I have since moved to a place with no central heating and we only get a little cold in the winter time, but this is so nice and brings back childhood memories. My old electric blankets were not soft; we always had to have a sheet between us and the blanket, but the technology is pretty much the same.This is SO soft and fantastic for lounging on the couch watching TV, or even in bed on a chilly night. It feels like a heating pad for your entire upper body (or you could use it on your legs, but I just curl up in a ball watching TV and wrap it around me. The cord is plenty long enough to plug in and sit on the couch. The only complaint I have is that the controller could be a little closer to the actual wrap because while the cord is long enough, I have to set the control and then put it on the ground because our couch is not that close to the outlet.Overall, I'd buy more of these. They are great for winters!

Overall, this is a very nice setup. The built-in scratching posts have been the most-used part of this whole thing, and the way that the cat is attracted to the posts, I have to wonder if they didn’t dip them in catnip.Aside from the posts, the cat seems indifferent to it in a lot of ways. She’s curious about the hanging bits, but does little more than play with the strings. Our cat is 16 pounds, and clearly too large to comfortably hang out in the little floating loft.All and all – my cat seems to spend more time sitting next to this large thing than sitting on it. It’s also larger than I would have anticipated, which is fine for a much larger room (or in our case, the spare bedroom), but if you’re thinking you can tuck it in the back of the living room, it’s not going to work very well.The set up was a bit interesting. They must have saved a ton on packing, because all the parts came flat in the box (which was nearly 60 pounds). The instructions were lacking, but thanks to another reviewer, I found that building it from the top down was the easiest way to assemble. It took less than 30 minutes total for setup, and my wife and I took our time assembling it.After putting it together, I realize that it can break down pretty easy when we ship it with our household goods. That happens a lot, and this looks like it will break down easily – which is a big plus.So the only cons are that it’s really meant for smaller cats and it’s a bit large. Our cat doesn’t seem to love the four tier concept and still chooses to climb up our entertainment center instead.

I tend to be a bit critical of little docks like this, but this dock pleasantly surprised me.It's constructed well. It feels very heavy duty, and does not tip over when using an iPhone 6 plus, or even, surprisingly, an iPad mini. I also found it surprisingly easy to make speaker calls when using my iPhone 6. The phone still sat comfortably on the base when I was pressing buttons on the phone.The iPad mini was even a bigger surprise because it plugged right into the charger and still had the folding case attached. It charged and synced up no problem.The only down side that I've seen is when using the iPhone 6 plus, for some reason, when I plug it in, the computer chimes twice, as if plugged it in twice. It syncs shortly thereafter and there are no further issues, but that does not happen with an iPhone 5 or the iPad mini.So this has a very sturdy feel, it’s stylish enough to have sitting out on my battle station, and it’s been consistent with charging and syncing. I like it a lot and it's getting a lot of use.

This seems pretty flimsy. I would not believe that it will last long if you are constantly moving it on and off the door jamb. It just doesn’t feel like a long-term solution.However, we use it as a way to separate the dog and cat, and it works fine. The cat hops over it and the dog gets frustrated.. .the perfect solution. The rest of us adults step over it coming and going so we don’t have to take it off. This is great for our set up, but if you have to traverse it regularly, or the large step is a problem, I don’t think this is the ideal solution and you should probably find something a little more heavy-duty.But if you need something simple – It’s fine, but don’t expect a long life span. It just doesn’t feel like it will last.

My wife actually bought this a while ago and used it for various kitchen measurements.At some point in the last 6 months, when I started counting calories, I politely took control of this and started using it many times a day.It’s easy to use – easy to set a tare weight, and gives what I can only assume are correct measurements (they are definitely consistent).  It’s easy to get the measurement for anything from liquids, to meat and anything in between. The size is just about perfect as I can put an entire plate on the surface if I need to.No issues – works great for someone counting every gram of quinoa salad or weight of cooked meat. It’s just easy. I would definitely get it again.

First to address the best part: These speakers sound really good! The sound that comes out is crisp, clear, and it works really well using either Bluetooth or the aux cord, but the aux cord produces more volume. There’s no clipping that I noticed and no distortion running an iPhone to play audio.  The Bluetooth setup was about as smooth as it gets, albeit a tiny bit time consuming.I tried it with different audio sources and had the same results. The spare computer, the laptop and the iPod all sound very good coming out of these speakers. I dragged other people over to listen, and everyone agrees that it’s a full sound, and most were impressed by the bass that comes out of these little speakers. As a simple set of powerful, but compact speakers, this is a great product.Then there were the less-than-ideal parts of this: It’s listed in Amazon as a portable audio product, and the description says that it comes with a portable carrying case; however, I would not describe this as portable. It comes with a very nice case and a TON of plug adapters, so in theory you could definitely take it with you, but then you will still have the power card to the wall, and the interconnecting power cord between the two speakers. So as long as you don’t mind a ton of wires, I guess that’s okay.Side note: Being someone who goes overseas a lot I actually appreciate the included adapters, but I don’t see myself packing up a set of computer speakers, with the necessary cables, to use on short overseas trips – Not when there are one-speaker, battery-powered options available for the same price or less.  The way the wires are connecting the units, this is really better suited for a fixed-solution like in the bedroom or next to a home computer.I do have to admit, when I opened it up I was disappointed at how simple/flimsy they looked. After listening to them, I think that they prove that they are a decent set of little speakers. Not enough to fill a concert hall of course, but I could see using these in a living room or a den to fill the room with sound. Not so much outside because you can’t get a lot of separation between the two speakers, but in a room – these are actually pretty decent.I will admit that the biggest deterrent is the price – They just don’t feel like they should be $145 speakers.

I have a Fitbit Flex (and I've had Fitbits for about 5 years), so I thought it would be good to compare the two.Pros:It's like a Flex - you wear it on your wrist. You can wear it in the shower, but I never do, however it's nice to know that you don't have to worry about small amounts of water (rain, washing dishes).It's cute. I like purple, but it comes in other colors too. It looks like a bracelet, moreso than a Flex.I really like the option of the inactivity alarm. It vibrates and I hop up and walk around for about 5 minutes when it reminds me.Easy to set up.Long battery life.Doesn't seem to not count steps if you are not moving your arms. The Flex sometimes doesn't count activity if I'm on an elliptical trainer because my arms aren't moving too.Cons:The step count difference between my Flex and the Jawbone UP2 is about 2,500 for a 10,000 step day. I routinely walk 10,000+ steps with my Flex, but I have a hard time reaching 10,000 with the UP2. I don't know which one is more accurate but the UP2 didn't give me the option of setting up my step length, which the Fitbit does.The silent alarm, while it worked really well, woke me up nearly an hour before my normal alarm. Then the app would tell me that my sleep was inconsistent. Well, stop waking me up nearly an hour before I asked you to! I turned the silent alarm off after 2 days of it waking me at around 5am (and yes, I did check to make sure that all time settings were correct and that I hadn't made a mistake).It fell off one day while I was crossing the street. Luckily it shot across to the other side of the street and I was able to retrieve it, but if it had just fallen off in the middle of the street, it may have been lost forever. I never had the problem before or since, so it may not have been latched properly.I don't really like that you can't change the band. I haven't had it long enough but my band on my Flex eventually broke, so I was able to replace the band. If the UP2 breaks, you have to replace the whole device. I also like the option of alternate colors or styles as purple doesn't always go with everything.Overall, I like the product. I wouldn't switch from Flex now because it has 5 years of history, but I can see myself wearing both and challenging myself to hit 10,000 steps with both devices.

I waited for the price to drop on this for a while before upgrading from a 2TB to this one.In that amount of time, there are new products on the market that might have been better, but I’m overall quite satisfied with this one. I’ve got to believe the specs and reviews that say this is one of the better ones to go with for sensitive data; however, of course I also have secondary and tertiary backups.I was not blown away by the speed. Looking at the specs, I was under the distinct impression that I was going to see an improvement in the accessing of files, both on the local computer, and across the network. I may have seen some improvement, but nothing spectacular.But this is exactly what I expected. It works, it works well, and has been very consistent.

Overall this watch is fine. I saw many complaints of it losing time, but I think that I need more than a couple of weeks to see that effect, because initially I’ve had no problems with keeping the time that I set.It’s also very well publicized that the 12 and the 4 are not the correct Roman Numerals. Personally, I’ve used this as a conversation starter a couple of times. Really it just highlights that this is a nice enough watch, but this isn’t a Rolex. It’s a decent-looking watch where some corners were cut.I don’t appreciate the band though. I have lost a bit of weight recently, and I guess my wrists are kind of thin now, so I have to make it smaller, but my hands area apparently freakishly large, so slipping my hand through the loop is a bit more difficult than it should be.The watch face was larger than I anticipated, but it’s not unwieldy. I can’t wear it with several of my dress shirts because it is pretty large. I like the novelty of being able to look though from the front to the back so that’s a bit of a plus.So if it does start to lose time, I will probably knock down my review, but I gave it three stars because I think it’s okay. It feels fine on my wrist, and so far it hasn’t shown any signs of irritation.

We got this for a small office (20 people) with a caffeine addiction.This is actually an impressive machine. Ours came slightly damaged in shipping, but nothing a hammer couldn’t straighten back out. The setup is pretty darn simple because there’s not a million pieces and knobs. You fill the tank with another pitcher of water when you want more coffee. For some people in my office – that took a little getting used to as more than one office member has made a HUGE mess pouring water into the tank without having a pitcher in the bottom part.The operation really couldn’t be more simple though. Turn on the warmers if you want, or don’t, but making a pot of coffee is as easy as putting coffee in the filter, and running a pot of coffee through.We live in a high-altitude environment, and had to figure out how to adjust the thermostat so that the water gets the right temperature, which was easy except that it would have been very nice to have a little gauge to make sure we got it to the right temperature. We did a lot of trial and error trying to find the right temperature, but once we got there – it was easy.Everyone is satisfied with the coffee and this thing is being used a lot now. So overall, we think it’s a great workhorse. If I had a comment I would say it’s almost too simple. But if you’re just looking for a traditional coffee maker for a bunch of people – this is just fine.
I have literally seen my cat reach up and scratch the tape that we put on the couches.I gave it three stars because I can only hope that it's doing something.

Overall they are fine. I love Boston baked beans and have to order the small packs so I don't eat an entire box/bag in one setting.These were just a tiny bit stale for my taste. Not horribly so, but just a little bit. There is no expiration date, just a code on the boxes, so I can't tell when the best buy date should have been.It's not enough to make me not want to buy them again, but they were just a tiny bit off.

This printer was very appealing to me because of the Airprint compatibility. I had been using the Epson Expression Home XP-320 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner & Copier, which is also a budget-minded wireless printer, but started showing problems right away. This Canon printer actually seems like a much more solid and easy-to-use product. It's a little larger footprint, compared to other desktop printers, but it has enough positive notes to make it a very decent value.The setup was not difficult. Connecting it to the Windows 10 computer was extremely simple, with the minor annoyance of having to download the driver from the Windows Store. For the purposes of this review I went through the setup process, step by step from both of the getting started guides (there are two). Surprisingly, the step I got completely frustrated on was loading the paper. I had inadvertently failed to push the tray back in after loading the paper, and while in hindsight I can easily see my failure, at the time there were a few annoying minutes attempting to figure out why the paper tray was not being recognized.So putting the printer together was quite simple, and loading the cartridges went very smooth. I really like the fact that the ink cartridges light up when they are securely sitting in the slots (although I am sure that adds cost to the new cartridges).As far as regular operation goes - Using the printer with the home computer is flawless. No issues what-so-ever. Printing is efficient and the quality is every bit of what you would expect out of an $80 printer. I am not one to use proprietary software, but when I used the windows-based scanning applications to scan in some magazine photos, I was satisfied with the result. I scanned some photos at 600 dpi resolution and there were absolutely no issues with recognizing the scanner. Using Adobe Acrobat DC to import both pictures and text was flawless without installing any of the additional software that came with the printer. And I really appreciate not having to install a CD worth of software to use the scanner.Then I moved onto the part I was most excited about - printing from my iPhone. Set up for that was actually easier than the desktop. All I had to do was scan the QR code from the instructions, download the app - then print a photo from my camera roll. The quality of the photo was average, but it wasn't the perfect result. The scanned photo I attached, shows that for some reason there was a line that printed down the side of the photo.  There's also no way to adjust the size or the placement of the photo (that I saw) but if you just want to print something off in a hurry - it's great. If you want a photo suitable for framing, I imagine you'll be printing from your computer instead.The next part was better. I had just been working on an Excel Spreadsheet that I had saved to my MS OneDrive. I wasn't optimistic when I went to "print documents" and saw only Mobile and iCloud as options, but one more click to get to "Other Documents" and it gave me the option of Dropbox, Google Drive or OneDrive. That was all I could have expected - but then it got better. I pulled up the email and just started printing. It was effortless to print an email from my iPhone - and I can see a BIG use for that. The only problem with that was it seemed to take a while, and I could only print the entire email (not just page one) but the double sided printing helped to minimize the waste.That’s the majority of my experience. There were of course features that I didn’t/haven’t gotten around to using yet, but so far I like this a LOT better than other low-cost wireless printer options. But my biggest complaint will be the cost of the ink cartridges. A rough search shows that an entire new set of ink cartridges is over $90 on Amazon… that’s steep. This thing better take a long time to go through ink.Other thoughts:- The eco setting that allows you to use two-sided printing was a surprisingly refreshing addition to a desktop printer. I liked that aspect of the printer a lot.- I am not a fan of having the five different ink cartridges, although I am sure that in the long run it may, possibly, be better than the all-in-one ink cartridges.-The double sided printing takes a while. As long as you have time to spare, it's fine.-When I max this out on 600 dpi scan from the Windows scanning app, it’s slow. The two pics attached are direct scans, the scone is a magazine cover. It’s not horrible, but I’m not overly impressed with the scanning quality.-I never did successfully scan from the printer to the computer, but I assume that’s because I refused to install from the CD. That really wasn’t a show-stopper.-The printer I got said black on the order slip, but I was delivered a white one. I don’t particularly like the white since it looks like it’s going to get dirty easily and discolor quickly. I assume the people ordering the white envision it fitting right in with the Apple eco system, and I’m sure it will, but black is slimming – the white makes it look like something from the 90’s.

Full disclosure: I really got Furbacca for me, the 41-year-old Dad, more than I did for my 9-year-old son. Our house has definitely housed Furbies in the past, and I distinctly remember the Furby-rush of 1999.When it arrived, I only played with Furbacca one night before relinquishing it to the 9-year-old boy. It does look like he likes to play with it more than me, but I’d also say that he might be on the higher end of the age-demographic for this toy, because my 11-year-old, who normally is all over small cuddly animals, really didn’t give it a second glance after I showed it to him. The 9-year-old though, bought right in.The app is a fairly large-sized one on iOS (won’t download over a cellular connection and my son ran out of room on his iPad) but it didn’t take too long to download and it worked fine on his first gen iPad Mini. I personally think the game is not the most exciting part of the deal, but it kept him entertained for a little while. In fact, my 9-year-old says that the app is the best part because of the interactive games and the ability to change the colors of the light-saber-shower, etc… He was simply amused by the app and found it interesting.Personally, I prefer to set Furbacca on the floor and let it mess with the animals in the house. The cat doesn’t go anywhere near him, and the dog seemed genuinely distressed when Furbacca was “talking” to her.As far as normal operation goes – The eyes and the mannerisms of the Furby are just as cute as they were with the first generation. There's a lot of movement going on with the rocking back and forth and movement of facial features, but I think the LED eyes aren't a very big battery draw.But back to my original thoughts – I think this was meant for Dad and Mom and not the kids. It retails for $30 more than normal Furbies, and there’s not that much of a difference except the Star Wars licensing and the cute bandolier. And the app of course, with the ability to collect the virtual Star Wars Furby Furblings; the first in the game being Han Solo. I liked the nostalgia and I am pleased that my son likes it too.And one last afterthought - Furbacca will interact with other Furbies - and it's pretty darn funny actually. They sit there and talk to each other. It's pretty cute.

I took my favorite Bluetooth speaker to the office and no longer had one in my kitchen, so I was so happy when this one came along. It's surprisingly good for a $15 speaker (but again, it IS a $15 speaker, so it's not the greatest quality ever). It's sufficient for the kids and me to listen to the news and some fun podcasts in the morning while making breakfasts and lunch.I would say the worst thing about it is that you have to hang it somewhere, but I found a cabinet handle that is rarely used and hung it there. It says it's water resistant, but I would be reluctant to use it in the shower as it has to be hung somewhere (I currently have a Bluetooth speaker in the shower that suctions to the wall, which is much better for a shower speaker).I'd buy another one if I needed another small speaker in another part of the house. It's good quality for the price.

I picked these up for mostly home use, but they are actually quite convenient to have around the house as well. Handling discarded food is a great example (like after a party) and where we live, we need to sort food from the regular trash, so these are actually nice when we have to clean up after some forgetful kids.The came in a small, but they fit equally well over my wife’s tiny hands and my average-sized man-hands. My only ding came when using them to open mail (Where I work we have to screen the mail) and the picture I attached showed how fast they ripped after opening 5 boxes. That did not impress me. I don’t think they snagged on the box, I think they just tore from pressure.They are latex free (important for me) and do not leave a powdery residue which is excellent. They feel heavy duty when I’m wearing them and that’s a plus. They come off easily and go right in the trash.Overall they were fine. I’m not sure about the way the first one ripped the minute I used it – but for my purposes, that’s usually not a show-stopper (although I can see in some uses where it would be).

It takes a little time to adjust to. It's difficult to balance on at first. I use it on my office chair and I have armrests on that chair, but if I didn't, I could see feeling like I was going to lose my balance.I like that it makes me sit up straight. If I start to slouch, my back starts to hurt, so I sit properly. I am up and down all the time during my work day, so I haven't had any numb butt issues, but the one day that I didn't have to stand up as often I did start to see what others reviewers were talking about. I look at it as a reminder to get up more often.All in all, I think it's a good concept. It came inflated and with a needle, but no pump. I have ball pumps because we have kids, but if you don't have one, you should get one. I've had it for about a week and haven't had any deflation.

We've had a Withings WS-50 Smart Body Analyzer, Black scale for over a year and a half, and while it's been great overall, I felt like some of the readings were inconsistent (mostly a person's body fat percentage) and so I looked forward to finding something new and comparing it.First of all - the setup was pretty easy over all. The most confusing part seemed to be which app to download, because there are a couple options in the (Apple) app store. I downloaded the wrong one at first, but the app quickly pointed that out. So that wasn't terribly painful. The hardest thing about the setup was getting the app to sync (didn't happen the first time) but once the phone found the scale - it's remained perfectly synced ever since.The scale itself is very pleasant to look at - so if aesthetics is important to you - then this should be a very nice addition to your bathroom.This scale replaced a simple, digital scale in the bathroom where it ended up, and the difference is amazing. This scale is much more consistent with other scales, like the scale at the gym and the other Withings scale in the house. So from what my family has seen, this is far more accurate than other, cheaper scales that had been using in this specific location. Which makes sense because the retail price is a lot higher than the cheap scale it replaced.A big plus the primary user likes is the temperature and humidity levels of the room it's located in. I will add that's hard to gauge how accurate it is, but it seems like a nice feature.The integration with the App is essential, and to me, this is where this scale pulls ahead of the Withings scale. It was easier to sync overall (although not by a whole lot) but after having used the Withings App for a year and a half, I really appreciate the different measurements that this scale and app has to offer. Specifically, I like that this app has body water, muscle mass and bone mass measurements (although I am extremely suspicious of the bone mass measurements) in addition to Weight, BMI and body fat percentage.Initially when using the app, it seemed reluctant to bring up any measurement other than weight, and it took me a while to figure out what I was doing wrong. Admittedly that wasn't my favorite part. Overall I feel the app could definitely be more intuitive. The other downside to the app is that it, of course, is trying to sell you on the entire ecosystem of the manufacturer’s products. It will only give you complete readings if you buy the blood pressure device, and activity and sleep monitor, pulse oximeter, etc... The activity and sleep function can collect data from the iPhone, but for the most part, I felt like the app is really trying to get me to buy into all the products they sell, instead of concentrating on making this app the best it can be.That all said, even with the app's disappointment, I gave it five stars because the scale works great. It gets the data to my iPhone and I can see everything that I'm looking for. I like the expanded options that my Withings does not have, and appreciate that from here on out, I can monitor some functions on a daily basis.In the end – this ended up being the primary scale for our college-age daughter. She is thrilled with it and uses it often. She says that it’s quite motivating to see progress, even if it’s slight. She had no problems setting it up, and appreciates that it’s more accurate than what she was using before. The rest of us kind of like it too –and I like comparing the two scales.TL;DR: It’s been a great scale for setup, use and data tracking. We’re very pleased.

This is the staple of the brother printer. Black letters on white background. Normally this doesn't come off unless you're purposely trying to remove it - and then there's no residue.No issues at all. Very satisfied overall.

For a made--in-China product, this was surprisingly well put together scratching post. It's fairly tall compared to others that we looked at, and the base is designed that this relatively heavy post won't topple over at any point. Our cat has only used it a few times so far, but it's large enough that our (relatively) large cat can fully stretch out and run her claws over it.I was pleasantly surprised that it's nicer in person than the pictures led me to believe.

We bought this to mark off two-mile stretches of running lanes in an urban area. This works fine, it's simple, and shows us ecatly what we need to know. It' not unwieldy, and it's simple to use. That meets out needs.

I personally was not impressed. I am quite sure that it provides all the nutrition that you need for a quick burst, but the taste was chalky and very much tasting of artificial sweetener. they also felt heavy (if that's a good description) when chewing them, and not something that I would really want to snack on during a half-marathon without water close to wash it down.They are certainly worth trying, but I personally was not impressed. Don't let the jelly Belly label lead you to believe these are going to be sweet and succulent.

Bought this because it was on sale, and have no regrets. Its' heavy duty enough for anything that we need, and I don't have any issues with leaving it outside, exposed to the elements.Picking it up under $10 is a good deal. better than i can get at the local hardware shop.

This is not the same bicycle pump that I used when I was a kid. It's super-fancy and probably overkill for the three kid's bikes that we have in the garage.We bought it because it was on sale for a modest price, and it has done everything we wanted and more. No issues - it's just not very portable.

Went on vacation for 5 weeks away from home and forgot the fitbit charger.Luckily this was cheap - it was delivered pretty quickly and it served as a much more economical solution than the local store.So it's 5/5 from us because it made life just a little bit easier.
Got this primarily for the nine and ten year old kids to use.We were just using this as a solution for them to use soap and shampoo. This works. that's all we can ask for.

We went about 6 years between cats, and when we got a new one - we went right back to the same litter that we used before.I like buying Tidy Cat in the big tubs, and our new cat has no problem using this regularly. It clumps easily, and makes clean-up easy for the ten-year-old whose job it is to clean out the box.Nice and easy - not stinky. Works for us.

I bought this because I had a specific need for a cheap black belt, and I am skeptical about spending $30-$50 on decent belts.This has not disappointed so far. I had read other reviews about premature wear, and I've had lots of experience with that with other belts, so I was a bit reluctant at first, but the price point was just right so I took a chance.it's been a couple of months and it gets used at least once a week, and I have not had a problem with wear on the belt itself. the buckle is fine and the paint if not wearing off yet (also a problem for cheaper belts). Overall satisfied, and while it's not the nicest belt ever, I gave the 5 stars based on price point and corresponding quality.

Installation went well. Adobe automatically uninstalled previous versions of Adobe Acrobat which is pretty expected at this point. I was prompted for a serial number which I find annoying, but still necessary I suppose. I will admit that this is the first time that I have installed a program from a CD ROM in over a year. It felt very nostalgic.I will also add that the oversized package had no documentation at all – just a list of features on the cover and inside box flap, and a CD ROM. I expected the program to be largely intuitive with no documentation.After the setup was finished (about 8 minutes from the CD) and did require a restart from my 64 bit version of Windows 7. After the restart, I had to log in with my Adobe Live Account. Not thrilled about that part of the process as it seemed very unnecessary for my home use of this product.  Finally – about 15 minutes later – I am able to start working.The very first form I open and try to edit, I get this error message: “This form cannot be edited in Adobe Acrobat DC. Please use Adobe LiveCycle Designer to edit this form”.Let me reiterate – I am a home user. This was trying to edit a form widely available from the internet. That’s the only explanation given. So I have no idea why.Next I tried to edit a file that I scanned into Adobe using Acrobat X, and editing text there. I got a series of error messages.  At this point I had used the product less than 30 minutes total and was already finding it less functional than Adobe Professional X.And that ended up being me experience. My previous version of Adobe Acrobat did all the same things, but with less error message. I was already able to export PDFs, scan searchable text, use eSignatures, combine files, and all the other big features that were advertised on the box. Only easier.So if this is the evolution of Adobe Acrobat - it’s not user-friendly. I will most likely uninstall this and reinstall an earlier version of Acrobat Professional. This just wasn’t a positive evolution. I was not impressed and will most likely consider carefully the future versions of Adobe that I get.

Overall these headphones are fine for use when not moving around a lot. I didn't fall in love with them and I just don't see me using them on a regular basis because of the shortcomings.To start off with, I'm not sure what the industry standard is for being able to claim "Noise Canceling" but I am confident these headphones meet the minimum standards and do not exceed that. Perhaps my ears are larger than the average user, but these don't seem to completely cover my earlobes, and so I have a feeling that ambient sounds are coming through that way.Overall, using these both at home and on 2 long flights from Mexico to Boston and back – I don't see them being that special. I much prefer the Bose style that covers the entire ear. The company says that the noise cancelling feature allows you to have the volume set lower and still drown out other sounds, but I have found this to be a very subjective claim.The biggest problem I had with this set of headphones is the length of the cord and the size of the controller. All told – the length of the cable from the input plug to the headphones is little bit over 5 feet long. That coupled with the rather large sized inline controller, and the cord is actually quite unwieldy.  It’s not comfortable walking around at all, and is only tolerable when sitting for long periods. That makes it okay for the airplane (assuming you don’t need to stand up often) but for use around the house with three young boys making noise in the background – this whole set is not very practical.I will say that I appreciate that they added a belt clip to the controller (knowing that it’s going to have to be secured when walking) but that’s one more thing to clip to my belt.  Even as I sit here typing this review, the relatively heavy controller piece keeps slipping off my lap and yanking on the headset. These headphones have shown me that I STRONGLY prefer noise cancelling headphones with the battery in the ear pieces.The monitor function seems unique, and while I can appreciate it being there for the Captain’s announcements on the airplane, I found myself just using the pause button on my iPhone instead.And lastly on the complaint list – I’m going to forget to turn it off. An auto off feature seems like a must for this type of device.

It's a case. Not very protective and it's kind of expensive for that. I prefer Otterbox or the like as I really like my phone to be well protected. It didn't come with a screen protector and I'm not a huge fan of this particular design. There are some really cute designs in this line though. Still, $25 seems like a lot when you can spend an extra $10 and get a protective case. And some of the protective cases come in cute colors too.On the positive side though, it fits easily in the pocket of my jeans. The slightly bulkier Otterbox fits, but the outline is incredibly visible.

Wow – I am blown away by the Schleich line of prehistoric animals. This one was so impressive I wanted to go back and give other brands (like lower reviews because I have not seen anything like the quality of this guy.  Moreover, this particular line of dinosaurs is way better than Schleich’s lower-priced toys – The sub-ten dollar range.My ten-year-old, who LOVES dinosaur action features, loved this one. He really likes the coloring (although I am skeptical of the authenticity) and the little touch like the moveable jaw was entertaining.I was impressed with the balance of the animal. This guy feels heavy-duty. The balance is perfect, and frankly, I considered leaving it on my office desk because it’s actually darn near a work of art. It really is that beautiful.The warning says this is not for kids under three-years-old because it’s a choking hazard, but I don’t see that jaw ripping off easily. I do think it’s more likely that a three year old will drop it on his/her toe and I can see where that would hurt like crazy… so That’s probably a good age limit.

I admit I was a bit skeptical when I ordered this.My first concern was the range of the Bluetooth capability, but when I press the button my keys will ring across the house - far better than my Wi-Fi Signal. So far I'm actually impressed.The app is pretty simple, but of course requires access to your location at all times. No real surprise there I guess.I also tried the feature where you can use your smartphone as a token, to locate the phone, but I don't find that any different than find my iPhone, so I guess I missed the point.For grins, I attached it to the dog (who tends to run away) but since the max range is about 150 feet, I had to pretty much be in sight of the moving animal. Not optimal for that.But it did work well enough that I find that I probably need to get some more tokens. I would prefer the ability to replace the battery when necessary and not just replace the token after a year, but I suppose that's not a huge price to pay (You get a discount if you buy in bulk).All told I like it. I don't have a wide range of reference because I haven't used one of these lost and found items before, but this worked flawlessly the first time. It seems to stay connected when I go in and out of range, and it's not terribly intrusive.Other observations:-The tone from the token is quite loud for me. I think you could hear it well if you had it attached to your keys, in your pants pocket in the bottom of the laundry basket.- The token is not exactly small, but it's not ridiculous. It does make my key chain a bit bigger.- It's fine for keys or the dog's collar, but if I want to put it on something else, I need to pull out the double stick tape or Velcro.
The only issue I had, if I remember correctly, is that this particular color combination is harder to get in the same size as the rest.But it's exactly what we needed - works perfectly.
This works fine. The fonts come out perfectly and it's easy to read with black on a yellow background.Fits the bill perfectly.

Well first of all - this is a very slick looking case. I think it's a bit bigger than I would like, but my computer components pretty much dictated I go with one of these larger models. But it does not disappoint in outward appearance. The polished black look could be confused for a nice stereo and the minimalist front design (2 switches, 4 inputs, a light and the CD portion) is very smooth. Appearance-wise. This is a great case.I did notice that when I screwed in, and then unscrewed the power supply. The black paint had already chipped away. That makes me wonder how this will hold up to scratching and general wear and tear and if it will still look so pretty in the next few months, but for now it's slick.I really appreciate how much work went into making sure that this box will hold as many components as possible while still keeping the functionality of a nice computer case. The three fans is a very nice touch, and thankfully they do include an adapter because I can't find a month board that has that many unused fan power supplies on the MB.The case is only as big as it needs to be. It's barely wide enough for a Micro ATX board, but it fits. My only complaint is that with most new motherboards, the eSata cables are all sticking off to the side (and not straight up) and as a result, most are RIGHT next to the front of this case. I think they kept that in mind because there is just enough room that you can play with the eSata cables. It's not perfect, but I think they did the best they could with that the motherboard industry is producing now.While it's a bit crowded, I think the manufacturer did a great job of using all available space. The mounts for a SSD and a larger 3.5" hard drive is nearly genius. I loved the concept, but unfortunately I ended up taking it apart and putting it back together a lot because of a motherboard failure. But the third time building and rebuilding the system, I got the hang of it.I thought the price of the case was a bit much. I think the price point should be under $100 based on other cases, but I also really liked this one and thought that overall it's a very well thought out case. I did have my suspicions about how long it will stay pretty (because of the way the paint easily chips off at the screw points) but for now - I just can't give it anything less than 5 stars because I am so impressed at how they managed to make everything fit well. I would caution that if you're buying a power supply for this case - get a modular one so you can minimize the number of cables. It will be to your benefit because over near the power supply those cables start stacking up quick and it's not super-easy to tie them down because if you ever have to replace something - you'll have to cut all the ties and start over.

Bought this for my nine-year-old's birthday - and he absolutely loved it. He adored the illustrations and has gone through all the books twice now.He also helped his older brothers, 10 and 12, to discover these  timeless classics.If there was a downside, it's that the fancy books don't hold up well when dragged all round the city, on family vacations, etc... The books get dirty quickly and are already showing significant wear. Which is not great for an expensive set of comics.  But I didn't count that against the rating because books are meant to be loved, and seeing these on the shelves (when they make it back to the shelves) in my house - you know these books are loved.

For some reason I tend to get more sinus infections/irritations than anyone else in my family - by a mile.Sudafed is an easy fix - pop a couple int eh morning and a couple more during the day, and I feel like I can function better.Glad you can still get them online - although I imagine big brother is monitoring how many you have shipped to your house~~

I'll start with the only con I could see: the smell. It smells like burning plastic when it's laminating. But this is the first hot laminator I have ever owned (I owned cold ones in the past that rolled the item through two plastic sheets), and it's perfect for my needs.I like that it's small. It takes up very little space. So when you are not using it, it fits perfectly in a drawer out of sight.It heats up fast. It was less than 5 minutes from when I turned it on. The "ready" light turned from white to green when it was ready.I laminated a few small items in the sheets, because I hate wasting, and I was able to cut around them and not have them come apart. One of the things was even slightly thicker (needed the 5 mil setting) and it came out really good.Overall, happy with this item.

It's super soft and our kids think it's cute. I personally think it's kind of gaudy looking, but it's a neutral enough color scheme that it goes nicely with our beige living room furniture.The one big downside is that it sheds like crazy! It could be a real animal for how much it sheds. Maybe that will stop once it's washed the first time, but for now there's faux fur all over everything. Don't wear black when using it until you wash it.

I researched microcurrent technology and I found no journal articles stating that microcurrent works for either wrinkles or scars. There's been no conclusive evidence so far.That said, I tested this for 2.5 weeks when I was alone without my family. This was perfect because then I could see what they thought when I returned.
