These include the camera image "flashing" in total darkness, needing to remove the monitor's battery to download the videos to your computer, and the camera jumping to night mode too quickly in areas with shadows.Finally, the fact that this system DOES NOT have a lot of options is worth mentioning. For instance, with the provided materials, you can not link this system up to your WiFi network, computer, or smartphone (you can with many other security systems); this package is expandable only in the sense that you can buy more cameras for it. Also, there is no motion alarm mode or other security function for the device (it can turn on if it detects noise, however - just not sound an alarm). If features like this interest you, then you should look elsewhere for your monitoring needs.Rating: 2 Out of 5 Stars. The Defender 22502 is little more than a glorified baby monitor. If that's all you want it for, it will serve you well; if you're looking for an actual security device, though, you should probably look elsewhere.

The TP-LINK TL-WN823N 300Mbps Mini Wireless N USB Adapter is VERY impressive. I've been using similar devices for years to connect my computers wirelessly to the internet, and this one has impressed me the most. Its extremely small size when plugged in is a definite plus (much shallower profile than the hard edge of my power cable), and it picks up signals just as well if not better than my previous adapters that were three times the size. It functions extremely well on my Windows 7 system, and I have no complaints about the adapter itself.What dropped my rating from 5 to 4 stars for this product is the included TP-Link Wireless Configuration Utility. The software could not seem to figure out how to connect to my wireless home router with one-touch setup. I fixed this by using Windows 7's built-in network connection software, and everything worked perfectly. So, you may think about just installing the drivers from the included CD-ROM and not the configuration utility.Rating: 4 out of 5 stars. I can highly recommend the adapter itself, but suggest skipping installation of the unnecessary utility program.

I really wanted to like the Genius Cam Mouse. I do freelance work that involves QR codes, so having a code scanner on my computer is something I could really use - and the Genius Cam Mouse promised to do that and more. The problem is, the only thing this mouse does well is move the pointer on the screen, and that's something a much cheaper mouse could also accomplish.There are so many things wrong with this product that it would be difficult to properly list them all in the space allotted for this review. I'll hit the biggest ones in the order I discovered them: the 25+ page manual only has three pages of actual instructions in English, and those aren't enough to properly explain how to get features like the QR code scanner to work (doesn't seem to work with most programs, either); installing the provided drivers actually slowed down the booting of my computer slightly but noticeably; the 2.0 megapixel camera shoots grainy photos, and is not as advanced as the ones on most modern smartphones; the video recordings are choppy and grainy; the various camera features DO NOT WORK WELL with programs other than the provided Genius/Arcsoft photo and video software; it is difficult to properly aim the camera (no sight other than lagged video image on screen); getting the mouse to actually scan QR codes is a difficult process that only seems to be possible within the provided software; the provided software does not work completely with touchscreens; etc, etc, etc...I have now unplugged the mouse from my computer and uninstalled all of the software. It will sit on my desk as a paperweight for the next few days until I can give it away to charity or otherwise dispose of it in a way that might actually benefit society (the two dollars the secondhand store will get for it will do something for someone, after all).Rating: 1 Star (wish I could give it 0). There isn't an easier way to say it: this cam-mouse is a waste of money.

This review is for the AmazonBasics DSLR and Laptop Backpack with Orange Interior. A black backpack with three primary sections and multiple pockets/straps, the name of this product is a bit misleading - you can hold all different kinds of stuff in it, not just a DSLR camera or a laptop. I use mine to hold my camera, camcorder, various battery packs, chargers, USB mouse, laptop accessories, and (yes) even my laptop on some occasions. The primary feature of the pack is the central compartment, which contains Velcro-edged interior pads that can be easily positioned to make 9 different compartments; they can also be removed completely to create larger (but fewer) spaces or one large opening (like a normal backpack). The other two primary sections include a completely open section for a laptop, and another section with a pouch and straps for smaller items (keys, pens, whatever).My experience with the backpack has been pretty positive. The orange interior does help to differentiate smaller pieces in lower-light settings (to an extent), and it does have a lot of storage room. I have positioned the main section's compartments to hold exactly what I need, so it is certainly doing its job. And the exterior pockets and straps are a nice touch, though I have not yet trusted my tripod to be attached to it yet (mine is probably a little too large for it - a monopod or lightweight tripod would probably work, however).There are two areas I'm not 100% happy with, however. The first is that small items can slip from the positionable compartments and end up further down into the bag. Design-wise, this could have been fixed by having Velcro on three sides of the interior pads that form the wall of the compartment, as well as having some sort of webbing over the opposite side. That, however, probably would have raised the price significantly, so the cheaper fix is to store those pieces in smallTupperware containers or other storage boxes at least a couple inches long on each side so they don't slip out. My other area of concern is the felt-like material the interior is made of (and that the Velcro sticks to) - it just doesn't feel particularly sturdy. Every time I move one of the Velcro compartment walls, it seems like the interior is going to rip. There are already a few threads hanging, so I don't reposition those compartments often (you really shouldn't have to). Again, for the price and what I am using it for(transporting my camcorder and camera to different events around town), I'm okay with that drawback.Rating: 4 out of 5 stars. Great backpack for general use, but buy something more durable (and expensive) if you're going to use this in adverse conditions such as long hikes, bad weather, or anything beyond general storage and transport across town.

Raise the Bar is an incredible book that explains the business philosophy of famous bar owner and TV personality Jon Taffer. The entire book can be summarized in one sentence: to Taffer, everything is about reactions. Evidence of this includes the title of chapter one ("You Sell One Thing: Reactions"), the title of chapter three ("Money is in Reactions, Not Transactions"), and the majority of the non-background content from the front cover to the back. This "reaction management" philosophy sounds easy, but - for the majority of readers - it is a mind-blowing and out-of-the-box concept they may have thought of in the past but have almost certainly not given enough consideration to.So, now that I've told you the secret of the book, do you still need to buy it? Probably. The strength of the writing is in both convincing the reader how important the reaction philosophy is AND in how to properly execute it in the real world. Though _Raise the Bar_ is certainly not a college textbook, Taffer does directly lay out a number of methods point by point to achieve this goal. This includes how to hire the correct people, the four rules of Taffer's overarching business philosophy, his five customer service standards, an explanation of four-walls marketing, and much more. There's even an appendix called "Creating the Perfect Menu" that some may find useful.Is everything in this book perfect? No. The writing style may be a little bit too informal for some, and I also don't think Taffer focuses enough on marketing strategies (his excitement and pride over "the big fat claim" in chapter 5 seemed a bit odd to me - people have been using freebie and chained coupons for a long time). But there are other books out there that can fill in the few weak spots, so to speak.Rating: 5 out of 5 stars. If you're interested in business (even non-bar business), you'll probably find something of use in these pages.

The Tomcat Live Catch Mouse Trap is a device I've successfully used to catch five critters living it up in my unused extra bedroom. Thanks to this trap, all five were caught and released alive in the woods down the road, there to take their place in the "circle of life" rather than ending up as so much rotting landfill in the local dump. Either peanut butter or Nutella was used to bait the trap in each case, and the device itself came out undamaged every time.So, what is this item? It is a fulcrum (think see-saw or teeter-totter) with a hinged lid at one end. The mouse goes in the open hinged-lid end, travels down the tube to the bait, and its weight causes the trap to tip slightly. The tipping trap raises the hinged lid, which then closes. When the mouse tries to scoot out the way it came, the lid is pressed closed even tighter, and the critter is trapped!If you are looking for a low cost, extremely effective mouse trap that is no-kill / humane, then this might be the trap for you. I say might because, quite honestly, there are some people that should not use this trap. For instance, if you can't check the trap at least twice a day (preferably three or more times), you shouldn't use it - anything caught in it for longer would probably die. Why? Because this isn't the mouse version of the Barbie Dream House (there actually is one of those, and it costs twice as much and isn't quite as reusable) - this is a small tube that will catch mice alive in a relatively cramped area. Also, if you have very large mice or rats, the tube may not be big enough to capture them (they will tend to knock the trap over on their way in, which allows the bait to be eaten but keeps the door from closing. This has happened to me twice). There are some larger traps (including the previously mentioned "smart" mouse trap and the Havahart traps) that might work better, but keep in mind that they have their drawbacks, too.The biggest negative I have about this item isn't the trap itself, but is the lack of decent directions that come with it. The device is packaged with a single sheet of instructions, but they are painfully lacking in useful details. For instance, a lot of the complaints I've seen about the trap not being sensitive enough to catch lighter mice could have been avoided if the directions stated that using more bait (thus increasing the weight on one end of the fulcrum) would be necessary to catch lighter mice (the trap will also not stay open if too much peanut butter is used - gotta find the right balance). Additional tips include: place trap on a hard surface such as a box top or multiple CD cases when using in a carpeted area; transfer mice into a larger enclosure if transporting long distances (taking the mouse for a three hour drive to the country in that tube = dead mouse); place in corner to help prevent large mice from knocking it over when entering trap; placing a tiny bit of peanut butter covered cracker in front of the trap's opening draws them to it more quickly.Rating: 4 out of 5 stars. Excellent trap that works, but needs better directions.

Charlotte Mackintosh lives alone on an island in Washington state.  Content to be alone  she writes sexy romances under a pseudonym and makes a good living.  Unfortunately the last owner of her  family cottage in Scotland has moved.  Charlotte flies off to only to find the house ofher childhood in absolute rubbles.  Luckily, Toran Ramsay is there to aid her with the multitude of problems,  He was once her high school sweetheart and sparks are flying upon the second meeting.I have read all of Cathy's books and find that I love them all.  She has such a rich storyteller style the draws one in and never lets you stop till the end. Even then you are wishing for more.  Her characters are always beautifully  described and  believable.  The dialogue perfect.  Wonderful synonyms paint the story into it's atmosphere.Great, great books, Cathy, and I wish you so many more.  You deserve wide exposure and all the blessings that could bring.

We have a dog and keep three bowls of cold water out in three different areas for her.  I like this one the best now as it absorbs water spillage and doesn't smell.  I think this would be a lovely gift to give a person with a new puppy gift to welcome him/her into their lives.
I like this product on my lips as they are consistently chapped all year round.  This tube of Bee Kissable Cheeks was great on my mouth so if you hesitating think of it for that reason.

Emmalyn Ross husband is in prison for one more year(though she hasn't kept contact in 3 of his 5 year sentence)  She is getting broke and must sell her home and moves to "Madeline Island" off the coast of Superior Lake.  Her hope is to survive in an old hunting cabin she and hubby still own.  Her trip to the Island, the challenges of her stay there, the quirky characters of all small towns ignites this lovely story.  Truthful, spiritual, and touching, the story flowed like the waves lapping the shore.The characters were well described and so interesting, the setting so beautifully described I would love to visit there, and the plot one most of us all have to work toward.....recovery from disappointment and hurt while seeking for solace and comfort.

I love the packaging of this colorful, delightful game aimed at the younger sector.  Each player receives five fish which you mold yourself with dough in brilliant colors....red, purple, blue and yellow.  54 playing cards are included and help you move about the board.  The object is to get three in a row allowing you to "squish opponents fish."  The last one with a fish still standing wins the game.Encourages coordination, concentration, agility, and sportsmanship.(always the tough lesson!)  I like the idea of squishing as boys will enjoy this game as much as girls.  Also making your own fish with the play dough will add extra enjoyment.Excited to play with my little nephews and grandson.

You buy a ping pong table and everyone is excited in the beginning.  But slowly they lose interest while you still are "jonesing' to play.  Solution. iPong Mini Portable Solo Table Tennis Server."  This uniquely designed machine holds 20 ping pong balls at a time ready to serve to you when you wish.  Aids with practicing hard shots as can be set wherever to challenge you.  Works so smoothly with only a touch of the on/off button.  No other mechanical adjustment required.  Silver and black make your new challenger attractive and solid.Much fun to be had!

Lovely packaging uncovers wonderful products.  Three bottles of Proativ Skin Revitalizing Serum sit beside a large jar of Skin Revitalizing Pads.  An extra set of pads are also included.Remove the lid from one of the bottles after shaking really well, and immerse the pads into the jar with serum.I really enjoyed the crisp, clean fill of the product which use at nighttime.  Gently pad your face and leave it on all night.  Fights oily buildup that can occur overnight.Excellent product for all ages.

This very lovely calendar journal is wonderful for keeping your dates, appointments and places you must go to at said times.  The cover is a soft rubber grey with etchings of a tree branches and pink birds.  It feels so nice to the touch.  Inside, the pattern is continued with tabbed months and plenty of room to write out the event, date, and time.  It would be such an attractive gift for anyone who has a busy schedule.  I love it more now that I have it in my hands than when I just saw it on Vine.

These adorable place-mats have many functions that I can perceive. Fun as their own table mats during mealtimes, great item to take on picnics or camping adventures, beach time, etc so children know they are special and have these durable mats just for them. The colors are very bright, and the place-mats themselves feel very pliable, and luckily, very washable. I can also see putting a couple on the table with coloring books, paint sets etc to save wear and tear of your tabletops. What a cute gift idea along with fun serving sets to match or or coloring books,, paint sets, play dough etc.

These adorable place-mats have many functions that I can perceive.  Fun as their own table mats during mealtimes, great item to take on picnics or camping adventures, beach time, etc so children know they are special and have these durable mats just for them.  The colors are very bright, and the place-mats themselves feel very pliable, and luckily, very washable.  I can also see putting a couple on the table with coloring books, paint sets etc to save wear and tear of your tabletops.  What a cute gift idea along with fun serving sets to match or or coloring books,, paint sets, play dough etc.

Allie is on the stretch of highway between CA and Las Vegas when a truck in front blows a tire into her windshield.  An accident ensues bringing about a journey that left me breathless.  The author Jennifer Allee has a vivid imagination,  a witty, sharp sense of humor, and good, hard writing skills which are to be applauded.  I really don't want to say more as the enveloping story keeps one guessing; I don't want to take that experience away from a new reader.  Part of the charm.  Couldn't put it down as I was so entertained, so intrigued, so shocked at times, so empathetic, so utterly touched.Really a superb read.  I am going to look up this Ms. Allee's other books as I would like to read more.

For years I have either finger applied or puff applied my base make-up, often noticing unevenness when in better lighting.  I thought I would try this to see if it really applies easier and more comfortably.  YES!  It even helps with the wrinkles that sadly blossom under the eyes.  Your coverage is definitely smoother and the wrinkles aren't caked.  More contoured; more finished.  The bristles are luxuriously soft.Good product and I will always use brushes now to apply my make-up.

The soft caramels are just that.....soft, rich and tantalizing, melting in your mouth.  I use to love the chewy ones, but the soft ones seem to permeate the flavor or toffee goodness faster.  One or two can be satisfying which is better for figure conscience folks....the decadently rich flavor is nearly overwhelming.  I love these and now will have them on hand when I need sweet tooth relief.

I have always been fond of CorningWare but now I am beyond ecstatic.  The new Aluminum Cast is fabulous in keeping the baking temperatures even and not burning on the sides.  I have cooked many casserole dishes as well as pot roast and pork chops within the gorgeous, lidded pot. I so grateful to have received it for review.VERY satisfied.

A fiber bar......ummmmmmmm....the only reason I ordered it as it was chocolate.  I am glad I did as this could satisfy my insatiable love of chocolate without giving me extra pounds.  It isn't dry and tasteless.  Quite chewy delicous.  Even my hubby, who doesn't love sweets liked these.  In fact, I think he will eat them all before I get another one.  Here I come to buy more and see if they have them in a lemon flavor.

One would think as one aged acne would never be the curse that it was as a teenager plagued with pimples.  NOT so.  Though the breakouts are minimal they still are unsightly which makes me love this product.  I can put it on a stubborn red spot at night and have it decreased significantly by morning.  I am really pleased by this product for aid in this way.  I don't know how effective it is for acne in teens, but for an older ladies skin it is marvelous.

My husband has always liked "Head and Shoulders" but this one has become a favorite of his.  The hydration leaves his hair silvery and soft.  Not dry and flaky but easily managed and shiny.  I can see this being a stellar product to add to the line of "Head and Shoulder" products.

Such a fun game.  Colorful and not too difficult for those around 5 and over.....though as children grow a bit older they seem to catch the bug that contagiously make them enjoy solving clues and mysteries.Sturdy pieces that are not easily lost.

My hubby was absolutely delighted with the comfortable quality of this coat.  Black in color, the coat boasts several pockets(in front and then on the sides as well.)  Orange quilted padding inside guarantees warmth and comfort as well.  It can be zippered or snapped shut or both for added warmth during rough winters.I was so happy that this coat is such a durable and attractive coat.

My grandson's bottom is much softer due to this lovely product.  We enjoy that it doesn't leave quite the mess that Desitin does.  He likes it because it moisturizes his little bum and leaves him feeling able to conquer the world.

Is your 3 to 6 year old hungering for knowledge.  With this clever package they learn science, math and other motor skills while playing this game.  Attached is the console which brings to life these lively characters.  Works wonderfully and I so happy I share this with grandson.

Our little shih tzu loves little Cesar's Filet Mignon and I thought, "oh, beef stew."  I actually serve her beef stew when I make a batch in my crock pot.  She just devours it.  SO, I knew she would love this flavor as little Cesars is a step above the rest.  Good ingredients and soft and palatable.  Smells good too.

What a darling way to give a child relief from a headache, high fever, bad bruises and all around discomfort.  The little puppy cap tucks beneath the chin with Velcro straps.  Inside the back of the puppy's head is a place for two very small yet effective gel cups to rest and ease the hurt and discomfort.(just keep them in your freezer)  The child will enjoy that a puppy is aiding him in feeling better.  Puppy has embroidered eyes and noses and a puppet like mouth resting on top the bill.So cute; wonderful gift for showers and baby parties.  My grandson will love this.  I am sure at 16 months it will get plenty of use if at least as a fun think to place on ones noggin. *smile*

Baseball players are on strike and many of their fans are furious.  How dare these millionaires ask for more.  One psychotic fan plans to make a lasting impression of players that "get above their raising."Into this plot come three amateur detectives who single handily solved the murder of one character's husband.  Roseanne, her brother, Graham, and Randy, their compatriot, decide to go into the business training under a true detective.  When the baseball crimes grab huge headlines they are recruited(of sorts) to aid in the solving of the hideous endings that befall the rich, pampered players.I hate to say more as mystery/crime books depends so much on the element of surprise.  I detest the thought of giving too much away so that your reading of this cozier mystery will somehow be impeded.There are a few problems; perhaps a bit too much background on characters that are not pivotal to plot; maybe a few effusive musing from a character that I couldn't image waxing this elegant.  Overall, however, if is a fun, enjoyable read and Michael Draper has improved so vastly after this first endeavor.  That is a the mark of a good writer; always working harder; attaining more of his craft.  I am proud to say this man is an online friend of mine; his strong spirit has been of such inspiration to me.In full disclosure, I purchased this book and I stand by my views!Fine job, Mike!!!!

Barbara Parker longs to break from her home in Blackpool trekking to London in search of fame as a comedian.  England's BBC is just beginning to offer lighter fare after the dirge of WWII in the 1960's.  Writers Tony and Bill long for a home to cast their spells of witty, smart humor.The story encompasses the characters and times quite brilliantly.  Much dialogue flows the story into a charming, yet very thoughtful read.  I loved the satire and the deeper thoughts that humor can penetrate if done well.  Nick Hornby's "Funny Girl" is done very well.I am loathe to say more as the plot develops so quickly that to give more away is nearly spoilers.  Just sit back and enjoy this book and think a bit.

Oh, what an exquisite towel!  One steps from a steamy bath and glides into this gorgeous, gentle towel, soft as a bunny's fur.  Wrap it around you as you luxuriate in it's fullness, tenderness, coziness and warmth.  It truly is like having a spa experience.I so highly recommend this that you buy one for yourself and give them away as Christmas gifts.  I am planning that.  People will thank you profusely.

I have only been using this product for one week but I like the cooling gel that is dispensed by the rubber applicator.  It spurts the right amount of product under your eyes.  So far, no major improvement but in a month if I see one I will do an update review.  It is lovely to take care of that area as it wrinkles so easily.  I smile too much having cause the lines and wrinkles and crinkles around my eyes and this product refreshes all that.Worth a good try.

If you love lots of creamy chocolate you have met your Nirvana.  Outside are two thick coatings of melt in your mouth chocolate.  The inside hides a Oreo like cookie that is crunchy and delicious.  What a treat.  I imagine these are full of calories, but I don't care....sometimes a person needs a chocolate fix and this will do it.I still have one package hidden away for that very moment when only chocolate will do.

I am always loathe to give low scores for new authors who really have a good story going.  In fact, I was uncomfortable carrying the large trade cover I received from Amazon so I purchased the book from Kindle.  I did this thinking I liked the first 100 pages and since it was longer this venue would provide me with my favorite form of reading.(these days)  But, as I read page after page after page of this book I began to weary.  The problem in my mind is the author stays way too long on subjects until they are like beating a dead horse.  I did plow through, but didn't have the pleasurable experience I was counting on.The positives;!) I did get through it where I usually toss a book after the first hundred pages if it is boring me. I am 60 years old, have been reading since I was 4 and am really particular about things like the flow of a book.2) The characters are deeply scoped which allowed me to care about them even with their powerful eccentricities.3)  The writing it is beautiful, but just too redundant.I will say no more as I wish this author great good wishes.  I think an author often does improve novel after novel so I will give Matthew Thomas another try.  He has something in his style that is compelling; just too much of a good thing maybe?

The writing is delightful, the historical elements well sought(though in all honesty  haven't checked all the facts) the characters well described and the banter between Queen Elizabeth the 1(daughter of Henry the 8th and Anne Boleyn) and her subjects including a handsome renegade , Robert Dudley is interesting.  Elizabeth staunchly refuses to marry any princes or kings from France or Spain to garner allies, deciding instead to make her own choices.My problem; all apologies to Alison Weir who has totally entertained and enlightened me over the years with the Tudor reign;  I think I am just worn out of the subject.  It was my fault in picking this book to read not realizing that I have wearied of so.Please buy it if you like the subterfuge and wrangling inside the walls of the castles.  Alison Weir does an excellent job.  That is why I gave it four stars and not three......I take the blame on myself because reading it became more of an assignment and less pleasurable as I already covered most of these subjects between Philippa Gregory, Alison Weir and a few other scholars on the subjects.Good read despite my whining. "grin"

What  little boy wouldn't love this speedway that gives his imaginations take flight of racing along speedways?  Being Fisher Price it is very durable, relatively easy to engineer, and bright enough to draw the child in.  My grandson things he is so cool(15 months) shooting these cars from top to bottom and then veering them at just the right time.  Of course he has a daddy that took time to teach but now it solely his toy. that took time to teach but now it soley his toy.Smile emoticon

I received a free copy of this book from Amazon Vine in trade cover.  Drawn in by the first page or two, I found it so hard to read as the print was inordinately  tiny and my eyes felt so strained.  However, my love of the exquisite writing pushed me to a choice that readers everywhere will understand......I decided to purchase the book for $9.99 from Amazon Kindle.  I will lend the free one out to better eyes than mine, but I do NOT regret in any form the money I spent.The story is an epic tale of man against time, place and situation.  Morgan's prose describing the Depression hit me so acutely;  though the Richard's were poor back wood folk, their ownership of a cow, a garden, etc made them able to reach out to the troubled hobos, some with families, that straggled by.  This family's whole lives were hard but they accept it with grace and humility.  Far from perfect human's, there are moments of trouble but even they seem valiant.The narrator, Annie, shares with us the time period from the 20's to the 40's.  Robert Morgan descriptions made this reader honestly see the Appalachian area and the characters.  It is not a fast moving pace, but one that dares you to dwell for moments upon the historical fact, upon moments that are tiny but so significant and to gaze upon this vast land and taste it as the Richard's did.Superb!!  I read "Gap Creek" several years ago and remember still how tough the lives of that group......Robert Morgan conveys this subject matter with such finesse.  EXCELLENT!!

Transformers Age of Extinction Mega 1 Step Bumblebee Figure is a bright orange with black interspersed.  Formidable looking, kids from 5 on will LOVE the look and feel of durable plastic that will bend from a large robot of sorts to a cool, slick, shiny racing car.  I know my Godson will be transfixed by this toy and spend hours playing with it which is the purpose.  I trust Hasbro, a leading toy maker, to offer quality and good times.

From the opening page of "What I Remember Most" I was absolutely hooked.  Ms. Lamb as a writer has done this before to me; what a talent that is!  I spent two sleepless nights(at least until my eyes hurt so badly I had to get a bit of sleep) reading this book as it is that compelling. Her characters are so rich, so beautifully explained through her composition of each.  The story is more suspenseful than anything I have read by her before.(which just lit the fire under me to keep reading at a nearly insane pace.)I won't delve into plot and such as other reviewers have done that beautifully.  I just want to concur that this is my favorite Cathy Lamb book, tied with "Henry's Sisters."  I will say I have her prior two books to read so they may tie as well, but you cannot go wrong buying "What I Remember Most."Happy, eye blurring, reading! :-)

The Leapfrog Sing and Play is so colorful and cute.  The youngster learns dexterity by pushing buttons that make the animals create their sounds and a song is played as well.  Very durable, very functional and very cute.

Do you have little ones going off to pre-school?  Want to temper their fears a bit.  "LeapFrog Learning Friends Play and discover School Playset" will offer lots of help in their preparations.  With soft malleable characters, the child can set them all up for learning.  Each one goes into a certain slot circle allowing the figures to talk to your child.  The play school aspects of this wonderful toy are so bright and cheerful and all set to teach them gentle lessons in listening comprehension, school routines and just having fun.  Wonderful toy for birthdays, holidays or just because.

Hey, it's Mickey and he is here to ease you to sleep, provide light when you are exploring, to hold in bed if you need to check under the covers, and to perch on your bed stand to guide you through the night.  A malleable plastic, young hands can easily carry this without any chance of being burned.  So darling as Mickey stands for friendship and this light stands for undying friendship through the darkness into the day.

When I opened this package and saw the divine "5 College Ruled Notebook" with a green cover I was transported back to college.(it has been a lot of years since then)  I love that it has the dividers for all subjects and the ruled paper inside is of the best quality.I plan to use this as a book journal.....I am a voracious reader so will use this as a journal that divides genres and favorite authors.  I journal all the books I read so this will make it simple and when I have filled this one I will buy another.Ah, sweet memories  and new uses.  A fine notebook indeed!!!

"Margaretville DM3400-000-000 Bali Frozen Concoction Maker" is absolutely fantastic.  Large in size, it can almost be daunting, but it is so easy to utilize if you follow the directions.  Not only does it mix your drink it dispenses it as well.  THUS, no need to play "hostess with the mostest" pouring maybe two drinks at a time from your blender.  The early recipients of drinks are ready for another before you serve all your guests.  No problem with this dynamic device.  I have noticed others have explained the details of how to work this, but I want to share just how easy it is to throw a party and not be working the whole time.  Smoothies in the morning that can be refrigerated for later consumption in a pitcher.  Party time at 5(cause you know what they say about 5 0 clock and party time?)  Make sure you have plenty of ice, fruits and whatever alcohol(or not) you would enjoy.  I myself love frozen alcohol-free drinks, but this fits all taste buds. The drinks themselves come out delicious!!!!I have never received a gift of this magnitude from Amazon Vine before so I am one very, very, very happy drinker.  Thanks for this incredible product!!!!!

In truth I read this product wrong when ordering.  I thought it was an ant and wasp spray as I don't have roaches.  I don't know if anywhere Wyoming has them.....they would freeze their little" cucarachas" off if they lived here. :-)I am happy for the ant spray as we sometimes get colonies of ants that find our front porch a great condo for their families and friends.  Being softhearted I let them live their dreams until they start marching into the house,  The the bug spray.  Out of respect I will say no more."Safer" comes in friendly, environmentally friendly white can with green art.  It sprays well right onto the exact spot you require.  There isn't any creepy smells afterward which is nice.  Of course keeping it up high and out of sight is always a good plan if children reside in your home.The one con I have is that when I went to snap off the white cap at the top it nearly fell in my hands. I don't like the safety issue with that.  It can easily be pulled off if a little hand decided to try it.  Please be aware of this detail.Good product that could be better by a  "safer" installed  top.  Irony, folks; got to love it.

Father Tim and Cynthia are back from Ireland and ready to take on their quiet retirement. Ha! Mitford and it's cast of quirky, but lovable townspeople have other ideas.The new priest, Father Talbot, fights inner demons that lead to his own demise.  Of course Father Tim is called to be his replacement till Father Bob from Colorado can come in.  Will Father Tim take on this challenge?  Will he give up "retirement" to honor this request?Sammy, Dooley's youngest brother is angry and sharing that anger with all that cross his path.  That he lives next door in Father's Tim's home in the basement with his brothers, puts a conundrum at Father's Tim next door step.  Helene, who rents out the basement, is calling for Sammy's dismissal and runs to Father Tim to come up with a solution for her dilemma.Hope, from "Happy Endings Bookstore" is happily pregnant, but this blessed event confines her to bed with no one to run her shop.  Who, if anyone, will step in and keep it running?J.C, the editor of Mitford's "The Muse" has hired a new reporter who asks, "Does Mitford Still Takes Care of It's Own?"  This becomes a heated debate among the townsfolk.Jan Karon offers other problems, but also joys as she writes in her famous heart-rending prose.  I laughed, I cried, and I LOATHED coming to the end of this larger than normal tome.  I could have read 500 more pages and still never been bored.  She writes with such grace, such understanding of characters, bringing them alive so that you swear you know these people.  Mitford is your town as are the occupants.  I own this whole series and pray that I may re-read them all someday.....for now I will say that "Somewhere Safe with Somebody Good" will be my favorite tied with "Shepherds Abiding?"  Course I would always feel each had it's own ambiance and fulfillment.  All are top notch.I almost envy you who now have this book coming in September to read for the first time.  I love being in Mitford every time I visit and pray many, many more visits are to come.  Glad you are in  great health, Ms. Karon, and pray that you realize how many of us out here love you for the series that brightens our lives. We are most grateful!!

Though the book begins lovely with Rann, main character, in the womb trying to understand his birth and logically explains his brilliant mind, the rest of the story goes on and on.  Rann meets his "love mate" Stephanie when they are 6 years old and together they try and find a purpose to Rann's rambling ways.  His brain leaves me little comfort as he searches Europe and Asian countries for some understanding.I love Pearl Buck but maybe this book should have been put to peace.  I know her estate was not given to her children and perhaps this was an attempt to recover some of their mother's awesome works.Give it a read if you like, but for me it was just an average book.

"Cascade Platinum Actionpacs" are so wonderful I can't say enough about them.  Contained in a smaller plastic container with a pretty purple lid, the packs themselves are so convenient.  I have used Cascade for years in the big green box,  but these are so easy to drop into the allotted spot and allow them to clean like a dream.  My dishes were sparkling when they came out so the 10x power and the inclusion of Dawn really made a difference.  They also have a lovely scent that is so inviting.Recommend!!!

I feel baldy but after my 100 page rule I couldn't make myself continue.  The writing is fine but the story kept falling flat for me.  I know how hard an author works so I am sorry this just wasn't for me.  I had to come up with the 100 page rule as I own hundreds of books and cannot waste a moment on a book that isn't drawing me in.Again, sorry to the author.....I wish you good sales and hope I might enjoy another by you.

Christina Henriguez introduces us to a group of Latin folks that move to Delaware to offer their children more opportunities.  Living within the same apartment complex we are given many stories by the residents.  Their will to survive and their willingness to work hard for what they have. Many really miss their home countries, but war, famine and violent weather have destroyed their beloved towns.  They find America challenging, but are grateful for what they have even though it is never much.I especially loved the story between Mayor and Maribel.  Both outcasts for different reasons, they bond together to find life made easier by each other's presence.Lovely story that is written very, very well.Very timely as we have women and children in detention facilities at present(July 2014) who have fled from Mexico.....will they be granted new lives?  Will they have a chance to overcome abject poverty?  This story presents many reasons why they should.

Such a darling toy for littler hands.  Several floors of the "Rock and Roll" playhouse has various music while children's hands help the characters of Julius Jr and his pals to dance, party, and turn lose.  Very colorful with disco ball, shimmering blue slide, elevator to get to each floor, a musical floor in yellow and brown squares that plays, "Dance with Julius Jr., musical instruments and Julius, himself, makes this such an amusing and exciting toy. Durable and reliable.  I want to play with it too so you can believe that I will be down with it all when the first child opens it.For those 2 years and up.

Laura McBride, first time novelist, has written a tour d force book set in the bowels of Las Vegas.  Behind the glitz and glitter many live quiet lives of desperation.Meet Baskim, a 7 year old boy whose parents are refugees from Albania. His family consist only of Baba, an angry bitter father, Nene, a loving, but lonely, depressed mother, and Tirana, a 2 year old sister.  Their tiny income ekes  from an ice cream truck and Nene's job at Kohl's.  Baskim is often hungry.  His elementary teacher and principal rise to the occasion by sharing their lunches and snacks.  They listen to Baskim very astutely.  This without knowledge of Baba who is erratically suspicious of  government personage.May I introduce Specialist Luis Rodriguez-Reyes and Nathan, both soldiers serving 3 tours of duty in Iraq, returning physically and emotionally damaged to their homes in "Sin City."  One accepts help from those that rise to assist; one does not.Encounter Avis, recently and surprisingly divorced after many years who is the mother of Nathan; Abuela Reyes, Luis's loving grandmother; Roberta, an attorney who volunteers with CASA(child advocate group) and Mrs. Delain, a foster mother who has loved, cuddled, and supported many children over her lifetime.Baskim, Avis, Luis Rodriguez-Reyes and Roberta are the narrators explaining the situation while introducing other characters who must rise.  All of these people's wits, hearts, and souls are tested after a horrible tragedy occurs.I don't want to indulge too much of the plot, so instead I will deeply encourage you to read this masterpiece of heart-ache assuaged by humanity.  Each person rising up to meet the situation as best they are able.This is an astounding tale not to be missed.  The flow is page turning, the characters deeply rooted and sometimes gutted for the reader's understanding.  A tale heartbreaking, yet hopeful.Ms. McBride has based this on a real event that occurred in Las Vegas years ago, pulled from headlines with knowledge from other sources.  Fictional, but all too real.The author was angst to present this tale without severely depressing her audience.  She succeeds.  Superbly!!MUST READ to the highest power.

My daughter loves these diapers for her little tike(10 months old) as they keep his outer wear dry even if he is wet.(of course she checks often)  They are also sooooooo darling to look at with  Minnie and Mickey Mouse decorating them.  They are easy to use, very pliable and just perfect.Recommend.

I hate writing less than stellar reviews.  I know how hard authors work to bring images and stories to the reader.  So, all I will say is that this book and I didn't click.  It could be my fault too....I was quite ill when reading it and maybe that left me unable to process.  I love Ann Hood's work usually so I will not put down this book.Read it and enjoy it.  It just didn't work for me.

I have tried most types of pens over my 60 years but I find these to be my favorites.  They don't smear, are much easier to use the their earlier models and free you to use whatever ink color you enjoy.  Simply push down the color and it is there.Glad to receive these.  I am grateful.

"Degree Motionsense Berry Cool" is a very good deodorant.  Because I prefer gel to the solid, I took a star away.  "Degree Motionsense" does EXACTLY what is promises in that it keeps you from sweating and also controls the scent of said sweat.  The "berry cool' smell is not overly abrupt; in fact is refreshing and light smelling.  The promise to be invisible is kept; you can wear those sleeveless shirts and not worry that the underarms of your blouse  will get stained.  Neither will the deodorant be seen on your underarms.Nice product that I will continue to use especially if it can be made in gel form.

In 1832, at the age of 18 Alice Burrows leaves the roots of her family farm behind, lured by the giant cotton mills in Lowell, MA.  Her own money, promise of gals and guys her age, and independence convince her these places must be perfect.  She has room and board(a broken down old building that is freezing in the winter and stifling in  the summer) her own earnings( paltry for 6 day-12 hour shifts of uncompromising work) and friends(who she commiserates with during their few free hours)  Alice awakens to the harshness and it is with a jolt; the mill which is so dangerous because of outdated machinery, no safety measures, the cotton that falls freely into the lungs of the girls weaving it and the easy firing of those who won't keep up the shifts or report problems.When people begin to become miserably ill or die the book picks up pace.  Secret meetings by all the cotton workers are held, plans are hatched to insure safety measures, a murder trial ensues, a romance commences that may not be the best for either participant.  Intrigue ensues making the pages turn much more quickly.This was an interesting read and though I didn't love it as I did "The Dressmaker" I read it and found it informative about the ancestors of those times that made the way a little less rocky for their predecessors.  I would like to visit these mills that have been preserved if I ever get out into that area.

Anna Quindlen is a favorite author of mine so it was predestined that I would get this book.(smile)  I didn't know what to expect, but I really enjoyed that it was a quiet, slower paced, endearing fictitious novel featuring Rebecca Winter, a renown photographer, middle aged, who has fallen on hard financial times due to a divorce and life changes. A need to find her refreshed self through art once more drives Rebecca to rent out her trendy NYC apartment and move to a sleepy little town.  She allots one year to find new direction in her pictured career.The writing is very descriptive and the characters really intriguing. Down home folk; quirky, realistic and ultimately endearing.  Events in this sleepy berg awaken Rebecca to unperceived choices that await her finding; for her enjoyment, for some disappointment, but ultimately for her awakening from entrenched habits to new possibilities.I think women will appreciate this soft, touching, observant book more than men.  That is okay.  I believe that was the target audience and I was so genuinely touched by the book I want to encourage all my women friends to give it a peruse.Lovely book Ms. Quindlen.

Once I read the directions and applied them, this product worked well.  The first day or two it was a pretty strong scent as my bathroom isn't all the large.  I had thought if it didn't tone down I would have to remove it but a week later I am appreciating the fragrance and cleaning prowess "Lysol Max."  I want my bathroom to be very clean and smelling spring clean as well.  "Lysol Max" provides me with both.

Oh, this the cutest tub while being sturdy, convenient, and safe.  A special baby sling cradles the tiny tots and when they are nearly 7 months, as my Alex is, they can splash while their parents aid.  Alex adores the little toys and his Daddy squirting at him with him. his would be such a cool baby shower gift and believe me I will be buying another when that opportunity arises.Love the "Sassy Splashin' Fun Bath Tub. Turtle."  Where were these things when my daughter was little?  At least I can enjoy them now with my grandson.

Lee Smith is a new find for me and I must say I struck gold immediately.  "Guests on Earth" is written with vivid descriptions, imaginative similes, characters so acutely discussed that I felt as if I knew them one by one.  Ms. Smith personifies the title of author and storyteller.Evalina Toussaint, having lost her fragile mother(an exotic dancer in New Orleans) to suicide is sent to a very posh mental facility financed by the mother's ex-lover whom is riddled with grief and guilt.  At twelve the establishment seems glorious to Evalina; the hospital mandates long hikes, swimming, and a multitude of physical activity.  Also garnered is artistic fervor and all forms of painting, dance, theater and music are enjoyed by the wealthy cliental.  Evalina even meets Zelda Fitzgerald at Highland House; amused and somewhat frightened by Zelda, Evalina gives her wide berth.  The Carroll's, psychiatrist and wife, foster the gifts Evalina exudes thus providing her with a great education, a prowess for the piano, etc.  But during the twelve years of her life lived in and around, Highland House, Evalina witnesses the many cracks of this institution as well as a fire that lead to demise.  And the treatments that can be used are less than humane.Walking through this time with Evalina was so fascinating. Surprisingly not terribly maudlin, the writing flows so easily and Evalina steals the readers heart and head as do former and present patients within the mental institution.Amazing read that assures I will be perusing  more of  Lee Smith's masterpieces.RECOMMENDED!

The high quality of these "Liquid Ink Dry-Erase Markers" led me to purchase a message board.  Having erroneously read these to be markers for packaging and labeling I thought at first, "oh, no."  But when I tested them and saw the brilliance of the color, the easiness of movement and that they don't dry out even if left for a day without their caps.  I decided why not purchase a board to leave notes on at home.  So this is case of a superior workmanship leading to my commitment on keeping them.  High praise I would say.

Crafted in Switzerland I chose this from Amazon Vine for my husband.  I was quite surprised by it's volume and strength upon receiving it.  Quite elegant and since I am deeply into "Downtown Abbey" on PBS I can imagine such a beautifully toned comb to be a gentleman's. I read on packaging that each of these combs are handcrafted in Switzerland with a 12 step process.  I think it is too nice for my husband who doesn't respect elegance, but he likes how it feels and combs so he is all about it. *smile*  And, ultimately, in our purchases don't we all look for that....a quality product that feels enjoyable to our needs?Would be lovely as a gift to that person who prefers quality and craftsmanship.

I have been a reader of  most literature for years now so occasionally if I come upon a book that doesn't keep my interest I no longer insist I must finish it.  Having read other books that cover abuse of women with a greater panache, I stopped at 124 pages in.  My major complaint was it was not moving me and I am quite an emotional person.  I am usually drawn into dilemmas like this of a young mother and her two young daughters forced to flee a punishing husband and father.  However, for whatever reason the story evoked no senses in me of their peril.I realize how hard it is to write a book; how a novelist anguishes and gives it the best they know how.  I admire anyone with that fortitude to complete one.  Perhaps with more time, Suzanne Redfearn will master the ability of high drama more astutely.  I am sorry I didn't enjoy the read and am sure some others will connect.  It may have been I have read this plot line too often, so will offer that as a stance.  But I know I wasn't drawn in and had to MAKE myself try to read.  Life is simply too short in your 50's to force oneself to plod through a book.  That is just my truth.Please keep writing, Ms. Redfearn and I will not be afraid to try you again.  We just missed each other in this read.

What an elegant piece of jewelry this is.  A small heart is lined with tiny, glittering crystals, the centerpiece being two tiny hearts connected to a larger light blue heart at the base.  It is so tastefully done that I doubt whether people will question it's validity on any level unless a jeweler. The chain is tiny links that highlight the piece to even more brilliance.  Would be a beautiful accent piece to a a lovely v-neck or rounded crew neck. I will not hesitate to wear this as a solitude piece when wishing to look quite feminine and understated.  Also would be fun as a stand out piece with other jewelry accenting it.

I have a 4.5 -year-old, 65-pound Boxer/Pitt Mix. Joy-Joy has enthusiastically devoured the other two flavors combinations of Solid Gold, Solid Gold Fit and Fabulous Holistic Dry Dog Food, Alaskan Pollock, Weight Control Recipe, Less Active Adult Dogs, All Sizes, 4lb Bag and Solid Gold Wolf King Holistic Dry Dog Food, Bison, Brown Rice & Sweet Potatoes, Moderately Active Adult Dogs, Medium & Large, 4lb Bag. She would hover around her empty food bowl, asking for more. However, not sure why but she was less interested in this flavor combo.I like the overall nutritional quality of this product. She adjusted seamlessly from her traditional dry food.

This chew toy arrived  today and our 4.5 -year-old, 65-pound Boxer/Pitt Mix, Joy-Joy, enthusiastically gnawed on it off/on for hours. She is the proud owner of many Nylabone brand goodies. Her past favorite was the Nylabone Big Chew Monster Original Flavored Durable Toy Beef Bone for large breeds.It is VERY difficult to find chew/toys that she does not damage in minutes. Other than the expected bristles; this will survive to entertain her for many weeks to come.

I sprinkled this seed in my side yard where the water company recently did some work, but (I believe) due to our unpredictable Kentucky weather I have yet to see any growth.I will update this review in the spring when it is our ideal grass growing season. Thank You for reading this review.

Susan Mallery gives readers a mirthful romance during the holiday season. This Fool's Gold installment encompasses friendship, family, and tradition. The author's light-hearted writing style immerses readers into the quirky relationship between the sassy Madeline and sexy action star, Jonny Blaze.

I have a 4.5 -year-old, 65-pound Boxer/Pitt Mix. Joy-Joy enthusiastically devours her 2 cups per meal (2x daily) but she still seems be hungry {considering her actively level this is common}. She will hover around her empty food bowl, asking for more.I like the overall nutritional quality of this product and she seems to enjoy it very much. She adjusted seamlessly from her traditional dry food.

I have a 4.5 -year-old, 65-pound Boxer/Pitt Mix. Joy-Joy enthusiastically devours her 2 cups per meal (2x daily) but sometimes seems to be still hungry {considering her actively level this is common}. She will hover around her empty food bowl, asking for more.I like the overall nutritional quality of this product and she seems to enjoy it very much. She adjusted seamlessly from her traditional dry food.

This Treat 'occupied' our Joy-Joy for just over 7 minutes. As a 4.5 -year-old, 65-pound Boxer/Pitt Mix she would be considered an aggressive chewer. However, as you can see (in the pictures) she enthusiastically devoured this treat.She is the proud owner of many Nylabone brand goodies; her favorite seems to be the Nylabone Big Chew Monster Original Flavored Durable Toy Beef Bone for large breeds.

Ideal for tailgating or celebrating your favorite NCAA team's latest win (assuming you are a fan of teams currently available). These are larger than the average Hefty cup (18oz version). A more expensive version of the typical disposable cup. However, our household would likely repurchase these brightly colored cups for a sport themed party/cookout.

In the past, when switching foods Peaches has experienced diarrhea; so we are reluctant to switch brands. However, she did not have any issues with this brands dry food The Nutro Company Indoor Senior Cat Food with Chicken and Whole Brown Rice Formula, 3-Pound - so we thought that we would let her try it. She did not experience any digestive system distress with this mix. In fact, she enjoyed this flavor combination very much - instance gobble-gobble. We will continue to feed her the Wellness Complete Health Natural Dry Cat Food, Salmon & Turkey Recipe, 5.9-Pound Bag  The vet recommended it for the Triple Cranberry blend; helps reduce issues with her urinary tract. But will mix in a little this for the whole brown rice - extra digestive health boost.

Recently, attended a conference in Tennessee and preferred this pouch over the one provided. This has several compartments with RFID. Which is great, because it allows better organization and extra protection. It has two zippered pockets (one for cash and the other for room keys and credit cards. A larger compartment, sealed with Velcro - prefect for a smartphone. a divider in the Velcro compartment has room for maps, tickets, etc.

Author Jennifer Lyon used her own brand of magic to weave hope and desperation into a beautiful love story.The author gained an instantaneous fan for her Wing Slayer Hunter series with the release of the 1st installment, Blood Magic. I enjoy the inimitable mythos this world offers readers, but it is the tenuous relationship between the witches and hunters that entices me most. I devoured every single release until the series halted; leaving this reader impatiently wanting more.I remember when Caged Magic was just a whisper of a rumor…and now that it is a reality – I still want more. I’ll try to be patient, but I cannot make any promises. Here is to hoping that Primal Magic and Fallen Magic are released soon…

I first discovered Elisabeth Barrett when a reader friend recommended Deep Autumn Heat the initial installment in her Star Harbor contemporary romance seriesUnfortunately, the introduction to the Return to Briarwood series was chaotic. There was too much detail thrust into the story, at times it felt overwhelming. The information overload detracted from the story. I stuck to the story because Caro and Jake's romance totally captivated my heart. I wish that there was more focus on their love story and less on the secondary character profiles. Hopefully, future installments will dedicate more page space to the main couple.Not in a hurry for the next installment, but The Best of Me is on my TBR list.

My first Kele Moon. I enjoyed her free-flowing writing style. The author used descriptive expressions to stimulate the temperament. My attention was held from the very first page. I was more than just an engaged spectator, I was embedded.  "...he hadn't gotten laid in months because he'd rather play domestic with the most clueless cop in Tampa Bay."

🍃🍂🍁This is a novel about self-discovery 🍁🍂🍃Liz Kroft is on a journey across the John Muir Trail, but mostly she is in search of herself. I was offended by most of choices during her life prior to the hike; she was incredibly selfish.  The writer delivers an amazing story -- it is beautifully-written.  The scenery is descriptive and smooth dialogue.  I was impressed with Dante's character; his strength, support and love for Liz made The Middle of Somewhere a story worth a recommendation.I recommend this for book clubs - great discussion points.

Since you searched this product out, you were probably are already aware that there are dozens of uses for Tea Tree Essential oil. However, our household’s main uses are as an additive in our homemade disinfectant and Rosemary dog conditioner. Also we typically put a few drops, alongside some dried lavender, in our humidifier each night. I have purchased other Nature’s Truth Essential Oils and the quality is of this bottle was as expected; this batch has a particular dense aroma, which I enjoyed.

Atlantic City Hustlers’ right winger, Alec “Sequoia” O’Meara, lost his wife, Tamara, to cancer two years ago. Due to Alec’s famed talent, the media publicized both Tamara’s battle with cancer and later, following her death, Alec’s grief. Since becoming a widower, Alec, has ensured that his relationships never deepen – strictly remaining in the just-for-fun stage.Annie Davidson’s most recent relationship ended when she discovered her ex, Corey, having an affair with a medical assistant. Growing up her athleticism always shrouded her femininity and drew criticism. Discovering Corey’s infidelity reiterated old insecurities…making her feel inadequate.The courting/flirting set the pace for this incredible couple. I do not have much patience for a whinny heroine with low self-esteem, but Alec’s consistent encouragement made it tolerable. Every moment is remarkable – witnessing two people determined to not love again…fall so deeply…was incredible.Not sure what the authors have planned for the Atlantic City Hustlers series, but I hope it those plans include many more installments.

I am always amazed at how authors, including Delores Fossen, can development love under the harshest circumstances and maintain authenticity. This Sweetwater Ranch installment began suspenseful and maintained that tone steadily throughout the story. My first story written by this author, but I plan to follow-up this read with the earlier installments of Sweetwater Ranch.Disclosure: This book was provided to me free of charge for the sole purpose of an honest review. All thoughts, comments, and ratings are my own.

I almost gave up after finishing chapter four; I was tired of the revengeful games – it was exhausting. Nevertheless, I found that I immensely enjoyed Sharon Kendrick’s writing style. Loukas and Jessica had an intensely emotional connection and once they soften toward each other the story improved greatly.

The author, Christine Rimmer, wrote many endearing scenes that were reflective of the deep intimacy between Jordyn and Will. This is a charming story about two people wanting to share forever with a special someone. A surprising beginning leads to a truly Happily Ever After!!!

Probably not my first choice of goodies, but I would consider purchasing these in the future if the price was not so prohibitive. These are a great snack to accompany my morning coffee. On really exhaustive mornings...I'll grab a yogurt and dip these bites into it. However, I do not recommend crumbling it into the yogurt, it become a mushy mess. Favor thing about the bites id the texture of these granola nuggets.Not sure why the description states 'Good source of fiber' - I do not consider 1g of dietary fiber as good.

I am a razor & shaving gel gal...always have been. However, after using this just a couple of times I have discovered that I this is my new (and improved) shaving ritual. I prefer to do the dry shave prior to showering…then touch up with gel after my shower – seems to provide the longest lasting shave for me. The runtime has not been an issue I can complete my entire ritual without recharging. The stand is compact and stable – better than the one provided with my hubby’s shaver.Recommended for those individuals (like myself) that firmly believe that there is no alternative to a razor.

While this will not replace our current household vacuum, Dyson Ball Compact Animal Canister Vacuum Cleaner - it is up to the task. We prefer the versatility of our canister vacuum over this upright...mainly due to mobility, size and weight. This is also louder than most vacuums we have owned...but also not the loudest - middle of the road. Favorite thing is the EXTRA long bright orange cord - can vacuum almost the entire carpeted area of our home without moving the plug (everything but the laundry room). The width was surprising, fits under most of our furniture - reducing the time spent on this, often dreaded, task.The last commercial/industrial upright vacuum we owned, an ORECK, had a magnetic bar which was amazing for my sewing/craft room.

Bella Andre captured my attention long ago with her endearing characters. I’ll admit I hesitate to read co-authored books that feature an unfamiliar (to me) author, Jennifer Skully aka Jasmine Haynes. I worry that the writing style of the newly introduced author will taint the story somehow…potentially dim my love of the other author’s work. Of course in this case, my doubts were unfounded…their writing styles were indistinguishable. Together they created an impeccable love story with fantastic character profiles.Disclosure: This ebook was provided to me free of charge for the sole purpose of an honest review. All thoughts, comments, and ratings are my own.

In Shameless, author Laura Wright gives readers two strong-willed characters that evolve quickly into each other’s happy ever after. The dialogue is fantastic…both are very vocal with their individual desires.Most Nephilim consider being called to join the Harem as an honor, but not Rosamund. She dreams of having a life, home and family…an impossibly if she remains at the Harem. She is forced to deceive everyone into order to ensure that she is released from her obligation after fulfilling her year. With only four days remaining, her determination is stronger than ever - until Incubus Master Scarus Vipera arrives. It has been five years since he last visited the Harem – forced to return due to his fading strength. I loved that he is unapologetic in his quest to consume power (feed). He selected Rosamund initially because she met his two criteria (1) has great power and (2) not in her fertile time.“I do not see the problem, Rosamund. You are Nephilim and I am Incubus. I take power and give pleasure. You give power and receive pleasure”Laura Wright ’s Dauntless novella is the retelling of the well-known Cinderella tale, with a few erotic twists. It is a story that has been told many times, in many ways – the Incubus/Nephilim makes this adaptation unique. Another unrepentant male...The Trevanion family tradition dictates that Incubus Master Casworon must mate with the Nephilim chosen for him. Cas believes that arranged matings is an antiquated practice and should be discontinued. The duty is a source of great contention between him and his mother. His mother is determined to solidify alliances with the royal families…no matter the cost to her son. Once a high-ranking and respected Temple Blade, Lia, now a servant in the House of Trevanion has yet to be introduced to the Lord of house. Cas’s Watchmen, Pennice, acts as the fairy godmother of this story offering Lia the opportunity to attend the party as a guest…restored to her previous beauty.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~I lowered the rating to 3 mainly due to the fact that I felt overall that there were important elements missing from these novellas. For Example: Who are the Three? I feel that I need to read the other Master of Seduction stories to gain a complete understanding.Disclosure: This ebook was provided to me free of charge for the sole purpose of an honest review. All thoughts, comments, and ratings are my own.

Exercising results in the occasional leakage and these pads, while larger than I prefer, satisfactorily absorb moisture.  These adhere to cotton panties best…but I did discover these bunch after a vigorous exercise class.

Marie Force put together another whodunit tale filled infidelity, rape and murder. I once again enjoyed shifting through the clues, eliminating suspects...and of course the Nick/Sam interactions were amazing. I usually lose interest in a series that features the same couple repeatability, but these two characters continue to surprise me. The secondary couples (Freddie/Elin & Tommy/Christina) were more prominently featured in this installment - I felt it detracted from the main romance.

Suspense author Marie Force amplifies the passion and reignites old insecurities in her second installment of the Fatal Series. Recently promoted Lieutenant Sam Holland is embroiled in another high-profile murder case. Also her relationship with the newly appointed Virginia State Senator, Nick Cappuano is attracting a surplus of unwanted media attention. I enjoyed the challenging situations the author developed for these adorable characters, but mostly it is the realistic resolutions that kept this reader turning the pages.Up Next book 3 of the Fatal Series, Fatal Consequences.

This is an interesting product because it is applied prior to drying after bath/shower. The thick creamy hydrating body thins as it is applied, heated by your body temperature – making it easy to spread evenly. Not to mention that any unabsorbed lotion is gathered by your towel as you dry…allowing me to quickly dress – decreasing my morning ritual. This hydrating body moisturizer leaves my skin soft and moisturized. The scent is pleasant…not overwhelming.I do not like to use it on recently shaved areas – it does seem too irate the skin.

I remain a dedicated fan of those sexy Pantera shifters from the Bayou Heat series.How can Michel be completely obsessed...yet remain so distrustful of Dr. Chelsea Young? Author Alexandra Ivy answers that question in this brisk romantic romp. I love that these two were able to overcome their respective pasts and find happiness.Oh My God...Striker is so easy to love. I did not think it would be possible to replace the Geek God, Xavier, at the top of my book boyfriend list but it happened - Striker has done it. Twelve is also freaking amazing. She has been through so much and her strength is enduring. Thank You Laura Wright for the best installment EVER!!!I am still shocked by how much these authors are able to cram into these short snippets...these quickies are VERY well-written.Disclosure: This ebook was provided to me free of charge for the sole purpose of an honest review. All thoughts, comments, and ratings are my own.

I devoured the latest installment of Cynthia Eden’s Purgatory series. I love the world the author has created for her amazing characters to live (and find love) within.As leader of the FBI’s Para Unit, Eric Pate, makes a decision, issues an order and expects it to be followed without hesitation. However, his longstanding record of being unopposed is about to broken – along with his legendary control. Eric is unnerved by the protective instincts (and other emotions) that flare-up around the mysterious Ella.Why the hell did he feel as if he’d just found something he’d lost?Ella Lancaster was imprisoned and brutally tortured, nearly to death, by Keegan James. Recently freed she refuses to be confined…even if it for her own protection.“Do you enjoy watching me?” Ella Lancaster asked as she stared into the one-way mirror.Just watching. Day and night…watching…Eric’s story was very different then I imagined. Considering his standoffishness I was not sure how his emotions/desire would be revealed. He was very rigid in the previous releases, even toward his step-sister, Holly. However, the author did a spectacular job of not compromising his character yet allowed him the ability to reveal his emotional state. I wish Ella had shown us more of her softer side – I enjoy a kick-ass heroine…with a hint of girly-girl.Keep'em coming...Disclosure: This ebook was provided to me free of charge for the sole purpose of an honest review. All thoughts, comments, and ratings are my own.

Wow...these are great. We received these a little later than the recommended Spring planting dates for our zone,#6. We decided to start our pods indoor in a 5-gallon fish tank; then transplant at the end of June, except for the Spinach . The Spinach Fall planting date for our zone is August - we will plant it directly into the garden at that time.The plants have not reached maturity. They do look very healthy at the moment, except for the Basil...it is slightly wilted. Will update later in the growing season. This is a pricey alternative to seed packs.  Want to try the Watermelon...if these produce well.

I broke the Metatarsal and Phalange bones in my left foot 2-years ago, also damaged the toenail. Eventually, the toenail detached…a new toenail has since grown. The new toenail has been plagued by fungus. I have tried a few things including oral antifungal drugs, but the fungus seems to return. The fungus causes my nail to yellow and peel. I have been using this product for just under 2 weeks. The fungus is not completely gone, but the yellowing of the nail has been significantly reduced.This product is oily…applied with a dropper.

We received the 4-piece vibrant red heavy-duty utensil set. The set included a slotted turner, slotted spoon, splendid spoon and spaghetti spoon. These are well-designed; manufactured for ideal performance, ease and style. Our household loved 3 of the 4 utensils; mainly because we prefer our circular stainless steel spaghetti spoon.

One of the most frustrating things about having braces is the inability to properly floss. I have tried many things including the 2 most recommended things - floss threaders and the Waterpik Ultra Water Flosser. Even with the increased dexterity and control of these amusingly named Gumchucks nothing makes me happier then my monthly adjustment visits – so I can floss without the wires in the way.My twice a day brushing ritual is a follows (1st) floss with Gumchucks to loosen everything (2nd) Waterpik (3rd) Brush and (4th) rinse with fluoride. These have replaced the floss threaders.

My daily workouts are brutal, thanks to my intense trainer. Those sweaty workouts leave my clothes stiff and musty. Often a single wash does not alleviate that stale scent – that is where these help.  I only use these beads with my gym clothes, the dog belongings, towels and sheets…mainly because of my fragrance sensitivity.During my weekly shopping trip I tried out other scents – my favorite Radiantly Sunny.Looks very much like Dippin' Dot ice cream – so keep out of the reach of the kiddos.

Chance Valentine {Watch Me}, Lex Jenson {Want Me} and Devlin Shade {Need Me} maybe partners in VJS Protection, Inc. now, but they were friends/brothers-by-choice since childhood. If like this reader, you love to binge read romantic suspense then I recommend 1-clicking Cynthia Eden’s Dark Obsession series immediately.I do hate to play favorites, but Dev is just that – my favorite. Julianna sure is a lucky girl. I would love to listen to him whisper techno-geek jargon in that deep sexy voice of his into my ear…all-night long."...her taste made him feel a little drunk. Sweet but rich."Disclosure: This ebook was provided to me free of charge by Berkley for the sole purpose of an honest review. All thoughts, comments, and ratings are my own.

This is definitely a love story that needed to be told, but I felt that the couple never took center stage. There was always someone/something that took the focus from them. They were even on the outskirts of my favorite scene, the flat tire.I have enjoyed my previous trips to Blue Heron and have plans to return, as Kristan Higgins gives life to sexy local, Jack Holland in her upcoming release, In Your Dreams.Disclosure: This book was provided to me free of charge for the sole purpose of an honest review. All thoughts, comments, and ratings are my own.

This is an incredibly delicate and beautifully designed necklace. I do not typically wear a lot of gold-tone jewelry, but this is a favorite addition to my jewelry collection. I did have a difficult time pairing this with earrings. I ordered these Gold Filled Frosted Heart Design 4 Inch Drop Chain Earrings to complement the necklace, but was not happy with the match.  I'll update the review if/when I find uncover something to pair this with. I do wish the gold flake floated freely.It is packaged in an attractive navy blue gift box, ready for wrap and a bow.

We expected more from a product offered by 2 well-known name brands, Scott's and Oxi Clean. The product did an OK job on removing dirt and mildew from our plastic lawn chairs and a fair job of removing algae from our private fence and vinyl siding. We quickly tired of using the spray and sponge method and moved to spray and plastic bristle brush.Probably would not purchase this version, but would consider a similar mix for a pressure washer.

RaeAnne Thayne introduces readers to Haven Point in this light holiday themed romance. This is a spin-off from her popular Hope's Crossing series.“For an instant, she could picture it with vivid clarity – children filling the big house with laughter and excitement, Christmas music ringing through the space, the air rich with the smells of cinnamon and vanilla and pine. “Aidan Caine and Eliza Hayward relocated to the small town of Haven Point separately, but fate (or Mother Nature) has decided to put them on a collision course with love – pun intended. Aidan has decided to host his family’s Christmas celebration at his recently acquired ten-bedroom lakeshore lodge, known as Snow Angel Cove, and recruits Eliza to help host. The job offer was initially fueled by guilty, but he quickly realizes the holiday would not be the same without Eliza and her daughter, Maddie.While I did not love the ending...it is an overall amazing holiday read filled with romance, healing and lots of adorable moments.Disclosure: This book was provided to me free of charge for the sole purpose of an honest review. All thoughts, comments, and ratings are my own.
Works fine. I use them at my gym because there apparently have none.
Looks and feels cheap. Not a good value. Link adjustments are tricky even with the supplied tool and most will need to take to a watch dealer to adjust. I'd rather pay more for better quality.
Good case. I little thicker then I'd like but would recommend.
Mixes easily. Tastes great.
The flip open lid is tricky to get closed.
Not anything like a real pedal. A beginner would be fine with this but anyone else will be frustrated.

Does a great job of keeping things cold. My problem with this bottle is that its difficult to drink from unless you use the cup. When I'm working out I want to drink straight from the bottle. Doing so almost always means spilling your drink onto you, unless you are very deliberate about sipping slowly and carefully. I just want to drink and not have to concentrate on how to do it without making a mess. If you only plan to drink from the cup / cap then you'll find this to be a five start product.
Worked great, then had the very common dark screen issue. It then stopped working altogether. This is a VERY common problem. Avoid this product.
Great product. Saved me numerous times.
I love this stuff. A little goes a long way. My face feels cool and calm when applying this after a shave.

I love this series from the top to bottom. The acting is superb; costumes interesting. Hearing the word "swell" made me smile. I would have given a five, but at some points the storyline was not believable or maybe enough there was not enough background leading up to a daughter's hatred for the mother, from poor to rich, etc.. As far as entertainment, the best I've seen in a while. I'm as stuck on this as I was "Downton Abbey".
