The waist portion is THICK so they look very much like granny panties! The totally cover her belly button. Not that my daughter needs to look amazing in her underwear, but these are a much bulkier fit than Hanes brand. I don't like how they often show over her pants and shorts. She is a lanky girl but with a big baby belly still, so if you're girl is very slim these will be a poor fit. On the other hand, they are holding up better than Hanes with fewer hanging threads and unraveling hem lines.
Flimsy. The threads started coming apart of both of them after only a few months of use making them look rather crummy.

This is only good for dogs around 5 or 6 pounds or smaller. It's very small. It does a good job at keeping the pee out of the way. Poop, however, is pressed into the holes when walked on. It is also a little too flexible in the center. I am a trainer and had only one dog do well with this. Fortunately I was able to unload it to the owner. I won't be buying another one. I much prefer pads in a locking frame. Good quality absorbent pads are just as good as this (I love the All-Absorb pads sold here on Amazon). If you're looking to stop chewing, spray the pads with Bitter Apple or sprinkle with Tapatio for a few weeks or months and it won't be an issue after a while.
It worked well for the short time I used it. The bottle fell off the shelf ONCE and the whole top assembly snapped off and spilled the contents all over. Be careful!

Fun game and easy to play for my daughter. She was 3 when I got it and is 4 now. She can't read and can still manage to play the game on her own and does well at it. Her 5 year old brother likes it too.

Not excellent quality. After many washes they still feel a little stiff and make an audible rustling sound. The fit is loose on a full-thickness mattress with a mattress pad. It slips off a little too often. My son loves the set and I think it will last a couple of years, which is good, but we've had better quality for the same price.

This brush is SHARP!!! It has cut my fingers and it makes every dog I've tried it on whimper and shirk away. I made it a point to be more gentle, but then I hardly get any hair. And God forbid I graze my fingers! Ouch!! I bought one for the dogs and one for the carpet sweeper (to clean the bristles). It works very well for the carpet sweeper, but I won't use it on the dogs anymore.

UPDATE: After seeing my original review below the seller sent me a free replacement nozzle. It works perfectly! After a least a month I haven't had to tighten it once. It sprays better too. This is now a perfect product, and the customer service was above and beyond.  :)Original Review: Great size, pretty bottle, but the top keeps coming loose. :(  I have to make sure it's tightened every time I pick it up. I'm afraid that I will drop the glass bottle one day while spraying.
Comfortable and cute very well. They seem sturdy and should last for many years.

Very nice set and a good value. I love that they lock in a closed position. The assortment is useful and the silicone is gentle on teflon and ceramic pans. I use tongs for everything and never seem to have enough. Pairing this set with a set of small tongs, I have now tongs for everything. Yay tongs!

I had the older version of this set for about 6 years and loved it. Something about this new version feels awkward in my hands and the bristles are a little too flexible. It's still very good, but I wish they hadn't "improved" upon the older model.
These are SMALL. Not what i expected for $10. I see that they have dropped the price to $5 now. I wish I had paid that.

Though very much a pink color, it is a little too much on the nude side for me. I was going for more of a subtle but fun pink. This has a very mature look to it. Still a nice color, just not something I'd give a "candy" name to. Unfortunately it makes me think of the "flesh" tone of a CPR dummy.

I love this thing! Such a simple idea I never thought of before. I was lucky to see this as a suggestion from Amazon. It holds about 30 fluffy clips and helps them look good without being shoved in a drawer or accessory box. It's very cute when hung on the wall - useful and decorative.

This is a very colorful assortment of ribbons. It seemed like a great idea, but upon receiving it I regretted having so many bows that are the same style. I think also my daughter is just a little too old for these (she's 4). They are cute, and I use them often, but I think they would have been a better buy for ages 2 and under. But that is all my opinion and not a knock on the product itself. They are very well constructed, nice and fluffy and holding up well even when tossed in my purse for a while.

I received a free item for this review, but my opinions are my own.The backpack is very portable and easy to unpack/pack. It holds quite a bit. It is on the smaller side for a backpack, but then again it is portable. This is by no means a replacement for a real hiking backpack. I am not the sporting type and don't have any hiking equipment, so I did use this as my primary pack for a small family trip to the Grand Canyon. I just needed it for water bottles, a first aid kit, snacks, and miscellaneous small essentials. It came in very handy and took up practically no space in my luggage.One little thing I really liked is that the pouch that holds the backpack transforms into a small usable zipper pocket inside the bag when opened up. It's a pet peeve of mine that many manufacturers don't do this on foldable bags. Such a minor thing, I know, but an easy useful addition to the design.The only thing I really disliked about this pack, and the reason for losing a star, is that the mesh pockets on the sides for water bottles are only good for a standard 16.9 oz water bottle. I used two 24oz Contigo water bottles and they were a squeeze to get in, and they kept falling out anytime there was any slack in the bag, like if I squatted down to talk to one of my little kids, which was often. I was constantly having to put one or both bottles back in. It was very obnoxious. Eventually one of the bottles cracked on the lid from falling out so many times. And towards the end of our day I had lost a bottle completely (it's lying around out there somewhere).I also didn't think the bag felt very comfortable on my back. This was't a huge problem, as it's not something I would use often, but something worth noting. The bag seems built for smaller people, not this 5' 8" German-heritage lady!

Am I the only person surprised at how SMALL this book is?? Ok, I see now that the dimensions are listed under the Product Details. Admittedly I didn't look there. I glanced and saw that it was 448 pages and read the leading description, and EVERY OTHER BOOK of this nature that my son has ever checked out from the library has been a large, coffee table sized book. I was disappointed to receive something barely larger than a pocket book. I take full responsibility since it is in fact detailed online, however if this is an unusual size for this type of book, which it seems to be to me, I think it would be nice to mention that somewhere near the beginning of the description. It is still full of lots of great info and illustrations so I'll probably keep it for him, but I will need to get a second larger book to make this the Christmas present I intended it to be for my anatomy-obsessed 5 year old.  :)
Some of the clips, particularly the smaller bows, look hurriedly put together and don't smack of style. The assortment was as pictured and fine for the price.
Perfect match for my TV and the keyboard is very useful for quick searches on Pandora and Netflix!

I've had this on my phone for many months and it doesn't have a single scratch! I throw it in my purse, shove it in my pocket, let the kids play with it, set it face down, nothing but abuse and I swear it looks it as good as the day I put it on.

My son loves these books! I think they are overpriced for such small books but if I'm rating the quality (not the price) I'd give it five stars. These Minecraft mini-novels get my 7 year old reading something other than baby books. He tests at a 3rd/4th grade reading level but finds advanced readers and even small novels intimidating (anything with smaller print). I've been struggling with getting him past picture books. These are a great intermediary!
Very solid tripod for the average user! I don't need a fancy tripod and I didn't want to spend a lot of money on one. This tripod does not feel cheap, it's easy to use and it's at a great price.

The case fits perfectly and maintains the lovely appearance of my husbands white Note 4. He hates cases because they ruin the look of a lovely phone, but actually thinks this case adds to it. I highly recommend it!

Makes my nail polish last!! Paired with an Opi nail polish this pair of top and base coat made my nail polish last 10 days without a single chip. No joke! I went on a cruise, packed and unpacked, swam with a dolphin, shopped and other normal activities and my nail polish was solid the whole time. It wasn't until I was back at home a couple of days that I started getting a few chips, but that was after 10 days of perfection! I only had to remove my polish because my nails had grown out so much that I had a quarter inch unpainted at the base.I paired these with a cheap nail polish and it lasted 3 days when it would normally last 1. Of course I was back to work training dogs then so that may also have been a factor. Either way, I highly recommend this set.

Very nice! A little larger than I expected, but then I've always had a hard time visualizing size, even given measurements. I was really looking for something tiny, but these are fine too. They aren't huge at all. The a good, full-looking size on my 4 year old daughter and small-ish on me, if that makes sense! The stones are very sparkly without being gaudy. I wear one in my upper ear each day and like the variety of colors.

Works fine as a large filter for the fridge. But the spout is SLOOOOOOW. I leave the small refill lid open to allow air in, but I don't think that's sufficient since the whole filter assembly blocks all the air anyway. Plan on having your fridge open for a long time to get water for a family of 5 at meal time.

Even slower than my 1.5 amp charger. Also I picked this one out because it didn't look like it had an LED-lit plug-in (which I find annoying in the car at night), but it does. But I'm not rating it down for that. I give it one star because it charges my phone up 5% in 30 minutes. My 1.5 amp charger charged my phone about 1% per minute.

By far this is the best game case I have come across, but that's not saying much since every other case I have tried (and returned) was literally junk. This case is cute and functional, but the threads were coming apart even before I opened the package. But I was so sick of returns that I just kept it. I wish I had exchanged it now since it is getting pretty bad. The sleeves work well, but I don't expect the heat-pressed seems to last forever. I had to have a little practice lesson with my kids to show them how to squeeze the games out, not pull, because I am afraid they'll pull the seems apart if they aren't careful.

It looks good, though a little too masculine (I'm a woman). It looked classy online but more utilitarian in person. I did want a case that offers real protection and looks good - I got real protection and looks ok, which is fine. It has protected my phone from a few drops already. I can literally hear how lightly it hits the ground on both concrete and tile. I recommend a glass screen cover as well. The gold edge coordinates well with my gold toned phone and hasn't scratched yet after two months of being in a purse, pocket and even dropped. The case still looks brand new. What keeps it from being a five star case is that it makes the buttons on the side, especially the power button, very difficult to push. I have removed the case multiple times and tried to wiggle the button portion around for an optimal fit. I got it to be a little better, but it's still not great. It's annoying enough that I am keeping my eye out for a new case.

Very flimsy plastic. There is no protection from drops - no padding or cushion, just a plastic shell. Little more protection than a skin. The stand wouldn't stay open and when it would pop back into place it flipped the phone over onto its face. The buttons on the side, a large surrounding area around the buttons and the full bottom are exposed, keeping those areas free to be scratched. It also offers no protection for the face of the phone (no raised edge to keep the screen from being scratched when placed face down and no protection for the edges of the front of the phone). Nothing about this case offers any real protection at all. The grey frame clashed horribly with my gold toned phone so it didn't even look good. I thought it was a lovely case when I saw it online, but in the end it was pointless and was returned for a refund.
Very nice book! Simple yet educational descriptions. Tons of gorgeous photos. My 4 year old loves it.

The charm and chain are each beautiful on their own. However, this charm was made for a bracelet, not a necklace. It does not hang as shown. The chain crosses the heart shaped space, and the charm, being thicker and heavier on the top where most of the fingers are, hangs upside down. This is not wearable.  :(  See uploaded photo.

Impossible to put together, even for adults. My 5 year old son couldn't put it together at all. My husband and I got it a few times, but it got harder and harder as the pieces got messed up due to all the forced effort. The brain pieces don't stay together while to try to fit them into the skull which makes it even more difficult. We returned it and got a refund.

They look classy and are incredibly comfortable for tall heels. The heel isn't has tall as it looks since your toes are on a platform, so you get that stiletto look without killing your feet. My husband says they are very sexy!I wear a size 9 in US sizes, though typically an 8 1/2 in sandals and dress shoes. That should translate to a 39. But since others reported them being small I ordered a size 41, which is a 10 1/2 in US sizing. They fit perfectly and I probably would have fit in a 40. So I do recommend ordering something larger than you'd normally order.UPDATE: I do not handle high heels well, and I just love these! We went on a cruise and I wore them twice for dress up night. I was able to keep my balance on a tilting ship, even after a couple drinks.  ;)  I got several compliments and lots of looks. I highly recommend these shoes. You can pair them with a classy dress for a very stylish addition, or pair them with a sexy dress or lingerie for a very happy husband!

The case is made out of plastic, not leather. I was really hoping for leather since I had hoped it wouldn't split as easily as a plastic hinge. It seems flimsier than the official HTC one, which I just returned because the flap split off after a month of use. I haven't decided yet if I will return this one. If it breaks, at least it's only $13, not $30. I really do like the concept of this case. It's easier to use than a screen lock, it offers snazzy features, and I LOVE talking on the phone with it closed rather than having the screen against my face. I will probably keep it. And if they drop the price I'll just keep buying new ones when they break.UPDATE: I reviewed too soon. The plastic "hinge" started to split within two days of use. Returned for refund. I've given up on Dot View cases.  :(
These work very well. The flat shape does tend to kink, but it's not a big deal. The long length is very convenient. Great value.

These are great for not rolling out my ankles and falling on my butt in jazz dance class. I am 5'7'' 150lbs and I got the small/medium. They fit snugly, which is what I wanted. I didn't like the idea of the ones with the hole in the heel - I was afraid it would feel like it was cutting in around the heel. These do feel too tight around my foot after about an hour, but I only need them on for that long.

This thing is just COOL. My kids almost never play with it, but seriously, how awesome is a spider drone that shoots darts? I think it looses a lot of play value because it's slow. But I think as they get older it will get more use. They are 4, 5 and 6 now and well versed in the use of Nerf. This is a cool toy, at least for the parents.  ;)

These bags are a perfect fit. My machine makes 2 lb loaves that are long, not tall. Not the really long ones - it only uses one paddle, not two (Cuisinart CBK-100). These make loaves look lovely for gifts - and EVERYONE loves homemade bread as a gift! I love bread give these to people when I'm never sure if I should get them a gift or feel that I should but don't want to spend a lot of money and don't want to get something stupid. Bread feels luxurious, it's easy on the wallet, and it's universally loved!

I love how this sleeve stays in place. It's a little tight on my upper arm but not awful. I'm 5'7" 150 lbs and got the medium. I just need support for when I'm training dogs for a few hours a time so that I'm not hating life later. This is perfect, easy to get on and off, stays in place and doesn't look like a medical device. Nice.

I am 5'7'' and 150 lbs. These socks feel tight and they don't go as high as in the picture. And they slip down. Granted, I have fairly muscular calves but still, they fit perfectly on my 15 year old skinny-as-a-stick niece so I think they're meant for a smaller and more slender body type. They work under rolled up skinny jeans with combat boots since the jeans hold them in place (for about half the day), but I can't wear them with anything else. They are also much thinner than I expected with cable knit (was going for thick and cozy) and they're VERY slippery on tile and laminate flooring.

UPDATE:After several months - and very hot summer - of use, I have decided that the Simple Solution Stain and Odor Remover works better than this one. Really I would venture to say that it helps to alternate. Maybe they each kill different strains of odor-causing bacteria. If you aren't having great results, be sure to check out Simple Solution, even though it's labeled as an indoor product. The downside to that one, though, is that it has a stronger smell. I do love how this Simple Green one as no discernible odor of it's own. It still works very well and I'll leave my rating at 5 stars since I think I'm really trying to achieve the impossible (perfectly stink-free lawn) and I'm happy to have any help at all!Original Review:Works great on our artificial lawn. We live in Southern California and keep dogs at our home for training. We'll have up to 8 dogs pottying on about 1000 square feet of fake grass for two weeks at a time and it gets STINKY. We fill a hose-attached pesticide sprayer with this stuff and douse the yard. The smell is completely eliminated.In the summer we use this 1-2 times a week. There is then no smell for at least a day or two and then a very mild stink for up to a week before we have to apply it again.In the winter we use this only once every 3-4 weeks. There is no smell for about a week and then a tolerable smell for a couple more weeks.Be sure to spray this on the yard AFTER THE SUN GOES DOWN. The UV rays will kill the living enzymes and it won't work. I tried it. It won't even work on a cloudy day. Also, be sure to use a generous amount of water. Don't just spritz the grass, give it a good soak. We use about 16 oz for our 1000 square foot yard, but it takes about 15 minutes to apply it with a hose sprayer since we use a lot of water. We've experimented many different volumes of cleaner and water and this combo works well for us.

This seems to offer good support. They don't feel snug enough on my wrists, but then my wrists aren't hurting either so I guess they work well. I'm 5'7 and 150 lbs with fairly skinny wrists my body type and these feel loose (I got the medium). I am a dog trainer and have bad joints. If I don't wear support on both wrists and my right elbow while training multiple dogs over a few hours then I will be hurting within a few days. I use these supports and the elbow one and I feel fine. They are easy to get on and off and stay in place.

Nice quality, especially for the price. I was mistaken and thought they had suction cups. They don't, in case you are confused like me.The tip feels like a soft rubberized plastic. I didn't expect them to be such "gentle" darts. Huge plus with fully armed 4, 5 and 6 year olds.

They seem short and also too wide. They will work well if you have short chubby arms. I am by no means a very thin woman and they are too saggy on me and don't stay up and only reach up to about 3 inches below the elbow. I am 5'7'' and 150 lbs. They are still cute and I wear them, but they aren't what I would call true arm warmers - more like long fingerless gloves.

My kids LOVE these. They are just bright enough to ease fears of the dark, but dim enough to prevent most of the screwing around. I just bought 2 more so that each kid can have their own (because the most fearful of the three kept stealing it after the other 2 fell asleep). Having to by three is a bit pricey, but cheaper than the stuffed animal versions, and hopefully a good investment in the long run.

I have loved Canon for years because I had an amazing printer from them. When it sadly died I was eager to buy the newest model. What a piece of crap! Why? Here's the list.* I can't get it to print a straight line to save my life.* I can't print envelopes without every one - or EVERY one - getting jammed.* It also tells me there's a jam when there is no jam.* It goes through ink like crazy.* Part of that is due to the fact that the print heads constantly get clogged so I have to clean them all the time.* It resets the internet connection so that I have to re-enter the password (4 or 5 times in one year).* It decides to do some sort of maintenance or something almost every time I print so that it whirs and moves and thinks and does God knows what so that it takes 3 minutes before the first page is printed.* Did I mention it can't freakin' print a straight line??* The words look blurred or like they have a shadow effect.* The output tray is horribly designed. It is too large (the entire width of the printer) but the actual functional is so narrow that it can't support more than a few sheets of paper at a time so paper falls to the floor constantly.Seriously, I hate this printer so much that I doubt I will buy another Canon. Most of it's problems are so subtle that I didn't really catch on that it was the printer and not user error for too long so now I am stuck with it. Pros? NONE. To say works "good enough" is like paying $10 for a burger and saying, "Well, at least it isn't poison." No, I invested in what was supposed to be a good quality machine and got screwed. Sad face.

Perfect for my 5 year old. He's average height and this is a tad big for him but the handle is of course adjustable. He can use it just fine and it will fit him for probably 10 years, assuming it lasts that long. Good investment.

AWESOME. I can't believe how completely flexible these are, yet they still feel very sturdy. I assumed only the stems would be flexible, but the frame around the lenses is too, yet the lenses don't pop out! They are a perfect fit on my 5 year old with a kinda big head. Most sunglasses look way too small on him. These are nice and large but still kid-sized.

Amazing value. Perfect for chore charts at home. I misunderstood the description - and honestly I still don't see how I could have gotten it right when it says "Mini motivational stickers with everyday and holiday themes." I thought this book had everyday AND holiday themes in it. It is everyday ONLY - no holidays. Bit of a bummer but still a great buy. These stickers will last a couple years in our house so I wanted variety along with quantity. Perfect choice.

Poorly made. The hinges that fold the sides up gave out after the first use so the sides would no longer stay in place. Also with the first use the back panel fell apart - the thick ends are glued on to keep the panel from slipping through the slots and one fell off right away. I returned it immediately.UPDATE: I have ready many reviews stating that the return shipping didn't make it worth it. I went through Amazon's return process online and was able to ship it back for free. Make sure you go online and use Amazon to make the return.

Not kid-sized at all. I read so many reviews and didn't really get any help in sizing. Some say they fit kids as small as 4, but didn't mention what size they ordered. I was looking to not spend a lot of money so I got the 6-8 size as the price was good and it was the only one with free (Prime) shipping. I have 3, 5, 6 year olds. The socks fit ME and I am a size 9 in women's, 7 in men's. I fold them down for the kids but they slip down because they are so wide. I wasn't sure what the size 6-8 meant, but was hoping it was toddler or child sizes since the title of the product is "Kids Super Soft Fuzzy Socks." My kids wear toddler 10, 12 and youth 1 and these are much, much too large.

It's made of glossy paperboard and rather small. The necklace hooks are just a piece of flat cardboard that will bend with use right away. It's impossible to open and close the tiny drawers without supporting the entire case with your other hand. My husband got this for me as part of my birthday present. He was so apologetic it broke my heart. He said he didn't have time to return it and get something else, but that I could if I wanted to. I missed the deadline though, and maybe on purpose because I hated to return a gift he gave me. It is just so cheap, it's really a toy. His intention was to replace my old jewelry box, which this couldn't do. Very disappointing. I gave it two stars only because it is cute and I'm sure I'll find a use for it...though it's been sitting around just looking cute since October 2013.UPDATE: I have made an honest attempt to make use of this. I put most of my hair accessories in it. The little drawers are so hard to open and close. It's a two-hand job - one to hold the box and one to pry a drawer open. I find myself wearing the same clips and pins forever because I dread opening this thing up, and again closing it. It's such a chore. The large open areas - one vertical and one horizontal - are useless. I have to move the whole box to access anything so whatever I put there just falls out. I'm basically having to fully reload the box every time I access it. So sad.  :(((  If you want an expensive paper replica of the TARDIS then you will love this.

The sticky label on the socks wouldn't come off all the way so there is a gummy spot with a bit of paper stuck to it. I needed them for an outfit so wore them anyway for one evening. They were nice and snug (though very smooth and slippery). After one wash on gentle cycle in cold water and dried on low they are totally stretch out. They fit loose and baggy and won't stay up. Total waste.

They are not as absurdly tight as the Capezio ones we had before. They go one much more easily. Still very tight on my small 3 1/2 year old. But as she says, "They're tight because they're tights."  LOL. They are a bit long too, but these are for taller girls (4-6 year olds). I got this size to avoid them squishing her poochy baby belly. It would seem that dance tights don't take into consideration that very young girls still have a belly!

Nice playful lighting. I was hoping to replace the regular light bulbs in my room so I ordered two of these as the light fixture takes two bulbs. I was happy to be able to use a single remote to control both lights, but the normal white setting is too dim to use for regular lighting. So the regular bulbs went back in and I will have to buy a lamp to use these in.UPDATE: We bought two lamps to use as bedside lamps and put these bulbs in them. Very nice! So now we have his and her remotes and nice soothing lighting for TV time or you-know-what. But they are so dim that I can barely read a book even with the brightest setting.

Ok value for the money (54 each). I ordered two for my dog, 13 pounds. I sprayed them with Bitter Apple to prevent chewing as they are wood. The were easy to install. I found the latch to be difficult. We made the gates a little loose so that they only have to be lifted to be opened, disengaging the latch at the top.I had to use the extensions for the one in a hall, which I thought was a narrow hall. I did not use any extensions for the one in a doorway.UPDATE: Within a month one of the two gates I ordered stopped self-closing. Within another month the other one also stopped self-closing. I have tried adjusting things but no success. Since I am using these for a dog it's not a big safety concern for me, but be advised. We're fine with having to close them behind us.

The pink is a god awful pepto bismol puke pink. Fortunately it broke 5 minutes into using it (I put too much hair into it and it beeped and spit my hair out - then never took up hair again). I returned it, got a quick refund, then ordered the all-black one. Much better looking and no problems so far. It has beeped to tell me that I have too much hair it in many times and hasn't broken yet. It gives me a more natural, playful curl than a curling iron. I use the setting that alternates the curling direction. I get compliments frequently. Everyone thought I got a new haircut.I have very short hair, cut jut below my chin, with heavy layering. The shortest pieces on top are about 4-5 inches long. At the bottom the hair is maybe 3 inches long. I put it right up to my head and get a really good curl out of it. At the bottom it curls just enough to keep it from looking like curled hair over straight hair. I can make it loose or tight, depending on the settings I use. The only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is because for whatever reason I cannot get it to give a nice curl on the parts in front, to frame my face. I'm not sure what it is I'm doing wrong, but I figure it shouldn't be this difficult.I have naturally wavy hair with thick strands that usually has a hard time holding a curl. What helps me is to put in some Crew Fiber (men's product) in when my hair is wet. Just a SMALL amount. Dry naturally or with a hair dryer. The curl holds better and lasts to some degree all day long. Sometimes I'll re-curl a few spots if I need to look better in the evening.If you want a tight, classier, more controlled curl, do use a curling iron. This is great for a casual, fun look. Or a lazy day when you don't want to do a lot of work.UPDATE: After 6 months of very frequent use (practically daily) it is still going strong. Better yet, it doesn't kill my hair like my old curling iron. I can use it daily and my hair is still healthy. And it gives such a playful curl I get compliments ALL THE TIME. Just recently at dance class (YES! The curls hold up well in dance even when they're 12 hours old already!!) someone commented on how cute my curls were and another woman said Oh yes, she always has the cutest hair! Now I am a 35 year old tired soccer mom so it's a big boost to hear such commentary.  :)  I love this curling iron. Ok, it takes some getting used to, so give it a chance.  :)
Beautiful. I love how the theme is on all of the cards, not just the face cards. I was hoping for the brown set and got the blue one. I wish I could have chosen the color.
They fit my old GE trash compactor. Thick and sturdy. They leak slightly about 1/3 of the time, but it isn't a lot to clean up.

Simply does what it needs to do. Virtually no assembly. First one I bought (different product) broke when first loaded. This one has been going strong for 5 months. I love the robber ends since one side is up against a wall.This product is NOT adjustable. But it is the perfect size for what I need (which was for the 3 and 4 years olds to be able to reach their clothes).

I have been fighting warts for 4 years on my son. This has been the best product so far. One wart is already gone! We will keep using it. Many others are getting smaller.  :)UPDATE: I broke down and finally took my son to a dermatologist to have his warts treated. He underwent one very painful treatment, and I was instructed to use an at-home product for a month and bring him back (really just 2 weeks - one week of healing, 2 weeks of at-home treatment, and another week of treatment before his next visit). When we went back the dermatologist was amazed to see that all of the warts were 100% gone! She wanted to know what I used and I told her it was this product. So I don't know if this stuff is just that amazing, or if it was the combination on me treating him at home for long time first. Either way, I still strongly recommend this (maybe with the addition of a dermatologist's treatment).

Excellent value for your money. Yes, it's EXTREMELY shiny, as all silver is brand new. That will mellow out in a week of regular wear. And yes, you will never get that brand new shine back. This is normal for silver. Seriously, it looks weird anyway so who cares.Much inexpensive silver still contains trace amounts of nickel that cause me to develop a rash. This does not. As a person freakishly sensitive to nickel, I can safely say this is nickel free.  :)

Beautiful. Great value. I ordered 5 in different colors as gifts, filled with pictures. I wrote an inscription on the inside cover in the front, and taped one last picture on the inside cover in the back (with double stick tape). They came out lovely and were well received.

Beautiful. Great value. I ordered 5 in different colors as gifts, filled with pictures. I wrote an inscription on the inside cover in the front, and taped one last picture on the inside cover in the back (with double stick tape). They came out lovely and were well received.

I was truly leery about buying this swift.  I've been burned with cheep Chinese made products in the past.  But as someone that doesn't need to wind yarn into cakes all that often I just couldn't justify spending more than twice as much on a handsome wooden swift. But it got good reviews in general from other buyers so I thought I would give it a try.  After all, if it was a real disappointment I would rely on Amazon to make it right.Much to my surprise it works very well.  I used it with a Knit Picks ball winder to make 4 yarn cakes from super bulky yarn. It was fully assembled out of the box.  I clamped it onto my coffee table and it worked smoothly and easily. Can't say I love the green plastic (white? blue?) but that is certainly minor.  While not as esthetically pleasing as a wooden swift, which are so handsome and harken back to the "olden days" and wooden spinning wheels, this one is less expensive, lighter weight, and more compact to store. If I had a craft studio where the swift would remain up and visible all the time, maybe it would matter more. And yes, while it is early days still, I expect that this swift will work well for my purposes.

I've recently resumed knitting after a more than 30 year hiatus, due to the arrival of my first grandchild. Way back when I never saw yarn in hanks and never used a swift or ball winder. Only some of the yarn I've bought arrives in hanks, and I can't justify spending top dollar on equipment I only occasionally use.  I've learned that Knit Picks is a reliable company and I expect that they will stand behind their products.  There were a few winders that were less expensive but I chose this one because of the reputation of this company.I had no trouble setting it up, clamping it to my coffee table, or using it to wind four skeins of super bulky Spud & Chlo yarn.  The cakes are even, clean, and well wound.  I'm very pleased with everything except for the colors in the winder.  Silly, I know.  It is a rather muddy-milky coffee color and a drab burgundy.  How about red and white? Black and purple? Maybe next time...  By the way, the instructions for assembly and use are printed on the box.  Harder to lose that way!

I think I am going to love this cover! I have had a seat cover on my Lexus RXs since 2001.  I'm on the second Lexus and on the second golden retriever. I have tried and worn out several, each one different from the previous one as I'd never found quite the right cover. My last one, a Kurgo hammock style, wore out in less than two years. The fabric totally separated where the seat joined the back. I spent a lot of time studying options for a replacement. Eventually I settled on this one, despite the fact I've never heard of the brand, AND I would have to pay extra for shipping (not Prime eligible) AND wait much longer for delivery than I'm used to. But based on other user reviews here, and features I wanted and needed, I decided to make a leap of faith and give it a try.I needed a vertical half zipper between the backs of the two front seats because the only air conditioning that is directly blown into the back seat comes from the rear of the front seat center console and without that zipper opening no air flow would get back there.  I wanted a sling/hammock type to keep sand and dirt from the dog getting down on the floor. I wanted a non-slip backing that would not mar my light grey leather seats. I needed seat belt/LATCH access.It arrived today.  I am so impressed.  The top surface is black micro suede, and it is quilted (and I'm certain there is some batting between the layers) to a subtle gold smooth fabric backing with non-slip little bumps all over that is designed to keep it from sliding and keep the cover in place.  It has long flaps that protect the sides of the seat.  There are adjustable straps that go around the front and rear headrests (they have buckles that actually open, you don't have to try and slip them over the headrests), and for the first time in all the covers I've tried, there is a similar but much longer strap that goes horizontally around the back of the seat back to keep it snug.The fit and finish of this seat cover looks very good indeed.  I suspect that it will be very effective and will last a long time.  After using it for awhile with the 85 lb dog, as well as my infant granddaughter in her car seat, I will post an updated review. I've posted a picture with a corner of the back folded over onto the front so you can see the no slip bumps, as well as a photo of the three pockets, two with snap flaps, that are behind the driver's seat and could hold a ball, leash, treats or whatnot.

I bought this mirror to be able to see what my 5 month old granddaughter was up to in the back seat of my car. She only rides in it a few times a week but I felt an investment in a mirror would be a wise thing, especially since babies ride rear facing for so much longer nowadays. Her mother (my daughter) rode rear facing for less than a year, which was what was customary and recommended 30+ years ago. Now it is for at least 2 years and that is a long time not to see what's going on back there!  This mirror is terrific!  It is quite large which makes seeing her so easy. The mirror surface, while not glass (for safety's sake) is distortion free and was protected by an easy to remove film so it was clean and unscratched. It was very easy to install on my rear headrest with woven straps and secure adjustable buckles-one for up and down and one for side to side. The best thing for her is that she now sees "another" baby in the back to entertain her. And one day down the road she will realize that she can see me as well. I couldn't be happier. No, it isn't the least expensive such mirror that is available but I believe it is an excellent value and I like the fact that the seller is a small family owned company. Give it a try.  You can always return it if you're not satisfied, but I cannot imagine why you would!

I wanted to give some additional information that I couldn't find elsewhere. The toy is just as described by others. But inside the well padded toy via a Velcro closure in the back is a small plastic box that contains the business end of things.  There are two AAA batteries which are replaceable.  There is also a switch that the adult can set one of the three possible modes - including music and three languages (English, French and Spanish) describing "orange square" "green star" and so on.  There is an instruction sheet tucked way into the packaging, impossible to read until opened and easily missed. The volume is soft and so is the toy.  Perfect for tummy time and for young babies just beginning to discover their world.  Highly recommended.
what can i say?  They do exactly what they are supposed to do-filter the water.  It work very well.

I have a new grandchild and want to be able to take lots of photos of the two of us without having to rely on anyone else. I've only had a brief time with this but so far I'm very impressed. The quality seems excellent, and the item is well made and very easy to use. It securely holds my iPhone 5S in its battery pack by a simple pressure clamp. Nothing to attach or twist it turn. Just widen it, pop the phone in and allow it to close on its own. I'm very happy so far!

My 18 month old iPhone 5S got to the point where a battery pack became necessary.  Even with intermittent charging of the iPhone during the day I could run out of "juice" and I didn't want to spend the money to have Apple replace the battery. I had a Mophie case for my iPhone 4S and while I liked it very much, I wanted to spend less than that case had cost.  This Lenmar case is perfect.  The case is an excellent value at the price.  It feels substantial and sturdy without being heavy. It doubles the total battery life of my iPhone. It uses a microUSB connection for charging.  The red is a terrific pop of color. There is a switch on the back that turns off or on the connection between the pack and the phone. You can leave it on to have the iPhone have access to the battery pack, or wait until your phone needs it before turning it on. The subtle light on the back next to the switch indicates the level of charge remaining, from green to blue to red. I can't think of a single thing I would change about this pack. I'm very pleased indeed.

I couldn't get a full bodied, strong cup of coffee with these.  I bought the Keurig machine because there are now choices in making your own K cups at home, saving money and the waste of throwaways, as well as being able to use your own freshly ground favorite coffee.  I tried to get the same weight in the same grind of the prepared K cups, but the best I could achieve was a rather weak cup of coffee.  I've tried starting the brewing process, and then immediately stopping it, to wet the grounds and let them bloom (as was suggested at several coffee lovers websites), and then brewing just the smallest cup.  I think these allow the water to come through too quickly.  Unfortunately I do not seem to have the packaging, so I'm stuck with them.  It was a lesson in disappointing coffee.  I've tried the Java Jig and wasn't happy.  The stainless steel Ekobrew is next.  I'm determined to be able to get a full bodied, strong cup of coffee out of my Keurig.  I'm not looking for espresso.  Just something similar to my original drip machine!

Disappointing.  I have used Melitta products for many years.  I had hoped these would be the answer to my goal of getting stronger cups of coffee out of my new Keurig machine (yes, I do use freshly ground dark roast coffee), and to saving the trash caused by single use cups and being able to use my favorite coffee.I disassembled a prepared K Cup of my favorite coffee to see the grind and to weigh the amount.  I mimicked both using my electronic kitchen scale.  But even using the smallest cup setting I couldn't get it to taste right.  And after using the Java Jig only twice, the bottom of it is no longer round, but rather triangular shaped.It isn't worth my trouble to send it back, I don't think, but I am very disappointed.  I'm trying the stainless steel Ekobrew next.

Beautifully made, heirloom quality kitchen tools.  Yes, they are pricey.  But after having bought several kitchen scoops for cookie baking and having them fail, eventually, to properly sweep and scoop out the dough, I got tired of fighting with my old ones (one was a recent OXO brand that I had high hopes for) and splurged on these.  They are American made, by a family owned company who only make a few things.  I'm not sure why cookie scoops are a mainstay of their line but they are.  The set is packaged nicely enough for a wedding or shower gift.  I mean, who has velveteen drawstring bags for their kitchen tools?  They also have a lifetime warranty.  AND once you register them with the company, they offer you a PDF download of a cookie cookbook - sugar, chocolate chip or peanut butter.  The peanut butter one I requested is over 80 pages!I don't know that i will have enough years left to really put them through their paces, but I do know that I can pass them onto my children who can enjoy them for many more years to come.They do exactly what they are supposed to do, and do it well.

These were disappointing.  They arrived damaged, with several of the flutes on the side of one of the cutters bent and or broken.  It didn't help that they were shipped in a padded bag instead of a box.  But I returned them as having arrived damaged, and decided to order,  instead, Prepworks from Progressive International GCC-8 Biscuit Cutters, Set of 7  Similarly priced, with more than twice the sizes, and much better made.

Just what I wanted!  My old tin fluted biscuit cutters were tired and rusty.  This set is a wonderful replacement.  There are several sizes, they are two sided so they will cut fluted and plain, and they nest.  If you pick them up one way they all separate from one another.  The other way, they stay "connected" and nested!  Clever idea!  And no rust!  I'm not sure I'll ever use all the sizes, but these colorful, dishwasher safe cutters are a cheerful and effective addition to my kitchen.  I'm very pleased!

As I've been trying to rid my house of what I believe is a single mouse (and having laid snap traps around) I thought I would add this to my arsenal.  While dubious of its efficacy, I did read positive reviews of it and similar products, so I figured what the heck.  Well, I am returning it.I frankly have no idea whether it works or not.  What I can say is that the package "instructions" and "description", including the name of the product, is written in the most peculiar version of English, with any number of mysterious language words I've ever seen.  I'm sure that most of us have encountered the rather charming efforts that non-native English speaking people/companies that can appear on directions, assembly instructions, and so on.  This goes way beyond it.  Frankly I don't think anyone who is half-way fluent in English wrote the copy.  There is NO manufacturer name, contact information, location and so forth on the product.  I've no way of knowing whether it was made in China, Thailand or elsewhere.There certainly isn't remotely $20 worth of materials and manufacturing in it.  Moreover, while it is supposed to be inaudible to human ears, that isn't the case.  I decided that I wasn't comfortable with the whole thing and contacted Amazon Customer Service.They graciously offered to give me a full refund with no return shipping charge, or a 40% discount if I wished to keep it.  They also offered me overnight shipping for a replacement product. I have decided to return it.  I don't know if I will replace it with a competitor's product.I encourage you to be cautious about this.  It may not be what you think it is, or may not work in the way you expect.

This is a wonderful book, and if you have any desire to learn to smock, I would grab a copy as it is out of print.  My mother gave me a copy 34 years ago when I had a newborn daughter.  I was able to teach myself to English smock from just this book alone.  Over the next several years I made over a dozen heirloom quality smocked dresses for my daughter.  Some are bishop dresses (round neck, raglan sleeved dresses that are gathered into the neckline) and some are yoked dresses where the pleats go across the bodice.  One of the best parts of this book are the instructions of how to adapt clothing pattern to heirloom quality clothing-changing a zipper closure in the back to classic buttons, making an extra deep hem to add drape and body (and possibly to be able to drop the hem halfway to accommodate growth), adding a sash for a beautiful bow at the back, and so on.  Having an 8" deep hem looks elegant.Not all patterns in the book are smocked but many are. There is a kilt pattern and a sailor suit, a smocked pillow, christening gown, romper, etc. If you are a reasonably capable seamstress you can make incredibly beautiful clothes for your children or grandchildren. And now my daughter is expecting her first child, a girl, in a few months, and while I've saved all the dresses I made for her, I will make some new items for my granddaughter. I'm so glad I've saved my copy of this book!There is a wonderful website for smockers called Garden Fairies Trading Company (www.smockingbooks.com).  They have been in business for many years.  They have patterns, supplies, and help.  There are pleating machines that can save you some effort in making the pleats that are the basis of smocking.  They aren't inexpensive but may be worth it.  Back when, I used iron on dots that I used to hand pleat my fabrics before smocking, and this website has those for sale as well.Between this book and the resources at Garden Fairies, you will be in great shape to make gorgeous clothes!

Just what you need for seed starting. I've used these many times in the past, and this bulk price is very good. They are great for starting sweet pea seeds.  Just transplant in their final spot in your garden, and there is no disruption of the tender seedling.  Perfect.

This is just what I was looking for.  I bought a lovely Kate Spade handbag but it had few pockets and I wanted a way to easily transfer all those items I need from one handbag to another. This will not hold anything but the smallest fold over wallet, but I didn't need it for that.  I use it for my keys, lipsticks, Bluetooth earpiece, pack of gum, pen, and compact. It is made of a very attractive and sturdy vinyl-like coated fabric.  It stands up by itself so it is easy to reach in to find what you need.  There are larger orgainzers (and one made by this company) that would be more appropriate for a larger tote bag or handbag, but this medium size is perfect for me.  I'm very pleased indeed.

This is a wonderful British magazine.  It is hard to find in the few remaining bookstores' magazine section and enjoying it monthly when it arrives in my mailbox is much simpler and easier than chasing it down.  It is full of interesting articles and wonderful photos.  This is the least expensive way I've found to read it.  Do give it a try!

I had this range installed about 6 months ago. It replaced a nine year old Frigidaire gas range which was generally satisfactory but I was always frustrated with the lack of speed of the burners, despite the fact that it had what was, at that time, about the highest BTU burners available on a regular gas range.  Water took ages to boil, and with pasta, it almost never came back up to a real boil before the pasta got soft and stuck together without the benefit of a proper boil.This new one has a more "pro-style" appearance, much sturdier iron grates, and wow, the burners! The 11,000 BTU burner in the old one has morphed into a 17,000 BTU in the right front, and the next more powerful one is 15,000 BTU in the left rear.  That means the fastest burner is nearly 50% more powerful than the old one, and boy, does it show!  Water boils so quickly I can scarcely believe it.  I can stir fry in a wok! There is a long oval center burner that I've not had occasion to use.  The grate for it can be replaced with an included griddle, for pancakes, eggs and bacon, and more.  I expect it will be very useful for making my Thanksgiving turkey gravy.  The roasting pan will fit very nicely on it.The convection oven is terrific, but I have found it takes longer to preheat than the beep would indicate.  I've no idea why I would want a "pizza" setting, however. I've not tried the broiler as I use an outdoor grill, but I expect it would work as well as any gas broiler, moderately well.  I've also not yet the need to use the self cleaning cycle but as it worked very well in the old range I expect it will do so with this one. I love to bake and have found the convection oven allows me to actually bake three pans of cookies at a time very evenly.  I expect to put the flexible half shelf to use this Thanksgiving, stacking the stuffing and vegetable casserole to the side of the turkey, and that will give me a chance to try out the temperature probe (and undoubtedly the self cleaning feature!).My only caveat about the rack that pulls out when the oven is opened is to be careful of it.  It must be the lower rack, and it will make it easier to burn your hands as it is raised up higher than the oven door when the door is open.  Just be aware of it, and know that you can disable this feature if you choose to.I feel that there is excellent value in this gas range, and as an avid and skilled cook and baker, I'm enjoying it to the max.  I paid about $900 for it.  A great price for an excellent range. I cannot imagine how a range costing twice as much could improve my cooking. I couldn't be happier!
A very nice way to show your support for England.

I bought this oven as part of a package on Groupon, but not until I'd read all the reviews here and on several forums on the web.  After all, one doesn't buy a $400 outdoor oven on a whim.  At least I don't.  And yes, I had some concerns after reading that some buyers had received either defective ovens or parts damaged in shipment.  I was encouraged to know that Blackstone responded immediately to everyone who had trouble. When I was unpacking I had my heart in my throat expecting a broken or bent piece. Everything was perfect. I was incredibly lucky. But you'll be in heaven once you get it up and running.  Mine is just 10 days old.A few suggestions based on my very recent experience:You will need a AA battery for the igniter (insert bottom end first - which the directions don't tell you), and you will need two D batteries for the motor.  My suggestion is to take advantage of the opportunity and insert the D batteries in the motor before you connect it to the oven.  Of course, you'll have to eventually replace the batteries while the motor is on the oven, but at least you'll have a chance to see what's what without getting way down and looking up into the battery compartment later on!If you've not bought a thrust bearing to help with the rotation of the tray, please consider it.  I read about it here in the reviews of the oven here on Amazon.  It apparently makes a huge difference and it costs under $12. Look at 51205 Thrust Bearing 25x47x15 Thrust Bearings. 51205 Thrust Bearing 25x47x15 Thrust Bearings You place it on the horizontal cross member that the stem of the rotating tray goes through (obviously around the hole for the stem) and just thread the stem through the thrust bearing and the cross member, and it rotates so smoothly on those bearings!After buying one thermometer that only went up to 715'F, I exchanged it for this model-the least expensive model that measures over 1,000'F (to give some latitude) this is the one I got from Amazon and am using:TopG TG8550 -58 to 1022°F Instant-read IR Infrared Thermometer Non-contact Temperature Gun with Laser Sight Targeting Pointing range -50 to 550°C Celsius or Fahrenheit; Built in infrared (IR) sensor and LCD screen with backlight; Battery includedThere are several models on the same page.  I got the royal blue one. It was the one that met my criteria.The pizza took three minutes and ten seconds to bake.  The laser temperature of the stone was about 700' and the air temp shown on the built in oven thermometer was about 400'.  The pizza had only been in the oven for under 10 seconds when I got the filming going.Here is a link to the 3 min You Tube video showing my pizza bianca baking.  It had only been in the oven for fewer than 10 seconds when I got the camera rolling:http://youtu.be/AGqah_VS60gI've made a couple of different pizza doughs from Peter Reinhart's book American Pie: My Search for the Perfect Pizza pizza book last night for the next baking trial.  I can't wait to try more!  This is an excellent book, highly recommended.BTW, it was suggested to me to have both a wooden peel and a metal one.  Assemble unbaked pizzas on the wooden one, remove them from the oven with the metal one. There are a lot of wooden peels out there.  I did splurge on the J.K. Adams handmade alder wood one, made in the US.  It was about $37, but it is beautiful and has a lifetime warranty. I've read posts in various places of wooden or bamboo peels cracking or splitting. This may be a case of you get what you pay for.  I find using semolina flour on the peel to be a wonderful way to keep them from sticking and to have them slide nicely onto the baking stone as it is more granular than regular flour.I buy just about everything I can from Amazon, mostly because they have excellent prices and better service and it saves me a whole lot of time.  Sure, I do live in San Francisco and I can get just about anything I want here, but shopping isn't my favorite thing to do.The peel is the J.K. Adams 23-3/4-Inch-by-14-Inch Alder Wood Pizza Peel. $37.I do try to support US manufacturers when I can (just bought a US-made kitchen range too) and this is a family owned company in your neck of the woods, Dorset, VT. 2nd generation.  There's a lot of information about the company here on Amazon's website.I also used John Boos Mystery Butcher Block Oil on the peel. John Boos Mystery Butcher Block Oil, 16 ouncesOne of the reasons I chose this oven over the Pizzeria Pronto or the Uuni wood pellet oven was to be able to cook other things in addition to pizzas.  To that end I looked for a pan that could handle high heat and would fit in the oven, and that cost as little as possible.So I chose the Lodge L9OG3 Pre-Seasoned Round Griddle, 10.5-inch, (Amazon item ASIN: Lodge L9OG3 Pre-Seasoned Round Griddle, 10.5-inch)  $13.79. It is on its way and will be here today.  I plan on cooking salmon, steaks, shrimp, chicken.  I think this is relatively new territory here, and we all will learn.I think you'll find that making your own dough is NOT difficult, especially if you have a sturdy stand mixer or food processor. I do bake a lot (but have less yeast dough experience) and highly recommend King Arthur flour.  You may know they sell a gluten free flour ($7.95 for 24 oz, unfortunately) that gets fry positive reviews.  I don't know what your frozen pizza dough is like, but I encourage you to give making your own dough a try.  It is very satisfactory and highly rewarding.Amazon carries Caputo Double 00 flour, and if you get a pack of 10 one kilo bags the shipping is free.  The price is what I pay locally for mine, and you can get it just about anywhere. Antimo Caputo Chef's Flour, 2.2 Pound (Pack of 10)  There are lots of ways to make dough, and I also use King Arthur's bread flour, available in many grocery stores as well as from their website.  Prices here on Amazon are pretty high.San Francisco backyards (if you have one at all!) are not generally known for being spacious, and mine is no exception.  Devoting some of it to my small Weber grill and now to this oven is huge.  I have no space to assemble my pizzas outside. I do what you seem to do outside and have everything laid out in my (also small) kitchen and move them to the oven on the wooden peel, and bring them back to the kitchen on the metal peel that came with the Groupon offer. That allows me to assemble the next pizza on the wooden peel while someone else keeps an eye on the one in the oven.It is a learning process.  Yum, yum, yum!

I received this cover as part of my Groupon deal for the oven, a metal peel, and this.  I was expecting some half-baked (no pun intended) vinyl former garbage bag wanna-be cover.  No way.  It is very heavy, excellent quality woven fabric with a water resistant (proof?) backing, and it conforms nearly exactly to this not easy to fit outdoor pizza oven. Given that the cover also covers two side shelves, this is no mean feat! The 'sleeves' for these shelves have wide heavy elastic bands that go under the shelves and the sleeves completely cover the shelves and wrap over the ends by some considerable way, and has elastic there as well.  No doubt this is designed to keep them in place even in windy conditions.  The Blackstone name is very handsomely embroidered in front in two colors.  It is certainly worth $50.  And if you live in a harsh climate, I would think it is essential.  I'm frankly delighted to have it, even though I live in San Francisco and our climate can hardly be described as anything close to "harsh".I love the oven, and this cover is just icing on the cake.

Excellent Italian bitter almond amaretti cookies at a very reasonable price. Just keep them airtight once open and they will stay crisp. I like a few crumbs sprinkled on top of my butternut squash ravioli with brown butter and fried fresh sage leaves in the traditional Italian style.
Well crafted. Works just great with my new Blackstone pizza oven to keep the baking stone topped turntable moving smoothly.

I've just bought an outdoor pizza oven (Blackstone 1575) and needed a wooden peel to supplement the metal one I got with the oven. I've read many reviews of them here, and kept getting hung up on wooden peels that split or warp or in some way fail...  And I really wanted a US made product. So, having used this company's goods before, and the fact that this comes with a lifetime warranty, I just bit the bullet and ordered it.It is lovely.  Smooth and silky, with a nice taper at the rounded tip.  It was perfect to assemble my pizzas on it (sprinkled with semolina) and slip them into the oven.  I use a metal peel to retrieve the cooked ones.I also used John Boos' Mystery Butcher Block food grade oil to protect this peel.  A couple of coats look grand.  I'm sure this will last a very long time.  Highly recommended.

What could be simpler?  Hammer one or two of these stakes near your rose bushes, and your fertilizing chores are over for the year.  No mess, no spillage, and it all goes right to the root zone.  They make all sorts for different garden and house plants.

Very nearly perfect!  The OOK series of hooks are easy as pie to use, sturdy, leave very tiny marks in the walls, and are made to hold up just about anything, from lightweight to very heavy.  Best I've used...

I've been on a long hunt to essentially replicate the two piece Smart Cover case for my original iPad 2, and it has been very frustrating. With that iPad I used an Apple real leather Smart Cover with another vendor's soft gel back cover. It worked perfectly for my needs for three years. I assumed it wouldn't be difficult to get a similar solution for my brand new iPad Air but that was a wrong assumption. I really wanted genuine leather, and I found that many cases that say "leather" mean PU leather, which is a polyurethane coated leather derivative. Be aware of what you are buying, if it matters to you.Apple no longer makes a real leather Smart Cover, only a Smart Case that covers the back as well, but it is $79.99 and it doesn't feel as much like real leather as I wanted. I thought I could do better. I wanted sleep/wake function with the cover, I wanted the back protected with something that would keep the iPad from slipping on a desk or other surface, and I wanted to be able to easily use the iPad in the lower propped up typing position, as I use the virtual screen keyboard about 95% of the time. When I travel and have to do a great deal of writing I take a separate Bluetooth keyboard with me. And I wanted the case to be red, preferably.This case was one I did buy but returned:Belkin Quilted Cover / Case for iPad Air (iPad 5) (Ruby), $39.99 ASIN: B00F6A5TEG. Very nice looking despite not real leather. But the frame that holds the iPad doesn't lie flat enough for me to type on virtual keyboard. The most feminine looking case and very attractive. I wish the typing position was better.This ended up being the the last case I bought and kept:StilGut Couverture Genuine Leather Case for Apple iPad Air with Smart-Cover Function, Red, ASIN: B00GXCJ8LQIt is bright red, it is beautifully crafted, and it securely holds the iPad Air without covering any of the edges of the iPad Air's screen, what I call the "frame" around the screen.This case has a fairly stiff back cover that grips the iPad Air quite securely. The entire iPad is covered in red leather, and the case is lined in black suede or suede like fabric with the StilGut name woven or stamped in. All buttons and ports are open and useable. The red color is beautiful, and exactly the red color I sought. It also comes with a two year warranty, and feels better made than the Apple Smart Case, at the same price. My only quibble is that I would have preferred to have had smooth textured calfskin or similar, not the textured leather this case is made with. But it seems I couldn't have everything I wished, and this beautiful case came the closest.I've found that many cases do count on the iPad being secured by the case itself using pieces of leather or faux leather to cover the frame, showing only the screen. But that type of frame prevents my thumbs from easily reaching the virtual spacebar and prevents me from typing effectively.The StilGut company is a new one to me, but is apparently a highly regarded German firm, long established. I feel very confident that should any issue arise during the two year warranty period they will stand behind their product. Their website shows many products for tablets and phones in many colors and styles.These are the other iPad Air cases I tried, bought, and returned. The AISN number is Amazon's in house stock number and you can find any of these cases by doing a search with that number.i-Blason 5th Generation i-Folio Slim Hard Shell Stand Case Cover for Apple iPad Air (iPad5-iFolio-Red), $24.99 ASIN: B00G3NDFW8 (grip holding the iPad Air was right, but I didn't love the texture).Jisoncase Red Genuine Leather Smart Cover Case for iPad Air JS-ID5-01C30, $74.99, ASIN: B00GNXJK0O, but ended up returning it read further to learn why. I have nothing but high praise for the Jison's vendor, TheCase's outstanding and accommodating customer service. Very personalized service. Excellent help. However the 2 yr warranty on the StilGut case won me over, however, over the 180 day Jison offered.Fintie SoftGel TPU Back Case Smart Cover Partner for Apple iPad Air (iPad 5 5th Generation) Slim Fit Compatible with Smart Cover - Clear, $4.99 ASIN: B00G7BKC3Q Kept the back cover, although it is not clear but frosty. I've been on a long hunt to essentially replicate the two piece Smart Cover case for my original iPad 2, and it has been very frustrating. With that iPad I used an Apple real leather Smart Cover with another vendor's soft gel back cover. It worked perfectly for my needs for three years. I assumed it wouldn't be difficult to get a similar solution for my brand new iPad Air but that was a wrong assumption. I really wanted genuine leather, and I found that many cases that say "leather" mean PU leather, which is a polyurethane coated leather derivative. Be aware of what you are buying, if it matters to you.Apple no longer makes a real leather Smart Cover, only a Smart Case that covers the back as well, but it is $79.99 and it doesn't feel as much like real leather as I wanted. I thought I could do better. I wanted sleep/wake function with the cover, I wanted the back protected with something that would keep the iPad from slipping on a desk or other surface, and I wanted to be able to easily use the iPad in the lower propped up typing position, as I use the virtual screen keyboard about 95% of the time. When I travel and have to do a great deal of writing I take a separate Bluetooth keyboard with me. And I wanted the case to be red, preferably.This case was one I did buy but returned:YOOBAO Executive Genuine Leather Case for Apple iPad Air/iPad 5 Tablet With Auto Wake / Sleep Function Rose, $37.99 ASIN: B00GNU30QW nice enough leather, but same frame issueThis ended up being the the last case I bought and kept: StilGut Couverture Genuine Leather Case for Apple iPad Air with Smart-Cover Function, Red, ASIN: B00GXCJ8LQ It is bright red, it is beautifully crafted, and it securely holds the iPad Air without covering any of the edges of the iPad Air's screen, what I call the "frame" around the screen.This case has a fairly stiff back cover that grips the iPad Air quite securely. The entire iPad is covered in red leather, and the case is lined in black suede or suede like fabric with the StilGut name woven or stamped in. All buttons and ports are open and useable. The red color is beautiful, and exactly the red color I sought. It also comes with a two year warranty, and feels better made than the Apple Smart Case, at the same price. My only quibble is that I would have preferred to have had smooth textured calfskin or similar, not the textured leather this case is made with. But it seems I couldn't have everything I wished, and this beautiful case came the closest.I've found that many cases do count on the iPad being secured by the case itself using pieces of leather or faux leather to cover the frame, showing only the screen. But that type of frame prevents my thumbs from easily reaching the virtual spacebar and prevents me from typing effectively.The StilGut company is a new one to me, but is apparently a highly regarded German firm, long established. I feel very confident that should any issue arise during the two year warranty period they will stand behind their product. Their website shows many products for tablets and phones in many colors and styles.These are the other iPad Air cases I tried, bought, and returned. The AISN number is Amazon's in house stock number and you can find any of these cases by doing a search with that number.i-Blason 5th Generation i-Folio Slim Hard Shell Stand Case Cover for Apple iPad Air (iPad5-iFolio-Red), $24.99 ASIN: B00G3NDFW8 (grip holding the iPad Air was right, but I didn't love the texture).Jisoncase Red Genuine Leather Smart Cover Case for iPad Air JS-ID5-01C30, $74.99, ASIN: B00GNXJK0O, but ended up returning it read further to learn why.  I have nothing but high praise for the Jison's vendor, TheCase's outstanding and accommodating customer service. Very personalized service. Excellent help. They bent over backwards to help me and I'm sure they would for you. However the 2 yr warranty on the StilGut case won me over, however, over the 180 day Jison offered.Fintie SoftGel TPU Back Case Smart Cover Partner for Apple iPad Air (iPad 5 5th Generation) Slim Fit Compatible with Smart Cover - Clear, $4.99 ASIN: B00G7BKC3Q Kept the back cover, although it is not clear but frosty. Excellent customer service. Very responsive.Fintie Apple iPad Air Case - Ultra Slim Leather Standing Case with Smart Cover Auto Sleep / Wake Feature for iPad Air 5 (5th Generation) - Pink $9.99 ASIN: B00IFUCQMM horrible bright color, has wide frame that interferes with typingFintie Blade X1 iPad Air Keyboard Case - Ultra Slim SmartShell Stand Cover with Magnetically Detachable Wireless Bluetooth Keyboard for Apple iPad Air / iPad 5 (5th Generation) - Red $24.99 ASIN: B00J7F2XYK (amazing portable keyboard, case is nice if you will always use keyboard, but no way to prop up for virtual keyboard use otherwise. Keyboard is available separately as:Fintie (Black) 7 inch Ultrathin Bluetooth Wireless Keyboard for iPad mini, iPad mini with Retina Display, iPad 2/3/4, iPad Air (Function Keys For Apple iOS only) $19.99 ASIN: B00D85YFUKCaseCrown Bold Standby Pro Case (Red) for Apple iPad Air with Sleep / Wake, Hand Grip, Corner Protection, & Multi-Angle Viewing Stand, $16.99 ASIN: B00BISWNLC. Impressive protection, nicely made, but same frame problem, faux leather.Belkin Quilted Cover / Case for iPad Air (iPad 5) (Ruby), $39.99 ASIN: B00F6A5TEG. Very nice looking despite not real leather. But the frame that holds the iPad doesn't lie flat enough for me to type on virtual keyboard The most feminine looking case. Wish the typing position was better.Snugg iPad Air (iPad 5) Case in Black Leather - Flip Cover and Stand with Automatic Wake / Sleep, Elastic Hand Strap & Soft Premium Nubuck Fibre Interior to Protect Apple iPad Air (iPad 5) - Includes Lifetime Guarantee $29.99 ASIN: B00EYDTA3W (same frame issue)And from Sena-my first choice:Sena Florence for iPad Air (Navy - 845192) $79.99 ASIN: B00JFI08L4I bought the red one at Sena's site. I loved it most of all and would have kept it save for the leather frame around the screen. Most beautiful leather, gorgeous hand, stunningly beautiful. Wish I could have kept it.I hope you will find this review helpful.
