Very responsive.Fintie Apple iPad Air Case - Ultra Slim Leather Standing Case with Smart Cover Auto Sleep / Wake Feature for iPad Air 5 (5th Generation) - Pink $9.99 ASIN: B00IFUCQMM horrible bright color (I had hoped for a nice pale pink), has wide frame that interferes with typingFintie Blade X1 iPad Air Keyboard Case - Ultra Slim SmartShell Stand Cover with Magnetically Detachable Wireless Bluetooth Keyboard for Apple iPad Air / iPad 5 (5th Generation) - Red $24.99 ASIN: B00J7F2XYK (amazing small portable keyboard, case is nice if you will always use keyboard, but no way to prop up for virtual keyboard use otherwise. Keyboard is available separately as:Fintie (Black) 7 inch Ultrathin Bluetooth Wireless Keyboard for iPad mini, iPad mini with Retina Display, iPad 2/3/4, iPad Air (Function Keys For Apple iOS only) $19.99 ASIN: B00D85YFUKBelkin Quilted Cover / Case for iPad Air (iPad 5) (Ruby), $39.99 ASIN: B00F6A5TEG. Very nice looking despite not real leather. But the frame that holds the iPad doesn't lie flat enough for me to type on virtual keyboard. The most feminine looking case. Wish the typing position was better.Snugg iPad Air (iPad 5) Case in Black Leather - Flip Cover and Stand with Automatic Wake / Sleep, Elastic Hand Strap & Soft Premium Nubuck Fibre Interior to Protect Apple iPad Air (iPad 5) - Includes Lifetime Guarantee $29.99 ASIN: B00EYDTA3W (same frame issue)YOOBAO Executive Genuine Leather Case for Apple iPad Air/iPad 5 Tablet With Auto Wake / Sleep Function Rose, $37.99 ASIN: B00GNU30QW nice enough leather, but same frame issueCaseCrown Bold Standby Pro Case (Red) for Apple iPad Air with Sleep / Wake, Hand Grip, Corner Protection, & Multi-Angle Viewing Stand, $16.99 ASIN: B00BISWNLC. Impressive protection, nicely made, but same frame problem, faux leatherAnd from Sena-my first choice:Sena Florence for iPad Air (Navy - 845192) $79.99 ASIN: B00JFI08L4I bought the red one at Sena's site. I loved it most of all and would have kept it save for the leather frame around the screen. Most beautiful leather, gorgeous hand, stunningly beautiful. Wish I could have kept it. I've owned two of their iPhone cases and love the quality and feel of the leather.  Stunning.  Really wanted to keep this one.I hope you will find this review helpful.

I've been on a long hunt to essentially replicate the two piece Smart Cover case for my original iPad 2, and it has been very frustrating. With that iPad I used an Apple real leather Smart Cover with another vendor's soft gel back cover. It worked perfectly for my needs for three years. I assumed it wouldn't be difficult to get a similar solution for my brand new iPad Air but that was a wrong assumption. I really wanted genuine leather, and I found that many cases that say "leather" mean PU leather, which is a polyurethane coated leather derivative. Be aware of what you are buying, if it matters to you.Apple no longer makes a real leather Smart Cover, only a Smart Case that covers the back as well, but it is $79.99 and it doesn't feel as much like real leather as I wanted. I thought I could do better. I wanted sleep/wake function with the cover, I wanted the back protected with something that would keep the iPad from slipping on a desk or other surface, and I wanted to be able to easily use the iPad in the lower propped up typing position, as I use the virtual screen keyboard about 95% of the time. When I travel and have to do a great deal of writing I take a separate Bluetooth keyboard with me. And I wanted the case to be red, preferably.I did buy this Jison case: Jisoncase Red Genuine Leather Smart Cover Case for iPad Air JS-ID5-01C30, $74.99, ASIN: B00GNXJK0O, but ended up returning it read further to learn why.  I have nothing but high praise for the Jison's vendor, TheCase's outstanding and accommodating customer service. Very personalized service. Excellent help. They bent over backwards to help me and I'm sure they would for you. However the 2 yr warranty on the StilGut case won me over, however, over the 180 day Jinson offered.This ended up being the the last case I bought and kept: StilGut Couverture Genuine Leather Case for Apple iPad Air with Smart-Cover Function, Red, ASIN: B00GXCJ8LQ It is bright red, it is beautifully crafted, and it securely holds the iPad Air without covering any of the edges of the iPad Air's screen, what I call the "frame" around the screen.This case has a fairly stiff back cover that grips the iPad Air quite securely. The entire iPad is covered in red leather, and the case is lined in black suede or suede like fabric with the StilGut name woven or stamped in. All buttons and ports are open and useable. The red color is beautiful, and exactly the red color I sought. It also comes with a two year warranty, and feels better made than the Apple Smart Case, at the same price. My only quibble is that I would have preferred to have had smooth textured calfskin or similar, not the textured leather this case is made with. But it seems I couldn't have everything I wished, and this beautiful case came the closest.I've found that many cases do count on the iPad being secured by the case itself using pieces of leather or faux leather to cover the frame, showing only the screen. But that type of frame prevents my thumbs from easily reaching the virtual spacebar and prevents me from typing effectively.The StilGut company is a new one to me, but is apparently a highly regarded German firm, long established. I feel very confident that should any issue arise during the two year warranty period they will stand behind their product. Their website shows many products for tablets and phones in many colors and styles.These are the other iPad Air cases I tried, bought, and returned. The AISN number is Amazon's in house stock number and you can find any of these cases by doing a search with that number.i-Blason 5th Generation i-Folio Slim Hard Shell Stand Case Cover for Apple iPad Air (iPad5-iFolio-Red), $24.99 ASIN: B00G3NDFW8 (grip holding the iPad Air was right, but I didn't love the texture)Fintie SoftGel TPU Back Case Smart Cover Partner for Apple iPad Air (iPad 5 5th Generation) Slim Fit Compatible with Smart Cover - Clear, $4.99 ASIN: B00G7BKC3Q Kept the back cover, although it is not clear but frosty. Excellent customer service. Very responsive.Fintie Apple iPad Air Case - Ultra Slim Leather Standing Case with Smart Cover Auto Sleep / Wake Feature for iPad Air 5 (5th Generation) - Pink $9.99 ASIN: B00IFUCQMM horrible bright color, has wide frame that interferes with typingFintie Blade X1 iPad Air Keyboard Case - Ultra Slim SmartShell Stand Cover with Magnetically Detachable Wireless Bluetooth Keyboard for Apple iPad Air / iPad 5 (5th Generation) - Red $24.99 ASIN: B00J7F2XYK (amazing portable keyboard, case is nice if you will always use keyboard, but no way to prop up for virtual keyboard use otherwise. Keyboard is available separately as:Fintie (Black) 7 inch Ultrathin Bluetooth Wireless Keyboard for iPad mini, iPad mini with Retina Display, iPad 2/3/4, iPad Air (Function Keys For Apple iOS only) $19.99 ASIN: B00D85YFUKBelkin Quilted Cover / Case for iPad Air (iPad 5) (Ruby), $39.99 ASIN: B00F6A5TEG. Very nice looking despite not real leather. But the frame that holds the iPad doesn't lie flat enough for me to type on virtual keyboard The most feminine looking case. Wish the typing position was better.Snugg iPad Air (iPad 5) Case in Black Leather - Flip Cover and Stand with Automatic Wake / Sleep, Elastic Hand Strap & Soft Premium Nubuck Fibre Interior to Protect Apple iPad Air (iPad 5) - Includes Lifetime Guarantee $29.99 ASIN: B00EYDTA3W (same frame issue)YOOBAO Executive Genuine Leather Case for Apple iPad Air/iPad 5 Tablet With Auto Wake / Sleep Function Rose, $37.99 ASIN: B00GNU30QW nice enough leather, but same frame issueCaseCrown Bold Standby Pro Case (Red) for Apple iPad Air with Sleep / Wake, Hand Grip, Corner Protection, & Multi-Angle Viewing Stand, $16.99 ASIN: B00BISWNLC. Impressive protection, nicely made, but same frame problem, faux leatherAnd from Sena-my first choice:Sena Florence for iPad Air (Navy - 845192) $79.99 ASIN: B00JFI08L4I bought the red one at Sena's site. I loved it most of all and would have kept it save for the leather frame around the screen. Most beautiful leather, gorgeous hand, stunningly beautiful. Wish I could have kept it.I hope you will find this review helpful.
It has a very pleasant scent and goes on smoothly. Easy to reach parts otherwise missed! Very glad I discovered it.

After five years of faithful service my remote's battery needed to be replaced.  I found this to be the best value, and it gives me a spare should it be difficult to find another one in future.  Price was excellent and shipping was very quick.  It took about 10 seconds to swap it out.

My hanging baskets were so tired and tattered. I found these on Amazon for less than half of similar products online or locally. Nice black vinyl coating on the metal frame. I'm very pleased.

I have (had) an old, tired real Rubbermaid rubber spatula that was finally giving up the ghost after about 20 years. I really wanted to replace it exactly but cannot find the same thing. I hoped that this would work nearly as well, but it doesn't.  Granted, it was less than $5, and I bought it based on the other reviews, but I'm very disappointed.  It feels very flimsy. The wood handle is rough and lightweight. And the spatula itself isn't rubber, but also isn't silicone, so it isn't heat resistant.  Doesn't scrape all that well, and will melt in a hot pan.  It wasn't worth my returning it, and I might find it somewhat useful from time to time, but frankly I should have passed this by.  As my children would say, "Meh".Update ****28 April 2014*****Completely unusable now.  The "rubber" top no longer adheres in any way to the handle. There is little that is more useless than a spatula whose head falls off in a bowl of cake batter (or anything else). It isn't worth the hassle for me to send it back, but I do wish I'd never bought it.  Save yourself money and grief.  Buy a different one...

Colace (brand) is many times the cost of this generic.  It isn't easy to find 250 mg capsules, but it saves me from having to take three 100 mg ones, which are much easier to locate.  Does what it is supposed to and saves me a lot of money.  A good deal all around.
What can I say about this product?  It is inexpensive, does what it is supposed to do, and was simple to install.
I find this series about hotels that need help to be an interesting window on hotel management.  The host, Anthony, is personable and engaging.

I needed a way to organize non-books on a bookshelf, to help the shelves look neat and less cluttered,and to keep small items from ending up on the floor.  These drawers come in several colors.  They are a good value and seem sturdy and well-made.

My golden retriever loves these soft and chewy treats, and we've not found one she doesn't like (or her friends, for that matter). I like them because I can tear off a small part to give, cutting calories  and making them go farther.  They keep very well, don't smell or make my fingers sticky.  I buy them on the subscribe and save program and the price is excellent.

It was totally my fault for not checking, but the vendor I bought this lamp from charged much more than my local IKEA store, and I didn't realize it until after I ordered.  More than TWICE their price.  After the two lamps I'd ordered arrived, (and after I learned how way much more I paid than I should have) I arranged to send one back, at my expense, unfortunately.  I will say that the vendor was very quick to respond to my request to return one of them, and answered my questions very quickly, so they get kudos for that.  But how they can charge more than twice the price IKEA does is beyond me.  It cost me over $25 to send the second lamp back so my net credit after returning the lamp was about 50% of what I paid.I really like the lamp a lot - very clean lines, lovely woven grey shade that allows the light to peek through the weave, and nice brushed nickel base and pole.  I bought the corresponding wall lamp (with a white shade) directly at IKEA and they look great together.  Even with the huge price increase, if you don't have an IKEA store near you, it is still a great looking lamp at less than comparable ones.  But just know IKEA charges half again as much.So I knocked off one star because of the price and only because of that.

I have never used anything like this product before and wasn't completely sure even what to look for.  My cheaply made kitchen cabinetry have had drawers that haven't tracked well for years.  As I was finally having my cabinets refinished (long overdue) I decided to empty out the silverware drawer and see what wasn't working right.  I really only needed to replace the plastic grip that attaches to the back of the drawer but this kit contains everything, and for under $4!  So I just went ahead and ordred several.  It was very easy to screw on the new grip and now the drawer glides as well as it ever did. I can't say how easy it would be to add drawer glides where there had been none, but I suspect it would not be too hard. Good directions, shipped quickly, excellent price. I'm very happy.

I wanted another lightening cable for my iPhone 5S without having to pay Apple's list price for their OEM cable.  I've had mixed luck with non-OEM cables, and feel that Amazon's basics are generally a good bet.  This cable is black, not white, but aside from that, it is every bit as good as the original one that came with the iPhone.  And at less than half the price of the original.  Well done as usual, Amazon.

I had my kitchen cabinets refinished and had to remove some towel holders that were originally attached years ago with a similar product (came with the holders).  Once I removed them from the cabinet door I had no way to reattach them, so I went looking, and found this.  While I've used Scotch's Command line to hang things, I didn't think they would stand up to the repeated re-hanging of the towels.  And they are expensive. This stuff is great! I probably have a lifetime supply now, but the cost of this entire roll vs the Command strips made buying his roll a no-brainer.What more can you ask for than a simple, well-designed product at a good price that does what it is supposed to do? Have it shipped to you in two days by Amazon, of course!Highly recommended.

I've used this product for two years now, and have been very pleased with it.  A little goes a long way-so much so that I dilute it in the wall dispenser I use in my shower.  The fragrance is pleasant, my color treated baby fine hair is manageable and easy to style. I like that these products have UV protection for my hair. My stylist recommends Alterna. Buying half gallons is a good way to save money over their smaller bottles.  I will continue to use these products. I encourage you to give them a try.

These are an excellent alternative to Lutron or Leviton decorative switches, especially the basic ones.  I was replacing every plug and light switch in my house and wanted to avoid paying those name brand prices. i learned of these on a a site that electricians use, and was very pleased that my favorite Amazon had them, and in boxes of 10, which saved me even more money (though you can get individual ones too.  These are also compatible with the decorative, screw-less cover plates made by Lutron, Leviton and others. Cooper makes a very reasonably priced one, and I was glad to learn they all seem to be standardized and interchangeable, so sticking with one brand isn't necessary.  I updated the look of my entire home for less money than if I'd used Lutron or Leviton exclusively. I did buy some of their dimmers that are incandescent/LED/CFL compatible, though, and that had features that I was looking for and was willing to pay for.  But for basic switches, plugs etc, you can't go wrong with this brand or Cooper.

this is one of those unusual bargain watches that fall into a rare niche of form and function at an astoundingly low price; as everyone knows, Timex watches today are generally pieces of junk, with low-end components and ultra-cheap Chinese-made movements, all sold at vastly inflated prices to a generally unknowing public...on the other hand, this particular model is more than meets the eye: is it a low-end watch? yes... does it use a low-end movement? yes... but what makes this watch stand out from the Timex trash heap are a couple features: first, the leather band is nicely made, with good stitching, and big enough for my large wrist... and second, this watch, unlike other Timex dive-watch pretenders costing almost four times as much, has a functioning unidirectional bezel!that's right - you get a watch that's actually usable for timing (i use mine for flipping steaks on the grill or making hard-boiled eggs)please understand and make no mistake: this is one cheap watch... the bezel only has 60 clicks, and the battery is ginourmous compared to most quartz movements - a CR2016... but the indiglo is only momentary and entirely adequate (you can read the face in the dark); i cannot speak for the longevity, but the movement keeps accurate time... another nice feature is the date-only display (i don't like day/date functions - useless to me, but at least this is only a date to deal with).so, as a pitiful Submariner homage, this cheap Timex actually delivers more value in looks, features and function than any others in its Timex trash-heap class - a rare bargain at its current price point

i just used these googles this morning on my daily one-mile swim - they are soft, the headband easily adjusted, and the seal didn't leak once...however, i can understand why some folks seem to think the shape is a bit off: i had a little difficulty in adjusting the placement of the googles on my face - the seal was fine, however - and perhaps i had the band a tad too tight - but they didn't seem as comfortable as my normal pair of googles from Finis...for those swimmers who talk about fogging: here's a tip - dip your pinkie in a little bit of baby shampoo, swap the inside of each lens, then polish clean and dry - do not get the lens wet when putting on the googles in the pool - you won't have any fogging whatsoever - this has worked for me every morning in the pool for several years using different brands of goggles - Cressi is no different...so, although i like these googles, your face may not accommodate them as easily as 'normal' shaped goggles - the Cressi has a bit larger lens and triangular shape... i'm going to try and loosen the head band just a bit tomorrow morning...otherwise i like these - the clear lens is a bonus because i normally swim in a dark pool (no underwater lights are on when i swim)

these came in a 12x7x5 box - each 'lock up' had a label sticker on top and a barcode sticker on the bottom, but were screwed together in four sticks of nine lock-ups... we thought 'Uh oh, these are going to be a pain to un-sticker!'we were wrong! each lock-up unscrewed easily from the next, and each label was that soft-plastic type of sticker that had no adhesive, but stuck by surface adhesion - each peeled off easily! a very pleasant surprise!these lock-ups were immediately put to use with help in sorting a collection of beading and other bits and bobs for making necklaces, bracelets, earrings, and toe rings - very nice! as a bonus, they were easily grouped to sort by size and color of beads - a great way to organize and a fabulous way to put to work - just unscrewed and grab the lockups for the job at hand...have not seen these anywhere in the stores, so we were very fortunate to get these from Amazon!

i like it when you receive more value than you anticipate from a product - although these are only 100mg (we take 400mg between us daily), the bottle arrived with a bonus extra 50 gelcaps!that's a nice surprise - although it's nearly impossible to empirically gauge the effectiveness of taking CoQ10 on a daily basis, we can say that as those folks who are also on statins (which we detest), the CoQ10 *appears* to alleviate some fatigue and loss of muscle tone from taking statin drugswe just plain feel better using this supplement

perfect for my Seiko SKXA35 - much better, beefier bracelet than the one on my Seiko SRP309 (Orange Monster)! thanks to another poster for taking the plunge - the solid machined watch end links slid smoothly and perfectly onto the watch, and the included stainless bar ends clicked neatly into place - this is the best upgrade for my watch- very nice

excellent compact cradle - nice they come in different colors, but this unit, paired with the original USB charger, works great for a bedside or desktop 'holster' for our iPhone 5sthe cord was long enough to reach the outlet and charger, but not too long to create a tanglethe phone is held securely in the lightening connector and displays the screen vertically (don't think i've seen a horizontal cradle?)we like this accessory - it will be used every day!

a big improvement over a more 'warmer' terry currently used... in a sub-tropical environment, apres-bath times are pretty steamy even with air conditioning... this product offers better arm movement than zip-ups and is easier than bath sheet wrapslightweight, stretch band and velcro make this one a winner!  and it works for someone 6-foot-2 with a 44DD!

without a doubt this is one of the best monthly planners out there - nice sturdy but flexible cover with open monthly layout offering large squares for appointments and notes - a few blank pages for notes in the back, along with some information pages and a very handy see-thru pocket in the back to store business cards or appointment pages or other important informationwe are going to use this instead of the normal desk-sized planner in our computer nook off the kitchen - it will save space on the desktop and still offer quick, at-a-glance update for our upcoming weeks(we're retired, so we make sure to write down any appointments immediately after coming back from the dentist or doctors, or getting off the phone with friends or scheduled maintenance workers coming to the house)you won't be disappointed with this planner - it's much better than tapping on an app for non-smart-phone users and very handy for our household

why do i, as a man, like this product? well, because it made my wife happy as she likes smooth legs and thinks this particular razor is the best she's ever used (each blade lasts a long time, so this 4-pack should be good for more than a year)
it ain't much, but the spudgers look OK... i don't think it's worth a Hamilton though

i'm a fireplug kinda guy and was a tad concerned about the potential fit of this T shirt... the color and feel of the fabric is great... put it on, and the fit around the shoulders is wonderful and there's no constraint around the neckline, unlike many other crew necks i've tried...however, the shirt in XXL appears to be made for fireplug guys about 5 feet tall! on me, the length of the shirt goes just an inch below the waist line... i guess some would call it a 'dressy look' - but to me it looked/felt kinda short in fact... and if there is any shrinkage... well, let's just say it won't be pretty if you sit down and lean back in a chair or wear your shorts prison style - you'll end up looking like a Wal-Martian

just in time for those chilly mornings... the hardest part about using this hand warmer is finding Zippo lighter fluid! i swear, i went to three different places, including a large grocery chain, the world's largest box-mart chain, and a local national drug store chain... the old days of shelf displays of pipes, pipe cleaners, tins of tobacco, flint lighters and lighter fluid seem to be over... it's kinda sad, but i guess this is where we're headed: a nation of electricity dependency, mountains of charging devices, and landfills filled with expended batteriesfortunately i was able to find Zippo fluid in the black 12-oz can... that can will take me through at least a month of warm hands with this warmer... open it up, remove the top element, fill the included cup, pour into the warmer (keeping it upright), replace the top, let sit for a minute or so, then light it up for 10 seconds (i used a small candle - we keep 'em on hand here in hurricane country)voila! a nice toasty hand warmer - perfect for my early morning forays on the bicycle to the beach for a swim... lasts me about 7 hours (don't know where the '12 Hour' comes from, but it doesn't last that long;  i keep a small crate in a corner of the garage to let it burn out - not inside the house!

restored and revived my 1951 Singer Featherweight - the modern molded plug saved time on redoing the old connector (you should take a look inside the old, original Singer bakelite plug - simply amazing!) - now my Featherweight is good to go for a long, long time - great price - less than a Lincoln!

Tested in 35F darkness:Seat was easy to install in an older bucket-seat import sedan. Attachment straps easily wrapped around non-airbag areas.Power cord was long enough to reach 12V port in back of seat, although the front (driver area) port was used.Seat heated quickly, especially on the 'Hi' setting; for extended trips aside from a short 15-minute commute in the cold, the low setting would be better.What this seat's heat control needs however, is an LED to indicate that the unit is on. This isn't a problem for those vehicles that turn off 12V power to the ports when the ignition is off; but this seat could possibly drain your vehicle's battery if, like some vehicles, power is always on to the ports.Overall, a recommendation - especially at its price point - it's an inexpensive upgrade for cold-weather driving.

a very nice cat tree indeed! arrives in a thick, sturdy box with neatly labeled parts, a pack of bolts - even the required Allen wrench! a one-sided sheet of paper clearly shows assembly - which only took 10 minutes (it's better if you have two people to do it, but it can be done by one person)...nicely crafted with thick hemp for the scratchers and soft velvet covering... minimal footprint... not as high as our other cat tree, but this would be a tree that a young cat could grow into... base is stable enough, but a 20-lb cat could tip it in a fit of energy (we always try to brace ours against a corner wall and away from furniture, but close enough to a window to feline lookout patrols!this is a much better construction than you will find in many big-chain pet stores, and this tree is sure to last! our resident cat overlord took to it right away, marked it, and played around on it - and he's coy at times...have a couple kittens? this tree as a play area would be like a barrel of monkeys!

it's always good to have some spare batteries on hand... here at the casa, we've replaced all incandescent bulbs with LEDs (including the 4-foot T8s in the kitchen and garage) - we also use LED candles instead of burning wax candlesunfortunately, our LED candles take a bunch of AAAs (the candles are on timers and automagically come on at 8 p.m. and are on for several hours before bed time); one of the worst purchases we made in the last two years was buying a bunch of CVS-brand AAAs that were on sale - bad batteries that only lasted for a few nights! arrrgggghhhhh! (i was *so* mad)these batteries are going to be kept on hand when we run through the bad ones - i don't like bad products, and i don't like cluttering up landfills with batteries - we'll eventually go with rechargables, but for now i'll use these Energizers and feel a bit better knowing that they're at least partially made from recycled batteries and material (i'll most likely use several in my single-AAA LED Fenix lights that i drop into each end of the pool during my before-dawn morning swim - helps keep me from cracking my head on the end of the lane during turns)i'm glad to see manufacturers bringing recycled products back to market - at some point we may get the energy storage problem licked to an efficient degree - but for now, there are these Energizers!

this is probably the finest stock and pasta pot with steamer i have ever run across... at one time i did have the big original Calphalon stock pot with pasta insert, but this multi-cook pot beats them all hands down... (believe it or not, the stock pot once sold with Le Creuset was unbelievably cheap enameled steel - a real piece of over-priced junk that wore out in less than a year!)this pot, constructed of 'surgical' stainless with an aluminum core, features the pasta insert, a steamer insert, and a solid stainless lid (the product image is deceptive - it is NOT glass!)the Viking folks claim this pot is also induction compatible (i could not test as i only have a ceramic cooktop)with all elements stacked, this multi-cooker measure 12 1/2" high, easily usable even on cooktops with only 16-inch clearance to the bottom of an above-stove mounted microwave; you can use just the stock pot, the pot with the pasta insert, or the pot with pasta insert and steamer insert on top (pasta and steamer inserts are not interchangeable).thoroughly wash and dry this set before use, then oil all inside cooking surfaces with a little vegetable oil - and NEVER USE METAL UTENSILS!!!a beautiful set that will last a lifetime and beyond - i'd say almost an heirloom ... you will be able to make some nice soups and stews, cook some great pasta, steam at least four chicken lobsters at one time, or even do a crab and shrimp boil for a half-dozen people using this cookset - amazing!superb quality, this is now the finest piece of gear in our kitchen

this 32gb micro-stick has just enough storage to be useful on my Macbook Air (i only need to back up spreadsheets, receipts and documents)i like that the case is formed for easy insertion and removal - much better than the small all-metal PNY stick, which is a devil to remove...the USB 3.0 compatibility makes this a perfect companion for today's chromebooks and notebooks... speedy transfers, read and write!highly recommended

wasn't quite sure about the packaging - the price was a little bit more than at brick-and-mortar, but the shopping and shipping value equaled out the cost - this is a 'commerical' pack which is used to stock single portions for sale on the shelving - but nice to have in this size (you get the equivalent of two 'boxed' Perfect Portions) - we keep a rotating stock of several months on hand because our Feline OverLord demands regular feedings of his Perfect Portions

this latest and greatest Chromebook comes shipped in a sturdy box, slightly larger than a lunchtime Pizza Hut pizza; contents are minimal, consisting of a power cord, power wart, and slips of paper introducing the computer...the computer itself is very impressive, with full-size USB ports, and SD card port, and HDMI... security slot and headphone/mic jack is on the right side, power input is on the leftstunning display, larger than many laptops; instant boot-up... i mean 'instant' - amazing FAST!i ran through the setup paces, enabling and disabling calls back to the Google mothership, agreeing to terms of usage (does anyone really read those?), creating a gmail account, etc... the whole process took less than 5 minutes, compared to the nearly half hour required for a modern Microsoft Windows 10 setup... definitely easy enough for first-time users (think tech-challenged parents or in-laws)this is a top-notch chromebook - much nicer than the now-ancient Acer sitting as a backup in a back study of the house... also, the 'skin' on this Toshiba is mottled silver, providing a 'grippy' surface that also hides fingerprints - smart design!lightweight and thin, this product won't put a creak in your back if you're trudging across campus, and has a big enough screen to do serious work without feeling cramped... easy-to-read  backlit keyboard, too!the Google launcher instantly provides access to a number of Google apps, such as its spreadsheet, word processor, slideshow, and graphics suite..also convenient is the ability to offer 'guest' browsing that won't affect your chromebook's web history or other data - a nice boxing off of data for security and privacy!you won't be disappointed with this chromebook - now if only i had a faster 'Net connection (the only drawback to using this species for one's computing needs)

we've always used a spicier, more expensive bloody mary mix (you know the one, with a bit of 'zing') - but we ran out...luckily, Mrs T arrived just in time for a pre-weekend breakfast libation (we make ours with some extra vitamin 'V' if you know what i mean)... this is a great base for experimenting with your own additions or spices - or you can just use it as is - it's very good... the portions are nice - just enough for a small pitcher or a couple for a couple!i always try to keep some fresh limes on hand... kosher dill slices, celery, or pickled asparagus work as mixing stalks... and most folks seem to like to find a nice green olive or two in their drinkto spice it up without adding cayenne or jalapeno sauce i use some fresh grated black pepperthanks, Mrs. T!!!

i like this watch - much more so than any of the other offerings in its genre (inexpensive, almost girly-man big, over-hyped and pretentious but made to fool the non-watch knowledge into thinking they see a masterpiece of horological engineering)...why? well, for a number of reasons:1) this is a thinner piece than most2) it has a plain, simple face - lacking a second hand, but featuring a tiny day of month display3) it has a movement, but who is to say whether or not it is Chinese or Japanese? (well, it doesn't say 'Japan' on the face, so...)4) the leather band is well-made5) the safety clasp - a positive - and a negative, but mostly positivethe downsides?1) still a bit bigger face than a 'normal' watch, but very good for these old eyes2) confusing instructions - especially on setting the date: ("turn back one day, then forward"?); stem settings "pull out stem 2 clicks" [can't]; "make sure to screw down crown" [can't]3) the clasp - very confusing to set, but once you figure it out, seems rather secure - have never run across one like it (a press-fit, levered hooked clasp - kind of like a hybrid between old style belt buckle and folding friction clasp)all in all, a nice watch - we'll have to see how it keeps time (you won't know if the battery runs out until you notice you're late for that appt or you got a parking ticket) - the watch came in the 'off' position, with the stem pulled out and a plastic insert

this unit is like most toy drones on the shelves and due to flood the market during the upcoming holiday season... there are some things to like about this kit and some things not to like...the drone worked out of the box, but you will need to download english instructions first if you want to get started - getting this drone up in the air right after a charge and after inserting 4 AAAs into the control unit is not intuitive... things to like include the inclusion of spare props and protectors, along with spare soft landing pads...things not to like include the hinged battery compartment on the control unit using a small phillips screw, the need to have a USB charger, the fact that only when charging is complete will you see a red LED on the USB thumb portion of the charger, the small drone start button and its position (awkward - should be on top), the confusing auto-flying mode start procedure (pressing the 'Juice' button on the controller works intermittently), confusing 'sync' procedure (toggling the throttle), the fact that even in 'Juice' mode, the hovering is inconsistent with variable speed to the props, resulting in awkward maneuvers for a novice, the fact that trim is required even when auto hovering - and finally, the extremely short (less than 5 minutes) flying timethat said, you will have fun with this toy, and it should provide at least an afternoon's worth of enjoyment - it will be interesting to see how these toys evolve on the next few years

ordered the 'light' version, but got the regular Campbell's Maryland-style Crab soup - and i'm still happy!only one store carries this soup - at twice the price - and i've never seen the 'light' version anywhere...i'm set for winter and some nice hot lunch or dinners - a hot mug of this soup with some unsalted Saltines and i'm a happy camper...

although the name of this product may be a turn-off to some folks, we found that the novelty value more than compensates for its marketing - the scent labeled on this small spray bottle is 'White Flowers and Citrus'it does indeed have a citrus-flowery scent - not unpleasant, and much, much more pleasant than the alternativethe bottle is small, unobtrusive, and due to design and color, would most likely fit in with the decor of any bathroom - so you can leave it out in the half-bath hall facilityour use is a bit more unconventional however... although our house guest, Winston, doesn't always telegraph his intent, this product has been instrumental in alleviating odoriferous emanations from his subsequent efforts in his box - a most gratifying benefit of using this product

a big, heavy watch with a few interesting features... comes in a plain white cardboard box, inside a bright yellow padded box... the contents must have shifted during shipping, as the protective plastic on the face was skewed and folded, and the instruction booklet was mashed with torn corners into the top of the yellow padded boxother than that, the watch was fine... i think i'm beginning to see why some folks enjoy buying and using watches - this watch had a couple features i've never seen or used before: a tiny stopwatch with a red hand at the six o'clock position - like other chronographs though, you start and stop the timer with a button press of the top right button, then reset with a single press of the bottom right button... the crown on the right functions as most to set the time and date - with the caution to NOT set the date between 9 p.m. and 1 a.m. - curious!you can also continue running a timing session, and do split times - make sure to read the included manual, not the simple one-page summary of the watch's componentsbut the feature that caught my fancy and attention was the inner-rotating bezel - twist the crown at the lower left of the face to rotate the timer bezel, which is beneath the synthetic sapphire (an added bonus for scratch resistance)this watch will also function as a knuckle duster in a pinch - and even if you have a large, thick wrist, you will most likely need to remove one or two links in order to wear this watch securelythis is an attractive watch with a readable face - i'm not sure i care for the large logo underneath the noon position though - a bit more understatement would go a long way

what you see is what you get - a matte-finish in the color - however, it is *not* iridescent...it's essie, so it's always great to apply with great coverage - no second coat required!short drying time - typical of essie...a fun Fall color!interesting color - something of a matted/suede effect -  this is the type of color that if you want to try something darker you can try...and you always have the option to add a gloss topcoat

works surprisingly well - you simply unscrew, fill with your desired dental rinse, screw back on... holds a bit less than a pint, so you can get a week or so of rinse on your countertopto use, just pump once, twice, or three times, then invert into the top cup - it's that simple!we'll have to see how long the pump mechanism holds up - not sure how long if you use a salt-based rinse?

great taste and texture - the salty/sweet crunch is just righton the other hand, don't expect to use these for anything except snacking - they're too fragileif you're a fan of toasted nori, you'll love these crisps - the little bag will go a long way for me, as a half dozen satisfy the craving for something tastythe only problem is: they're hard to find!!!

opened the plastic wrapping and was greeted with a foul, nasty industrial chemical smell of a tire factory - stank up the whole kitchen!no label of manufacturer or country of origin, but we can all guess who?sorry, this is a cheap dollar-store knockoff with bad product materials - i wouldn't let it anywhere near any food, nor would i suggest inhaling the chemical smell of the 'rubber' insulation - which can't be silicon

the smell of this cream is light and lovely; it also has an interesting texture - a cross between a gel and a cream; you don't need a lot - a little goes a long wayit does make the skin feel soft and smoothbut: it doesn't 'soak in' very well - leaves a film that precludes use of other products on top of the skin (makeup, etc.)best use is for a 'night cream' vs a day/morning creamdid not list if the product was 'animal cruelty free' (this is important)for the price, the packaging should be a bit more 'upscale'

was hesitant to use this self-tanner due to other negative reviews, but was pleasantly surprised - it was very easy to put on - did not get a lot of streaking - the consistency was thick enough that i didn't have to worry about dripping - it stayed where applied - smell was pleasant - could use on the face, unlike other products - the color was more on the brownish-tan side, not 'orangy'on the other hand, you have to be careful for the first three hours so as it will rub off - and the coloring only lasted for four or five dayswill probably use to fill in or even off an existing tan, to smooth out tan lines, etc.

the real deal - these are exact replacements for the Bissell Stick Vac 38B - now we can wash a dirty one, slap in a fresh one, and rotate filters to keep our vac at its peak performancethis is when you can honestly say, "Bissell vacs really *do* suck!":-)

here's the bottom line: this is a great all-in-one (with the exception of telephone fax) that straddles to occasional user to office user - it's more for a SOHO user who wants to save money on office ink and doesn't mind spending a bit more for a piece of equipment (a tax write-off for the IRS, and sometimes a tax liability for local government)expect to lose some desk space: you will need a few extra inches over your old printer's footprint due to the ink tank on the right side of the printerthis is a sturdy piece of gear and configured to our network quickly and easily by using Wi-Fi Protected Setup, WPS, which involves selecting WPS on the printer, then pressing the WPS button on your network router (if available, which it was with a Verizon router). You can modify settings using the Web Config Utility, which means browsing to the printer's local IP address.works like a charm under OS X Mavericks, and since a previous piece of Epson gear (slide-scanner) was installed, the interface for printing setup and scanning - Epson Scan - was the same; you can also use OS X's Image Capture applots of ink, little hassle - paper handling is as you'd expect on this size printer - typical envelope, photo paper handling, etc. - most users are going to be more interested in printing - this printer is not a speed demon: about 10 pages per minute in black and white, half that for colorbut you definitely won't be running out for ink in the middle of a larger print job!

Professional piece of equipment. Now employed in our community pool shower room. Came with a sheet of instructions, screws and plastic anchors, and a 'key' to open the unit. Also included a massive roll of soft bath tissue - much better quality than one generally finds installed.This product matches those employed by our community and is sturdy enough to stand up to years of use. The large roll capacity means less maintenance. I just wish our board member would elect to buy better quality tissue.

definitely an improvement on an oldy-but-Goody! the new formulation with the fruit flavor makes this the go-to relief powder when you don't have any water nearby...i could do without the caffeine, but i took some right before bedtime and was able to sleep easily with no headache or body ache...not a bad solution to keep in back pocket!

this item couldn't have arrived at a better time - while most folks may use this as a convenience feature to add a bit of humidity during times of dry air or in environments that remove water from the air, we used this as a medical device for our feline during upper-respiratory tract infection recoveryadding a bit of eucalyptus oil to the water and running this device in a warm, small enclosed space (one of our little bathrooms) enabled us to help our little recently adopted kitten breathe easier and recover faster (as most experienced cat adopters know, the chances of bringing a cat home from a shelter with URI is pretty good, so it's always better to be prepared)...the large reservoir in this unit allowed us to set it up, then not worry about interrupting sessions during treatment - very nicea bonus is that it is quiet, while helps immensely when dealing with a sick kittenthis humidifier worked great!

this is a big, beefy watch that weighs almost a pound...designed for left-handers, this timepiece features a stopwatch button, time/date crown, reset button, synthetic sapphire crystal, second, minute and day wheels, along with analog hour and minute hands, and a sweep second hand for the stopwatch featurepress the bottom button to start the stopwatch from the 12 o'clock position, press again to stop; press the top button to reset and the sweep hand will rotate back to noon - very nice!beefy band in brow leather - comes in sturdy box w/instruction booklet; face and back are covered in shipping filmi'm taking off a star for poor, inconsistent luminescence on the dial (splotchy coverage)

I was prepared to give this product the benefit of the doubt, as I really like rotini and Alfredo sauce (usually not together though). However, my worst fears were realized after microwaving this 'meal' for a minute in my microwave. The result was a salt-laden, unappetizing, tasteless glop with an Elmer's Glue-like texture.Simply awful. I'm not sure even a starving kid would like this. Bad after-taste as well. Does not taste like it's good for you either. Even though touting no artificial flavors or colors, this is not healthy food. Way, way too much salt.Nope, I'll pass on this one.

This has to be one of the most frustrating and thoughtlessly engineered pieces of you-know-what i have experienced in the last 10 years. It is far worse than AppleTV, and infinitely more frustrating:1. its default is set to kilograms out of the box with no way to change the setting on the scale without connecting via an app - STUPID STUPID STUPID STUPID!2. there are two sets of 'manuals' in the box - a 'manual' and a 'quick start guide' - they both say the same thing - which is nothing, really - no screenshots of the app, no mention of an Android app, no common sense FAQ!3. it takes 4 AAA batteries; be aware that Bluetooth will suck the life out of these faster than a zombie alien4. there is no 'on/off' switch, and there are two confusing reset buttons by the batteries5. it requires bluetooth and a network for updating and configuration6. no mention of an Android app, but there is one; download it and you'll find out that you need the larger, 43MB(!) version; the original version won't work with the scale, then aborts operation when trying to use it with the scale - remove the first, useless app from Google Play - STUPID STUPID STUPID7. app requires email and user registration, along with giving up privacy settings on your device - INTRUSIVE8. the app is non-intuitive and confusing on startup (although typical of Android apps)9. pairing this device was a nightmare - the 2.0 Android app had NO visible 'pairing' setup (i went through settings on my cheap 4.4 tablet)10. don't buy this for your mother, your father or a favorite aunt or uncle - you will shortly be tasked with setting it up, and even then you will end up with a massive headache from the frustrating experiencewant to use this 'scale' as just a plain scale out of the box? sorry, you can't!!!AVOID THIS OVER-PRICED PIECE OF JUNK AND ITS AWFUL, AWFUL SOFTWARE!!! HORRIBLE IMPLEMENTATION!!!! BAD ENGINEERING!!! IT'S LIKE IT WAS DESIGNED BY A TEENAGER - NO FEATURES, BAD PROCEDURAL SETUP!

there is much more to this 7800mAh power pack than any other on the market... first is the ruggedized packaging and its IPX6 rating (more formally: "Protected against heavy seas - Water projected at all angles through a 12.5mm nozzle at a flow rateof 100 liters/min at a pressure of 100kN/m2 for 3 minutes from a distance of 3 meters.")next, are the 'smart' features: besides functioning as a power pack with a built-in flashlight, this pack supposedly has a USB memory for devices connected to various ports; using the two small green buttons on both sides of the LED array, you and set or erase various feature of the power pack, which offers a male micro-USB and 'standard' male USB port on two attached cords. A third female 'standard' USB port can also be used to charge another deviceof course, this being a Goal Zero product, there is a bit of hype in its marketing/package; for example, "Optimized to charge quickly from Goal Zero Nomad Solar panels or any USB port" - in reality this translates to: "You'll need to attach your Venture 30 to a USB port for five hours, or you may need up to 16 hours to charge from a Nomad 7 solar panel"this product is feature laden, although you can also find multi-USB-port recharging packs in the 7800mAh range that are less expense... where this product shines is compatibility, compact, rugged packaging, smart charging (2.1Ah USB ports for tablets!), and an interesting LED flashlight array that also functions as a charge/status indicator...the LED array is quite bright - do NOT look at the LEDs when you press the right-side button! you can set a 'default' LED flashlight mode by pressing and holding the flashlight button, then cycling through modes by tapping the left-side battery button, then releasing both buttons... you can select a number of different modes (fast/slow flashing, high/low levels, and combos of each) - the Venture will remember the mode as a 'default'Goal Zero does not say how long the LED flashlight will last on a full charge (obviously dependent on mode); i can imagine you'll get several days of light from this power pack on low-mode, and the super-bright flashing mode could be very handy for roadside or hiking emergenciesnice pack, nice packaging, smart features... it's a winner!

these bites are good - however, as they kind of resemble dog treats for humans you may be inclined to think they have a solid, yet moist softness with a peanut butter flavor...however, they are crunchy with a peanut butter flavor and a sweet, honey like aftertaste... still good, and according to the packaging, balanced in the amount of carbs, protein and fatthese bites contain sugar - this is not a diet snack, so even though the word 'balanced' is present in the name, this is not really a good food for a diabetic (although a few could be eaten in moderation for a taste)the packaging is awfully big for the five packs, but this would represent a work week's worth of snacks for afternoon apres-workoutsi like them, and each small bag contains plenty of human dog treats - enough to satisfy this big dog!

this is not, repeat not, a protein or healthy bar - this is a snack bar... while each bar only has 9 grams of sugar and 3 grams of protein, there are 21 grams of carbs... by weight, the top three ingredients are: peanuts, corn syrup, and sugar (not turbinado sugar or brown sugar)i'm giving this bar 3 stars - it's OK, tastes good, and the 'zippiness' of the cayenne comes through after 15-20 seconds of the first bite (most likely masked by the sugar and chocolate)...my main beef with these granola bars is that nearly all become almost inedible after a very short time in high temps - try hiking or walking in 90F heat with one of these in your pack, cargo pocket, or purse, and you'll end up with a gloppy, sodden mess and sticky fingers - not fun!at least the picture on the front of the box makes the bar look healthy - to Nature Valley's credit (a General Mills company), no claim is made that this is 'health food.'

just finished cleaning up breakfast after making two different sandwiches with this maker: a low-carb bread sandwich with egg, Canadian bacon, and a slice of white American cheese... here are the steps i used after prepping the maker (wash, dry, then spray w/veg oil):1. scrounge around the house for a glass or jar that just fits the circumference of the maker, then press out two slices of bread to fit - voila!2. preheat3. open maker, lay down bread, then bacon, then cheese4. close middle section, crack an egg into the maker, piercing the yolk5. place bread lightly on top6. close, set for 4.5 minutes7. after time's up, slide egg plate to the left8. open maker, use small plastic spatula to slide onto a small plate9. let cool, then enjoy! it was PERFECT!the next sandwich was made using a bagel, Canadian bacon, slice of swiss cheese, and an egg - the bagel was too big to fit, so i thought for a minute, and then SQUEEZED the bagel slices to fit - easy!!!now here's where to avoid a mess - LET THE UNIT PREHEAT BEFORE MAKING A SECOND SANDWICH!!! if you don't, the egg run out of the make down the sides...(don't ask me how i learned this...)i like this unit - our breakfast turned out just fine the first time - and was great!i am taking off one star - there are too many 'nooks and crannies' on the device to make cleaning really simple - if you make a baked on mess, you'll need a hot scrub with a toothbrush to get all the stuff out of the little edges - but if you preheat between sandwiches, you'll be fine

when i clicked the five-star rating for this five-star product i did so because my wife insisted that when i write this review that i let folks know that it is, indeed, a five-star product -as i've learned over the years, women can have a hard time finding a good fitting bra at a reasonable price - believe me, i've been on the hunting excursions and many times have personally witnessed the frustrations during the searchso it was a really nice, very pleasant surprise when, on a whim, i acquired this bra for my wife - she of course, was a bit skeptical, but immediately had to admit that this bra was comfortable, supporting, and fit like a glove...and it makes her look fabulous, so five stars from me!

this has to be the most amazing, convenient and useful camping product i've ever run across... i'm kinda 'old school,' and in the past have used Army surplus sleeping bags, Swedish military surplus cooking gear, and old brass stoves, such as the SVEA 123 and Optimus 8R, but one thing, at least to me, that was essential for a nice sleep in the great outdoors was a good pad for my sleeping bag - for years i used an old Thermarest, but alas it literally disintegrated from use...this pad on the other hand, is just amazing! it packs down to nothing, weighs only 12 oz, and features - gasp! - a built-in pillow!!! YAHOO! life is great now under the stars! it only took a few breaths to blow up (push down to lock the air valves)...and even better: it comes with a repair kit in the unfortunate situation you plop down on a goat thorn or sharp rock...5 stars all the way for this product!

this is a top-of-the-line 3-season sleeping bag - although stated using 'DriDown,' this bag contains a 70/30 mix of duck/polyester fill in a box-construction mummy... good features are:- light weight- nice 550 loft- padded head- bag insulated head area- two-way zipper for venting (most folks are also going to use a liner nowadays; i'm old school and used a $15 Army surplus bag for nearly 20 years until it died)- sewn-in hanging and tie-down points (for airing or storing the bag, and for avoiding the dreaded 'bag rollover' when sleeping at night)of course, you will also need a lliner and good mattress (again, i'm old school and used a Thermarest for years, but recently acquired a fabulous Klymit Inertia air pad to go with this bag)i expect this sleeping bag to last me the rest of my years - if you need to learn more about sleeping bags i recommend 'The Complete Walker' (3rd edition, *not* the 4th), or REI's advice links on sleeping bags and liners...no country of origin listed anywhere on the bag's packaging or on the bag or on Kelty's site - we can all probably guess where it was made, can't we?

i'm not sure how 'patriotic' buying Chinese-made cotton bar mop towels is, but these appear to be up to the task of wiping down our kitchen countertop; however, WASH THESE BEFORE USE!!!these are cheaply made, sold at a premium price without a prewash - NOT COLORFAST!!!i don't trust any new colored towels, so i ran the red one under some water in the sink, squeezed it, and yup, bright red color emerged from the towel - definitely shows lack of concern for the consumer - beware!

this product, according to my in-house tester, is excellent at what it does and provides at least one marked improvement over many other mascarasfirst, it certainly will give you those 'Manga' eye lashes! however, with a bit of judicious removal, very acceptable (toned down) results may be obtained, thankfully due to the water solvency of the makeup... to quote: "Not every gal wants Tammy Faye Baker eyes"the brush is convenient, ergonomic, and best of all, has a non-rolling extrusion - in other words, it won't roll all over a counter! there is plenty of makeup included, so this brush will last for quite some time...

compact, phone-sized charging unit with higher-than normal capacity and dual amperage USB ports (many tablets or other devices need more power to recharge)takes about 7 hours to recharge this battery cellthe digital readout is handy, but could have just used red/yellow/green led schema too...voltage on the USB ports only seems active when a device is attached or digital readout button is pressedDO NOT THINK ABOUT USING THE USB IN SERIES!!! common conductors for the ports are used and the unit *will* shut down (albeit non-destructively, which is a bonus)i'd be wary about claims of recharge times, btw - and remember, if you're going to put this in long-term storage, deplete the battery to 60 percent (Li-ions are happier that way)only a one-year warranty

This is a fairly small section of Catit's Circut track - not enough to make a full oval. It doesn't come with any instructions but there isn't really any other shape it can make other than an "S." It can be difficult to snap the sections of track together (again, no directions) but if you slide one notched side into the hole from the top as you slide the other in from the bottom in a twisting motion until you hear the click of the tab, it goes a little easier. The transparent green sections just drop in then slide back in their slots to lock.We already have the Catit Design Senses Super Roller Circuit Toy for Cats so my cat knows how to play with the Catit Play Circut design and we have plenty of track to make a closed shape with hills and valleys. I took the advice of another reviewer and added the new ball as well. She seemed to like it, especially when they clacked together.There are things I'd change about the Catit Circut Toys: the track covers make it far too difficult to swat the ball. Not only are they a little small for an adult cat but she can't really get a good swing. She ends up tapping the ball which leads to problem number two: the ball needs to be weighted more/differently. It doesn't roll as well as other track balls. We also have the Bergan Turbo Scratcher Cat Toy, Colors May Vary and the heavier ball takes off. It would be fun if Catit could make something like Bergan Twinkle Replacement Ball, Colors Vary - it keeps my cat glued to her other cat track when she plays with it.Right now the Catit Circuit is her upstairs track (because it's a heck of a lot quieter than the other!) and when she gets frustrated with trying to get at the ball, she likes to lay on top of it. One thing I do like about Catit's system is that you can add other things to it. This particular Catit Circuit needs to have other pieces added to it for maximum fun.

This seems like such a good idea and I was excited to try it. Unfortunately I ran into trouble immediately when I found out I needed to download an app to use it and my phone wouldn't work (there's a list of phones that will on their website). I did a little begging and the dude let me borrow his Galaxy S5 so I could set things up. Well, not only did I need his phone to download the app and input my information (age, weight, ideal temperatures, etc.) but I needed to keep it with me and keep it on throughout the night. I begged my way into keeping the phone with me and after all that, the app kept losing its connection to the unit. For days.As I mentioned, this is a great idea and other than the major issue with the app, I could have loved it. Setup of the pad and base until was simple and it was comfortable to lie on. I wish Nuyu would find another way to let their customers input information. Not everyone has a smartphone, not everyone wants to leave their phone on all night and they would avoid the endless headaches caused by apps not working.In the end this turned out to be a useless product for me. I can't continue to try to figure out the app, especially on a borrowed phone, and I'm not buying a new phone just so I can download the app myself.

This is a really attractive, cozy infinity scarf. I've never worn one before and boy, what a mistake. I live in the midwest and in the winter I'm constantly struggling to keep my ears warm with a regular scarf (no hat head, please). Even though this has a relatively loose knit and wrapping the six-foot length twice around my neck gives a kind of cowl effect around my face, it still feels warm on my head, ears and neck. There's plenty of scarf to pull up and arrange around my face if I'd like some protection there too. The soft elasticity of the knit keeps the scarf on my head, hugging my ears and up on my face without being tight. It's light and very comfortable to wear; the knit isn't itchy at all.The scarf I have is a true black and cream mix and it looks great with my gray coat. I can't say enough about how soft and snuggly this scarf is.Free product received for evaluation and review.

This bath step is perfect for anyone who needs some extra help getting into the shower, especially someone with hip or knee issues. It's completely non-slip with a soft foam top and a wide base that will be comforting for anyone who's unsteady. It does look big and it takes up a lot of floor space but as someone with intermittent knee issues who's also taken care of a parent after a knee replacement, it can be scary to get out of a shower with wet feet and trust your unstable weight to a smaller area. The step can be put up or put away after each use - we put ours in the tub since the shower curtain hid it from sight - so the issue is workable. I like that it's stackable so that in the future if we need it to be higher we can add another step.There are many other uses, most obviously as a step for children in the bathroom. If you or someone in your house has issues with elimination, it can be used in front of the toilet to raise your knees a bit (creating a pseudo Squatty Potty).Free product received for evaluation and review.

I think this is a product that's a great idea - and is something I wanted, badly - but it isn't really right with the FitBit One. Even though it's small, the FBO is still too bulky to fit comfortably on the wrist like this. I have an average 7" wrist and when inside this wristband, the flat area taken up by my FBO spans nearly the entire top of my wrist. I had a difficult time getting the straps tight enough because it wouldn't conform to the shape of my arm, then when I got it as tight as I could I had some issues getting it fastened. The way the wristband closes - two black rubber pegs are pushed into two slots - isn't secure enough that I'd wear this outside. It was fine for wearing around the house, especially when under the sleeve of a shirt but I wouldn't take it elsewhere.As far as accuracy goes, I haven't found a place to put my FBO yet that measures it properly so this isn't any different. It seems to give a low count vs the high counts I get when I put it in my pocket or clip it to my sock and the low count when I attach it to my bra.Discounted product received for evaluation and review.

The dude has issues with heel spurs and he goes through a lot of inserts. He thought they were a great combination of firm support with some bounce from the gel and the overall composition feels sturdy compared to other heel cups he's used that are similarly priced. Once he got used to them, the inserts were comfortable and helped with his day-to-day heel issues. The adhesive backing is generally fine - the pair he used in some dressier leather shoes haven't moved. The pair in his athletic shoes are starting to slide around a little bit, possibly because he wears them every day and he ends up with sweaty feet sometimes.Free product received for evaluation and review.

I swapped out the white ball in my cat's Turbo Scratcher for a Twinkle ball not long after I bought it and it was one of the best purchases I made for her. She loves it and I think it's one of the reasons the toy has kept her interest for so long. I only just now had to buy a new ball, meaning the first one kept working for about a year and a half! I don't know if it was weird luck or not but I ended up with a teal ball both times.We also own a Catit track and this does NOT fit. It's too big.

I love these microfiber cloths for dusting, cleaning glass and any other gentle cleaning or drying job I have. They don't leave streaking or dust behind and they don't scratch so I've used them on everything including my Kindles' screens and stainless appliances.I have the eggplant and they're really more bright purple than the deep color I'd have expected. I expected them to bleed a little so I washed them in the sink a few times until they were okay. The edges and quality of the towels were fine after washing - these aren't premium towels but this is a large pack and still a good value.

There are parts of this tree I think my cat will like and use a lot and parts that are poorly designed and make this clunky.From the beginning: I took another reviewer's advice (which was invaluable) and assembled this upside down. It really doesn't come with instructions, just a blown out diagram of the pieces in the general idea of what the tree looks like. It actually ended up taking three of us in the end when the bottom wouldn't go on without pulling the legs into square. It only took about a half hour and it wasn't difficult, just fiddly. The sisal on the posts is nice and tightly wound and the carpet is soft without any sharp staples or tacks exposed.Even while we were putting it together, I didn't understand why there was a swinging platform under the top tier. No cat I've ever had likes to jump on a moving surface and there's no way to step or jump on or off of it without it moving back and forth *and* side to side. If you've got multiple cats, it's also likely that if you manage to get one on the swinging platform, you'll have one devil underneath that'll decide to bat at it. My cat hated the thing (she kept staring at it, I think she thought it was going to fall on her) so after a day, I took it down.The small ledge on the right is too small - the angle of the image gives the impression it's longer than it is, there's actually only about four inches difference between the top edge and the back of the second tier's edge. It might be large enough for a little cat or kitten to sleep on but it's barely wide enough for my cat (an average-sized three year-old) to get on her back legs and leap to the top tier. She looks nervous every time she stands on it, enough that I've put a footstool on that side of the tree so she can get a running start at it if she'd like.There are things she likes about it which is why it gets three stars. She loves the middle tier in the morning because it's big enough that she can stretch full out on her back in the sun. Later in the day if she's on it, she's on the top tier and a couple of times I've found her in the little cubby hole. She likes to hide her toys around the house and she's deposited a few in the lower hammock.This is a big piece and like I mentioned at the beginning, it's kind of clunky. Unless you have a larger room, it'll look best near a corner because it's such a big rectangle and it's so very *beige.*

I'm close to a beginner when it comes to photo manipulation - I'd tried Photoshop Elements a few years ago and it was too much for me so I downloaded a free basic program and have been using that. I'm comfortable with a lot of the tools now and this version of PaintShop Pro has been much more pleasant to pick up. I was able to immediately start using the basic tools I already knew plus some new features like auto correct that immediately improved what I'd been creating. When I installed and registered my products I was sent to Corel's website and offered some extra downloads along with a signup for a newsletter for weekly tips that I took advantage of and a section devoted to tutorials that I bookmarked.I installed this on my laptop running Windows 10 and I haven't had any problems at all. Installation was smooth and it hasn't caused any problems even when I keep it running all day with other things in the background.I absolutely love this so far. I wouldn't ever be able to justify buying Photoshop but this is a wonderful, less expensive alternative. It does everything I need it to do (even without me figuring it all out yet).

I seriously cannot be without these bags - I use them for everything. The regular zip bags don't work at all for leftovers, they don't keep things fresh or keep odors in. These are perfect. Not only can I store leftovers in the fridge, I can put them in the freezer and know that they'll be just fine. There's a little click at the end of the zip letting me know the seal is complete and I've never had a problem with liquid leaking.I use these for many, many other things too. They're tough bags and can hold heavy things like batteries. I use them to keep paint tubes and rolls of heavy jewelry wire separate, among other things.I've picked up the regular Hefty zip bags occasionally and always come back to the freezer version. They're just so much more versatile and can take just about anything  you put in them.

I wish I had something to report but after a few weeks, this hasn't done one thing for the dark spots - some small scar residue, some freckles and some other non-freckle spotting - I applied it to. I don't know how long it's supposed to take for a noticeable difference to occur but other products make claims that theirs produce results within shorter time frames so I assume it's possible to achieve results within less time than I used this. I just know I'm a little frustrated that I used this religiously on top of skin treatments I already use religiously, and nothing happened beyond some over-moisturizing.I actually WILL continue to give this a chance for another couple of weeks to see if it'll do something and if there's any change at all, I'll come back and adjust my rating.

We have several Bluetooth enabled devices in our household so with a tween and near-tween who are obsessed with boy bands, I reluctantly turned this over to them. With some assistance, they were able to figure out how to link their phones and how to use an SD card with it (ugh!). The older girl figured out how to use the phone through the speaker and had clear coverage from anyplace in her room. They were able to easily tune into all of their favorite radio stations as well.All of us love the sound the speaker produces. For such a little unit (a bit smaller than a loaf of bread), there's a decent level of bass. It won't rattle your internal organs but it's better than I expected and with the clear treble makes for a nicely rounded sound. There's no distortion or crackling even at the highest volume.The unit comes with a USB cable and it holds a long charge, seven or eight hours worth of use. It doesn't affect performance but it's also a very nice looking speaker - the curves and dips make it less clunky and more like a display piece. We're looking forward to warmer weather again, when we can take it outside and listen to music in the backyard.Discounted product received for evaluation and review.

This is a really nice pair of sunglasses, better than the price would lead you to believe. They seem solidly built - the arms are tight and the plastic is substantial and the lenses, while not polarizing and not as dark as some, provide comfort in direct sunlight. I've got really sensitive eyes and these have provided perfect protection. They come with a very nice semi-hard zippered case, a drawstring bag and a microfiber wipe for the lenses (essential!).I'm a child of the 80s so I love this particular style of sunglasses. I had many pairs of Ray Bans back in the day and these are like an updated version with the wider arms, silver colored accents and slightly larger lens size. I just need to dig out my bomber jacket and Guess jeans and I'll be ready to go!Discounted product received for evaluation and review.

The dude had a bad experience with another beard trimmer and until now, rather than risking an accidental shearing, has waited until trips to the barber to get it cleaned up. That means he looks like a maniacal lumberjack for a few weeks. Not good. This is a great trimmer, one he can easily handle on his own without fear of accidentally shaving off his beard.This is a highly adjustable unit - you can leave slightly-more-than stubble to an inch of hair between the beard and hair comb attachments. You adjust the length by increments on the dial. The dude used the "9" length with the beard comb and it cleaned up his short beard nicely. The unit is very quiet and light and holds a long charge.This is strictly a beard trimmer and he has to keep his razor to get a sharp edge around his ears and anywhere else. If he ever went on a month-long trip someplace and had to pack both of them it would be a pain but since that probably won't happen, it's not a big deal. The trimmer comes with a kind of flimsy little bag that only holds the body, not the cord. It seems odd for such a relatively pricey item.

I use my ear buds primarily in the gym so my requirements are pretty simple: I need good sound so I can turn up my music loud enough to block out the sounds of the machines, I need the cord to be tangle-free and I need the ear buds to be comfortable and secure.The sound is really good through this set. It's clear without any distortion - there's not a great bass quality though and when I really cranked the volume up it became more apparent. I don't know if you're ever going to find great sound balance in a low-to-mid-priced set of ear buds and compared to other similar sets I've tried, it's about the same.The flat cable is fantastic - I can't believe what a difference it makes when it comes to tangling. I usually just toss my ear buds in my workout bag and worry about straightening them out the next time I need them, something that takes a while because they end up in a knotted mess. These just didn't tangle - I dropped them in and when I picked them up the next day they were perfect.The ear buds are a comfortable soft rubber - there are several sizes included and it's not hard to remove one and put on another. I can't wear any of the hard ear pieces or anything that wraps around my ears so this is pretty much my only option and I need it to be extra secure. I decided to keep the silicone bud that came on the set because I got a firm seal and it hasn't come out even when I run. The metal housing looks and feels solid and strong so I hope it lasts longer than all of the plastic-housed ear buds that have ended up in the trash.There's a multi-function button on the cable that can be used for pausing/starting music and answering calls but it's not something I use. It comes with a nicely sized zippered case that you can actually store the ear buds in.Discounted product received for evaluation and review.

I really like this set of cleaning cloths. I have the white set and my recommendation would be unless you're planning on bleaching them - or don't mind them looking grubby - pick a color. The scrubby cloth is really tough and great for pans and other places you'd need major elbow grease. The striped cloth is a mixture of a medium weight scrub and microfiber and I use it for cleaning my counters, cook top and stainless sink. I'm able to get a nice shiny finish to my sink and appliances especially that I don't normally get with just cleaning. I haven't used it there yet but it would also be great for cleaning the bathroom. The soft microfiber cloth is fluffy and I keep one dry for wiping dust off off my televisions and other electronics. The other I use spray with to do my regular dusting. Even though the cloths aren't huge, because of the loops they hold a lot of dirt.

This is a great, rugged little mat that's perfect for a mud room or anywhere a lot of debris gets tracked in. I live someplace that gets a lot of snow in the winter and even though I have a have an entryway rug there already, it slides around and I always end up with a dirty, slippery mess by front door. This rug isn't going anywhere - it has a thick rubber backing and didn't move around at all when I put it down. The top feels like it's made out of a kind of industrial material, between rubber and nylon, and is sculpted with deep ridges that will hold all kinds of gunk and liquid. It still has a low clearance and I have no problem opening and closing my door.I don't see why you couldn't use this outdoors if you wanted to prevent dirt from shoes coming in if you don't have a mud room, like in a garage or on a porch.

This is a festive egg platter with room for a dozen eggs (or a half dozen deviled eggs). It's slightly bigger than my dinner plates and the salt and pepper shakers are a nice size, maybe three-fourths the size of my regular stoneware set. I was slightly disappointed by the appearance of the set, given the Lenox name and the supposed retail value. It feels closer to stoneware than fine china - it's very thick and clunky and the glaze is dull. The color is also a much darker bone than any other pieces in my holiday collection - it's bordering on tan. I don't know if this is older stock or if I just got a weird piece but it wasn't what I was expecting based on the image.I love holiday dishes and will still have fun setting it out because hey, it'll be mostly covered by eggs anyway. But I wish it had been closer to the image.

I'm not 100% happy with the way NuPro engineered this case even though I appreciate that it's a low-cost alternative. There are several little issues that are obvious when you open it up. First: it's bulky. The thickness of the faux leather and lining add quite a bit of clunk once I compare it to my HDX with an Amazon cover. My Fire seems stable enough inside for now but it's very, very easy to bend the elasticized edges and pull it out again. The magnetized cover doesn't turn the Fire on and off and with the raised buttons on the top, it's easy to accidentally start or turn it off even while you have the cover closed.
