Most of the dust came off by tapping it hard against the inside of my garbage can, which was great because I thought, "I have to buy one of these twice a week?!"I wish it had come with the extender; it would be much more useful. The handle is quite short.Honestly, I much prefer a lambswool duster. It can last years and years and does a great job. But, in lieu of that, this works very well. I just am generally more in favor of non-disposable products; that's the reason for the four stars instead of five.

I love bubble bath and was looking forward to trying all three of the trio. My first impression of all of them, smell-wise, was terrible. The Nourishing Milk and Honey has almost no odor. The Hibiscus is almost sickly sweet. Lastly, I sniffed what should have been an easy one, lavender, and well, it doesn't smell like lavender, at least not any good lavender essential oil. And that's what I want in a bubble bath, and what I would have expected from this brand. I read the ingredients list and was surprised to discover that there are some "real" ingredients such as honey in these as they don't look, smell or feel like anything approaching a natural product.They don't lather much and they are rather drying. They will make a very good lingerie wash. That's what I always do with bubble bath that doesn't satisfy. It's the same stuff - sodium laurel sulfate (or some variation thereof).

I really like this cream. It has a subtle smell that goes away within minutes. I can't stand how much fragrance are in most moisturizers and creams.This product moisturizes and seems to leave a subtle glow. I put a little too much on my fingers a few times and put it on my whole face. Why not? I really like it and it's great under mineral makeup.The pump mechanism is quite hard to start. I thought it didn't work at all. On day three of using it, it started working. I thought of taking a star away because of that, but well, it works fine now.

I absolutely love this pen! It writes so smoothly, even on nubbly watercolor paper. It's a fine line, but not too fine. Just right (at least for me). I love it for sketching. Did I say "love" enough?! I adore the length. I generally use a dip pen and am used to the extra length, so finding this pen has made me a very happy camper. I am of the understanding that one shouldn't throw this "desk pen" into one's bag, but I will try. If it doesn't work afterwards or if it leaks, I'll report back, but for right now, it's become my go-to pen when I want a nice black line.

These are lovely. They are crocheted, which can't be done by a machine. Though they're sold as dish scrubbers, they make very nice washcloths because they exfoliate without scratchiness. They are also perfect for those little scraps of bar soap. Just pop them into the fish's mouths and the cloths will lather up beautifully! I'd rather use these for my shower than the sink, as I don't want to get them stained. They are just that cute!So, why didn't I give them five stars? It's because they're ten dollars and I don't know where they are made. It doesn't say on the wrapper, nor does it  say here on Amazon. And I do want to know. It's a fair guess to assume they're made in China. Even if they are, ten bucks for two of them is a ridiculously low price. We may like it, but if one considers that Now Designs sold it wholesale, can you imagine how little the person who crocheted these made? As a crocheter, I feel guilty about even liking these. It would take a fast crocheter at least a few hours to make one of these. I like these so much and they would make lovely gifts, so I plan on making some myself.

Excellent nitrile gloves. They are a little thicker than the black nitrile gloves I've used in the past, but that's great. I like the texture in the fingertips. These are really superior for using with wet materials. I haven't used the whole box (not by a long shot), but I rather doubt any of them will rip when putting them on, which has happened with me many a time using Black Magic Nitrile gloves. They run a tad large. I am between a small and a medium in most gloves and these are perfect for me. Easy to get on, but not loose enough for liquids to get in. Pricey but highly recommended.

I live in a fairly small space with a combination of rugs and bare floors. I have been using a Panasonic canister vacuum, which has been satisfactory. Ever since my old Electrolux bit the dust I've not been that happy with any vacuum. They're all just "good enough." This vacuum is better than that on rugs, for sure. It's as good as my Electrolux. For rugs, I give it five stars plus! It took me about 1/4th the time I usually take vacuuming my bedroom, where I have enough rug real estate to essentially be wall-to-wall. I live in an old house and the places where the floor dips are hard spots for vacuum cleaners, especially when there's a rug over the spot. There's a place near a doorway that I never feel gets cleaned enough and this vacuum stood right up to it without a hitch! Bravo!The down side is that vacuuming the bare floors with the beater bar turned off is so-so. The "dust" attachment works fine for bare floors, but wow, that'd take a long time. So, I stuck on the floor attachment from my other Panasonic. It fits and works great. For the price, this vacuum should have come with a floor brush. I'm guessing anyone buying a non-upright vacuum is looking for something that works equally well on carpets and bare floor. This will, with a bare floor brush, and at this price point it should have been in the box, not something that one would have to buy separately.The upholstery attachment works well. I like the fact that there's a place for the crevice and dust attachments on the wand and it would have been perfect if there was a way to store all the attachments on the unit, but it's not a deal breaker.The cord is nice and long. The telescoping wand is long enough for me (and short enough, too), but I'm only a tad over five feet tall. I'm guessing this vacuum might be short for those who are tall, especially since the rug attachment works significantly better when one holds the wand at an extreme angle. The dust cup is easy to clean. All in all, I'm quite satisfied with this vacuum and very impressed with it on rugs.It is heavy, but not as heavy as any good canister vac. It rolls easily, and it never tipped over once when I was vacuuming, It also didn't get hung up on furniture like my regular canister vac does. It's cute and is great size for a smaller house or apartment for both vacuuming and storage.

I've used this three times and can't bring myself to trying it again. First off, the smell. It's nice enough; it smells quite a bit like a European soap or Cashmere Bouquet, but on me, the scent did not dissipate quickly. The first time I used the product, I applied it in the morning (and quite sparingly), and I could still smell it hours later. All that scent right up in my face gave me a low level headache. I wear perfume, too, so it's not that I'm all that sensitive to fragrance, but really, I'd rather not have my facial products compete for my olfactory attention. The other problem I had is that I felt as if my skin was sticky or had a film on it for hours. It felt rather like I had a soap film on it. I tried the product two other times, at bedtime. The first time my husband objected to the odor. The second time I applied after he'd fallen asleep, and at that point, I decided that this simply isn't a product I want to use again.Did it moisturize my skin? Not really, but I will admit to three times not being the fairest of tests.

This is by far the best ink pad I've ever used. I just did a bunch of rubber stamp, linoleum, and styrofoam prints and compared them side-by-side. This has a richer, crisper black that looks like real printmaking ink.  It dries quickly. I can't recommend it highly enough, especially if you want your images to look like high quality wood cuts. Fine details show up well and there's no bleeding on any of the paper I used. Fantastic!

I found that this product did absolutely nothing for my skin. I was disappointed, as I'd used a far more expensive B3 product in the past (with excellent results) and didn't want to pay so much for more. Even with less than a pea-sized amount on my face, it felt sticky, especially on hot days.I am pleased that the company gave me a full refund. They stand by their product and that's excellent. I hate wasting my money. Obviously, this product works well for some people.

This bra is close to perfect for me, which is quite a feat. I usually wear a 28 or 30G. Since I read that this one ran small, I ordered a 30GG. It was a bit big in the cup and I went right to the last set of hooks, so I ordered a 28GG. It is a true 28 inch band and fits me without any movement. The cups fit perfectly. Even though the straps are wide set and where the cups meet the straps sit right in my armpits, I was shocked to discover that I could wear the bra all day without any chafing. For the first half a day of wearing it, I thought, "Wow. This is what it feels like to wear a bra that fits!" I also looked smaller (which I appreciate). It even looked good and natural under a t-shirt, though I have to admit I've never had that much lift, even when I was 14!Unfortunately, it's not an all-day wear for me, though I tried, and wished it would be. Maybe it will be when it's broken in some. I'm not used to wearing the correct band size.I really appreciate that there are four hooks in the back. I've been very frustrated by the fact that the majority of bras in small band sizes, even if the cup size is large, have only two hooks. My favorite bras are long line ones, which I modify by cutting and sewing the the center front so that it rises up.This bra is SO close to perfect, and it's such a great price. No, it's not beautifully made, but it's not awful, and it looks fabulous on.

My hair is thin and fine, and I'm always looking for products that give it body without too much scent and/or stickiness. "Root lifting" is just what I need.I applied the product just as the package says by rubbing it between the palm of my hands and then applying it to my roots. I then bent over and did the blow dry and tousle that usually gives my hair a good amount of lift even without product. It's getting it to stay that way that's the trick!When my hair was dry, it looked great. I thought, "Wow. That's a lot of hold without hair spray!"Unfortunately, one of my pet peeves - scent - reared it ugly head. Like most hair products these days, this stuff is highly scented. I can't tell you what it smells of exactly. It's a bit fruity, I suppose. The bottom line is that it was too strong, at least for my taste, and on a hot and humid day it was really annoying me.  I also wear perfume, and frankly, I'm tired of hair products competing with my perfume!But, if it had really held my hair in place I may have been less unhappy with the scent. It took only a few hours for my hair to flatten out. It did look like it had a bit more thickness and body than if I hadn't used any product, but this wasn't anything to jump up and down about.The search continues. . .

Wonderful sweet almond oil! This is truly an unscented oil. I am very impressed. It's a fantastic skin moisturizer. It soaks into my skin and leaves it feeling naturally soft. I have extremely dry skin and I'm thrilled with this oil. Even after applying quite a bit to my arms and legs, my hands don't feel greasy and oily. I wear perfume and have been looking for a truly scentless product for my dry skin and have now found it! I'm sorry I didn't try this sooner.

My cat loves cat treats. She's a bit picky, but she'll usually try something. I gave her five of the salmon & cranberry treats. She sniffed them and seemed unsure if they were food. She then ate them and looked up at me as if saying, "Where's my treat?" Of course, I have no idea what she's thinking, but that's how it seemed. Indeed, an hour later, she was back in the spot where she usually begs for a treat. Today I gave her a few more and she totally ignored them. I'd give these a one-star review if she hadn't eaten them in the first place. I presume other cats will like these, but my kitty says, "No thank you."Today I got the tuna & cranberry treats. I totally expected her to turn her finicky nose up at them, but no, she gobbled them up and then meowed for more. Since Amazon treats both flavors as if they're the same product, I had to come revise my earlier (bad) review of the salmon treats.My cat is not overweight so I'm not concerned about the calorie count of her treats. If you are, these are a good bet, though I can't begin to guess if your cat will have the same taste as mine.

I've been trying to read this book every evening for over two weeks now and I finally gave up. For me, the writing, which felt dry, often jarringly impersonal, and often disjointed, kept me from reading the very important, timely, and positive information in this book. I simply could not read it. I'm grateful that I already am quite familiar with the teachings of the Dalai Lama.But no matter. Goleman's writing style is obviously fine for many people, and if it's an entry point to the very important ideas of the Dalai Lama's, then it's great. For me, I'd prefer to read the Dalai Lama himself. I've read many of his books, and some of them I consider classics, such as Ethics for the New Millennium, which I've recommended to countless people.Still, I'm grateful for this book, too. These are important ideas. We all have different taste in reading material, and so it's good that there are different iterations of the same ideas for different people.

I have to say I am disappointed by these headphones. They have excellent sound separation but the low-end bass is sorely lacking. Because of the excellent sound separation, I thought they might fare better listening to acoustic music (my original test had been with heavily produced trip hop), but no, it was even more noticeable to me. I listened to a track of Bach that I've listened to for over four decades now, and I wondered where the low end had gone. Still, they're very nice headphones, but at this price point, I expected true excellence. Additionally, most people will find them uncomfortable. They need more padding for a heavy headphone. One last point - my Chromebook's Bluetooth could not detect them, so if I was reviewing them solely with my own computer, I wouldn't be able to give them even one star. I had to use my husband's laptop to test them. I can't say I don't like them, but I can't recommend them.

These are simply okay. I expected the bass to sound better, considering "rich powerful base" is the major selling point. When compared to Panasonic's  model RP-HT21 headphones, which are super lightweight and only $6.99 right here on Amazon, I thought, "Where'd the bass go?" I'd use these to listen to audiobooks, but for music, I much prefer the just-mentioned Panasonics, or any of the NuForce in-ear models, some of which are less expensive. However, these are perfectly fine, and do have a clean sound. They are also comfortable, and I do wish they were more satisfying, as they match my blue laptop perfectly!

When I told my husband that I received a free bottle of this $71 product, he said, "What if you like it?" At that point, a week ago, I was highly skeptical,  and replied I doubted it would be an issue.I'm in my fifties, and frankly, there's been no "miracle beauty cure" that I've thought has done a thing for my skin. Getting enough sleep, eating a good diet, protecting my skin from the sun,and washing my face with high quality mostly natural products has been my strategy. I was blessed with a good complexion and tight pores.I think it would be bizarre to be my age and have no visible signs of aging. To want for that seems ridiculous, in my estimation. But, of course, I want to look my best, as we all do. My skin is fairly dry, has some age spots and lines, and the skin has become less taut. So, with great skepticism, I tried this. I've used neem oil in the past, as it's been used in India for a long, long time. I prefer oil to moisturizer, as I dislike the feeling of product sitting on one's face. Neem and coconut oil both are excellent moisturizers, but they both left my skin too greasy.Much to my surprise, this Nia 24 really made my skin look and feel great upon the first application. It can be used alone or with another product. I used it alone first; three drops were plenty for my entire face. My skin felt moisturized without any greasiness and stayed that way through the day. I didn't make my skin red or tingly, as some others report. In addition, I was quite pleased that this product has a nice natural smell of citrus. A few minutes after application, I no longer noticed the smell, which is unusual these days with most skin care products. Very nice indeed!As the week progressed, my skin really did look more healthy. I kept asking myself, "Is it because you know this is pricey?" Considering my extreme skepticism about any beauty products, I think the answer is no. I like how my skin feels and looks, and the sheerness of this product. As for the age spots, I have not noticed a difference, but if I do, I'll come back and give this five stars. Honestly, the only reason I'm not giving it five stars is that I can't really believe that $71 is a reasonable price. I know there are more expensive products out there, but there are also less, and I'm guessing someone is making a tidy profit. Of course, that's what companies do, but at this price, it's just a luxury that most people would have to think more than twice about. Sure, it's less than a shot of Botox, but that's not a great thing to compare it to. Still, I can't say anything else bad about this product other than the price is too high for this shopper. If it were less, I would definitely purchase it, though. I love the way my skin feels!I used the product with some under-eye product and this worked really nicely.

Full disclosure: I received this item free through the Amazon Vine program. It didn't come with the recommended Scott-Vincent Borba Anti-Fatigue Corrective Concealer Tool with Line Smoothing Tear-Drop Blending Applicator ($40), which costs more than the concealer itself, so I used my finger to apply this product. And though the tool is probably useful, I'm sure using a finger or another brand of applicator is just fine.It is thick, but not so thick as to make it difficult to use. I have dark circles and redness under my eyes, and this isn't a great product for me unless I apply a good amount of foundation makeup over it. Why? Because it's not a true "color correction" (CC) product. Though technically speaking, color correction claims can be made when there's anything that "diffuses light" in the product (in this case, supposedly citrine diamonds), true color correction for red comes from a green concealer. Simply applying something lighter, thicker, and close to your skin tone on red or dark under eye circles will make them look grey. That is true in my case, and it's not a great look, to be sure. So, for days when I do want to wear a lot of makeup, this is a perfectly fine product, as it does what many other products like this do, even out skin tone and cover "imperfections." Then, if one has to do true blending and color correcting, one puts full foundation and even a finish of powder over that.I prefer to wear the least amount of makeup that I can. I think the level of "perfection" that we're increasingly being told we need to aim for as women is ridiculous. This is fine for days I want to wear a lot of makeup, but for a quick swipe of under eye concealer on days I want people not to see how tired my eyes look, I'll reach for something else. I think it's best to buy that in person, where there are many, many different shades, and one can pick one that's just right for one's skin. I am very pale, with a yellow cast, which is unusual in someone so light skinned. So, for me, it's important to buy some products in person and from lines that have a lot more choices that match one's skin tone. Otherwise, it's awfully hit or miss. And, I've found that one can use a lot less product when it's really right for one's skin.I may be ranting a bit, but this product, like most beauty products, comes with a lot of hype (though there could be even more). Citrine diamonds are lovely amber colored stones. Are they really in here, ground up? If so, I think this product would be much pricier. Will the "Black Algae and Sustainable Red Palm Oil increase cell turnover?" I have no idea. I have no idea what "InvisiVeil Technology" is. It's just advertising hype. But, Scott-Borba's hype is no better or worse than other companies, so it feels almost unfair to be calling them out on this. However, as I do use (and buy) some pricey products from companies such as Dr. Hauschka, whose claims to using natural and beneficial products are backed up with easy-to-read and accessible ingredients lists and information about the products on their websites, I do feel it's important to point out unsubstantiated claims in makeup products when I see them.

I got this book through Amazon Vine, and because of that, I have to review it. If not for that, I would probably not write a review. If I can't finish a book, I figure it's my problem, it's not for me, and I don't like to write bad reviews. But, I don't have that option here.Bottom line: I could not conjure up a shred of interest in Eytan Bayme's life. The book felt like it had one punch line, over and over again; He's a kid who's Orthodox and - gasp! - he wants to masturbate, look at porn, have sex and eat pork!  As my grandmother would have said, "Enough already!"I had read some of Eytan Bayme's writing on his website and found it good and amusing, but this extended foray into his childhood left me more than cold. I could not help thinking, repeatedly, that he's no Philip Roth and this was no Portnoy's Complaint.One could say that well, that was then and this is now. Maybe that's so. Maybe it's a generational thing, but some books transcend that. This one doesn't, at least for this reader. If you want to read a great book about a Jewish boy's coming of age and dealing with lust and masturbation and all the rest, this doesn't hold a candle to Roth. And perhaps the fact that it isn't fiction makes a world of difference. I am not sure. But, by halfway through this, I had really had more than enough.

My finicky cat LOVES these snacks. Maybe too much, lol! I got some free at a whole foods fair, and brought them home for her to try. After that, she turned up her nose at the ones I get from the supermarket. Ah, well, they're only a little more expensive, and I suppose they're better for her. We love to keep our kitties happy, don't we?

An extraordinary compendium of fabric manipulation techniques! If you're looking for patterns and projects, however, this is not the book for you. I, however, am delighted by it. I've been inspired over and over again by the contents. There's just enough technique information, though if you're a beginner sewist or fiber artist, you may need more instruction. I am a fine artist who uses fiber, and when I'm feeling stuck creatively, this is one the books I turn to.I also know, that by looking at this book, I'm not unconsciously stealing any ideas. These are techniques, not finished products. Fabulous!!!

I have an old Vega banjo and these strings are just not right for it. I was really surprised at how suddenly my usually good sounding banjo sounded nearly like a cigar box guitar. They were not bright, and the wound string sounded "dead." I've used D'Addario strings on guitars for years. Go figure.
Smells like white glue and acts like white glue. Very disappointing, overpriced product.

I found this book captivating. At first I was a bit put off by the style. As another reviewer noted, this book is not "poetic." It's not beautifully written, but neither is it poorly written. It's plain spoken, and that turns out to be quite refreshing. So is Henry Marsh (called Mr. in Great Britain). He's done a lifetime of good work, but is humble. A surgeon who recommends that a patient's family sue him? Not in America. And I suspect not likely anywhere.Traumatic brain injury and death have visited my family more than the usual amount of times. Because of this, instead of feeling adverse to reading about neurology and neurosurgery, it interests me greatly. Knowing more than usual served me well when faced with one of the difficult conversations  with neurosurgeons Henry Marsh repeatedly writes about in this book.It is refreshing in the extreme to read about a surgeon who can admit his mistakes and understand how much luck plays in both life and surgery. Marsh writes about the arc of his career as a neurosurgeon and the wisdom, humility, and even distancing that he's had to develop in order to work in this difficult specialty. In some ways, he doesn't give away too much personal information; we know his first marriage ended badly on account of his being a neurosurgeon, but what that really means is never explained. I suppose it's unimportant, a salacious detail.This book is about surgery, the life of a doctor in the hospital, first and foremost. It is about neurosurgery, in language most laypeople can understand.There's something a tad dry about this book at times, but it underscores the times when Marsh is not dry. At one point he indulges in cursing for an entire paragraph, and (unlike another reviewer), I found it rather thrilling. He could have indulged in a rant about bureaucracy and the National Health Service in a more coherent fashion, but he did not. He's a human being, not a superhero, and that is, in fact, what this book seems to really be about. Neurosurgeons are flawed human beings doing the job that gives them nearly God-like powers. Henry Marsh knows that he is not a God indeed, and for that I'm glad to have read his very human book.

Adam Benforado sheds new light on the inherent biases in our justice system or, more precisely, the ones inside our minds, that we are incapable of seeing. He does with, too, with writing that is readable and compelling. I haven't read a book that I quoted to friends and family so much in a long, long time.In this book, police and prosecutors aren't cast as villains but as people who believe they are doing the right thing (which is generally the case). The same with solitary confinement, long prison sentences, and the like. We have a system that is based on what we believe to be results, but increasingly, there is not a correlation between what we want - a safe society, fairness - and how we judge and incarcerate people. This book is fascinating for in it is a broad question - do we really want fairness in our system or do we want to continue to do what we want because we simply believe that it is right? Do we want to exact revenge and punishment and allow those with the most money to buy the verdicts they want or do we want a fair, safe society that is best for all?I think most people do want justice to be fair. We also want our justice system to work. We want to keep criminals off our streets and out of our homes. One hard truth is that when justice is not fair, people tend to lose respect for the law, or if they are among those whom the scales of justice falls more heavily upon, learn to be afraid of it. This does not make for a safer and good society. I hope it is safe to say that one needn't be "liberal" or "conservative" to understand that these issues need to be addressed. That is why this is an important book, one that I found almost impossible to put down. Adam Benforado not only finds fault, but shows us ways to improve our system. I applaud his work.

I have to admit to a strong preference for natural products. I use Dr. Hauschka Cleansing Cream, 1.7-Ounce Boxwhen I want a facial scrub. But, that is an expensive product, and so when I got a chance to try this Neutrogena Scrub for free, I figured I'd give it a chance.Yes, it left my skin clean without being stripped. However, I didn't find using it to be all that pleasant an experience. The "green tea" smell is not bad, but I was keenly aware of how fake it was, especially as the entire product has the consistency of a gritty shampoo. The exfoliating grit is also so small that one needs to be very careful not to get it into one's mouth or eyes.I'd never thought about the actual consistency and content of exfoliators before using this product.  I'd never been concerned about getting any into my mouth or eyes when I've used a product that uses oatmeal or almond for exfoliation. I suppose once you start using natural products it becomes hard to go back. Still, this facial cleanser does what it says it will do. It's not the kind of product I want to use on my skin, but at least it neither leaves a residue, a strong odor, or strips the skin of its natural oils, so if you want an exfoliating product and haven't developed an aversion to non-natural products, it's perfectly fine.

I usually buy Lundberg rice, but I thought I'd give this one a try because I like the company.  Sadly, it's disappointing. Though a mix of different rice, it is fairly bland and lacks the nuttiness I expect from brown and red rice. The consistency is sticky and bordering on porridge-like. Reminds me of short grain brown rice that was popular in the '70s. Would make good rice pudding. Otherwise, I can't recommend it. "It's okay."

No synopsis here; there's enough of them.The Fifth Gospel hit every sweet spot for me; good writing, excellent religious history, personal drama, and mystery. I would venture to guess that lovers of the more recent religious thrillers might find this book a tad too dense, but I may be wrong. I omitted a star for being a bit of a plod at times; it could have used some trimming. The book it reminded me of most was Anthony Burgess' "Earthly Powers," though this book is not the audacious, oftentimes funny masterpiece that was. Since I am making the comparison, some of the plodding nature of "The Fifth Gospel" was due to a total lack of humor. Still, if you enjoy good historical fiction and have an interest in religious history, I recommend plunging in.

. . .finish this book. Really, I tried.The publisher's blurbs do not do it justice, especially comparing the author to Patricia Highsmith. There is nothing Highsmithian about either the story or the writing.I started the book and was quickly met with dashed expectations. This was not what we had been promised! No soaring writing. No intricate emotional twists and nuances. Did I miss something?I was interested up to a point. In the end, it just came down to this: I have other books to read. We all have a limited amount of time in our lives to read fiction. This book did not hold my attention. If I haven't explained it well enough, I'm sorry. I can't.Bottom line is that if you're a Highsmith fan, you'll probably be as disappointed.

This peeler was such a disappointment! My first impression was "Wow!" because the handle and grip feels absolutely perfect in my hand. If it weren't for that, I'd give this product one star.First off, I used it to peel the skin off fresh ginger. Ginger is difficult to peel; I usually use a knife, but I figured that the serrated edge would work well. I was not wrong about that; I was impressed with how thin a peel I got. As I usually do, I peeled towards me, and twice had the serrated blade stick in the skin of my thumb. Not a full fledged cut either time, but not pleasant.  I haven't had that happen to me since I first learned to peel vegetables properly (decades ago). It did a great job on the ginger. My assessment was it might be worth learning to respect this blade as the peel was nice and super thin, almost grated. I washed the peeler, had the blade nick me once again, and put it aside for my husband to try on some other veggies. My thumb had had enough.He peels away from himself, the opposite of me. He used it on both sweet and white potatoes. He said he would not use it again: "Too much work. The peels get caught in the serrated edge and one has to clean it out too often." I was standing right next to him and could see that it was true. It also seemed to take him twice as long to peel those potatoes as usual and indeed he said it seemed so.I see that this may be good for tomatoes. I have never peeled a fresh tomato; if I ever do so and discover this is indispensable for that purpose, I'll revise this review. Otherwise, I can't see the benefit of it. On top of that, I think the blade is too wobbly. I have a Kitchenaide peeler that looks like a knockoff of the OXO one; the blade does not have as much play, and because of that, I find I can be much more precise in my peeling.Too bad! I still am curious about the julienne version. . .

I feel silly writing this as it's so old fashioned, but my husband set this up, so excuse me for not being even vaguely technical in my review:He said the set up was easy and it appeared to be "working." However, we saw absolutely no change in our WIFI signal. He reset the router and this device three times and still, no change. He did a speed test. We saw a drop in speed. He said to me, "I can't even say whether this device is working or affecting anything one way or the other."Either way, it is not working for us. He doesn't know why and neither do I. The indicator lights make it seem as if it should be. He said the instructions were clear; he followed them to the letter with both ways of hooking it up, and still, we see no change or "negative change" in our WIFI connection.

If I were reviewing this book simply for myself, I would give it two stars, but I think it is a generally good book. However, it is not what I was expecting. I did not expect the bulk of the book to be "how-to technique."What I was expecting was an in-depth book about acrylic paint. I know it's called "Painting in Acylics," but the description I read lead me to think there was more about materials than technique in this book.  Perhaps that was wishful reading on my part. The materials sections are good, but they are not detailed in the way that the technique section is. The section on the paints, while good, are no more than twenty pages in a 300 pages plus book. Furthermore, the photos of pigments are small for this large book. One reason I selected this book is because I've recently become interested in using some unusual acrylics (eg. interference colors). There is information on colors such as these, but it's only one page. Not in-depth at all. This book has great basics on materials, but not more than that. In fact, I just decided to edit this review because one person commented that there is nothing on the toxicity of paints. That is a big oversight in a book that is otherwise so detailed and well organized.If you're a hobby painter and like how-to books to follow along with, you'll love it. Me? I doubt I'll look at it again after than a few perusals. I do like "how to" books, but I want as much information about materials as I can possibly get. The technique part? From my training, I think it's best to know your materials, experiment, and practice. This book has what I'd call a "rigid" approach. Not to my liking, but I can see it is excellent for many, so I can't dismiss it because of that. If you like a lot of short tutorials on technique to follow along with, this book may be your holy grail. It's just not mine by a long shot.

I've been trying to find a 16-18 pound paper for almost a year. Finally found one! Yes, the shipping is a bit much, but I'm delighted with this paper. It's surprising smooth. Yes, it's thin. That's why it's so useful. I can use it for tracing, use it for sketching, and not worry if I ball up a piece and throw it out. When sketching, I don't like worrying about wasting paper and I hate the texture of newsprint. One reviewer said it was hard to erase without smudging. I found that not to be the case with a white eraser.This paper is perfect for my uses. I'm not planning on putting it in a printer. 500 sheets for 11 bucks is superb for sketch paper! I will be reordering it. Hope they keep making it!

This is a very nice product. I don't like the smell but it's bearable. What does it smell like? Rotted apples. I live in the country and know what that smells like. It's not the worst smell and after a few minutes, I didn't notice it much. Still, it's not what I'd call enjoyable.Anyway, I did a patch test (which is neither on the box or the jar of product, but only here on the web). No problems, so I went ahead and used the product.This is a gelatinous goop. I slathered it on my face and neck, carefully avoiding my eyes, set a timer for ten minutes, and waited. The product does tingle quite a bit but it's rather a pleasant feeling. By the ten minute mark, it had almost dried up and felt a bit tight on my face. That too, was rather a pleasant feeling. It performs more like a masque than a peel. I took a washcloth with hot water to wash off the product. I didn't want to splash water on my face as I assumed that getting this in one's eyes wouldn't be a good thing.I was pleasantly surprised to see that this product does a lovely job. My skin felt scrubbed clean without being stripped of oils. It was noticeably softer. Even my husband noticed a difference (and he's indifferent to most things such as this).I can not attest to whether or not this helps with hyperpigmentation because I haven't any on my skin, but it does a fine job of what I'd call "super cleansing." I've only used one other product that worked as well as this, Philosophy's Microdelivery Peel. That product is harsher, abrasive, and warms up on the face. I think this does about as good a job, is comparably priced, and is a more natural product. I was going to give it four stars because I didn't like the smell or the sliminess of the product, but y'know what? In spite of these things, I'm giving it five stars, because my skin feels and looks good without a lot of nasty ingredients.

The story of my experiences with mattresses and mattress pads is long and complicated enough to write a book about, so I won't get into it too much. Making a very long story short, after years of trying every conceivable mattress, my husband and I bought a high end Stearns & Foster with a light pillow top. We erred on the extra firm side because it one can always put mattress toppers on, but you can't make a soft bed more firm.I have chronic joint pain and found myself waking up feeling terrible in the mornings. So, I purchased a memory foam mattress topper. We'd had a memory foam bed and I liked it, but it was hot, and my husband hated it. I thought an inch of memory foam might be okay, but it didn't help much, so I put a gel foam topper on top of that. That turned out to be quite good, but after a year, the gel topper was worn out, or I got worse, or both, and I was once again waking up in a lot of pain.I have a latex pillow and sometimes I sit on it, so I did some research into latex mattress toppers. I liked the fact, too, that they are all natural (or can be). This one is.So, I got it. I can not tell you how happy I am! It is what I have been needing and wishing for for years. Even though this one is marked "soft" it isn't really. It has spring and it doesn't squash down all the way to the mattress. I can't guarantee that will be the case with you, as it does differ with weight; both my husband and I weigh under 150 pounds.Anyway, I love the way it feels. I love the fact that it isn't off-gassing some petroleum product. As the other reviewer noted, it has a smell rather like almonds, but I couldn't smell it once I put a mattress cover over it. Covering this topper is a must as it can be ripped quite easily. I put a waterproof mattress pad over it which holds it in place quite well and also protects it from my cat's claws.I am waking up in less pain. It is cool. It is comfortable. The price is great for a 100% natural latex pad. My husband likes it, too. From what I understand, this will last a good long time. I am delighted with this mattress topper and wish I'd found it sooner! If you have pressure points, arthritis, or other issues that make you wake up in pain, I can't recommend this highly enough.Tip I learned from this company's website: If you have a "good mattress" a one inch pad is enough. If your mattress isn't good, you would be better off with a two inch pad. I really appreciate the fact that the seller of this product isn't pushing their most expensive product. Kudos to them!

This is a wonderful (but slim) collection of essays; Donald Hall's musings on his past and present. He is (obviously) in his eighties, and his voice is clear. In our youth obsessed culture, we need to hear more from the old and for that alone I am glad for this book.I don't appreciate reading synopses of books, so I won't write one, and anyway, this volume is thin enough that telling you much about it would spoil the fun of reading. I came to it fresh, not having read him before (indeed), and found it a wonderful read. Mr. Hall's style is spare, pointedly witty, and often wise.I read this book on an afternoon where we had no power in our home in Maine; I read bits aloud to my husband.  We're in our late fifties and  live in a town where we are on the younger side of middle and old age. So, reading this spoke to much of our condition.So, we (not just I) enjoyed Mr. Hall's sharing of his life and memories, and sharing his gratitude for that life, both past and present. Even more, I enjoyed that he did so without veering into either sweet sentimentality or the (terribly overdone) stance of an old curmudgeon. He has led a good and robust life and still does, though now from a wheelchair. There's no self pity in that; the life of his mind is rich indeed, and he had led a fairly charmed and privileged life before (and I suppose he still does).We need to understand the richness of simply looking out a window. Mr. Hall tells us about this without preaching it. He may be an old man, but his voice sounds totally fresh. He is simply telling us what life has been and is for him. He is a writer, so he writes it. And anyway, this isn't a self help book.I've written enough; I'm not a writer, but Mr. Hall certainly is.In all, I felt I'd spent an afternoon with someone I'm glad I met. Hall's beautiful writing was a pleasure to read and I can not recommend a book more highly. Now I'll go back and read what came before.

Great, high-quality product. The only thing that would make this product better is wheel locks. The spinner-style wheels make rolling through the airport or down a plane aisle a breeze.  But it also means you can't leave the case on an incline. The trade off between spinner or traditional wheels is a matter of personal preference. I'm good with the spinners.

Great looking, comfortable hat at a fair price. I needed a bowler hat for a costume. I decided to go with a hat I might wear on other occasions instead of a throw-away. No regrets. This hat is exactly as advertised.
Love the fabric and the fit. But no fly = no buy for me. I like the feel of these better, but the lack of a fly is a nuisance for everyday wear. I'm sticking with the UA Statement series,

Nice supportive feel. A bit tight, but that's the intent. Nothing will move around. The fabric feels a bit slick, but is thicker and more durable than similar, cheaper products.  I like the more cotton-like feel of the UA mesh product better, but it doesn't have a fly. So I'm sticking with these for now.

These socks are thicker than your average dress sock. At first, I thought I would find that a problem. But since I wear them with casual shoes, I found that they are actually very comfortable. The thickness gives them a very high quality feel. I would definitely buy these again. But if your shoes fit tight, these are not for you.
Didn't love these. If you like the feel of wool against your skin, they might be okay. But they are thin and don't seem to hold up well after washing.

The case seems well-constructed. But I was hoping to use it for checking my guitar on flights. It doesn't feel as solid as the SKB case I've been using for this purpose, which has a hard plastic shell. The leather-like exterior of the ChromaCast case looks nice but certainly wouldn't stand-up to airline handling. Feels like it would get easily scuffed and perhaps even tear. Not what I expected for something labeled as a "hard case."My Seagull dreadnought fits a bit loosely and slides up and down. My Martin dreadnought fits better. The case is fairly deep, which means a bit more room in the goody box under the neck. But it's also bulkier and a bit more awkward to carry than my previous case. This case feels heavy, even when empty. The leather handle actually has sharp seams and isn't particularly comfortable. And the case didn't come with the pick sampler, which isn't a big deal except that a product should come with what it says it should come with.I don't dislike this enough to return it. It looks nice and it's okay for toting my guitar locally.  But I wouldn't buy it again.

A great little mixer for the money. But mine arrived with channel 1 dead, so I'm having to return it for replacement. Bless Amazon for making returns so easy.Pros:  Compact. Good mic preamps with no background noise (bonus points for this because it's both critically important and rare in low cost equipment). Logical controls. Flexible outputs with a separate Record, Aux and Effects bus.Variable level of effects for each channel.Cons: Effects quality is okay, but not outstanding. Only one effect at a time--you can't cascade effects or choose different effects for different channels. Selecting a different effect or setting effect parameters requires lots of button pushes.I haven't tried the USB interface yet, so I can't comment on that. I like this unit enough that I'm getting another even though the first one was defective.

I already own a Wusthof Classic chef's knife and paring knife. I didn't realize how much better a serrated knife is for certain tasks or I would have bought one long ago. This knife breezes through bread, tomatoes and other hard-to-cut foods so easily it's almost fun. Best kitchen tool purchase I've made in quite a while. Highly recommended.

Making hard/soft boiled eggs in this unit is relatively straightforward and seems to work well. Poached eggs, which is the main reason I bought it, is another story.The poached egg cups are too small to hold a regular large egg. When the heat comes on, the eggs expand and drip into the water underneath, which confuses the sensor. The buzzer, which is extremely loud and obnoxious, goes off after about a minute while the eggs are still completely raw. There is no way to turn just the buzzer off. You have to turn the unit off, remove the poached egg pan, clean the base unit, refill with water and try again. The egg cups are also oblong rather than round. So if you're making eggs benedict or putting the poached eggs on an english muffin, they don't fit well.The cooking time is adjusted on this unit with microscopic changes in the amount of water you add via their special measuring cup. The difference in water amount for a different number of eggs is literally a few drops. Plus, their recommended amounts of water doesn't always work, so you'll need to experiment. Not a great way to control cooking time.I didn't hate it enough to return it. It does seem to do okay with boiled eggs. But I wouldn't buy it again.

I've been using a T1 for a few months now.  It's a good news/bad news situation.Voice quality is good on both end of the calls.  Setup is easy.  I don't find the voice control particularly useful, but some people might.  The biggest problem is securing the T1 to your ear.  The over the ear option is clunky and not particularly comfortable.  The in-ear pads are comfortable, but not secure.  Even with the largest ear pad, the headset is constantly falling out of my ear.  Worse, the ear pad's are difficult to put on do not stay securely on the headset.  That means if you keep the T1 in your pocket and pull it out to use it, you're likely to find the ear pad doesn't come with it.Because the ear pad is constantly falling off, I managed to lose it, meaning I had to pay $16 (including shipping) for 2 replacement ear pads just to be able to use the headset I paid $60 for.  The USB recharging cord is also ridiculously short, but it's a standard connector, so you can pretty easily find a replacement.I want to like the T1.  But having to spend a couple of minutes fiddling with the ear pads practically every time I want to use it and having it constantly fall out of my ear makes it not particularly useful. I can't recommend it unless you are satisfied with the over-the-ear option.

New to me author.Jessenia is going to be murdered simply because she is a female but she is not just any female she is the last female.Her lover Timaos however will now be killed also unless he does Jessenia's final words to him. Prince Jaegar was an evil man and his soldiers were well versed in torture before death. His brother Jadon is evil but not as badly.Will the gods and goddesses give Jessenia the answers? Well both of these brothers of doom are given a word / curse from someone higher than them.This is a very short intro into the world of dark and light, good vs. evil. I am going to have to delve now into the world so I can see what happens.I was loaned a copy of this book via Amazon loan

Jocelyn works for Homeland Security and she knows there is evil in the world but when she runs head on into a sexy, seductive, dark and handsome vampire named Nathaniel all bets are off. She was out searching on a case of women being taken and used in a human trafficking ring. Nathaniel is entranced by Jocelyn and he sees something in her that he has never wanted in all his centuries. He has to figure out why Jocelyn thinks him a horrid creature this has him even more intrigued. He knows someone has scared her but who?We get evil and good, a little darkness and a whole lot of sexy.Will Jocelyn get any closer to finding out who is doing the trafficking? Or will she get caught up in Nathaniel’s world? Nathaniel knows she is his the one the moon and fates sent to him but how to get her on his side? Let alone in his bed.Nathaniel and his brothers now must avenge their brothers’ death and protect Jocelyn.I was gifted the audible of this book and let me say it was really good the narrator spoke plain, brought life to each character amazing. The story was strong and the characters drew you in. I hope to read more in this series.

Baz works for a newspaper that wants the big story surrounding Rock Star Rex. So Baz has been sent in undercover to get the dirt. What Baz doesn't expect is to like this band and its members and what he really doesn't expect is to take a huge liking to the lead band member.Rex however wants no parts of it but knows its a must to help the band. Rex has demons and he lashes out. Things start to change and he opens up more to only have it all ripped wide open by none other than Baz.Fantastic m/m romance story. The story is not overly fast and they don't just run into romance. Loved it.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

Sean is a detective and of course an alpha male. He gave his wife an ultimatum sometime back and it back fired on him because she walked out of his life. Now over a year and she is back to demand that he sign the divorce papers and mind you a divorce he wanted. Caitlyn works a lot out of the country on goodwill missions and it has caused many issues in her marriage but be damned if she will allow Sean to dictate what she does with her life. Caitlyn wants her marriage but she wants her husband to be open about things and talk more. Can they save their marriage?Well first they have to hide because someone is after Sean who he put in prison. Can he protect Caitlyn or will she cause issues?I enjoyed this story although short it is romantic with a touch of suspense.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

A lot has been happening within the Storm MC group and it's all left in Scotts hands to fix the crap. Scott would rather work on fixing his woman’s mental health after losing their baby. Harlow is a strong woman and she will manage her mind and soul. Everything that could happen to this couple does in this book. The author has done a fantastic job in portraying everything in great detail. I loved this book now don't get me wrong I have loved them all but this one was tops in my own honest opinion. We delve deep into the club and many of its players. Lies and distrust are all out. We get a great amount of sexy but we also get strength, mystery, suspense and a whole lotta suspense. Kudos to the author on a book very well done. And I hope we get more from these bikers.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

This is a wonderful box set of romance, happily ever afters and wishes. All are very well written and I enjoyed them very much.I am going to write my review on a few of the stories. I truly recommend this box set if you love romance at its finest.The Bad Boy Meets his Match by Kristin MillerWe have Cora who now owns a lingerie store and just recently broke up with her boyfriend. Cora has dreamed many nights about an old love she had when she was younger Alec.  Alec now is a multi-billionaire who inherited his fathers company and Cora has kept up on all the smut in the papers about him. Cora decides to do a weekend get away with some of her girlfriends and they are going to the lake where Cora met Alec for the first time. But things don't go as planned and Cora is in for a shock. Alec is beyond shocked when he sees who is staying in the cabin next to his. What will become of this couple who never forgot their time together? Fantastic Romance story.Collide & Burn by Claudy ConnThis was truly a romance. Wade Devon is a ruthless millionaire who basically has never wanted any type of relationship with any woman aside from one or maybe 2 nights. When Wade decides to buy a horse farm while in town a laughter catches his ear, the woman who made the laugh catches his eye and more. Charlie is happy she gets to stay on the farm although sadden that her parents are selling it and moving away. She can't wait to meet the mysterious man who has purchased the farm or can she? Once Charlie's eyes land on Wade all bets are off and keeping her heart in tack well she isn't sure how she will manage. Very sweet romance that was not rushed.Snowflakes, Exes, and Ohs by Melanie JamesDylan and Abbie were a couple all through high school and had planned to marry. But as life often does things get in the way mainly Dylans need to not be tied down in a small town so he is off to the Navy and when he returns after something tragic happens he finds more than he bargained for. Can Abbie forgive him? Can he forgive himself?Let me say I have read many books actually all books written thus far by this author and none tore my emotions wide open as this book did. You will go from crying literally to anger, to shock and surprise. Wow talk about a roller coaster ride. I loved it I truly loved it.Unwrapping Noel by Jennifer TheriotThis is a fantastic love story.We have Noel who is a public relations specialist. She has done very well for herself. Noel had a crap marriage though and finally divorced her husband Dave after 13 years of marriage. But he reeled her back in at least to get her help after being diagnosed with cancer. Do you think that changed him? Nope think again but finally Noel opens her eyes to the horrible man she was once married to. Noel hates the Christmas holidays and it just gets worse for her. She has never really felt that she was sexy or attractive.Noels dear friend Tony is getting married so Noel is off to California and with some luck have some fun.Well as they say when your not looking.  While in California she attends a meeting with Tony and some others to discuss a new project. Little does she know her life and heart is about to change thanks to one Mr. Leon Hallas the trainer / business partner of Tonys that is if ex-husband Dave don't mess it up.Again very well written and truly a romantic story. I enjoyed it very much.Ruck by Holly S. RobertsVan is jealous of what his brother Joel and his wife Cami has but he has always been the one night stand kind of man. His best friend Danny has always loved him although he never knew it and when he finally figures out what he wants he may not get it. Danny is hurt by how Van has been since she has known him so right now its a game and it's not Rugby.  I really enjoyed this story.

This is Jack's story. We met Jack in a previous series.He owns a security firm Saints Protection. He was in the Army Special Forces before beginning his own firm.The Governor has now called in Jacks team to help with the murders of young college girls.Tonya was out partying with her college friends for her 21st birthday. She goes on off by herself to her place and before she gets inside someone throws something over her face and she is taken.Jack also has to figure out how an old woman breaks his barriers at his home. Bethany her granddaughter hopes that Jack and his team will understand that her gran is very ill. But things start turning in Jacks stomach when it comes to Bethany.Jack is the ultimate alpha male who protects those he loves and those who he works with. His team is everything to him.Can Bethany break some of his shields? to gain his heart?Totally loved this first book in this new series. Can't wait to find out more about the rest of the team ! I love how the author does the crossover and brings loved characters from a previous series.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

Kelly and her man bear shifter Gabe are in a huge pickle in this story. Of course, witchcraft plays a part and it is never good.Gabe is a shifter but no one in town knows. But all things may come out as a few more bear shifters are in town and a crazy doctor may break the secret.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review

I was gifted a copy of this box set for my honest review. Often it's hard to rate a book with so many authors so I will do the best I can by rating it in whole. I am putting a written review for the following books although all were wonderful stories.Close Liaisons by Anna Zaires & Dima ZalesNew to me authors.Mia is curious about the beings who are now residing in her state / country. She meets one while at the park one day named Korum. He is fascinated by her and Mia kind of thinks he is sexy. Well one thing leads to another and they end up in bed where Mia finds it's not exactly what she thought. Mia likes Korum but she isn't sure of what can become of them. She knows he cooks a mean meal. He is very open about talking to Mia concerning his kind. Mia hates him but she doesn't.This wasn't a bad story although I would have preferred a bit more story prior to their bedroom scene. Also Mia is some what whiney.Shifted Undercover by C.E. BlackNikki is keeping something from her new husband. But she is not the only one. Adam and Nikki haven't been married long but both are keeping something  from the other.When Nikki finds out what her husband Adam is and whom he works for all crap hits the fan pretty much. Adam is determined to keep Nikki safe but she is a strong and determined female. Nolan wants neither of them to tell each other their secrets but it happens. Their boss now has no idea what to do when both are taken hostage.  I enjoyed this story as I loved the Alpha Division series by  this author. Very well written and tons of action and suspense and super hot romance.Capturing Her Bear by Charlie DayeNew to me author.Berend has been held captive by scientists who have been doing testing’s on him for months.Aspen has now been captured and the scientists who captured her have made her into something / someone she doesn't know?A nurse is told to extract a sample from Berend then what happens is shock to both Aspen and Berend.Berend knows what the doctor is trying to do and he also knows its likely he succeeded with Apsen he just wishes his bear was happy about it.Aspen is not shocked that he is a bear shifter only because her hand did the same kind of change. Aspen escapes but not with her bear. But can she save him? And will his bear claim her? Well no because he sends her off to find his friend Torben who very well may be Aspens mate. But can these two save Berend?This was a really hot , and an emotionally intriguing story.Bitten By Choice by Izzy SzynThis story is about a girl named Becky who is taken and turned after her step brother takes her to meet his boss. One of her captures Ryan however decides to help her. She wants to go home she misses her boyfriend and her friend and family. But the evil vampire they are running from is going to be hunting them as he is Death. He is threatening her family so she has no choice but to get back to her family and protect them from Caleb.Not a bad story. It could use more proofing.Dragon's Chase by Mina CarterI love dragon shifter books so I had to read this one. This was a new twist for me. It is nicely written and had a lot of action and romance unbound.Zane by R.E. ButlerNew to me author.This was a really well written gorilla shifter book. I have never read one but this one was fantastic. Kudos to this author for giving us something different.

This story grabbed me from the get go and I finished it in one sitting.Please have your tissue box when you go to read it but I truly recommend it if you love stories that grab you and true romance.Alyssa has lived her life never wanting to get to close to anyone although she has had the same boyfriend for roughly 6 years even knowing there is no love there. He doesn't treat her badly per say but he doesn't show love either.She finally decides to break it off with him and when that happens of course he shouts out his love for her but its too late. Lys moves back in with her grandmother who has been her mother all her life.She gets together one evening with a guy she works with Landon who has been a very good friend to her but things are awkward between them and she is confused but lets it go for now. She loves hanging out with Landon. She learns they both have had a s*** life.Anna who is her best female friend is getting married soon and Lys wonders if she will ever have that life or if she even wants. Then all that could go wrong in her life does. Alyssa finds she needs her friends and what is left of her family more than ever.Will she ever have any goodness in her life?The only thing I would have liked more in this story is more of an ending.Riveting story I enjoyed every single wording. I highly recommend it and sorry I cannot give you more without spoiling it.  Pick it up and find out if Alyssa ever gets her happily ever after.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

Cassie shifts and finds when she awakens she has killed something she just is not sure what. She finally makes it home to the place she and Seb now share to find her boyfriend Seb looking at her covered in blood. Seb will do all he can to help Cassie with this new learning process of shifting. Seb worries because Cassie is a first. The first female shape shifter he knows of.Cassie's dad is one of the Hunters and a doctor but she refuses to see him unsure of what he may do if he finds out what she is. Ash needs to die but are Seb and Cassie able to do it.Cassie wants revenge for best friend Eve.People are going missing and of course, the ones they call The Monsters, which now includes Cassie, seem to be the culprits but it’s not true or is it?And who is the Raven shifter that helped save Sebs life?This is a nicely written second book in this series. I would gladly recommend it for anyone who loves paranormal. Great for the young teen who loves a little dark in their read.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

What can I say? Another fantastic book in the Deadly Ops Series.In this one we have Tucker who along with members of his team are being setup. Their only hope is kidnapping a very important woman with the NSA Karen. They would never hurt her but she at first doesn't know that. Once Tucker explains it all Karen knows she will do whatever it takes to help this man and his team. Burkhart is the boss of Karen and he is worried about his employ more than anything. Can Tucker and Karen get him on their side?We have alpha men along with very strong willed women. The females in this series are every bit as strong and powerful as the men who capture their hearts. Wonderful story.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

New to me author.At first, I thought I was re-reading a book by another author as so many things are similar but it is not so no worries there :)I liked the story but the flow well it lost me from the get go as there is just too much going on too soon.The bad:  Too many repeats and too much going on with too many beings.I found myself being lost throughout the story line. The characters were ok. I think with more thought and some more editing this book could be much better.This book was free on Amazon and was recommended to me.

I absolutely loved Ghleanna and Brams story !! We hear mention of Bram in previous books he is a delicious alpha dragon shifter. Ghleanna is one tough cookie and an Alpha in her own right. She is fierce and stubborn. Her brother is not too happy with her. Bercelak feels she is making a huge mistake.  Ghleanna is tasked with keeping Lord Bram safe but who will keep Ghleanna save from his wiles?I have read previous books in this series and loved every single one of them I actually need to reread so I can leave reviews. If you love dragon shifters this author writes some of the best I have ever read.I was gifted this book for my honest review.

This is a wonderful romance book. We have a couple who were once best friends and now they are both back in their home town and things may have changed but for the good or bad?Drew hates that he has had to come home for the holidays but he promised his grandmother he would. However, his brother Rob and his wife who is someone Drew would rather forget about are there also.What shocks him the most is the woman he met at the bar the previous night is also sitting at the dining table only he had forgotten who she was.  Piper does not know what is going on with Drew and Rob but she knows something terrible must have happened between the brothers.  Piper is so happy to meet back up with the man who was once her best friend and just maybe if the fates see it he can be more.Ellie it seems doesn’t have any friends left. Although Piper is now Ellie’s son Jacks teacher, she really doesn’t want anything to do with Ellie.Piper will hate her even more so when Drew finally tells he what went on between himself, his brother and Ellie.Can Ellie mend Drew’s broken heart?Can Drew be the best friend to Ellie he once was and even more?I really enjoyed this very well written book. The characters are very strong and very believable so much so the story just drawls you in from start to finish.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

We get the next couple in the Eternal Mates series and oh, my are they hot. I have enjoyed this series and I think I found my favorite so far.Harbin is an Assassin and is sent on the mission find a cat shifter. A snow leopard of all things. Well this just boils his blood considering it is what Harbin is. His boss Hartt is refusing to give him the job and he is not sure why that is?While at the club, Aya meets the eyes of one of her kind. She was getting her groove on with a male Vampire and noticed the smell of one of her kind. A male of her kind who was injured. She had no idea what was going on but she is soon to find out.When Harbin and Aya get together sparks will forever fly for this couple. Fantastic story in this series. Very well written and  you get just the right amount of action, love and mystery.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

All of the stories are sweet, short, hot m/m shifters. I am leaving a written review for the following books in the story. All were well written although quite a few need more editing.  4 Stars.Bear Back Mountain - Artemis WolffeAlexander is a physical trainer. His receptionist is constantly trying to hook him up.Hunter is a bear shifter who needs to find his mate. So his first start of doing that is getting back in shape.Alex has really vivid dreams of Hunter and finds his eyes in the dream to be very weird.Finally after getting to know each other a little Hunter lets Alex know he is a shifter.There is just one problem. A female named Jessica.Then sickness starts and Peggy teases that he is likely pregnant. Alex finds it all funny but will he after he does this test?This couple is hilarious as is the story but oh so hot also. Very well written although short it was a nice story.End of Shift - Z.P. JenkinsAndrew had been seeing Nick but then when things start to heat up everything that could go wrong does.Nick unbeknown to Andrew is a wolf shifter but much more .While driving back to his folks for holiday break Andrew wrecks and ends up in the house and hands of Victor.What will Andrew do with a bear shifter? And how will Nick handle things?Can Victor save Andrew?This is a really well written short story. We get some mystery, action and a whole lotta hotness.Choosing the Omega - Angel KnotsEverything in Colin’s life had always been hard considering he was orphaned and was sent to foster homes all his life. However he managed to graduate with top honors determined to make something of his life.  But on the morning of his last exam all things go to hell in a hand basket. Although never really needing a release even at the ripe old age of 22 all of sudden he couldn't even get out of bed. Colin finally headed to the doctor to see what was wrong and next thing he knows he is on a plane with a colonel heading to someone’s pack? Someone named Hart.Someone who is to test him but Colin isn't sure what he is being tested on and he doesn't want to be sent back home.Upon meeting lieutenant Hart it all clicked into place. He wrapped Colin in his arms and rushed him back to the barracks. Ben now gets the pleasures of telling Colin what he is and what everything means.I enjoyed this story. Everything was good as far as story line and characters. But finding out about Colin and why certain things happened to him I would have liked more reason or details.Ferocious - M.H. SilverThis one is a really short but hot shifter story. It has a romance span of 10 years so nothing was fast about this couple.Snow Leopard Bound - Wednesday RavenBrock was tired of being cheated on. He wants something more than a random fling. Brock and his bestfriend make a wager. Now can he keep what he wagered? Chance was living life as if he was dying tomorrow which wasn't to far fetched. What happens when these two men meet is romantic to say the least. Very heartbreaking and overwhelmingly sweet.Not a bad story but it needs more editing.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

And we now have the next story of Xan Valentine and Georgie. I love this couple they have been through so much and in this story its a living a hell for them. Georgie has finally been kidnapped by the Russians. Do you think Xan /Alex / Alexandre will leave it be? Nope he won't. Adrien and Alex  and a few others are off to save the day if they can. Alexandre will lose many things close to him in this fight.  Anything that could go wrong does and many things will transpire that will take this couple to the next level. A wedding of a dear friend stirs emotions in Alexandre / Xan he didn't realize he was missing. Can Xan talk Georgie into not leaving him?She still has plans to go to Atlanta even after all that has happened but Alexandre will need her now more ever. Because I have read the previous books in this story this book was very emotional for me. My heart bled for Alexandre and the life he has had.Absolutely loved this book.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

We met Aidan briefly in book one in this series. Aidan works for the Alliance, which is a group of various species working together to keep all safe. Well they have come across of humans who are working together to destroy all shape shifters and Aidan knows they have to stop them. But a little pretty thing might stand in his way. Heidi is the daughter to an Alpha and she has been sent to join in with the Alliance on this mission. When Heidi meets Aidan, she immediately knows who he is but she is not sure she understands. He isn't one of her kind and she has no idea what to do about it? Can Aidan show Heidi that they are to be one regardless? The fates choose whom they want.But can Aidan keep Heidi safe while they figure each other out?His brother Derek may be able to give him some advice since he just took a human as a mate.I enjoyed this book and love this authors writing style also.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

And we are now into the next part of Evan and Abby's story. And let me tell you first make sure to read the previous two books so you know their history and the characters. This book is so damn dark and twisted. Evan has been trained all his life to take lives and now he is in a battle to save the life of the only woman who he has ever loved. Will this couple ever get their happily ever after? Well grab it and read. It will not disappoint if you are into dark romance with so many deranged and twisted roads to get through. I absolutely love Nat who is Evan's sister and I hope her and Michael get a book.  Fantastic story and a fantastic series.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

This is a pretty neat small selfie stick. It worked just fine with my Samsung Galaxy S3 phone. It arrived nicely packaged. Easy to use. Very sturdy and good quality.I was gifted this item for my honest review. It is not a very long selfie stick but will do the job.

Let me say I have read and loved every single Hard Ink book out. And I am so freaking happy to see that although we are venturing into a new series with the Ravens we still will likely hear mentions of those we loved from the Hard Ink Series. Jess has worked for Hard Ink aka Jeremy for a while, as has Ike. Ike is a member of the MC club Ravens. He has always adored Jess and when she calls him for help one night scared to death he knows he would move heaven and hell to get to her. The problem he has is keeping his hands and heart to himself. He cannot let go of his past but if he doesn’t he may very well lose the woman he loves as well as his best friend.Wow just flipping fantastic loved this book from beginning to end and can not wait to find out what else is in store for The Ravens especially Dare.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

In this book we have Natalie who has a very abusive past. We have Jack who is an ex cop now turned PI who lives next door to Natalie. Jack has asked Natalie out many times only to be turned down. Natalie is crazy about Jack but can’t let her self think they can ever be anything. Jack comes from money and is white. Natalie comes from a druggie mom and dad and poor.While out at an Estate Sale Natalie comes upon a jewelry box and after someone whispers into her ear she purchases it. Later while looking inside of it she finds under the felt a hidden area that holds an Emerald. Many things transpire and suspense is not short in this book.Jack and Natalie become a team in a sense but will that be a team in love also?I highly recommend this book to those who love a good romance book.Grab your copy of this enchanting romance and find out.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review

And we now have book 2 in this freaking wickedly awesome series. I love books with various paranormal creatures and boy do we get that. I also love necromancers and Kris is truly that. She owed a favor from the last book and in this book she is returning it by working at the bar for the vampire. Something is happening at first one no one knows. Rush wants to be there for his beloved but Kris would rather not have to worry. Rafe however is always there he is hers. Kris's grandmother is in on this hunt and all things transpire. Wicked fighting and demons in masses but not just demons.I would suggest you start with book 1 in this series so you truly follow the story.Great book!

New to me author.This is a compilation of 12 short but very steamy shifter gay romance stories.Book 1 I will say is my favorite although I would have loved more story. Gunner is super hot and he knows what he wants.All of the books are the same in regards to story line each male finds their mate and creates the bond. They are all short and I prefer when a story is that short that it have some depth.I recommend them for those who love short, hot, steamy, alpha, gay m/m books.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

In this book we have guardian bad boys. All of which are gods of one form or another. The leader Uri and his brothers frequent a specific bar for women mostly humans. But he is wanting another who is forbidden from him or is she? Alexandria needs someone to help her and she knows Uri will be who can achieve what she needs. Can she get his help?We have so many immortals, humans and gods / goddesses I am not sure which I preferred. The book was good and the characters were strong and tons of hotness , some action also.I borrowed this book from Netgalley.

In this book, we get Jared's story. Jared is more of the homebody of the Von Brandt's. He actually laughed when his cousins had found their mates and learned they bonded so quickly. Well while off at a charity event Jared bids on a mystery woman who is she? Well he is determined to find out. Elise has no clue of the feelings she is having for this stranger. Her horrible employer put her into this auction. He is a slime ball and was bidding to win the dinner with her also.This book is part of The Vonbrandt's series and I loved the first two books in this series. I wanted more story but aside from that it was a very hot and sexy read.

Hauk and Aeron are mated to a human female Brianna is carrying a baby which is starting to drain on her. Aeron is worried but his female is so stubborn. Leilani is best friends with Brianna and also human.Leilani is off to a meeting and that has Aeron concerned and now his mate. He is off to find out what is going on.  The meeting Leilani is having is with Con the leader. Leilani is a human female who has no idea about the rules of this other place. But he is too late and she now has to stay in the mountains for one moon cycle.Oh what is she to do ? Well what else be swooned by so many handsome warriors. Leilani will do so much more than that for the future of the Mountain Region. Most take two mates but Con and Leilani are about to change the rules on so many levels.Futuristic, Action, Suspense and OH so hot .. Keep in mind this is a novella so its kind of short but packs a great punch.I was gifted a copy of this book for my honest review.

It arrived today. I was so excited when I bought this but alas it had issues right out of the plastic shipping bag it arrived in. Overall its very pretty , looks sturdy enough.
